Description: 91 points James Suckling 'A soft and silky syrah with berry and cherry character. Hints of chocolate. Medium to full body and a fresh finish. Cool. Drink now.'

title: Emiliana Novas Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: The 2018 vintage seems to be one of the best of the decade. Its moderate temperatures have given well-balanced wines with fresh fruit such as this delicate and fruity cabernet, with aromas of red fruits and herbs. And its light-but-tense body makes it an excellent candidate for a barbecue. This cabernet comes from vines planted in 1992 on the alluvial soils of the Linderos area in the traditional Maipo Valley. Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2021)

title: Les Lauriers de Rothschild Montagne-Saint-Emilion 2017
Description: Comprised of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Franc, Les Lauriers des Rothschild hails from the St. Emillion appelation and is aged in French oak for 12 months. The wine has a wonderful purple colour, bright and bursting with fruity aromas of cherries and raspberries and a subtle oak presence. Light bodied with medium acidity, red fruit on the palate, notes of cedar, super smooth tannins and reasonably long finish, makes this wine extremely enjoyable.

title: Open Fresh'n Fruity Gamay VQA
Description: This VQA gamay from the popular producer is ruby coloured and shows aromas and flavours of spice, dark fruit, rye bread, mushrooms and watermelon. Medium-bodied and fruity with a dry finish, it's well-suited for barbecued sausages or over-roasted turkey breast topped with berry compote alongside roasted vegetables and rice.

title: Vidal Reserve Merlot Cabernet 2017
Description: Made from grapes grown in Vidal's Gimblett Gravels vineyard, the Vidal Reserve Series Merlot Cabernet Sauvignon has dark red fruits and a hint of oak on the nose.

title: Carlinet Barbera d'Asti Superiore 2017
Description: The intense and deep colour suggests the thickness of this wine that comes with a set of olfactory sensations reminding of red berries, cocoa and spices, the taste is intense, persistent, large and silky. Wine suitable for long storage. Excellent with rich meat main courses.
By:: Poderi Rosso Giovanni Di Rosso Lion

title: Miriar 2015
Description: Deep purple in colour with dark purple rim. Powerful and very elegant aromas of ripe forest fruits, chocolate, coffee and vanilla. On the palate it is powerful and smooth with candied fruit flavours. Structured body with a silky, long and warm finish.

title: Dionysos Red
Description: Red, bright ruby in colour with a complex aromatic presence. Sweet hint of fruit, with notes of vanilla, clove, and cinnamon. Well structured with light and gentle tannins, light and balanced acidity with a fruity aftertaste .

title: Armata dell'Aiola
Description: The wine shows a beautiful intense ruby red colour, while on the nose presents very pleasant and intense hints of fresh red fruit (cherry). In the mouth the wine reflects the visual and olfactory sensations, and, being endowed with a good balance it leaves the mouth clean and pervaded by pleasant fruity and floral aromas.

title: Chianti Classico Riserva DOCG 2016
Description: Intense ruby red colour with garnet reflections. Elegant, subtly spicy nose with ripe black fruit and herbs. Medium body, vibrant tannins and a fresh finish.

title: Vicente Gandía El Miracle by Mariscal Garnacha 2017
Description: This Garnacha comes from hand-harvested grapes grown on gobelet-trained 35-year-old vines. It's crafted in a crowd-pleasing style, with good freshness and balance, notes of cherry, plum, mocha, vanilla and spice, and an underlying suggestion of clove. This will be great with winter stews or roast lamb dinners. (Vintages panel, Feb. 2020)

title: Lacrau Organic 2016
Description: Ruby with good intensity. Intense and deep, very fresh and mineral, slight spicy notes. Dry. Balanced acidity. Tannins give structure and personality to this wine.

title: Three Thieves Red Blend
Description: A collaboration between wine visionaries Charles Bieler, Joel Gott and Roger Scommegna. Their Red Blend is a masterful fusion of zinfandel, merlot, cabernet and syrah, sourced from California's best regions. Robust smoky, cassis and coffee flavour, with a hint of cinnamon. Pair with barbecue, cured meats or mature cheeses.

title: Trinity Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: In partnership with Trees for the Future, a nonprofit that has planted over 180 million trees, Trinity Oaks plants one tree per bottle purchased. The grapes are sourced from sustainably farmed vineyards. Brimming with blackberry and juicy raspberry flavours, this red is superb with grilled steak or eggplant parmigiana.

title: Fragospito Red 2014
Description: This 2014 vintage is made up of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 50% Syrah. Deep red in colour with aromas of dried fruit, spices, chocolate, and vanilla. Full-bodied, aged in oak barrels for 18 months. Pair with red meats, grilled vegetables, spicy sauces, and yellow aged cheese. Thessaloniki International Awards 2019 - Bronze Medal (2014 vintage)

title: Luberri Seis de Luberri Media Crianza 2018
Description: Expect aromas of cherry and cassis with a tight tannic palate. Flavours of cherry and cassis are pleasant, while the finish is ripe, warming and healthy.

title: Ashkar Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: This classic wine is well structured with ample richness and depth, accented with the woodiness of toasted oak and the sweet aromas of black currant, plum, and vanilla.

title: Sella & Mosca Tanca Farrà 2015
Description: An attractive red with dried berries, balsamic and spices. Medium-bodied, soft and velvety. Drink now. {to 2023+] Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Senses Wines Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Deep in colour with notes of dark fruits, blackcurrant and spices, this wine has a velvety tannic structure and balanced acids.

title: Giz Vinhas Velhas 2015
Description: This wine comes from the Bairrada region of Portugal and is made from 100+ year old vines aged 20 months in French oak. Aromas of ripe red fruits and cedar notes, with mocha, spice and forest floor. Palate is dry and full bodied with ripe red fruits and mineral notes. Juicy acidity, fine structure and tannins with an extremely long finish make this wine a delight.

title: Farmhouse California Red
Description: Farmhouse Wines are part of the Cline portfolio of wines from Sonoma, California. The winemaker uses blending to highlight the best fruit and does not over-oak the wines. A smooth blend of zinfandel, shiraz and carignan, with cedar, chocolate, cassis and toast notes.  Serve with charcuterie, appetizers or a cheese board.

title: Enotria Red 2019
Description: Enotria means 'Land of Wine' and this is a charming blend of two very old indigenous grape varieties, Liatiko and Kotsifali, which successfully marry with the international Syrah grape. The blend is made from Syrah (60%), Kotsifali (30%) and Liatiko (10%). This wine can be aged nicely up to three years. It has a pleasant and youthful ruby colour. The variety of aromas includes red fruits and elegant notes of pepper. The taste is fresh and fruity, with high acidity and medium tannins. An interesting and easy to drink wine, with great balance and pleasant aftertaste.

title: IRIS Toscano Rosso IGT 2015
Description: Deep ruby in colour with intense, fruity aromas and notes of leather and vanilla. On the palate, structured, full, and harmonious.
By:: Tenuta Di Artimino Soc. Agr. Srl

title: Grumarello Carmignano Riserva DOCG 2013
Description: Vivid ruby red colour with garnet hints due to the maturation process. Intense, harmonic, sophisticated, it has a wide and complex range of aromas: red berry fruits, blackberry, tobacco, leather, cloves. Perfectly harmonic, full bodied and persistent flavour, with an appropriate range of acidity.
By:: Tenuta Di Artimino Soc. Agr. Srl

title: Vega Canada Joven 2019
Description: Clean cherry red colour. The nose is fresh and fruity. The palate is balanced, with a medium structure.

title: Poggilarca Carmignano DOCG 2016
Description: Vivid ruby red, with slight garnet coloured shades. The wine has red berries and spice aromas with a delightful vanilla sensation. The mouthfeel is very sophisticated and harmonic. It has a persistent and pleasant tannin flavour, with a well combined freshness.
By:: Tenuta Di Artimino Soc. Agr. Srl

title: Porto Carras Merlot Organic Red PGI 2016
Description: Old vines and low yields bring out an interesting approach to the grapes typicity: lemony notes set against a clearly mineral background on the nose, while the palate is fresh, crisp and savory.

title: Monnier et Fils Clos de Citeaux Pommard 1er Cru Grands Epenot 2017
Description: A mature Burgundy showing all the complexity of these old vines. A classy Gevrey that shows intense fruit with a delicacy that can only be achieved in Burgundy. The palate is concentrated, fine and delicate with discreet tannins and perfect harmony ... Magnificent!

title: Calmel & Joseph Villa Blanche Pinot Noir 2019
Description: Bright, luminous cherry red. Offers us some stunning fruity aromas: cherry, grenadine, redcurrant, and cooked strawberry, but also notes of leather and spice. The subtle tannins of Pinot Noir express themselves harmoniously, giving way to a magnificently taut finish. Citrus and red fruit intermingle with lightly peppery notes. This is a wine that asserts its origins whilst respecting the most majestic qualities that this northern grape has to offer.

title: Monella Douro Red 2017
Description: Beautiful purple colour, fresh notes of raspberry, blackberry and spices. On the palate shows round and velvety tannins, good concentration and long aftertaste. A wine that pairs wonderfully with the rich and smoky characteristics of grilled meats. Richer meats, such as grilled lamb and beef chops, are an optimal pairing for the wine.

title: Maleatis Red 2014
Description: Dark ruby colour, excellent and complex structure. The blackberry savor leaves in the palate a spicy and durable taste totally unique.
By:: G. Tsimpidis And Co. Monemvasia Win

title: Planeta Rojo Bonarda 2019
Description: It's a deep coloured wine with purple hues. It contains aromatic notes characteristic of berries such as raspberries and ripe strawberries, with a spicy background and a touch of eucalyptus. In the mouth, the Bonarda is a voluminous and structurally complex wine containing a broad expression of ripe tannins. It's a young and fruity wine, which gives great pleasure to the palate.

title: Valley Spring Mountain Pinot Noir 2013
Description: A light ruby colour with a slightly brick edge, this wine offers aromas of earth, mushrooms, forest floor and sour cherries. The palate is intense, rich and lively with bright cherry fruit and a whack of minerality; very Burgundian in style.

title: BK Gower Pinot Noir 2019
Description: Musk and undergrowth on the nose, Morello cherries, exotic spices and white pepper on the palate with great tannic structure. A handsome balance between finesse and power - broad shoulders and a slim waist.

title: Planeta Rojo Syrah 2019
Description: A vivid and deep violet colour, with a unique glow. It has aromatics notes characteristic of ripe fruit (blackberry), with a tobacco aftertaste and smoky notes. On the palate, the Syrah is a young and fruity wine with a distinctive acidity that makes it fresh and perfect with pasta and red meat.

title: Planeta Rojo Reserva Malbec 2018
Description: An intense wine with violet and black borders. It possess aromatic notes of berries and perfect combination of vanilla and coffee, very well balanced with a touch of tobacco, and a final taste of butter produced by the aging in French oak staves. These components make this wine a unique exponent of the variety. In the mouth, it's distinguished by its high volume body, with sweet tannins accompanied by a great intensity of aftertastes that make this variety really pleasant to perceive. In short, it's a great wine, worthy of being evoked.

title: Heinisch Pinot Noir Haide 2016
Description: Dark garnet red, scents of wild strawberries and raspberries and a little bit of cherry. On the palate we find cherry and strawberries with some dark chocolate and a touch of mint. Ripe but very fine tannins and an eternal fruity finish.

title: Domaine Pinte La Capitaine 2018
Description: La Capitaine is a single vineyard, but each grape variety is fermented separately. A rich vintage, full of red fruits. Silky palate. Well balanced and fresh.
By:: Societe Viticole Du Domaine De La P

title: Echeverria No Es Pituko Cabernet Franc 2019
Paitin Barbaresco Riserva Sori 2014
Description: Sourced from a 0.9 hectare parcel of old vines within the Sori Paitin parcel on Serraboella. Calcareous clay with sandstone. Underbrush, pine, menthol and dark spice aromas. Racy and linear, the palate shows cranberry, tart sour cherry, star anise and dried sage alongside taut, close-grained tannins.

title: Baracija Refosk 2018
Description: Tar and tobacco on the nose. Raspberry, blood iron, blackberry, and white pepper. Long finish, relatively high tannins. Medium bodied, juicy and very well balanced.

title: Lescure Chambolle Musigny Les Mombies 2017
Description: The 2017 Les Mombies is aromatically reticent on opening with notes of black tea, hedge fruits, and soil. With air it becomes more expressive with blackberry, Italian plum, and game. The mid-weight palate offers dark fruit flavours and good concentration over a fine mineral core and tannins that are more crushed velvet than silken, and this has fine fresh acidity and nice lift on the finale.

title: Lescure Pommard Les Vaumuriens 2017
Description: A palette of red and black fruit, blackberry, blueberry, redcurrant, cherry stone, ripe plum. Leather, spicy and wild notes are also present. A round, structured and assertive wine.

title: Lescure Beaune 1er Cru Les Chouacheux 2017
Description: The 2017 Chouacheux shows very floral aromas of ripe black cherry and plum, with hints of brown spice, citrus zest and earth. There is nicely sappy, chalky fruit on the palate - black cherry, plum, red currant - backed by firm acidity and the ever-present core of minerality found in the Chantal Lescure wines.

title: Fabio Green Palma 2018
Description: Made from a dominant variety of the region, with a dark colour, fresh acidity and full, round tannins. Green Palma is from old vines (50-60 years), offers a superb material with delicate aromas of white flowers and hints of aniseed. The palate has a lot of power that makes this wine a jewel.

title: Fabio Gea Notu Seguiva Gocce d'Acqua 2015
Description: Notu was Fabio Gea's grandfather, and the name of the wine means, Notu followed the drops of water. This is an edgy, dynamic wine, showing ripe fruit. It stands out in the vintage, and it's exciting to drink.

title: Chateau Coupe Roses Les Plots AOC 2018
Description: It expresses itself with a blend of powerful and complex aromatics of candied fruits, spice, blackcurrant and pepper. On the palate it delivers amazing ripeness, great balance and good length.

title: Mutiliana Tramazo 2017
Description: A Sangiovese from a unique parcel located in the foothills of Modigliana. Fresh with ripe fruit and a herbal edge, promising development with time. Fine tannins, dry finish.

title: Mutiliana Ibbola 2017
Description: A fresh and elegant Sangiovese from the Ibbola valley in the foothills of Modigliana. This wine treads the tightrope of austerity and elegance, with an incisive palate driven by fine tannins. Floral and earthy aromas mingle on the nose, with delicate fruit and minerality marrying on the palate. Persistent finish.

title: Lignier La Riotte, Morey 1er Cru 2016
Description: Vines planted in 1959. Located at the foot of Clos Saint Denis, on a gentle slope, in a clay-limestone soil packed with small stones. The wines are usually generous and open, even in their youth. They are very easy-to-drink and characterized by lush red fruit. Drink preferably within ten years of bottling.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Calmel & Joseph Villa Blanche Syrah IGP Pays d'Oc 2019
Description: A wine of reddish-purple colour with exquisite violet reflections. The nose opens with seductively powerful aromas of ripe black fruit, then come cocoa and mocha, with fig, prune and blackberry joining in the dance, mingling joyfully with vanilla and toasted notes. In the mouth, the smoothness of texture and the silkiness of the tannins are astonishing. The aromas echo the same black fruit enhanced with truffle-like notes of forest floor, leading to an opulent but superbly fresh finish. A wine gorged with sunshine that indulges the senses whilst maintaining a perfect balance that allows it to rise to all occasions.

title: Mutiliana Acereta 2017
Description: Produced with Sangiovese grown on 20-year-old vines in the heart of the Acerreta valley. Ripe fruit, earthy tones and fine tannins come together in this refreshing yet textural wine.

title: Potinet Ampeau, Volnay 1er Cru 2010
Description: Vines planted in 1947. Covering an area of 34 acres, purchased in 2010, this old vineyard is located at the foot of the 'Les Cailles' Premier Crus. Produced from a small crop affected by millerandage (very small grapes of varying sizes), the wine has a dark red hue and scents of violets and blackberries.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Teran Coronica 2016
Description: Red wine of attractive density and glossy ruby red colour. On the nose, the aromas of ripe forest fruits is interwoven with notes of smokiness. Medium body, smooth and balanced with soft tannins. Taste of ripe forest fruits, cinnamon, cloves with a hint of smokiness. Careful selection of the highest quality grapes and careful cellar work are an integral part of the character of this wine, making it the ideal partner for venison and game meats. Serve at 16 - 18 ° C. Decant half an hour before consumption.

title: Mutiliana Ecce Draco Rosso 2018
Description: A Pinot Nero from a unique parcel located in the foothills of the Appenines. Fresh with gentle fruit, delicate tannins and a distinct earthiness that highlights the site.

title: Hubert Lignier Chambolle-Musigny Vieilles Vignes 2014
Description: Vines over 50 years of age. Growing on silty clay soils, this Chambolle is finer than 'Les Bussières', very aromatic and can be appreciated from its youth. Rich, fragrant and complex, it lines the palate with silk and lace. Its delicate but fleshy texture in no way detracts from its solid and durable structure. On the sweet side with little trace of acidity, its tannins remain silky-smooth.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Hubert Lignier Bourgogne Rouge 2018
Description: Juicy, bright dark and red cherry fruit, soft and alluring. Pure, crystalline and round, melt-in the mouth flavours, characterized by fruit and melted tannins on the palate, and shows surprising texture and length.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Terre di Giobbe Rosso Piceno Superiore DOCG 2016
Description: Intense ruby red colour, with violet overtones, a mature red fruit aroma with blackberry and plum to the fore. A sweet soft flavour, long-lasting and harmonious appealing in the mouth. Not filtered, may contain sediment. Serve between 18-20°C with pasta, grilled and stewed meats, mature cheeses.

title: Ser Balduzio Marche Rosso IGT 2013
Description: Deep ruby red colour. Intense aromas of wild cherry, plum and black cherry, elegantly fused with mellow tones of oak. A wine of excellent structure, full-bodied yet elegant and balanced. Ser Balduzio is long on the palate. A wine to accompany elaborate dishes, rich and complex. Not filtered, may contain sediment. Serve between 18-20°C with pasta, grilled or stewed meats and mature cheeses.

title: William Single Vineyard Bull Swamp 2019
Description: One of five estate vineyards, vines are 38 years old. Aromatic bouquet with blackcurrants and licorice. Silky palate with blackcurrants, redcurrants, small red berries, violets, lavender, and spices. Light-on-the-feet yet deceptively intense, elegant yet powerful, so minerally it's like sucking on wet stones. Very, very long finish.

title: Manifesto 2016
Description: Rated 92+ points by Wine Advocate. The 2016 Manifesto is a 65/35 blend of Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional aged for 18 months in new French oak. It comes in at 14.5% alcohol. Very elegant and showing mid-palate finesse, this has fine fruit, but it's not just fruity. It seems precise, focused and tightly wound. Ending with pop and power, it demonstrates that it is not really ready to drink. It will require a little patience.

title: Quanta Terra red 2015
Description: Rated 91 points by WIne Advocate. The 2015 Grande Reserva is an equal blend of Touriga Nacional and Sousão, plus 20% Touriga Franca, aged for 18 months in new French oak. It comes in at 14.5% alcohol. When seen at an early stage over the summer, this seemed pretty fine. It has now been released in the USA. At this point, lacking a little of its youthful intensity, this is a bit more sedate but still very fine. It has the fresh and lively feel that I expect from the vintage. This could use more cellar time, but I was surprised to see the tannins drop off fairly fast, making this far more approachable than I thought it would be. That's not to say it is completely ready. Beautifully balanced and very elegant, this is nicely done, a perfect food wine. It may yet improve if it develops complexity as it goes along.

title: Manoir du Carra Julienas les Boittieres 2017
Description: Very nice ruby colour, subtle peony, violet and cinnamon aromas. Full bodied, with a nice and fruity attack. This wine will reach its best potential after having spent a few years in the cellar. Serve at a temperature of 17°C.

title: Manoir du Carra Fleurie Vers le Mont 2016
Description: Intense dark red colour. Subtle floral aromas such as violet, peony, lily: typical aromas from 'Le Mont' terroir. Full bodied and well balanced this wine is full of character. Serve at a temperature of 17°C.

title: William Downie Cathedral Pinot Noir 2019
Description: Strawberry, sour cherry, chocolate and vanilla, spot of mushroom. Interesting textural wine in the mouth, quite bright and lively at first, blackberry, black cherry before a nice medium-long finish.

title: William Single Vineyard Manilla Pinot Noir 2019
Description: One of five estate vineyards, vines are 35 years old. The wine offers a sense of depth and texture which is only possible with dry grown, old vines. Medium to full bodied, with poached plum and clove flavours.

title: Terra a Terra 2014
Description: Rated 90 points by Wine Advocate. The 2014 Reserva Terra A Terra is an equal blend of Touriga Franca and Tinta Barroca plus 20% Sousão, aged 18 months in used French barriques. It comes in at 13.3% alcohol. I was surprised at how good this second wine seemed in this tough vintage. The answer, said co-winemaker Jorge Alves, was simple: they declassified the upper level. It wound up here. Fruit forward, concentrated and showing ripe tannins, this is a pleasure to drink. It has some room to grow too.

title: Fonterenza Rosso di Montalcino 2017
Description: 100% Sangiovese Grosso. The fruit for the Rosso di Montalcino bottling comes from 3 contiguous, north-facing estate plots--Vigna della Strada, Alberello and Bosco--on complex clay soils variously rich in limestone, sandstone and schist, harvested and vinified separately. The vines are farmend organically and harvested by hand. The fruit is destemmed, crushed and fermented with native yeasts in open-top vats with a maceration of 15-20 days. The wines of the separate parcels are then blended and aged in used Slavonian oak botti of 35 hectoliters for 24 months, before being bottled without filtration.

title: Chateau Dereszla Balaton Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Cuvee 2018
Description: This tasty cuvee was made of grapes grown in the volcanic soil of the Badacsony wine region. Excellent choice for steaks and other grills.

title: William Downie Gippsland Pinot Noir 2019
Description: The Gippsland Pinot Noir is wonderfully balanced with blackcurrant, blackberry and hints of clove and nutmeg. Beautifully dense and concentrated on the palate, lifted violets and florals shine through along with the inextricably long finish.

title: Domaine Ratte Trousseau 2018
Description: The grapes are harvested manually and destemmed directly in the vineyard. Semi-carbonic winemaking allows for extraction of colour and aromas contained in the skin of the grape. This process preserves the delicate Trousseau, giving it power and an incomparable fruitiness, both on the nose and on the palate.

title: Genesis Red 2018
Description: Genesis Red is made with Merlot (50%) and Xinomavro (50%). The two varieties are harvested and vinified separately. After the alcoholic fermentation, skin contact for 6 weeks and maturation in oak barrels for 8 months. On the nose there are juicy red fruits, tomato and olive with notes of vanilla, coffee and spices in the background. The body is well-structured with round tannins and a rich finish.

title: Domaine Camille Braun Pinot Noir 2019
Description: Natural wine. Complex and ample with aromas of small red fruits. Powerful and balanced. Still young, it can be kept for 2 to 3 years.

title: Frank Hellwig Shiraz Grenache
Description: A juicy blend of shiraz and grenache named after a hard-working Aussie winemaker. Enjoy quality through simplicity - it's less oaky, nicely dry and overflowing with smoke, coffee and prune flavours. 'Step out of the way and let the grape speak,' Frank Hellwig reckons. It has plenty to say for itself.

title: Refosco Da Peduncolo Rosso DOC 2018
Description: Pleasantly intense on the nose, aroma of violets and irises, to follow plum, sour cherry, blueberry and blackberry with a mineral note of flint and a memory of undergrowth. On the palate it expresses a full and decisive taste, round tannins, freshness and mineral flavour in balance and pleasing fruity returns that complete an elegant taste.
By:: Le Contrade Di Savian Arnaldo E Wil

title: Handley RSM Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir 2016
Description: Aromas of warm dark fruit huckleberries, blackberries and yeasty pie crust with hints of redwood forest floor and mushroom broth. Bold flavours of black cherries, blueberries, and huckleberries dominate with lesser notes of green tea and soy. The fruit is dense and mouth filling with a long and persistent finish of chalky cocoa bean tannins, delicate acidity, and a penetrating saline minerality.

title: La Fagiana 2017
Description: Ruby red, very intense colour. Great structure and persistence, it confirms the notes picked up with the smell, characterized by dense, soft and ripe tannins. On the nose, intense and persistent, characterized by the union of small ripe blackberries and of spicy notes coming from the 'élevage' in barriques.
By:: Fattoria Di San Quintino Di Cecchi

title: Ti Amo Vino Rosso 2016
Description: Intense red and violet reflections with a pleasant perfume and clear aromas of blackberry and raspberry. A wine of great personality, balanced, full, decisive and particularly full-bodied.
By:: Le Contrade Di Savian Arnaldo E Wil

title: Timo Mayer Close Planted Pinot Noir 2019
Description: As the name suggests, this wine comes from a densely planted portion of Timo's Bloody Hill vineyard, where vines are positioned only 75 cm apart from each other. Timo likes to use a proportion of whole bunch to give his wines a particular stalky savouriness, which is very much a trademark of his Pinots. For this cuvee he does a 100% whole bunch ferment with a portion of the grapes, and blends that back with the destemmed component. The ratio of each changes with every vintage. The finished wine has fragrant whole bunch characteristics, fresh red fruit, and plenty of spice. Delicious and balanced, with a very long finish.

title: Ehret Family Knight Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Our 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon opens smooth upon entry with a lifted palate of chocolate-covered cherries. The wine features long, lingering oak tannins that extend the palate on the back end. Expressing layers of fruits like Santa Rosa plum, red, and black cherries, the fruit provides a foundation upon which to showcase the vibrant flavours. Approachable but complex array of fresh fruit nuances. It drinks well now and will be exceptional for the next 5-8 years.

title: 2019 Timo Mayer Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Timo sources his Cabernet from Yering, which is slightly warmer than his Bloody Hill vineyard. The wine is whole-bunch fermented with wild yeasts. Spicy and stalky, it has the classic black and red berry notes of Cabernet with a perfumed freshness.

title: Binyamina Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon Kosher 2017
Description: Red wine characterized by a restrained maturity and excellent balance between freshness and concentration of ripe fruit flavours. Its rich colour, concentrated aroma and flavour, complementary acidity, and high complexity are the result of optimal ripening conditions and diverse terrains.

title: COS Delle Fontane 2014
Description: Sourced from estate vineyards in the area of Fontane in Vittoria where the winery is located. 300 m elevation, flat exposition. Red soil of medium consistency; made up of subalpine sands composed of limestone and silica. Hand-harvested. Vines average 25 years of age. Dark berry character. Full to medium body, textured tannins and a vibrant finish.

title: Timo Mayer The Doctor Pinot Noir 2019
Description: Sourced from Timo's infamous Bloody Hill vineyard, this wine is similar to his other Pinot - Close Planted - except it is made with 100% whole bunch. The nose is powerful and wildly aromatic, while the palate is deliciously savoury, with incredible texture and fresh acidity. Put simply, it is an absolutely stunning wine. Great to drink now, but will age beautifully as well.

title: Darting St. Laurent Dry Feuerberg 2018
Description: The color is ruby red in the glass and reveals the scent of ripe plums and dark wild cherries accompanied by bourbon vanilla. On the palate there are soft tannins with a pleasant length.

title: Incognito Red Cuvee 2017
Description: This wine is made from six different varieties using traditional pulp fermentation and aged for fifteen months in old barrique barrels made from French oak. Incognito is a medium red wine with wonderful fruit accents, not so heavy in alcohol, yet complex in taste. Like all our red wines, this cuvee is consistently dry, but with a soft tannin structure. Ideal as a food companion for everyday pleasures: pasta, cheese variations, or a hearty snack.

title: Hill Family Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Spicy cherry and dark rose notes developed in the wine and these evolved beautifully in the 11 months it spent in barrel. This wine had no fining and only a light filtration. Lovely aromas of cherry pie, almond and anise are balanced by a hint of clove, plum and Bing cherry fruit on the palate. Tannins and colour were abundant, giving us a wine of deep colour, firm, yet fine-grained tannins and a rich, juicy mid-palate.

title: The Cave Kosher 2016
Description: 250 Years ago an enormous cave was quarried inside a natural grove in the heart of the Carmel Mountains. The conditions created by the cave's natural features turned it into an ideal wine cellar and in the 19th Century it was used as such. This top quality wine is a blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, and 2% Petit Verdot. The grapes were harvested in the choicest vineyards in the Upper Galilee and underwent meticulous production processes. Aged for 24 months in French oak barrels and will age for years to come.

title: Mettler Copacetic Red
Description: The Copacetic Red is a Zinfandel-based red blend sourced from estate vineyards in Lodi. The region is a benchmark for Zinfandel, where warm days, cool evenings and sandy loam soils produce wines of notable balance. This one is super food-friendly, lively, rich and intense, with suggestions of dark berries, chocolate, warm spices and subtle oak tones. Try it with grilled ribs.

title: Barmes Buecher Pinot Noir Reserve 2018
Description: A sonorous tone of ripe but fresh black cherry appears on the nose. The palate has the same poise and purity. There is concentration and firmness of texture, fineness of tannin, but also toned slenderness. It's a very elegant Pinot Noir.

title: Bask Pinot Noir
Description: This dry and soft-textured pinot is low in sugar and loaded with dark berries, toast and spice aromas and flavours. Subtle citrus and nutty notes round out the finish. The perfect match for year-round casual entertaining; serve with grilled salmon, roasted root vegetables or a selection of local cheeses.

title: Tryst Smooth and Silky Red
Description: From Arterra wines, the Tryst label features approachable, flavourful wines. Packed with juicy plum and dark fruit flavours, and a hint of spice, this soft-textured red blend can be lightly chilled before serving. Pair with grilled meats, seared tuna or stuffed portabella mushrooms.

title: Duemani CiFRA 2018
Description: This is a direct and fruity expression of Cabernet Franc with lots of tension, freshness and energy. It is a beautiful and delicious red with fresh tobacco, cherries and hints of earth. Medium body, light tannins and a fresh finish that puts an emphasis on dark fruit and deeply vinous perfumes. 92P JS. 91P RP.

title: Duemani Altrovino 2017
Description: Altrovino has intensity and richness that are really impressive. Expressive with aromas of blueberry, myrtle, hints of basil and chocolate. Tannins are nice, velvety and soft. Full body with a beautiful freshness on the finish. 94P JS. 93+P RP.

title: Naturalmente Bio Perricone IGT 2018
Description: For decades the Perricone grape, also known as pignatello, had been the undisputed leader of the red grapes in western Sicily. A careful vinification has transformed its prickly character into an incomparable personality: a one of a kind wine. Rich with red fruits, mixed with notes of liquorice, a classic expression of the relationship between the variety and its land. A wine of great power and harmony while simultaneously expressing a fresh and lively character. Pairs well with charcuterie/salumi and other savoury antipasti, eggplant parmigiana, vegetable tarts and cheeses.

title: Duemani Suisassi Syrah 2017
Description: In 2017 Suisassi Syrah expresses the maximum of the varietal with a finesse and an impressive quality. Spices, raspberry, dark berries, licorice and hints of violet, follow one another in an aromatic concert. Full body and silky tannins, all in perfect balance, in this year of warmth and concentration. It is a bomb. 99P JS. 94 RP.

title: Duemani Cabernet Franc 2017
Description: Duemani Cabernet Franc 2017 is an intense and concentrated wine, relieved by a great freshness. Along with the pleasant notes of spices and dark berries, you get all the thickness and the richness you might expect from a Cabernet Franc of this vintage. Straight and energetic. 95P JS. 95P RP.

title: Ashkar Doer Blend Cabernet Sauvignon/Merlot 2014
Description: DOER is a great blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and hints of Shiraz. The grapes were handpicked from a vineyard in the village area of Iqrit. This full bodied red wine is well balanced and is characterized by it's rich fruity flavours of black berries and toasted oak.

title: Robertson Winery Chapel Red
Description: Situated in the Robertson wine region, in South Africa's Western Cape Province, Robertson Winery has been making wine since 1941. This cabernet-merlot blend is soft and extra dry, with ample cassis, smoke, cedar and bell pepper flavours. Suitable for every occasion, and the perfect pour with ribs, steaks or hearty stews.

title: Slow Press Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Slow Press wines are a tribute to the craft of winemaking. This Cabernet Sauvignon blends fruit from three key California regions. Pour a glass and savour the depth, balance and natural fruit character. Expect bold, dark fruit, cedar and bell pepper flavours and a velvety finish. It's ideal to pair with your BBQ favourites.

title: Kozlovic Teran 2018
Description: Fresh and intense aromas of raspberry, blueberry and strawberry are complemented by hints of pepper and herbaceous notes. Bright and vibrant with silky tannins.

title: Theopetra Estate Red Blend 2017
Description: Deep purple colour, fruity aromas of blackberry, blackcurrant and cherry, sweet aromas of quince paste, black pepper, sandalwood and coffee. Rich, and at the same time, elegant palate with pure flavours of black fruits, nicely integrated ripe tannins, sweet spices and a long complex finish.

title: Floralia D'Arcos Vinhao 2019
Description: Intense in colour with aromas of red fruits. Fruity, balanced, soft and persistent. Pair with meat dishes, especailly baked and grilled. Serve between 12° and 15° C.

title: Emina Crianza 2016
Description: Intense cherry red with purplish hues. Highly complex in the nose with blackberry and plump jelly. Toasted and nutmeg notes in the background blending perfectly with the primary flavours of red fruit. Smooth, elegant silky tannins and fruit driven finish.

title: Giacosa Barolo Falletto 2016
Description: Purchased in 1980, the Falletto estate is comprised of 13 hectares in the commune of Serralunga d'Alba. Considered by Bruno Giacosa as the best area for producing elegant and long-lived Barolos, the Falletto vineyard is southwest facing in an ampitheatre of steep slopes of calcareaous clay soils. After three weeks' maceration in stainless, this rested for 30 months in French Botti casks, followed by 6 months in bottle. The Falletto Barolos are austere, elegant and complex, with excellent structure and suave tannins.

title: Giacosa Barbaresco Asili 2017
Description: 'There's impeccable transparency and freshness to this Barbaresco on the nose, which introduces bright rose petals, lifted orange peel, crushed stones and sour cherries. The stoney tannins trace intricate detail on the medium to full-bodied palate, highlighting the racy acidity, brambly undertones and a beautiful array of wild berries. Yes, there's power and depth of flavor, but this is all about grace and beauty. Drink from 2024.' 97 points, JamesSuckling.com (November 2019)

title: Marenco Aldo Suri Organic 2018
Description: Made from organic certified grapes which have been hand selected from vineyards just above the town of Dogliani. One of the main characteristics of Suri is the uniqueness that the aging in concrete vats gives the wine. Suri is an easy drinking young red wine which has a bouquet of red fruits, jam and liquorice.
By:: Az. Agr. Marenco Aldo Di Maren

title: Gallo Otto Marche Rosso IGT 2016
Description: Firm nose, light toasted, sooty, spicy oak, black berries and notes reminiscent of oregano, licorice, nuts, dark chocolate and a hint of coffee. Firm, juicy, dark fruit on the palate, smoky, sooty, toasted, spicy oak and some chocolate, hint of bacon, licorice, some dried herbs, persistent and full-bodied. Good substance, some depth, integrated sandy tannins, prominent spicy oak on a fairly fresh, firm, juicy finish.

title: Chateau Chizay Cabernet Sauvignon Kosher 2019
Description: Full bodied with intense colour and rich flavour. Pleasant aroma of violets and almonds. Harmonious with distinctive tartness and nicely balanced acidity. Serve at 16°C with red meat dishes, salami or hard cheeses.

title: Toscana Rosso Carbonaie IGT 2015
Description: In the glass the wine shows a deep ruby red color. Deep and intense on the nose, with aromas of ripe fruit. It presents a strong body and is followed by a special elegance and complexity, presenting a mix of blacks fruits and a hint of spice. The taste is subtle and round, with a lingering aftertaste. 95 points - David Lawrason/WineAlign
By:: Il Drago E La Fornace Srl

title: San Bastian Barbera D'Asti DOCG 2019
Description: This Barbera D'Asti is in its most classic version. Entirely vinified in steel with a short cold maceration before fermentation, this wine best expresses the characteristics of the grapes, enhancing the fruity notes accompanied by a good structure typical of Barbera wine from Agliano. Suitable for immediate consumption or can be extended to the next 2-3 years with the possibility of tasting its quality even longer in the best years. Food pairings: Great with cod, white & red meats, cheese and salami.
By:: Poderi Rosso Giovanni Di Rosso Lion

title: Domaine Les 4 Vents Crozes-Hermitage "Saint Jaimes" 2017
Description: Intense red colour with a nice deep purple concentration. This is a well-balanced wine with a good structure, displaying strawberry jam notes with a long and elegant toasted finish.

title: Domaine Les 4 Vents Crozes-Hermitage Rouge "4 Vents" 2018
Description: Intense red colour with deep purple hints. Ripe red fruits with subtle pepper notes dominate this wine. The palate reaches a nice structure with delicate tannins and an elegant spicy finish.

title: Montesecondo TIN San Giovese 2017
Description: The fruit is hand-harvested, destemmed and put directly into unlined, above-ground, 250-to-350-liter clay amphorae from Spain. Fermentation is spontaneous with native yeasts and no sulfur added. Maceration with the skins lasts 6-8 months before racking and bottling without fining or filtration.

title: Domaine Boucabeille Monte Nero Cotes du Roussillon Village 2017
Description: This wine displays a deep purple colour and the nose shows a complexity between black cherries and spices. The palate is very well balanced: fresh, fruity, spiced, with fine tannins. This is a full-bodied wine, with a delicate ageing in barrels, and despite the hot climate in Roussillon it is a wine with a strong minerality and nice length. It can be kept over 10 years.

title: Maison Noire Cabernet Franc 2015
Description: Inspired by the Loire Valley style in France, this medium-bodied red delivers velvety red berry flavours with an earthy, herbal core. Nutty nunaces of oak carry through to a light, fragrant finish. Pair with pork or veal dishes.

title: Graffiti Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Pelee Island Winery presents a medium-bodied, deeply-coloured cabernet sauvignon that delivers great taste and excellent value. You will enjoy aromas and flavours of black plum, toast, nuts and herbs, underscored by notes of more dark fruit. Pair with charcoal-grilled black bean burgers or a selection of aged cheeses.

title: Megalomaniac Much Obliged Red
Description: Honouring our brave healthcare workers, a portion of the proceeds of each bottle sold will be donated by Megalomaniac to Food Banks Canada. This blend of 100% Ontario grapes displays flavours of red berries and dark fruits with nuances of spiciness and dried flowers. Superb with roast lamb or a selection of local cheeses.

title: Cono Sur Pinot Noir Organic
Description: Cono Sur was the first Chilean winery to export pinot noir. Made from organically grown grapes sourced in the Colchagua, San Antonio and Bio-Bio valleys. This balanced and juicy pinot is brimming with floral, underbrush, fig, red fruit and citrus aromas. A great value and the perfect pour for seared tuna or char siu pork.

title: San Pietro Monferrato Rosso Bellavita 2013
Description: This is a beefy red bend of Albarossa (crossing of Nebbiolo and Barbera), Barbera, and Cabernet Sauvignon. Aged in French oak for two years smoothes out the tannins and warms up the fruit with spices and vanilla. Great finish.
By:: Tenuta San Pietro In Tassarolo Az.

title: Peller Family Vineyards Light Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon Light is made with grapes from the finest vineyards in Canada and around the world. Lighter in alcohol without compromising on flavour, this cab offers notes of cassis, flowers, nuts and bell pepper highlighted by a smooth finish. Ideal for any occasion or pair with red sauce pasta, pizza or barbecue.

title: Lion D'or Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Ruby red colour and luscious aroma of berries, cherry and sweet spices. Well-rounded with soft tannins and velvety finish. Perfect Pairing: Accompanies pleasantly our daily menu, roasted meats and vegetables, braised meat casserole, meats and poultry with delicate sauces and medium strong cheeses.

title: Marqués de Vitoria Reserva 2014
Description: I love the overtness to the fruit here, but also the focus; it opens with dark cherries, freshly picked blackcurrants, heather, black raspberries and tangerine peel. The palate shows just the right balance of polished tannins and plush dark fruit, with the punchy acidity keeping everything in check. Pure and agile. Drink now [to 2023+]. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, July 26, 2019)

title: Palladino Barbera D'Alba DOCG 2017
Description: Easy to drink and and elegant, it has a fruity nose with notes of blackberry, strawberry and cherry. The palate is well balanced, with a fresh, dry taste. As it ages, it relaxes and becomes soft and velvety.

title: Hobo Camp Cabernet Franc Organic 2018
Description: An elegant, light-bodied and varietally compelling wine for a value-minded price. The 2018 Camp Cabernet Franc is 40% from the organic Mojon's Bench vineyard in Alexander Valley, and 60% from the organic and biodynamic Puma Springs vineyard in Dry Creek Valley. Simple winemaking with 20% whole cluster, native yeasts, and the wine was aged in 1-4 year old barrels.

title: Hobo Camp Cabernet Sauvignon Organic 2018
Description: Organic and sustainably farmed grapes from the Alexander and Sonoma valleys. Fermented in stainless steel followed by 10 weeks in old oak, this is a fresh, fruit-forward style. Fresh red berries with a hint of creamy vanilla are accompanied by a very refreshing acidity.

title: Hobo Folk Machine Pinot Noir 2019
Description: Folk Machine Pinot Noir is always fairly light weight and light in colour with relaxed tannins and medium acid. 2019 is consistent with the past few vintages and with what we expect from this wine. It is a very lively and an easy wine to serve with most foods. Keep expecting a fun Pinot that is elegant, pretty, and drinkable. Though light in colour due to no attempt to extract or over manipulate, the wine does not lack for flavour or body, but rather shows the silky more subtle side of the variety.

title: Sandbanks Route 33 Red VQA
Description: Sandbanks Estate Winery is situated along the picturesque shores of Lake Ontario, in the heart of Prince Edward County. Route 33 Red is an elegant partnership of merlot and petit verdot, offering flavours of spice, smoke, plum and herbs with a citrus finish. Pairs well with roasted beef, lamb or dishes with a hint of spice.

title: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Baco Noir VQA
Description: From an award-winning winery comes this well-made baco noir. Expect inviting aromas and flavours of blackberry, ripe plum, oak, spice and smoke. The wine is full-bodied and smooth with a dry, lengthy finish. Serve with a venison burger alongside onions rings or lightly peppered lamb skewers.

title: Golden Coast Red VQA
Description: The golden coast of Lake Ontario's southern shore is known as the Fruit Belt, home to plums, cherries, blueberries, strawberries and a bounty of juicy wine grapes. This rich blend includes merlot, cabernet and baco noir; a bottle of sunshine to be enjoyed year-round. Serve with grilled meats or roasted vegetables.

title: Monterra M-Block Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: A ripe, round wine, with blueberry, blackberry, eucalyptus, mint and lifted violet floral notes - very nice! This medium- to full-bodied, generous Cabernet Sauvignon offers great value and has the region's supple tannins. Pair with grilled meats. (Vintages panel, Feb. 2020)

title: Just Merlot
Description: This is an approachable French merlot, exhibiting aromas and flavours of blackcurrant, spice, cherry, and raspberry. It's medium-bodied and fruity with a velvety finish. A perfect match for roasted rosemary chicken sided by fluffy rice and sautéed turnips or fennel sausages on a bun with roasted red peppers.

title: Benvenuti Caldierosso 2017
Description: Caldierosso is a cuvee of our indigenous Istrian grape variety Teran, Italian Nebbiolo, Spanish Tempranillo and Merlot. Full body wine with perfect tannins, well balanced acidity and expressed aromas of forest fruits; blueberry, raspberry, vanilla and carob.

title: Lacour Tourny Bordeaux Merlot Cabernet
Description: An attractive, everyday Bordeaux at a great price. It's crafted using merlot, the dominant grape in the blend, and cabernet sauvignon. The two together make a harmonious wine. Expect plum, cherry, raspberry, oak and herbal tones. It's full-bodied and smooth with a long finish. Pair with lamb chops and grilled vegetables.

title: Sandbanks Baco Noir VQA
Description: Deep ruby red colour; upfront aromas of vanilla and dark berry fruit; extra dry, medium bodied, with a sweet fruit centre, refreshing tangy acidity and flavours of juicy black fruit, hints of savory pink grapefruit and smokiness.

title: Três Bagos Reserva Red 2016
Description: This wine is a blend of 40% Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo), 35% Touriga Franca and 25% Touriga Nacional, all grown on the producer's family vineyard and matured for a year in stainless steel and another in oak. Expect an elegant, structured wine with an interplay of earthy red and dark berry fruit, and pour it with beef stew or burgers.

title: Terroir D'Altitude Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: This food-friendly wine was aged for four months in French oak. Expect aromas and flavours of blackcurrant, cinnamon and spice. It's full-bodied and smooth with a long, graceful finish. Pair with grilled steak alongside sweet potato fries and seasonal vegetables.

title: Casalinho Juta 2019
Description: Notes of jammy red fruit and spices. Round texture in the mouth, with elegant tannins. Full-bodied, with long and distinct aftertaste.

title: Adaras Aldea 2019
Description: A nose of preserved fruit balances a drier palate from a short time in oak. Nice ripeness comes through the limestone minerality, as well as tannin and red, pulpy fruit.

title: Bell'Aja Bolgheri 2017
Description: Lots of bright fruit and orange-peel character with hints of smoky oak. It's full and flavorful. Drink or hold. Score - 91. (jamessuckling.com, July 1, 2020)

title: Giacosa Barbera d'Alba Faletto 2018
Description: Intense aromas and flavours of cherry, layered with hints of licorice, graphite, and plum preserves. Balanced and full-bodied on the palate with nicely integrated acidity. Optimal period for consumption: 2020-2030

title: Tilenus Ecologico 2019
Description: Bodega Estefania is not a newcomer here with its Mencia cuvées. It reiterates with an organic version with a fruity character. Vinified with the precious advice of the great Raùl Perez, the wine showcases the digestible and flavourful profile of the king of Bierzo grape varieties, with notes of red and black berries, a floral touch and spicy fragrances.

title: G6 Vina Bibich 2017
Description: Aged in French oak, this has rose and raspberry perfumes, with deep black-plum and berry flavours. Striking acidity and bold, angular tannins soften on the palate, revealing a smooth, luscious finish.

title: Chateau Carras Red 2010
Description: Red dry P.D.O. made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Limnio, Merlot. A rich deep purple colour with complex aromas dominated by black berried fruits and vanilla. Delicate, smoky, with structure and balance. Excellent quality, rich and long velvety finish. This wine has the potential for long ageing. Best with red meats, game, hard cheeses and spicy sauces.

title: San Pietro Ruché di Castagnole Monferrato 2018
Description: [Luca Maroni did not include a review.] Score - 94. (lucamaroni.com, July 30, 2019)

title: Santa Rita Secret Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Great cabernet sauvignon from the Maipo Valley, a region known as one of the best for growing this variety. A ruby red colour is followed by aromas and flavours of ripe, black fruit and vanilla with notes of herb, cedar and cloves. The palate is full-bodied and smooth with fine structure. Match to a good burger or lamb.

title: Fartote Red 2018
Description: Ruby in colour with complex aromas of ripe fruit. Well balanced with predominance of fresh fruit; smooth and alluring tannins; good acidity. Serve between 16 - 18 ºC.

title: Barmes Buecher Pinot Noir VV 2018
Description: A subtle charge of Amarena cherry unfolds before notes of ripe, fresh red cherry and stone take over on the aromatic nose of this wine. The sinuous palate is framed by freshness, held within a fine tannic structure that allows both the purity of cherry fruit and concentration to shine in this elegant Pinot.

title: Tesouro de Pais
Description: Intense colour, unusual aroma of ripe fruit and red fruits with an intense, velvety taste. Smooth tannins and elegant finish.

title: Do Sanguinhal Petit Verdot 2016
Description: The palate is full bodied, with soft tannins and elegant after taste. Long and smooth finish.

title: Nemeion Nemea Reserva 2010
Description: Intense, clean and complex aromas of fruit, oak, vanilla and cloves. Multifaceted. Velvety with good quality tannins. Rich and full bodied with a long finish. The grapes are picked by hand in the second half of October. Best served at 18°C with red meats, game and hard cheeses.

title: Tandem Winery Macula Red 2013
Description: A wine with a deep burgundy red colour, of good intensity. A very complex nose with delicate notes of spices, cloves, black pepper. Mineral, hints of mountain vegetation and scrubland, balsamic and dark chocolate notes. Powerful on the palate and rounded at the same time, with nuances of the Yerri Valley's distinctive terroir where wines, woodland flowers and violets are found growing. A long finish, very elegant and fresh.

title: Stravaganza 2017
Description: Intense flavour of ripe red fruit, with slight hints of vanilla. Powerful but elegant this wine expresses the unique character of the Douro wines.

title: Trilho da Raposa 2016
Description: Intense ruby red. Aromatic notes of wild fruits, very ripe red fruits and jam. Delicate, very soft, fruity with ripe tannins and a long pleasant finish.

title: Tandem Winery Immune Red 2019
Description: Deep and attractive red colour with a powerful violet rim. Mountain wine with a powerful expression of the terroir. Intense black fruit, thyme, rosemary and notes of scrubland. On the palate it is long, very fresh, broad and savoury with a generous structure and an attractive texture.

title: Tandem Winery Ars Nova 2014
Description: An elegant wine overflowing with ripe fruit flavours complemented by delicate balsamic and spicy notes. Layered with complexity, this is a powerful expression of its mountainous terroir.

title: Dona Matilde Red 2017
Description: Aromas of ripe black fruit such as black plum and fig followed by a resinous and menthol character surrounded by smoked notes and spices like green pepper. On the palate, soft and full-bodied, fresh with good acidity and a long and persistent aftertaste. Serve between 16 - 18 ºC.

title: Hautes Pierres Rouge 2016
Description: Colour: deep purple with ruby highlights. Bouquet: intense, rich extracts with scents reminiscent of red fruits and candied fruits followed by hints of spices, cocoa and roast. Palate: full body with fruit flavours balanced elegantly by soft tannins and a long, smooth finish with lingering hints of red berries and fruits. Dishes: roast and grilled meat, game birds, richly flavoured dishes, medium and aged cheese. Ageing: 8 to 10 years. Recommended temperature: 16°

title: Eduardo Torres Pirrera 2016
Description: This organically farmed wine is full of fresh red fruit with herbaceous tones. Excellent minerality and subtle earth tones. Very perfumed! Lovely wine to drink.

title: Turtle Red 2018
Description: Sour cherry colour of medium depth with violet edges. It expresses and offers a very appealing and elegant aromatic bouquet of all the aromatic nuances offered in a very elegant way by all the grape varieties like leather, pepper, violets, sweet spice and slight hints of cocoa powder. Dense and powerful, it needs age to fully develop its charm and show its capacity to age beautifully. The tannins are delicious and the acidity of the wine is balanced. Excellent and lingering aftertaste.
By:: Minos Cretan Wines Sa Miliarakis Br

title: Carro Stellato Orcia Rosso DOC 2013
Description: Intense ruby red in colour, it is characterized by hints of ripe red fruits, accompanied by spicy and balsamic notes. On the palate it is full, with ripe and well integrated tannins. Good gustatory persistence.

title: Giallo Toscana Rosso IGT 2018
Description: Ruby red. Nose very typical expression profile, with hints of cherry, tobacco and tending to a final spicy aroma. In the mouth it is balanced, elegant, characterized by distinct notes tasty and minerals persistent.

title: Prestige Rouge 2013
Description: Colour: deep purple with ruby highlights. Bouquet: intense, rich extracts with scents reminiscent of black fruits, red fruits (blackcurrant, cherry) followed by hints of spices, licorice, mint, cocoa and roast. Palate: full bodied, concentrated, with fruit flavours balanced elegantly by soft tannins and a long, smooth, elegant finish with lingering hints of red berries and spices. Dishes: roast and grilled meat, game birds, richly flavoured dishes, medium and aged cheese. Aging: 8 to 10 years. Recommended temperature: 16°

title: Lomond Syrah Cape Agulhas 2016
Description: Deep ruby. Expressive aromas of classic spice, with beautiful blackberry undertones. Abundant aromatic flavours of white pepper with dark fruit and well-structured tannins. Elegant.

title: Arcere Orcia Rosso DOC 2016
Description: Dark ruby red with light garnet hues. The nose is very rich, with hints of leather, tobacco and wood vinegar. This complexity is also found on the palate, with moderate tannins well integrated into the structure of the wine. Good minerality. A wine of great longevity and persistence of flavour.

title: Tenario 1 2016
Description: Rated 90 points by Wine Advocate. The wine matured in a combination of concrete tanks (30%) and used barriques for ten months. This is the one with a younger and fresher profile and with more fruit character, a more serious version of the Adara Calcáreo, with very good drinkability and freshness. It's juicy and the tannins are quite polished, with the chalky texture of the limestone soils.

title: 01' Orcia Sangiovese DOC 2016
Description: Ruby red colour with light garnet hues. The nose shows a very typical Sangiovese profile, with hints of cherry, undergrowth, tobacco and spice. Very balanced and elegant, the mouth is highly persistent with a typical mineral finish.

title: Lomond Cat's Tail Syrah 2017
Description: Single Vineyard. Clear, vibrant and rich ruby red. Juicy red fruit with ample black pepper and other spices and hints of floral notes. Rich and intense flavours of pepper, dark chocolate and spice with soft, silky tannins.

title: Guancianera Avulisi IGP Red Wine 2018
Description: This wine displays an intense ruby red colour, deep and impenetrable, with aromas of ripe sour cherry and blackberry. On the palate, compactness and softness, brought out by the velvety, sweet-tannins. To be served at 18° - 20° C.

title: Chateau Maison Blanche Bordeaux Rouge 2015
Description: Chateau Maison Blanche was purchased in 2000 by Patrick Bouey. While their purchase of Chateau Maison Blanche is relatively recent, as far as Bordeaux goes, the Bouey family has a long history in the region. In fact, the family has been active in the Bordeaux region as winemakers and negociants since 1821. Medium-bodied, with a forward, easy going, early drinking character.

title: Herzog Special Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: The Alexander Valley features layers of gravel - ideal for growing premium-quality, ageable Cabernets - and produces full-bodied, soft-textured Cabernets. This textbook example has generous blackberry, cherry, vanilla and mocha notes along with licorice, which is another Alexander Valley hallmark. Pair it with grilled portobello mushrooms, roast turkey or grilled steak, or cellar for 7+ years.

title: Shabo Cabernet 2019
Description: A wine of dark ruby colour that has rich flavour with fruit and berry tones and a lasting, full, round taste with elegant tannins.

title: Château La Villatade Côtes Noires Réserve Minervois AOP 2016
Description: 'Elegant, marked by notes of cassis and underwood, then spicy notes, to finish with a minty touch. Ample and balanced. A very round wine with successful harmony on complex notes of prunes and underwood; the tannins are silky and velvety. In the finish, subtle notes of red and black berries extend the mouth.'

title: Château La Villatade Vin de Sophie 2017
Description: Fairly generous nose made up of cherry, blackberry, and spicy notes (gray and white pepper), along with delicate aromas of fresh mint and mocha. The wine is warm and envelops the palate well. A long and silky finish will make you want to have a second glass!

title: Berta Paolo Barbera D'Asti Superiore Valbeccara 2017
Description: Elegant and full-bodied wine with intense hints of red fruits and spicy notes, vanilla, chocolate, liquorice and tobacco, harmonious and round.

title: Berta Paolo Monferrato Rosso DOC 2018
Description: Ruby red colour; Notes of cherry and strawberry, fresh, balanced and pleasantly lively, slightly tannin, good body and soft structure.

title: Mesa do Presidente Red Douro
Description: Blend of three native varieties shows great charm, offering soft floral and lightly scented red-berry character with gentle spritz and refreshingly light, fruity finish. Very rich, intense, elegant and with a long aftertaste.

title: L'Astemia Pentita Barbera D'Alba Superiore DOC 2018
Description: The olfactory profile gives the concentration of fresh red berries. Moving the glass, you start feeling the sensations of complexity with some blackberry and black mature fruit. As a final touch you get some spicy hint that accomplishes the olfactory profile. The slight acidity exchanges immediately with the rich body and the wine invades the palate. The wine is fresh and drinkable thanks to the acidity that creates a balance with the alcohol and the rich extract.

title: L'Astemia Pentita Barolo DOCG 2015
Description: The wine has an open olfactory profile, intense and expressive. The flavours of blackberries and plum jam are quite evident, as well as some slight balsamic and spicy notes, with some tiny sensations of liquorice and brushwood. In the palate the wine structure is smooth and the full body of this Barolo promises the positive future evolution. It is a gastronomic wine and should be paired with important entrées.

title: Vernay Côte-Rôtie Blonde Seigneur 2017
Description: This côte blonde-style Côte-Rôtie (with 5% Viognier), is the perfect blend of intensity and delicacy. A dark colour with a mineral smoky nose with dark fruits, black olive and pepper all enhanced by a floral component brought by the Viognier. This is a highly aromatic and elegant wine. With well-constructed but perfectly smooth tannins, this Côte-Rôtie is well-rounded on the palate with a beautiful long finish. Smooth and sensual, it expresses an immediate pleasure.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Fontalle Chianti Classico Riserva Gran Selezione 2015 2015
Description: Vivid purple colour and a rich and intense bouquet with definite fruity notes of raspberries and blackberries and irises floral hints backed by notes of vanilla and resin. The flavour is full, concentrated, very elegant and balanced with a very agreeable, lingering aftertaste of licorice and conserve. Drink over the next 5-7 years. 14.5% alc/vol

title: Di Majo Norante Cabernet 2018
Description: A dark-fruited, brambly nose with building notes of peperoncino, dried thyme and dark plums. Medium to full body, ripe, fleshy tannins and a medium-chewy, tarry finish. Drink now. Score - 91. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Boutari Naoussa Xinomavro 2017
Description: The 2017 Naoussa is a Xinomavro, of course, aged for 12 months in well-used French oak. It comes in at 12.9% alcohol. With this vintage, Boutari revives its original, old-style label as 'the first ever bottled red Greek wine.' It's very atmospheric. The wine is pretty good too. I'd say this is the best since the 2013, granting that they aren't all here together, which makes it a nice bargain. It's beautifully textured and approachable, and it has some of that Xinomavro earthiness. The power is tamed, though. This is a relatively refined Naoussa, not an older and more rustic style. That's not to say there isn't a little bite on the finish, but the tannins are rather ripe. This is lovely. It should age well. The price is pretty nice too. It's a perfect choice for a house pour or a restaurant. Drink date: 2020-2030. Score - 89. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Sept. 30, 2020)

title: Elo Single Vineyard Monastrell 2015
Description: Opaque ruby. Cherry, cassis and lavender on the fragrant, spice-accented nose. An appealingly sweet midweight that offers juicy red and blue fruit flavors and hints of vanilla and fruitcake. Closes smooth and broad, displaying very good clarity, smooth tannins and a late suggestion of candied licorice. -- Josh Raynolds. PAIRING SUGGESTIONS: This is a Monastrell to enjoy, savor and sip. Due to its restraint and balance, Elo is an incredibly food-friendly wine. Ideal pairings include pastas with sausage, octopus, dishes heavy in green vegetables and lean meats. This wine also pairs perfectly with cheeses.
By:: Cia. De Vinos Del Atlantico, S

title: Plantagenet Normand Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Complex nose of black raspberry, cherry and savoury undertones of dry mocha and earthy notes. A torrent of blood plum and black cherry dance on the palate intertwined with savoury gamey flavours. The intensity of the fruit and savoury notes is well supported by a fine grain tannin and excellent acidity. A very well balanced palate with the potential to age. 93 points James Suckling. 92 pts James Halliday.

title: Plantagenet Aquitane Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: Parcels of fruit from the highest quality vineyards in the region were harvested. Intense cassis and dried floral aromatics. Resolved tannins frame a dense vibrant core of berry fruit, hints of fresh tobacco and subtle earthy undertones. 93 Points James Suckling.

title: Plantagenet Wyjup Collectioin Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: The best parcels of Cabernet fruit from the highest quality Wyjup vineyards in the region were harvested to make this wine. Intense aromas of cassis and dried floral characters balance well with the subtle nuances of spicy oak. Well structured tannins provide the backbone to the dense and vibrant characters of dark berry fruit, with hints of fresh tobacco and generous, earthy undertones. This wine is delicious now but will reward those with the patience to cellar this wine.

title: Felsengartenkellerei Besigheim Eg Noir 2019
Description: Made using Pinot Noir, Acolon and Cabernet Dorsa grapes, this wine has a charming ruby red colour. It's slightly fruity aromas of blackberries and dark forest fruits come with a soft, round, full-bodied and lasting flavour. Pairs wonderfully with venison, lamb, beef and spicy cuisine.

title: Château Bouscaut 2017
Description: 92-94. Barrel Sample. Ripe and spicy, this wine has great fruit allied to firm tannins. It is juicy, full of black currant flavors and fine, ripe acidity. This wine should age well, drink from 2022. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast)

title: Pavillon Rouge 2017
Description: This has great concentration, with carefully balanced black fruits that are fleshy and inviting but unfussy. The berry size was a little bigger than last year after the September rains (70mm in 20 days) so there is a feeling of juice and mouthwatering seduction once you give it some time to work through the initial austerity. There's no dilution through the mid-palate, and it's one of the few second wines that really gets your attention in 2017. They lost 10% of the crop to frost, giving a yield of 35hl/ha, with no secondary fruits used in Pavillon or Margaux (not even the first generation buds from any affected plots). 22% of total production is the lowest ever for Pavillon, and combined with the low yield means there will be 40% fewer bottles. The vineyards were entirely organically farmed in 2017, although there are still no plans to go for certification. Harvested 18-26 September. 3.7pH. IPT 73 - as high as last year. 4% Cabernet Franc also in the blend. Will be 60% new oak. Drinking Window: 2024-2038. Score - 92. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Château Larcis Ducasse 2017
Description: The 2017 Larcis Ducasse is a rich, sensual wine, with softer contours and more plushness than is typically the case, part of which is attributable to the vintage and part of which is the result of gentler winemaking. Dark red cherry and plum fruit is nicely pushed forward in this succulent, racy Saint-Émilion. Mocha, licorice and menthol wrap around the juicy, pliant finish. The 2017 is an especially succulent, racy Larcis. It has been consistently brilliant on the four occasions I have tasted it so far. Score - 92-95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com)

title: Château Poujeaux 2017
Description: Right from the nose this has rich, deep cassis and dark fruit notes, as well as a lovely juicy vibrancy through the palate. There are firm tannins that have some vibrancy to them. Although it's not as persistent in structure as in 2016 and 2015, this is an extremely successful wine in the 2017 vintage. Aged in 33% new oak. A yield of 26hl/h, so there will be reduced volumes - an estimated 140,000 bottles this year. Fortunately the gravelly heart of the vineyard was not affected by the frost. There is an austerity to the tannins but it's still hugely enjoyable. Drinking Window: 2021-2032. Score - 92. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Château Clinet 2017
Description: Alluring, offering fleshy layers of fig, boysenberry and plum compote notes lined with anise and roasted apple wood accents, this is nicely integrated already, with fresh acidity embedded throughout. Score - 92-95. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com)

title: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste 2017
Description: These guys often over-deliver in challenging years, and have done so yet again. As you would expect in a vintage that has produced such an excellent Lacoste Borie, this GPL is exceptional, a real success that's juicy and carefully extracted. It has weight and impact, with a Pauillac tannic hold and presence. It's one of my wines of the vintage, and a must buy. The balanced, sculpted, juicy black fruits fully deliver personality and signature style. Harvested 15-29 September, yielding 45hl/ha. 80% new oak. Drinking Window: 2025-2038. Score - 94. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2017
Description: The final blend of the 2017 Cos d'Estournel is 66% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 1% Petit Verdot and 1% Cabernet Franc. Very deep purple-black in color, it offers up intense scents of crushed blackcurrants, blackberries and black cherries with touches of incense, spice cake, star anise and plum preserves plus a perfumed hint of potpourri. The palate is medium-bodied with very firm yet wonderfully ripe, 'sweet', fine-grained tannins at just 13% alcohol?something of a miracle in our modern times. The palate sports fantastic freshness and tons of energy emitted from the intensely perfumed black fruit layers, finishing on an epically long-lingering mineral note. Truly profound. Score - 97-100. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Château d'Armailhac 2017
Description: Opulent and powerful for d'Armailhac with blackcurrants, blackberries and black olives. Full-bodied, tannic and extremely muscular. Very well done indeed. Score - 93-94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com)

title: La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion 2017
Description: This is a lovely fragrant wine, less dense and concentrated than the last two vintages but extremely accomplished. It has beautiful aromatics, gorgeous red fruits and an overall feeling of brightness and cohesion. It's fresh, succulent and easy to recommend. Frost only affected 0.3% of the vineyard area, leading to yields of almost 50hl/ha across the two estates in 2017. It was the third earliest harvest on record at Haut-Brion, commencing on 24 August for the whites and 31 August for the reds, with the only real difficulty to overcome being the low levels of sunshine over the summer. 22% of production went into this wine. Drinking Window: 2023-2033. Score - 92. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Colio Cellar Door Series Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: The Cellar Door Series is crafted in an approachable style. This fruit-forward cabernet sauvignon has inviting aromas and flavours of black currant, plum and a hint of oak. It's medium-bodied and fruity with a long, dry finish. Pair with barbecued steak, oven-roasted chicken, potatoes and seasonal vegetables.

title: Château d'Armailhac 2017
Description: Opulent and powerful for d'Armailhac with blackcurrants, blackberries and black olives. Full-bodied, tannic and extremely muscular. Very well done indeed. Score - 93-94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com)

title: Trius Baco Noir VQA
Description: Situated on Niagara-on-the-Lake, Trius has been creating quality wines for decades. This wine is deep ruby, with lovely notes of plum, earthy beets, cherry, spice and a hint of new leather. It's full-bodied and smooth with a lengthy finish. Serve with saucy ribs or grated beets and goat cheese over Fettuccini Alfredo.

title: Château Figeac 2017
Description: The 2017 Figeac is magnificent. Beautifully layered and exquisite in the glass, the 2017 possesses remarkable balance and harmony from the very first taste. An utterly beguiling, captivating wine, the 2017 simply has it all. Bright, red-toned fruit, mint, spice, lavender and rose petal overtones flesh out in the glass, but above all else, Figeac is a wine of total harmony. The Grand Vin includes 10% second generation fruit. Even so, production is down around 50%. Score - 94-97. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com)

title: Château Grand Mayne 2017
Description: The 2017 Grand Mayne has quite a powerful, voluminous bouquet with red berry fruit, smoke and truffle aromas, not quite delivering the same level of delineation as the previous vintage but still nicely focused. The palate is medium-bodied with fine-grain tannin, clean and precise with a fine bead of acidity. It is a lighter style of Grand Mayne compared to the wines of ten years ago, more nimble on its feet. The finish is lively, uncomplicated and quite mineral-driven, completing what is a fine follow-up to the 2016, though this will drink earlier. Drinking Window: 2021-2038. Score - 90-92. (Neal Martin, vinous.com)

title: Château Palmer 2017
Description: The 2017 Palmer, a blend of 54% Merlot with 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Petit Verdot, is very deep purple-black in color and leaps from the glass with freshly macerated blue and black fruits: wild blueberries, blackberries and black cherries plus hints of licorice, rose hips, tilled soil and oolong tea with a waft of truffles. Medium-bodied, very finely crafted with exquisitely ripe and smooth yet firm tannins and sporting great mid-palate intensity and wonderful freshness, it finishes long and minerally. Score - 96-98. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Château Pedesclaux 2017
Description: 93-95. Barrel Sample. This generous wine revels in its ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. It has firm tannins already fully integrated into the ripe blackberry fruit notes. Drink this fine wine from 2024. Score - 94. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast)

title: Château Clos Saint-Martin 2017
Description: Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2017 Clos St. Martin delivers impressively intense crushed blackberries and cassis notes with underlying espresso, cigar box and pencil shavings notes. Medium-bodied, finely crafted and elegant in the mouth, the vibrant fruit is well-framed by fine-grained tannins and seamless freshness, finishing on a lingering mineral note. Score - 91-93. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Clos La Madeleine 2017
Description: Fresh and focused, with a gentle mulled spice hint infusing the plum and cherry compote flavors. Delivers subtle toast and lingering whiffs of tobacco and savory. An understated style. Score - 89-92. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com)

title: Château Petit Village 2017
Description: This is layered and very poised with plum and chocolate character. Full body and chewy tannins that are polished and focused. Very long and serious. Score - 94-95. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com)

title: Domaine de Chevalier 2017
Description: The 2017 Domaine de Chevalier Rouge was cropped at 34hl/ha between 11 and 29 September and is matured in 35% new oak for 18 months. It has a vivacious bouquet with quite generous black fruit, raspberry, brine and black olive that is well-defined and focused, if not possessing the complexity of the previous two vintages. The palate is medium-bodied with fine, slightly edgy tannin - layers of black fruit interlaced with melted tar and graphite, closing in a little towards the finish with a gentle grip. I appreciate the deft manner in which this fans out and leaves a mineral residue on the finish. A Domaine de Chevalier of refinement rather than power, one with 'buvabilité' or 'drinkability'. Score - 92-94. (Neal Martin, vinous.com)

title: Château Gazin 2017
Description: A dense and flavorful red already with dark-berry, seaweed and wet-earth undertones. Full body and round and chewy tannins. Green olives on the finish. Serious for the vintage. Score - 94-95. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com)

title: Or Haganuz Amuka Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
Description: The Or Haganuz Amuka Cabernet Sauvignon is a dry red wine, made of Cabernet Sauvignon from the Idra vineyard. This vineyard is located 900m above sea level and is composed of mostly basalt soil which is commonly found in the Golan. Red in colour with some purple on the rim, this wine offers aromas of ripe berries, currants and toasted oak wood. This wine is full bodied with velvety tanins, a slight hint of coffee grains, and juicy red fruit on the finish.

title: Château Fonbadet 2017
Description: The 2017 Fonbadet is positively stellar. Plump, juicy and impeccably refined, the 2017 has so much to recommend it. Silky tannins wrap around a plush core of bright, red-toned fruit in this super-expressive inviting Pauillac. Fonbadet is not the most complex Pauillac readers will come across, but its balance and sense of harmony are simply impeccable. Tasted three times. Score - 91-94. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com)

title: Château Pichon-Longueville-Baron 2017
Description: The grand vin represents 50% of production this year. A blend of 79% Cabernet Sauvignon and 21% Merlot, the 2017 Pichon-Longueville Baron is deep garnet-purple in color and simply sings of vibrant blackcurrants, black cherries and rose hip notes with nuances of potpourri, incense, licorice and pencil shavings plus touches of cigar box and fertile loam. Medium-bodied, super intense and possessing stunning poise, it has very firm, fine-grained tannins and a beautifully silken texture, with bags of freshness and a very long, perfumed finish. Score - 95-97. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Château Saint-Pierre 2017
