Description: They have done a great job this year of not dipping far below the quality of the last few vintages. The only indications really are in the texture and the more savoury-edged register of the fruit. The tannins are a touch more pulled in on the finish, closing things off just slightly too early. Overall this is a clear success, with punch, personality, juice, fine tannic hold, and notes of bilberry fruits, charcoal and cedar smoke. Very good quality. ,Drinking Window: 2026-2040. Score - 94. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Château Haut-Bailly 2017
Description: The 2017 Haut-Bailly is composed of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot. Very deep garnet-purple colored, it has a wonderfully spicy nose of cinnamon stick, cloves, anise and fenugreek with core of roses, warm blueberries, black forest cake and black raspberries plus hints of underbrush and iron ore. Medium to full-bodied with firm, ripe, grainy tannins, it has oodles of freshness and great finesse, continuing bright and energetic on the long, minerally finish. Score - 94-96. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Vieux Château Certan 2017
Description: Composed of 81% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, the deep garnet-purple colored 2017 Vieux Château Certan gives up gorgeous black raspberries, crushed black currants and warm black berries on the nose with chocolate-covered cherries, violets and star anise suggestions plus black truffles and wood smoke. The palate is medium to full-bodied with wonderful concentration in the mid-palate and firm, very finely pixelated tannins, with seamless freshness and fantastic length. Score - 96-98. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Clos l'Église 2017
Description: The 2017 Clos L'Eglise is a wine that brings together power, tension and energy. There is quite a bit of richness to the fruit, but also plenty of supporting structure. Beams of underlying tannin give the 2017 its drive and sense of direction, while keeping the flavors perked up. Bright red stone fruit, mint and white pepper lead into a sculpted finish lifted by striking floral notes. This is a decidedly tannic, tightly wound Pomerol that is going to require patience, but it is also hugely promising. The 2017 was done in 100% new 300L barrels. Score - 92-95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com)

title: Château Gruaud Larose 2017
Description: Well-built, with plum and blackberry fruit that is very fresh, thanks to bright acidity. Light floral, anise and graphite notes add range. A savory streak keeps the finish going. Score - 91-94. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com)

title: Château Giscours 2017
Description: An accomplished, enjoyable Giscours. The fruit character is less generous than 2015 and 2016, but it still has presence and charm. Damson, bilberry, charcoal and slate are cradled by fine tannins that point to well-controlled extraction. There's no dip through the mid-palate, and the overall structure is juicy and elegant rather than exuberant. A juicy frame that will age well. ,Drinking Window 2025-2038. Score - 93. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Château Trotanoy 2017
Description: A final blend of 90% Merlot with 10% Cabernet Franc, the deep garnet-purple colored 2017 Trotanoy opens with expressive red and black fruit notes including redcurrant jelly, kirsch, Black Forest cake and cassis plus hints of roses, dried Provence herbs, tobacco and underbrush. Medium to full-bodied with generous, expressive fruits supported by plush tannins and just enough freshness, it finishes long. This is quite an opulent, decadent Trotanoy! Score - 96-98. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Pastoral Liqueur Red Wine
Description: Pastoral dessert wine gladdens the eye with dark garnet red colour. It features mild astringency, complex bouquet with tones of dried prune and boiled cream. Its taste is full, velvety, with tones of chocolate.

title: Château Duhart-Milon 2017
Description: 90-92. Barrel Sample. This is a perfumed wine, as well as a touch herbal, with generous tannins. It is juicy, ripe with black currant flavors but with an edge that gives some firm structure. The plush fruit is cut with acidity offering a fresh finish. Score - 91. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast)

title: Château Les Carmes Haut-Brion 2017
Description: The 2017 Les Carmes Haut-Brion is subtle and understated, but it's all there. Lifted aromatics, bright, red-toned fruit and silky tannins add to the wine's brilliant, chiseled personality. I find the 2017 more precise and nuanced than in the recent past, with less overt power. It's hard to know exactly if the style of the 2017 is a result of the growing conditions of the year, or the result of an evolution in winemaking that includes the introduction of terra cotta, among other things. I certainly get the sense Guillaume Pouthier reined the wine back a bit in 2017. No matter. The end result is all that counts, and in 2017 Les Carmes Haut-Brion is positively stellar. As always, the high percentage of Cabernet Franc and a healthy dollop of whole clusters give Les Carmes an explosive bouquet and plenty of saline-infused energy. A closing flourish of sweet red berry fruit, mint, rose petal and mocha leaves a lasting impression. The 2017 is not an obvious wine, but it sure is gorgeous. Don't miss it! Tasted two times. Score - 93-96. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com)

title: Château Bélair-Monange 2017
Description: A real success in the vintage, from an estate unaffected by frost. This wine is showing some beautiful floral notes, followed by a palate with lingering aromatics that tease. The well-handled, rich but flexible tannins lend an austerity that bodes well for ageing. The wine really opens up in the glass, and although it's a tighter effort than in the past few years, they are staking their claim to be among the best St-Émilions on the plateau. This is a gorgeous wine, and that austerity is going to fill out beautifully during barrel ageing. Drinking Window: 2026-2040. Score - 95. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Château Les Carmes Haut-Brion 2017
Description: The 2017 Les Carmes Haut-Brion is subtle and understated, but it's all there. Lifted aromatics, bright, red-toned fruit and silky tannins add to the wine's brilliant, chiseled personality. I find the 2017 more precise and nuanced than in the recent past, with less overt power. It's hard to know exactly if the style of the 2017 is a result of the growing conditions of the year, or the result of an evolution in winemaking that includes the introduction of terra cotta, among other things. I certainly get the sense Guillaume Pouthier reined the wine back a bit in 2017. No matter. The end result is all that counts, and in 2017 Les Carmes Haut-Brion is positively stellar. As always, the high percentage of Cabernet Franc and a healthy dollop of whole clusters give Les Carmes an explosive bouquet and plenty of saline-infused energy. A closing flourish of sweet red berry fruit, mint, rose petal and mocha leaves a lasting impression. The 2017 is not an obvious wine, but it sure is gorgeous. Don't miss it! Tasted two times. Score - 93-96. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com)

title: Emphasis Agiorgitiko 2016
Description: Agiorgitiko is one of Greece's most respected and widely planted grapes. This fine example offers aromas and flavours of dark red berry, plum and warm spice with vanilla and floral notes. On the palate this is full-bodied and generous with balanced acidity and ripe tannin on a long finish. Well suited to roast lamb or beef.

title: Le Sabbie dell'Etna Rosso 2017
Description: Le Sabbie dell'Etna Rosso comes to the glass with a delicious and complex bouquet with notes of cinnamon, black pepper, blackcurrant and cherries in alcohol.

title: Terredora Di Paolo Aglianico 2018
Description: A firm, chewy aglianico with cherry, walnut husk and some pepper. Medium body, slightly dried tannins and a medium finish. Drink now. Score - 89. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 24, 2020)

title: Fita Preta Alfrocheiro Também Quer Estar Nu Tinto 2018
Description: Dark bright violet colour, intense floral nose, some typical notes of chemical, earthy and graphite. In the mouth it shows good density, pure, fresh with a long texture.

title: Conceito Red 2017
Description: 95 pts Robert Parker - Fresh fruit, with cherry and blackberry notes, married with barrel notes. Good acidity, which gives it great gastronomic amplitude. There is no words to describe this great wine.

title: Domaine Simonis Pinot Noir 'Courbes' 2018
Description: Domaine Simonis is one of the biodynamic pioneers in Alsace, eliminating chemicals over 20 years ago. The family has been cultivating vines in Ammerschwihr since the 17th century. This Pinot Noir comes from a plot hand harvested at full maturity. After 3 weeks of maceration, the wine ages sur lies for a few month. Deep and structured red wine, you will find notes of ripe red fruits like blackberry and blueberry. It's best accompanied with red meat, charcuterie and cheese.

title: Domaine Simonis Lune Rousse Biodynamic 2019
Description: This 'late harvest' of Pinot Noir deserves an exceptional name. It's called Lune Rousse because the moon is the most important star for biodynamic vintners and its amber colour resembles the honey moon. This colour comes from a long and slow pressing of the grapes (6-8 hours). Afterwards a wild fermentation takes place in aged oak barrels for 6 months to bring structure to the wine. A delicious aperitif, or pair with foie gras or chocolate or red-fruit desserts.

title: Domaine Simonis Zèbre Biodynamic 2018
Description: This wine, a Simonis exclusivity, is intended to stand out from the crowd. Domaine Simonis is one of the biodynamic pioneers in Alsace, eliminating chemicals over 20 years ago. The Zèbre, first created in 2013, is a 'Blanc de Noir'. It's a 100% Pinot Noir, with a beautiful pink colour! The grapes were harvested by hand and then pressed directly without maceration. Magnificent fruit on the nose, supple in the mouth, the wine is both structured and concentrated. Best paired with Italian cuisine or grilled meat.

title: D'Ont Poke the Bear Red VQA
Description: A delicious blend of cabernet and baco noir. In the glass, its colour is a deep, dark purple. On the nose, it shows bright aromas of cedar, plum, flowers and herb with hints of vanilla and apricot. The dry, medium-plus bodied palate, is smooth, yet structured, with flavours of cedar, dark berries and sweet herb.

title: Cosimo Maria Nicole 2018
Description: Deep ruby colour, Nicole is an example of Sangiovese at its best - succulent and powerful, at the same time refined and elegant. Intriguing and complex on the nose, with a fruity component well recognizable also on the palate. The tannins are present but round and well integrated. A characteristic wine of excellent drinkability.

title: Stanley Red Wine 2018
Description: Elegant wine with great balance and structure, intense colour where the balance between the ripe fruit and the wood is notorious. The palate is voluminous, with soft tannins, long finish.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Considering this is the biggest production wine from this producer, it's really impressive. Redcurrants, blackcurrants, spearmint, aniseed, cedar, sage and pine needles. Very refined with fresh berries, interlaced between savory notes, the layers of tannins driven along by bright acidity. Drink now or hold. Better after 2021. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, May 3, 2019)

title: Terra d'Oro Zinfandel 2017
Description: An attractive, sunbaked earthiness gives this full-bodied wine a distinctive edge as it pours out deep blackberry and grilled plum flavors that ride the mouthfilling texture. It's a warming, hearty wine with personality.  Score - 90. (Jim Gordon, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2020)

title: Vegalfaro Rebel.lia Tinto 2019
Description: Deep ruby colour with purple hues on the rim. Medium intensity of red fruits, wild herbs and scrub with subtle toast and smoke. Fresh and clean driven by mature red fruit that fills the mouth with ripe red plum, cherry and blackberry. Fine integrated tannins and alcohol with good weight of fruit resulting in a long, balanced finish.

title: Vegalfaro Caprasia Bobal - Merlot 2018
Description: A medium ruby colour, clear and bright. On the nose a good intensity of ripe red fruit - red cherry, raspberry with underlying balsamic toasted notes. It´s a medium body wine, fresh and balanced on the palate with smooth red buttery fruit and polished velvet tannins balanced by fresh acidity. A moderate finish of lingering red and black cherry fruit.

title: Rennersistas Waiting for Tom Rot 2018
Description: The Waiting For Tom Rot has a beautiful glowing garnet hue with flexes of violet. This complex wine has aromas of spicy dark berries, minerals, with nuances of blackberries. On the palate, it is juicy with notes of cherries, blackberries, and liquorice. It has a beautifully refined tannin structure with a lovely and ever so slight minerality.

title: Gran Bombus Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Intense red with violet hues. Aromas of tobacco, black pepper and mature red fruit. Elegant and powerful, full of mature red and black fruit. It invades the palate with a wide and long aftertaste. The ageing in new French oak casks enhances the elegance of the wine without covering the fruit expression.

title: Gran Bombus Malbec 2016
Description: Deep ruby with violet hues. Intense and pure mature red fruit such as cherries and plums. On the palate, powerful, precise and elegant. This wine shows intensity of mature red fruit. On the pallet it is concentrated and balanced with generous weight, minerality and structure.

title: Alta Alella Merla 2019
Description: An expressive, fresh and pleasant red wine. A new vintage of this fruity wine, with intense aromas of ripe red fruit. Voluminous in the mouth, yet easy to drink. Back to the essence and the vinifications of the past, with the confidence that only the experience can bring. The purest expression of the traditional variety Mataró, a red with its own earthy-fruity personality.

title: Vega Sindoa Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: This Cab is sourced from hillside sites rich in red and gray marl with significant traces of sandstone. It's long and complex, with fresh dark cherry, cassis and pepper spice, all framed by tobacco smoke. Elegant tannins make it a great option for lamb or steak.

title: Domain Modat Petit Modat'mour Rouge Organic 2018
Description: Domaine Modat is located in Roussillon (Agly valley). Certified organic with biodynamic practices, the wines are a sincere reflection of the land where they are produced. Le petit modat'mour rouge is a blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah. The grapes are hand-picked and full of flavours with enough acidity to age a few years. Fresh and slightly spicy, it will pair well with a charcuterie board or spaghetti Bolognese.

title: Le Vieux Pin-Cuvée Violette 2018
Description: Cuvée Violette, as the name suggests, displays the perfumed and floral side of this noble grape variety. The palate is silky smooth thanks to a gentle co-ferment with just under 1% Viognier. The focus is on the feminine and graceful qualities of Syrah coming to the foreground. In the cellar we kid around and call this wine a syrah for Pinot Noir lovers. Crunchy bramble fruit and purple flowers mingle with pepper and spice. Red bramble fruits burst on the nose and on the palate. This cuvee is ready to be enjoyed and savoured upon release. It can be aged for the mid-term (5-7 years). It will most likely continue to improve past that age too.

title: Norma Etna Rosso DOC 2016
Description: In the glass the wine is bright with a light red cherry hue. On the nose the wine opens with aromas of woodland berries, baking spices, crushed blue flowers with a balsamic note. The juicy palate offers ripe dark cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and white pepper alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. The mineral driven finish closes on an anise note. The finish is long and lingering. Pairs well with tomato-based dishes, firm cheese, cured meats, or as a meditation wine on the patio. Drink 2018-2026

title: Alfacinha Superior Red IGP LX 2018
Description: The grape variety is on full display, with abundant notes of red fruits accompanied by a subtle floral touch. Fullbodied but elegant, juicy and lingering in the mouth.

title: Wayne Gretzky Cabernet Merlot VQA
Description: This bold and fruit forward expression of cabernet merlot blend shows its versatility. The ruby red colour is filled with an aromatic bouquet of cedar, black currant and chocolate with the notes of toast and nuts. These same flavours are reflected on the palate and supported by soft medium tannins and a dry finish.

title: Smallfry Barossa Estate Shiraz 2017
Description: Made from fruit sourced from the Vine Vale subregion of the Barossa Valley. This wine reflects the characters of the Solodized Solodnetz soil series in which it was grown. An elegant, spicy nose with developed, ripe, juniper berry characters and firm grainy tannins in the mouth. Very much a food orientated style, maturation in seasoned oak has integrated flavours without overpowering them. Dark plums, cigar box and cinnamon bark on the nose. Initial fruit sweetness balanced by grainy tannins and fresh acidity come through on the palate.
By:: W.G Ahrens + S.L Hilder Trading As

title: Vinota Red
Description: Obtained from Dao red grape varieties. This wine is young and fresh, very structured and with soft tannins. Reveals ripe red fruit and sweet jams.

title: Vinha Da Urze Reserva Red 2016
Description: This wine is dark in color, followed by ripe blackberry, fig and black cherry aromas with lightly integrated oak. It is a medium body, with an elegant texture and forward fruits on the palate.This wine matches with meats, cheeses and most Mediterranean cuisine. Serve between 15 and 16 º C.

title: Always On Friday 2018
Description: Brilliant claret ruby colour, rich fruit aroma with intriguing notes of chocolate, green tea and dates. On the palate it has power and structure but is, at the same time, fuity with ripe blackberry and cedar flavours standing out. A delicious, complex wine with a long, smooth finish.

title: Vinha do Bispado Reserva Red 2016
Description: Very fresh and elegant with notes of wild berries and black cherries in balance with seductive nuances of liquorice, the aroma being complexed by discrete wooden notes. On the mouth it is very concentrated, warm, with firm tannins and soft texture, very intense finish and persists to show strongly the strength of wines of the Upper Douro.

title: Little Fox Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Noble expressive and well-balanced. Bright bouquet of raspberry and green pepper. Hand-picked and hand-sorted, the wine spends 2-3 weeks on the skins. Aged in French oak barrels for 12 months.

title: Vinha Do Bispado Red 2018
Description: Medium in colour, aromatic bright wild blackberry and fig aromas dominate the nose, balanced with elegant ripe black fruits on the palate. This wine matches with meats, cheeses and most Mediterranean cuisine. Serve between 15 and 16 º C.

title: Lykos Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Rich, with a complex aromatic palette of spices, nuts, ripe fruit and chocolate. Round mouth-feel, with balanced acidity, progressive tannins and a long-lasting aftertaste.

title: Kratistos PDO Nemea 2016
Description: Deep ruby red colour with a complex bouquet of spices, cinnamon and tobacco framed by ripe fruit aromas and hints of vanilla. Rich, spicy palate with soft, balanced tannins and velvety aftertaste. Can be aged for long periods.

title: Artakama Natural Pinot Noir Organic 2018
Description: Nothing added, nothing removed. The practice of making this wine is low input and low intervention farming followed by hands off natural wine 'growing'. The name Artakama means desire and search for truth. This wine is from a new range of wines created by Le vieux pin and Lastella wineries. It comes from old vines (over 25 years) from the heart of the golden mile in BC. The organic wine is crunchy and full of fruits like cherry, raspberry and strawberry. Fine tannins and great acidity. A magnum to enjoy with friends!

title: Cascina Castlet Litina Barbera Superiore 2016
Description: A deep ruby colour that changes to garnet during maturation. Full, intense and very persistent bouquet. Litina's structure and generosity bring hints of vanilla and woodland fruits. Warm, full-bodied dry taste that enhances all the vinosity of the vineyard. Remarkable softness and balance. Long, intense persistence. Best served at 18°C in wide glasses with pasta first courses (tagliatelle, ravioli) seasoned with meat or game sauces, as well as with stewed and roast meat second courses. Excellent with medium-ripe cheeses, such as toma and pecorino.

title: Roth Estate Russian Sonoma Coast 2016
Description: The 2016 Heritage red blend has a medium to deep ruby colour and a nose of crème de cassis, chocolate-covered blueberries, black cherry jam, vanilla and nutmeg with notions of herbs and pencil lead. The palate is medium to full-bodied with good intensity and youthful fruit character. It has a firm frame and just enough freshness, finishing long.

title: Pop Art Red PGI Evia 2018
Description: Bright ruby colour with purple overtones and a complex bouquet of roses, cherries and prunes. Palate with balanced acidity and a pleasing aftertaste of soft tannins.

title: Cascina Castlet Passum Barbera Superiore 2016
Description: Deep garnet colour, with the limpidity and warm, intense sheen of garnet turning to ruby that are the assurance of great richness and a powerful structure. Broad, elegant and lingering bouquet with hints of plum and redcurrant jam. Warm, austere palate that underscores Passum's generosity and fullness. Its notable harmony and balance are enhanced by tannins that soften to sweetness and by a pleasant sapidity. Very intense and long-lasting aroma typical of great, long-aging wines. Excellent with braised meats and game, ideal with mature cheeses and dishes prepared with truffles.

title: Château Saint Bonnet Medoc AOC 2015
Description: Château Saint Bonnet is located in the commune of Saint-Christoly-de-Médoc, on the left bank of the estuary of the Gironde. Full bodied mouth with soft tannins. Nice nose of dark red fruits. Serve at 17-18°C and can accompany cutlets of lamb, roasted beef.

title: Château Baronne Tedaldi Cuvee Du Parc AOC 2017
Description: Château Baronne Tedaldi from the Languedoc & Minervois appellation. Red wine with a brilliant ruby colour. A nose and a mouth of blackberry with notes of fresh butter and a sweet finish. Perfect pair to red meat dishes, pizzas and mixed salads.

title: Korta Katarina Plavac Mali 2012
Description: Lively, full and almost opaque by colour this full-bodied wine is smooth, balanced and elegant. This Plavac Mali is dynamic, with a recognizable aromatic profile of ripe flavours, dried and stewed fruit, followed by Mediterranean herbs and spices. This wine has a strong potential for aging.

title: Maranzana La Violina Dolcetto d'Asti DOC 2019
Description: This is an attractive, versatile, full-bodied wine; it has the wine's characteristic colour of intense ruby red, with shades of violet-red. Its bouquet has great length, with vinous and fruity characteristics, and notes of almond, violet, bilberry and raspberry, with balsamic undertones. On the palate, it is long, dry, zesty and delicate, with an appreciable tannic sensation, well-balanced and with an attractive freshness. It has a light vegetal note, with hints of red fruit, more specifically cherry. Ideal for all courses of a meal, though particularly successful with first course dishes, risotto, relatively simple main course recipes, and fresh or moderately matured cheeses.

title: Zulal Areni 2018
Description: Ancient thick skinned, late ripening variety with  medium tannins and medium to high acidity. This wine is dark ruby in colour and demonstrates aromas of red forest fruits on the nose. They are accompanied with plum and peppery notes on the palate giving way to nicely balanced acidity and  velvety tannins.

title: Clos LaChance Estate Meritage 2017
Description: This wine is full-bodied and complex, with great depth and notes of dark black and red fruits, ripe currant, tobacco leaf, cedarwood and violet. The tannins are smooth yet firm, carrying its great weight through a long finish.

title: Corte Giara La Groletta Amarone della Valpolicella 2017
Description: Corte Giara is a collab between the renowned Allegrini family and a small group of local growers in Veneto. The wine is made from 70% Corvina and 30% Rondinella and offers notions of plum, dark cherry, almond and chocolate, with nicely integrated oak. Savour with bollito misto or a rich mushroom risotto.

title: Paolo Conterno Riva del Bric Barolo 2015
Description: The vines that bore fruit for the 2015 Barolo Riva del Bric are a bit younger in this site compared to those used for the Ginestra. This Barolo is great, but it is without the same complexity you get in the other one. It's a more sensible expression of Nebbiolo, with thick layers of black fruit followed by tar, moist earth and savory tobacco. It shows similar density and thickness of fiber that you get in the Ginestra cru, only the wine's complexity is less articulate and nuanced. Drink it in the medium term after three to 3-5 of bottle aging. Drink date: 2021-2038. Score - 93. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, June 28, 2019)

title: Oshin Areni Reserve 2017
Description: This barrel-aged Areni has an elegant deep red colour. Powerful aromatics of cherry, strawberry and subtle hints of smoke escape the glass. On the palate the wine has soft and silky texture rich in blackberry, bright red fruit and spicy flavours. A prolonged finish of red currants, lavender and sweet oak closes out the wine.

title: Kendall-Jackson Jackson Estate Petaluma Gap Pinot Noir AVA 2018
Description: Petaluma Gap is the newest Sonoma County AVA, created in 2018. 100% Pinot Noir from our Cloud Landing vineyard. 10 months in French oak (30% new). 92 by Wine Advocate & JebDunnuck.com

title: Pied a Terre Sonoma Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Aromas of ripe blueberry, black cherry, vanilla and pencil shavings; rich mouthfeel with smooth tannins and incredible length. A perfect compliment to hearty meat dishes accompanied by root vegetables.

title: Meler 9 Meses 2015
Description: Red wine with cherry red colour with maroon rim. Strong bouquet, fresh, red ripe fruit with balsamic touches. Very expressive on the nose. On the palate rich with ripe fruit and good structure. Its aftertaste is strong and balanced.

title: Arroyo Crianza 2016
Description: 'Intense black cherry red with purple and violet undertones on the edge of the glass. Medium high opaqueness, bright red and very attractive colour. Intense blend of aromas, of very ripe almost preserved red fruits; strawberries, raspberries, blueberries and above all blackberries with delicate aromas of pastries and lactic hints. Reminiscent of very delicate woods that finish in vanilla and cinnamon aromas; toffee and cocoa. The entrance of the wine in the mouth is very delicate where ripe blackberry and strawberry flavours stand out. Then the wine opens up and fills up the mouth in a very structured manner. Spice flavours, lactics with very round and soft tannins. The right touch of preserved fruits with the right amount of high-quality woods.

title: Princesa Reserva 2018
Description: Purple in colour with inky reflections. A powerful and expressive nose immediately reveals aromas of red fruits such as damson, elderberry and blackcurrant, followed by raspberry, spices, pepper and ending with a superb minerality. A dense mouth feel with a vigorous attack which develops powerfully, with remarkably smooth, fresh tannins. It displays the same red and black fruits which are present in the nose, and you can discern the taste of cocoa, coffee and fine mentholated flavours. There is a lengthy, tannin-rich finish which displays great elegance.

title: Quinta Da Corte Gran Reserva 2015
Description: 'Full and very expressive, opening with aromas of blackcurrant and blackberry jelly, raspberry, pepper and liquorice then developing elegant floral aromas and ending with subtly toasted notes. Smooth, full-bodied and very flavourful, carried on a framework of soft, creamy tannins with a mellow acidity giving balance to an ensemble which is elegantly constructed from the attack right through to a finish which is long, crisp and delicate and brilliantly displays all the minerality of the schists.'

title: 13th Street Expression Series Cabernet/Merlot 2019
Description: The fruit-forward nose pops with ripe cherries, cassis, concentrated raspberries and currants. It shows medium tannins on the palate and bursts with red berries, cassis, touch of anise and plums in a fresh and fruity style with light spice notes. The blend is 48% Merlot, 39% Cabernet Sauvignon and 13% Cabernet Franc. Score - 89. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Oct. 19, 2020)

title: Señorio de Librares Crianza Red 2017
Description: Made from 95% Tempranillo and 5% Garnacha grapes. Cherry-red with a terracota rim. The nose has nuances of fruit compote balanced with aromas of vanilla and coconut. A good attack in the mouth, medium bodied with well polished tannins. Pair with medium-and-long-aged cheeses, charcuterie, blue fish and meat in sauces.
By:: Bodegas Y Vinedos Senorio De Librar

title: Weinstock Cellar Select Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: Weinstock Cellar Select Cabernet is harvested later in the season than usual and consequently has an incredible level of richness. It has wonderful aroma notes of cranberry, blackberry and tobacco aligned with a balanced oak bouquet and flavour. This wine was aged in both new and one-year-old American and French barrels for nearly 18 months. Weinstock Cellar Select is the perfect food wine with its soft mouth feel and nice, rich, soft tannin. Enjoy it now with steak, pasta, and grilled chicken.

title: Carmel Selected Mediterranean Dry Red 2018
Description: From the Shomron region, this wine is a blend of five grape varieties grown in Israel, and reflects its uniquely Mediterranean origin. A dry red wine that is light, fruity, and refreshing.

title: Radacini Cabernet Sauvignon & Merlot 2017
Description: The classical Bordeaux blend aged for 6 months in French barrique. Complex, elegant nose, black fruits lead the way, along with spice and leather notes. A medium bodied wine, finishing with dark fruit and earthy notes.

title: Vigneti Zabu Syrah Terre Siciliane 2018
Description: 100% Nero d'Avola. Intense, ruby red with purplish highlights and intense aromas of red fruit, balsamic and floral notes. Warm on the palate with a long-lasting finish and an aftertaste of woodland flowers.

title: Cavanera Rovo Delle Coturnie 2014
Description: Clear, bright, ruby red, true to type. Decisive and sophisticated notes of small red fruits, raspberries and peaches, enveloped by intense nuances of nutmeg and black pepper, framed with the more delicate scent of rose petals. The full-bodied flavour and seductive tannins take centre stage.

title: Vigneti Zabu Nero D'Avola DOC 2018
Description: Intense, ruby red with purplish highlights. and intense aromas of red fruit, balsamic and floral notes. Warm on the palate with a long-lasting finish and an aftertaste of woodland flowers.

title: Fazio U Munti DOC Sicilia Nero D'Avola 2018
Description: Delicate and persistent notes of berries (blackcurrant, blueberry) and cherry on the nose. Round mouthfeel, fruity palate.

title: Giuseppe Bocchino Arduine Barbera d'Asti DOCG 2018
Description: Made with 100% Barbera this wine has a ruby red colour with violaceous hues. Fresh and fruity, simple and pleasant, medium bodied with marked tannins. Serve with entrées, white meats, and medium-ripe cheeses.

title: 9 Fields Shiraz Robertson Valley 2018
Description: Black violet colour. Aromas of mulberry, island spices, with a velvety, crisp, dry-yet-fruity medium body and a graceful, engaging, medium-long black pepper, fudge and tar finish. A truly South African Shiraz that will be a natural with grilled meats.
By:: Black Falls Brewing Company Pty Ltd

title: Joy Juicy Red Robertson Valley 2018
Description: Elegant and velvety this juicy red is brimming with luscious ripe fruit and silky tannins. Hints of berry and currant. An outstanding wine that oozes sophistication and balance.
By:: Black Falls Brewing Company Pty Ltd

title: 9 Fields Cabernet Sauvignon Robertson 2018
Description: Violet colour. Smoky aromas and flavours of smoked nuts, singed chocolate, and grilled cherries with a silky, bright, fruity medium body and a smooth, intriguing, medium-long finish with nuances of ripe berries and greens with crunchy tannins and light oak flavour. A crisp and refreshing red with a smoky backbone.
By:: Black Falls Brewing Company Pty Ltd

title: Antica Irpinia Aglianico DOC 2016
Description: Gentle and flowery, with generous hints of ripe red fruits. It's a full bodied red wine, but never loud. The long finish is all played on raspberries, violets and with a surprising hint of rosemary.

title: BR Touriga Nacional 2015
Description: Very rich nose between dry vegetable notes, smoked cask and bloom, characteristic of the variety. In the mouth it shows a very elegant, rich and full of freshness wine, promising to last many years.

title: Piano Reserve Red DOC 2018
Description: A beautiful ruby colour with an intense and complex aroma, dominated by very well ripe red fruits, black fruits and floral notes. An intense flavour with excellent volume, very well integrated acidity and good tannins. A long and complex finish.

title: Piano Red 2019
Description: Intense ripe red fruit on the nose, silky in the mouth with a long finish. Made to be drunk now but can age for 2-3 years.

title: Baron Herzog Aleph Red Blend 2019
Description: This wine is a proprietary blend from the wonderful Baron Herzog winery in California. While the varietals remain a secret the wine exhibits restrained fruit flavours, with mainly red fruit on the nose and the mouth. The wine is medium bodied and has a pleasant finish. The Aleph, a new Baron Herzog wine, is a wine that is perfect for everyday drinking. Pair this wine with spaghetti and meatballs, grilled salmon and turkey.

title: Il Palagio Le Bambole Chianti Classcio Gran Selezione 2015
Description: Bright ruby red in colour with intense cherry notes. Typical Palagio with unique earthy nose, fine hints of red fruits recalling oak flavour. Big structure, well balanced, fresh with smooth tannins. Tasty and persistent. Serve between 18-20° C with red meats, pork, lamb , aged cheeses.
By:: Az. Agr. Il Palagio Di Piccini Moni

title: Almendra DOC Douro 2018
Description: Medium in colour, aromatic bright wild blackberry and fig aromas dominate the nose, balanced with elegant ripe black fruits on the palate. This wine matches with meats, cheeses and most Mediterranean cuisine. Serve between 15 and 16 ºC.

title: Fran Corres W Tempranillo Young DOC 2019
Description: 100% Tempranillo from the region of San Asensio and Briones, in Rioja. A deep intense purple with bluish hints. Fresh aromatic fruits with blueberry, strawberry, red cherries, and violets. a juicy easy drinking wine with a lively acidity and well-balanced fruit explosion. Perfect as an aperitif or with cheese and meat platters, salads, pastas, and paellas.

title: Fran Corres Red Crianza Selection 12 Barrel 2016
Description: 100% Red Tempranillo grape from the region of San Asensio and Briones, in Rioja. aged 12 months in 60% French 40% American barrels. Colour is a cherry red claret tone with an intense, subtle, fresh aroma of red fruits, mainly redcurrants and raspberries, milky background, with elegant minerality, toasted, vanilla and smoky glints. Palate is sweet on entry, smooth, well structured tannins through the mouth, lingering finish that is full-bodied, elegant, and rounded. Wonderful with antipasto. IWC 93 Pts

title: Fran Corres Rendime Finca State Red DOC 2016
Description: 100% Tempranillo Tinto from the Réndime vineyard located in the region of San Asensio and Briones, in Rioja. Select hand picking, aged 12 months in 60% French 40% American barrels. Deep cherry with a complex, intense, blackberries, spicy and balsamic notes, well-integrated fruit, and wood. Palate is well-balanced and rounded. Full-bodied passage through the mouth and a long finish. Gold Medal at the 2019 Brussel International Competition 'Tempranillos of the world'.

title: Pietro Cassina Ca daj Tass Coste della Sesia DOC 2012
Description: A deep ruby red in colour with accents on the nose of roses, violets, red fruits and spices. Dry on the palate with structuring tannins and notes of cherries, forest fruits and crushed spices. Delicious when paired with salami, risotto, red meats, mushrooms, truffles, and hard cheeses.

title: Pietro Cassina Ciuet Coste della Sesia DOC 2011
Description: Deep ruby red in colour with very intense notes of flowers like rose and soft violet, followed by red fruits, like wild cherries and spices. Dry wine, well refined tannins, cherries, forest fruits, spices. Good structure, harmony, good roundness, and elegance typical of the Nebbiolo wines from Lessona area. Pair with young and middle matured salami, winter risotti from Piedmont (Panissa), red meats, wild bird preparations, mushrooms, truffles, middle and high matured cheese.

title: Pietro Cassina Tera Russa Coste della Sesia DOC 2012
Description: Deep ruby red in colour, dark when the wine is young. On the nose, very intense, harmonic meeting point between flowers, fruits and spices. On the palate, intense, dry, soft tannins, forest fruits, minced spices. Extraordinary structure with inborn elegance and great personality. Pair with young and middle matured salami, winter risotto Piedmont tradition (Panissa), red meats, mushrooms, truffles, mature cheese.

title: Pietro Cassina Lessona Pidrin DOC 2014
Description: Deep ruby red, tending to orange reflections when aged. On the nose, intense and persistent, with notes of rose and violet, red forest fruits, and spices with good minerality. On the palate, dry, well-developed tannins, intense, equilibrate and persistent, continuously recalling the flavours pictured from the nose. Exceptionally good structure, light velvety with the natural elegance of Nebbiolo wines from the Lessona area. Serve with salami, risotti from Piedmont's old tradition, red meats in all styles, 'crusted' fillet, roast hare, roast partridge, cheeses, truffles.

title: Bastardo! Red 2018
Description: In the visual phase, we have a concentrated wine, with a present tear, which makes it a serious wine. In the nose, we have an intense and fruity wine, with notes of ripe red fruit. In the mouth, it has presence and is round, which pleases the consumer. This wine goes well with meat (white or red), taking advantage of dishes that follow its structure.

title: Feijoada & Co. Red 2018
Description: Presenting a fruity palate, with a balanced acidity, present but soft tannins and a well integrated wood, this ruby colour wine is also characterized by a bouquet of raspberry, dry figs, strawberry, violets, mint and green tea, having a medium finish.

title: Siegrist Pinot Noir VDP Gutswein 2017
Description: A characterful Burgundian style Pinot Noir. Passionate, wild, deep fruit with elegant coolness and structure. Aromas of spices, herbs and black fruits. Fantastic mouth feeling and long finish. Perfect for beef, lamb, wild boar and deer.

title: Polluce Calabria Rosso 2019
Description: It has a bright and deep ruby red colour, a complex aroma with hints of cherry and blackberry, fragrant and spicy. On tasting it reveals great concentration and softness, the taste is elegant and velvety with a good aftertaste. Recommended food pairing: Red meats, tasty roasts, grilled meats, game, and seasoned cheeses.

title: Meia Encosta Red 2019
Description: Crystalline and pearly pink in colour. Very intense and fruity in the nose, with highlights of red fruits such as strawberry and raspberry. Youthful and voluminous in the mouth, it has a perfect acidity that gives it a lot of freshness and a persistent finish. Excellent accompaniment with appetizers, dishes of grilled lean meat, pastas and pizzas. Tapas, sushi, risotto or seasoned fish are also superb suggestions.

title: Il Massiccio IGT 2015
Description: A blend of Sangiovese (85%) and Merlot (15%), this wine is bright with a ruby red hue. On the nose aromas of ripe red forest fruit, wet saddle leather, cinnamon dominate. The juicy palate confirms the aromas on the nose. The tannins are smooth, supple and well integrated. The finish is long and lingering. Pairs well with tomato-based dishes, firm cheese, cured meats, or as a meditation wine on the patio. Drink 2019-2028

title: Kuria Red Transdanubian 2017
Description: Ripe and black fruits dominate both in the nose and on the palate, with notes of blackberry, black cherry and spicy cooked red plum. In addition to a subtle smoky character, the spiciness of clove completes the experience. A fruit-driven red blend, with lively acidity and a pleasant finish.

title: Etyeki Kuria Pinot Noir Etyek-Buda 2017
Description: Classical pale ruby colour. The nose is layered with notes of sour cherry, red plum and dried cranberries with some nutmeg. On the palate the wine is balanced, the red fruit notes are complemented by vanilla and subtle rose pepper. An elegant Burgundy-style Pinot Noir.

title: Etyeki Kuria Kekfrankos 2016
Description: Blackcurrant scents with a fine pepper note and toasted fresh aromas. The round palate yields juicy flavours, light spiciness and fine acidity. A smooth and elegant wine - so easy to love.

title: Esk Valley Merlot Cabernet Sauvignon Malbec 2018
Description: This wine is a fragrant, complex medium bodied Gimblett Gravels blend. Densely coloured, it has a bouquet of dark cherry, tobacco and cedar while the palate shows high quality with supple tannins. This wine can be enjoyed while young but will gain complexity with aging. Pair with red meat and game dishes.

title: Binaro Joven 2019
Description: Cherry red colour with violet tones. Fruity aromas, with nuances of liquorice. In the mouth it is soft with velvety tannins and a very refreshing finish. Perfect with tapas, starters, rice pasta dishes and lighter meat meals.

title: Binaro Crianza 2016
Description: Red ruby colour, medium layers. Aromas of ripe red fruits with a background of cinnamon and spices in a perfect assemblage. In the mouth it shows a smooth structure and a light freshness which gives a very pleasant finish. A perfect wine for any meat dishes.

title: Trecciano Chianti Colli Senesi DOCG 2019
Description: A bright ruby red coloured wine. Fruity bouquet with a touch of violets. A lively, lasting flavour with the right amount of tannins. Excellent with all cold cuts, first course and simple meat dishes.

title: Chateau Fougas Sans Souffre Ajoute 2019
Description: Biodynamic vineyard located in Bordeaux - Côtes de Bourg. 'Sans soufre ajouté' is a natural wine made of Merlot (100%). No sulfites are added to keep the freshness and the expression of a great vintage like 2019! Juicy and full of fruit, it's also well balanced and clean. Recommended to be decanted before enjoyed. Best paired with red meat and chocolate!

title: La Nature de Durfort Vivens 2018
Description: La Nature de Durfort Vivens is a biodynamic and natural wine. A special cuvée that comes from a second growth in Bordeaux - Margaux! Elegant and refined, this wine is a jewel considering the very low volume produced this year.

title: Château du Champs des Treilles Le Petit 2018
Description: Château du Champs des Treilles (certified biodynamic) is a family property located in Bordeaux, a true hidden gem! In 1998 it became one of the first organic properties in Sainte Foy Bordeaux. Le Petit Champ is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Hand picked grapes and wild fermentation gives a fruity but structured wine. The tannins are round and the acidity makes it a perfect wine to share with friends as an aperitif.

title: Château du Champs des Treilles Grand Vin 2018
Description: Château du Champs des Treilles (certified biodynamic) is a family property located in Bordeaux, a true hidden gem! In 1998 it became one of the first organic properties in Sainte Foy Bordeaux. The grand vin comes from a plot of old vines (50 yeard old) planted on limestone and clay soil. Grapes are manually harvested, and hand sorted to only keep the best part. Aged in barrel, it brings complexity and power to this noble wine.

title: Algil Tinta de Toro 2018
Description: Intense cherry colour with violet edges, medium/high layer. On the nose, very expressive with aromas of ripe fruit, floral and memories of berries. In the palate, fine and subtle entry, powerful and persistent flavour of ripe fruit with light nuances of toasted barrel from aging in barrels, with a long and pleasant finish.

title: Copain Hawks Butte Syrah 2016
Description: Beautiful deep purple hues with enticing aromas of boysenberry, pomegranate juice, dried cranberry, hints of forest floor, bay leaf, violets, and black olive. Robust tannin up front, followed by laser-focused acid in the mid-palate, that carries back to a juicy finish of tart red cherry, fresh cranberry, and boysenberry.

title: Copain Brosseau Vineyard Chalone 2016
Description: Since 2005 when we first made Syrah from the Brosseau Vineyard, this wine has the uncanny ability to mirror some of the characteristics we enjoy in a Northern Rhone Syrah. Found in the famed Chalone AVA near the Pinnacles National Park, our southern-most vineyard source, the vines are planted in decomposed granite and limestone soils. Aromas of blueberry reduction and star anise are complemented by notes of blackberry and peppercorn with hints of California Bay leaf and graphite on the finish. The wine is brooding with a great structure and young tannins. It is drinkable now, with aerating or decanting, but will show its best with 4-5 years of cellaring.

title: Onx Wines Mad Crush 2017
Description: +92 Dunnuck from Templeton Gap - 35% Grenache, 29% Tempranillo, 24% Mourvedre, 5% Syrah, 5% Zinfandel, 2% Petite Sirah. Only 1100 cases made. 16M in 500L French Oak puncheons, 15% of which was new. The palate boasts a host of fresh fruits, agua fresca style; Strawberries, cranberries, and cherries. The wine finishes with silky smooth and juicy with gushing and long lasting flavours. Funky package.

title: LangeTwins Single Vineyard Barbera - Macotera 09 2018
Description: Deep garnet in colour; herbaceous-sage quality that integrates with bright red fruit notes to create a complex aroma; twelve months of aging in American oak barrels adds sweet tones that complement the natural acidity of the wine; on the palate, flavours of dark cherry, plum and blackberry merge with soft spice; the finish is long and balanced.

title: Hobo Camp Merlot 2018
Description: Camp was created by the Hobo Wine Company in 2013 to showcase the quality and value of Sonoma County wine. They work with top growers and vineyard managers in very high quality and responsibly farmed, though lesser know, vineyards throughout Sonoma County to produce table ready, food friendly, approachable and affordable wines.

title: Hobo Camp Zinfandel 2018
Description: In 2018, for the first time ever, they ended up blending all of Dry Creek Valley and Rockpile fruit together to make one wine. On their own, the Dry Creek was all fruit and a little thin and the Rockpile was all tannin and lacking fruit. Together, they complemented each other quite well.

title: Bellacosa North Coast 2017
Description: Deep ruby colour and rich hue. The nose is complex and shows layers of dark fruit flavours and spice tones. Blueberry, rich plum and red raspberry notes are apparent. Soft notes of vanilla and toast provide aromatic richness. The texture is supple with depth on the pallet. The tannins are lush with long finish texture. This wine is drinkable now, but will continue to improve for 5 to 7 years. Enjoy with your friends and favourite foods.

title: AERENA Cabernet Sauvignon Red Hill 2017
Description: Over the past decade, the Red Hills-Lake County AVA has been building up its resumé as and an up and coming source for top Cabernet Sauvignons. The 2017 Aerena by Blackbirds stands on its own as a bona fide top Cabernet Sauvignon. Its aromas and flavours of ripe berry and an underlying note of oak should pair well with a perfectly grilled ribeye.

title: Bera Dolcetto d'Alba DOC 2019
Description: It is the wine of the Lange tradition, absolutely dry, young and fragrant, ruby red in colour with violet tones and intense fruity fragrances that reminds one of cherries. It's dry and harmonic flavour with good acidity and a pleasantly tart finish, makes it preferable for an everyday meal, but it's also good with cold cuts or cheese for a quick snack with some friends.

title: Schiopetto Blumeri Rosso IGT 2017
Description: 95 points James Suckling 'This is a fantastic red. Best ever from here. Iodine, oyster-shell, black-olive and blackberry character. Full-bodied, layered and chewy, yet polished and intense. Needs two or three years to soften.'

title: Comparini Poggimele IGT Toscana Sangiovese 2017
Description: Poggimele is 100% Sangiovese, after spontaneous fermentation it ages in steel and French oak barriques (8 months) and is bottled without filtering. 2017 vintage has notes of ripen raspberry, candied violet, ribes and cassis. Mouth is intense and juicy with a salty finish.

title: Château De Fontenay La St Marguerite Rouge
Description: Delicately wooded, vanilla notes associated with a well-rounded palate contribute to making this wine a marvel of subtlety.

title: Banshee Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: Our Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon is deep, purple-ruby in colour with aromas of black plum, cherry, and earthy notes. A juicy entry on the mouth delivers plush and fine tannins with great opulence and velvety texture. Densely layered flavours of boysenberry, cassis, and plum meet rustic, savoury herbs, anise, graphite, and a touch of cocoa powder on the persistent midpalate. A finale of round tannins frame a balanced, lingering finish. It plays nicely with California grass fed beef burgers, balsamic lamb lollipops or grilled beef short ribs.

title: Franco Roero Carbune DOCG 2019
Description: 100% Barbera d'Asti. Purple-red with violet reflections. Clear and immediate balsamic aromas blend perfectly with menthol; subsequent aromas of hazelnut, pepper and cloves compete with each other to conjure up sensations of roasting's. Rich, complex, full-bodied and balanced with hints of chocolate, leather, tobacco and bitter cocoa. The finish leaves smoky sensations on the palate.

title: Franco Roero Mappale 213 DOCG 2018
Description: Single vineyard, single (213) block is vinified separately from the others(including Siché and Cellarino) and spends 18 months in large barrels. The fruit here is rich, darker, spicy and the acidity less pronounced, rendered, melted in. Still it's a dark, hematic bruiser with Cassis and dark chocolate, plus the omnipresent energy of acidity. Also ropey, tart and glazed, almost to the point of deep caramel.

title: Franco Roero Sichei 2018
Description: Ruby red with intense aubergine purple reflections. Aroma initial impact of inviting hints of pink pepper and nutmeg followed by a persistent aroma of dog rose and hawthorn; wild strawberries and cherries soaked in alcohol give a great kick to the aroma. Taste is clear hints of coffee, toasting and a touch of graphite. The high alcohol content and the acidity typical of the variety of grapevine are offset by elegant tannins and hints of dark chocolate jams. The persistent, long finish of liquorice is of great impact on the palate.

title: Franco Roero Cellarino DOCG 2018
Description: A powerful bouquet of red jam, alcohol-soaked fruits and stewed plums precede hints of dried rose and violet. The powerful aromas of mature fruits are also fully and intensely felt on the palate; in the glass the wine develops hints of leather, chestnut and an all-embracing chocolate. The finish is defined by hints of liquorice and pine resin which leave a pleasurable balance of freshness.

title: Ménage à Trois Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: This full-flavoured cabernet sauvignon has forward aromas and flavours of ripe plum, chocolate and vanilla, followed by cedar and spice. The wine is full-bodied and smooth with a long, luscious finish. Enjoy with bacon-wrapped barbecued steak and French fries or pizza with your favourite toppings.

title: Wolf Blass Red Label Cabernet Merlot
Description: Founder Wolfgang Blass has been making wine in South Australia since 1966. This approachable red is bursting with aromas and flavours of ripe cassis, plum, oak, chocolate and fresh mint. It's full-bodied and smooth with a long, velvety finish. Serve with grilled lamb chops alongside cheesy scalloped potatoes.

title: Little Rock Rouge 2017
Description: A quirky blend of classic French grapes Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Syrah, this wine is designed to find a happy place between easygoingness and complexity. Look for spicy dark fruit notes and pair with mutton stew.

title: Bera Barbera d'Alba DOC 2019
Description: A good structured wine with great harmony and a long finish. It has a deep ruby red colour with garnet red tinges, intense fruity fragrances of currant and blackberry, supported by a hint of vanilla. It is dry with pleasant acidity. It's great flavour combines well with salami, roasted and boiled red meat and well aged cheese.

title: Bera Brachetto Piemonte DOC 2019
Description: A unique wine, cherry red in colour, with a characteristic fragrance of fresh flowers and roses long with a slight musky sensation and intense note of red fruits. Sweet, vivid, fresh with least acidity, it explodes on the finish with the same fruity notes felt by the nose, that suggest a good pairing with wild berries, sweets and strawberry parfait, jam tarts and sweets in general.

title: Bera Barolo DOCG 2016
Description: An elegant, austere, noble wine, obtained from Nebbiolo grapes, cultivated in the town of Castiglione Falletto, displays a garnet red colour with reflections warmer with the passing of time. In the glass it gives off ethereal and spicy fragrances, with light vanilla and flowery notes. A full bodied well balanced wine with a long finish.

title: The Last Warrior Red 2016
Description: Soft but rich on the nose with notes of black cherry, black plum, prune, mint candy, dates and earth, exposing the nature of Cabernet Sauvignon and the unique charms of Helan Mountain. The high concentration brings a taste of firm fruit cores and salty minerality.

title: The Summit 2016
Description: Bright ruby, with a fresh and ripe aroma of black fruits. Blends of black cherry, blackberry scent, mixed with mint, Chinese hawthorn and cigar fragrance. Full of energy and charm.The tannins are delicate and mature, the taste is smooth and round, and the good acidity makes it lively.

title: Left Field Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Juicy little minxes strawberry and cherry playfully flirt with cinnamon and allspice, finally succumbing to the rich, warm and seductive nature of a supple leather chaise lounge.

title: Brusa Di Marengo Diego Riserva Via 10 Anni DOCG 2010
Description: The bouquet features warm autumn notes of hay, forest and undergrowth, dried flowers, ripe plums, spicy notes, a hint of chocolate. On the palate beautiful Nebbiolo fruit, quite dry, again with the aromas of the bouquet. The tannins are fine-grained, slightly astringent. Over time, the wood is quite pronounced again. The whole experience is framed by the wonderful aromas that are released and the wines beautiful texture.  Full-bodied, warm and round, with appealing long aftertaste.
By:: Az. Agricola Ca Brusa Di Marengo Di

title: Brusa Di Marengo Diego Barolo Menico DOCG 2015
Description: The wine in the glass is beautiful and light grenade red with light orange tones from time to time. The taste experience is pure and intense, the flavours are rich and evolving with lovely tones of plums, cinnamon, violet, cherry and licorice. The wine has a full body with amazingly released aromas and a persistent comfortable aftertaste. The whole experience is framed by the wonderful aromas that are released and the wines beautiful texture. On the palate it is full-bodied, warm, and round, with appealing long aftertaste.
By:: Az. Agricola Ca Brusa Di Marengo Di

title: Brusa Di Marengo Diego Dolcetto d'Alba Vai 2017
Description: 100% Barbera D'Alba. A beautiful bright purple red colour with violet reflections. On the nose, the fragrance of wild blackberry accompanied on the finish by notes of rose, red flowers and black pepper. The taste is fresh and enhanced by a gentle tannin. The finish is very pleasant with a return of dark berries.
By:: Az. Agricola Ca Brusa Di Marengo Di

title: Bricco San Pietro Vigna d'Vai DOCG 2015
Description: 100% Nebbiolo. Distinguished by its strong tannins, high acidity and distinctive scent. The wine in the glass is beautiful and bright, intense garnet red, with slight orangey undertones. Clear-cut and expansive nose, with plums, violets, cinnamon, cherries, and liquorice. Full-bodied, warm and round, with appealing long aftertaste.
By:: Az. Agricola Ca Brusa Di Marengo Di

title: Pedroncelli Barrel Select Cabernet Franc 2017
Description: There's a fragrant bouquet of cherry, mint, dried herbs and black pepper spice followed by flavours of red cherry, spicy oak, cinnamon and a touch of nutmeg all coming together nicely. The lasting finish is spicy and framed by medium tannins with toasty oak notes.

title: No Es Pituko Cabernet Franc 2020
Description: 100% Natural Wines 'No Es Pituko', which is Chilean Spanish, loosely meaning 'IT AIN'T FANCY'. Wild-fermented, unfiltered.

title: Smoky Bay Shiraz
Description: This sizzling shiraz from Australia is bursting with aromas and flavours of black cherry, blackberry jam, cranberry, a touch of mint and toasty oak. It's medium-bodied and fruity with a silky finish. Pairs nicely with pepperoni pizza or beef stew with a side of mashed potatoes topped with crumbled peppercorn bacon.

title: Wassmann Kékfrankos 2015
Description: Clear, cool and quite firm scent of cherries and dark berries with slightly herbal and floral nuances, hint of bacon and a hint of pepper. Tart, slightly acidic, yet slightly covered fruit with a bite and youthful, fine-grained tannins, cool style, good sustainability, still yeasty tones, some salinity in the background, has freshness, quite elegant style, a hint of paprika and olives in the background, very good finish with a bite. Needs some time.

title: Renacer Punto Final Malbec 2019
Description: Shows deep violet colours with red hues. Strong floral tones of violet and rose combined with red fruits such as blackcurrant and raspberry. Subtle notes of vanilla from the passing contact with oak. In the palate the wine is smooth and silky with round tannins and a long persistent finish.

title: Renacer Repasso 2018
Description: Deep and intense ruby red with purple shades colouring, this wine has plenty to offer. Its very complex because offers fresh aromas like plums and violets and in the second nose offers aromas like honey, cherry and ripe figs which combine with spicy notes of black pepper and aromatic herbs.

title: Renacer Calibre Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
Description: Intense ruby red. Powerful nose. Notes of red spices like paprika, jalapeños, tomato leaves and fresh black fruit. Well-structured silky tannins, juicy and vibrant. Sweet attack well balanced with the vibrant acidity. Persistent finish.

title: Renacer Punto Final Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
Description: Intense red ruby colour with violet and black reflections. Aromas of cherries, currants and ripe plums complemented by black pepper, sweet spices and cassis notes, with an elegant mineral background. Sweet entrance with mature tannins, balanced with good acidity. Elegant, persistent on the palate and a long finish, good tannin structure.

title: Omen Element 79 Vineyard Syrah Viognier 2019
Description: Raw and lively with concentrated aromas of cranberry and raspberry mixed with floral notes. Bright and fresh in the mouthfeel with touches of minerality in the background. A well awarded winery with a dedicated pursuit of quality and innovation.

title: Omen Single Vineyard Rorick Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: Blackberry and blueberry aromas with an undertone of cherry & a touch of savoury herbs. This full-bodied Cab has great concentration and a firm but creamy texture. It offers plenty of immediate appeal and also bodes well for continued aging.

title: Emina Reserva 2015
Description: Smooth plum and berry aromas are ripe and on the money. A full, direct palate is weighty but not heavy, with racy acidity. Blackberry and black currant flavors are fully oaked but don't taste woody, while this Tinto Fino is smooth on a finish with wood spice and vanilla residuals. Drink through 2028. Score - 93. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2020)

title: Ella Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva 2017
Description: Ruby red colour with violet hints. Ripe fruit such as blueberries and plums plus a touch of mint. Rich but elegant on palate with ripe tannins and a tasty end.

title: Amante Syrah Mourvedre Gran Reserva 2017
Description: Exuberant but fresh, elegant but crispy, and all the time pleasant. Violet notes, red fruits, eucalyptus and mint compose the aromatic profile of this unique wine. A rare combination for Chilean viticulture that shows terroir ability to develop great wines with the style of Apalta.

title: Yalumba Y Series Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: This vegan-friendly cabernet sauvignon offers aromas and flavours of dark cherries, plums, violets, dried herbs, and delicate oak. It's full-bodied and smooth with soft tannins on the long-lasting finish. Serve with grilled Portobello mushrooms topped with red wine reduction sauce alongside sweet potatoes.

title: Casa Marin Cartagena Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Casa Marín produces four different Pinot Noirs originating in different Lo Abarca vineyard blocks. The different soils, clones, and vinification methods result in four completely different Pinot Noirs. Cartagena Pinot Noir can be described as Casa Marín's most fruity and fresh one. The grapes come mainly from clay soils and are harvested two weeks earlier than our other Pinot Noirs. The wine is aged 12 months in French oak barrels without any new oak. This Pinot Noir has a less intense colour but intense red fruit aromas. It has a lively acidity which gives the wine more depth.

title: Alento Red 2018
Description: Made mainly from the typical grape varieties typical of the region. This wine is garnet red in colour with an intense aroma of red fruits, well balanced and with a good freshness.

title: Jacob's Creek Double Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: A legend in South Eastern Australia, Jacob's Creek Double Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon offers a unique flavour profile from the oak barrel ageing and finishing in the used whisky barrels. Expect cassis, mint, caramel, oak and olive notes. It's full-bodied and smooth with silky tannins on the long finish. Try with rack of lamb.

title: Tenuta di Poggio Cosimo Sincero 2018
Description: On the nose, it expresses delicate fragrances of violets and roses. On the palate flavours of ripe cherries, full and fresh with pleasing tannins that are present but not invasive.

title: Luberri Cepas Viejas V de Pago Rioja 2016
Description: Made from grapes of Tempranillo vines averaging 60 years old and aged for fourteen months in barrel is a powerful, concentrated wine with notes of dark plums, blackberries and wild berries, plenty of balsamic notes of Mediterranean herbs and a whiff of smoke.

title: Chosen Diamond Kosher 2017
Description: This mesmerizing wine features Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with a touch of Petit Verdot and Syrah . Vineyards in the Golan Heights and the Upper Galilee regions each lend the best of their unique climate and soil characteristics to create the slow dance of flavours abounding in this wine. The mingling of an unconventional blend of varieties results in a lively red-black ruby colour and an aroma that begins with black cherry, cassis, white pepper and coffee, and continues with nuances of earth, herbs and smoked meat. The palate reveals a full-bodied, rich, balanced and elegant wine, with a long, complex finish distinctly reminiscent of the old world.

title: Kvint Cabernet Sauvignon Kosher 2016
Description: It features pleasant astringency and harmonious acidity. Its bouquet is complex with aromas of nightshade berries enriched with hints of morocco leather. Fruity, with soft and velvety tannins and long finish.

title: Domaine George Vernay 'Les Fleurs de Mai' Syrah IGP 2019
Description: Iconic producer of the Northern Rhône, Georges Vernay is famous for having 'saved' the Condrieu appellation by keeping a few hectares of Viognier in the region after WW2. Christine Vernay, 3rd generation, took over the estate in 1996 using organic farming methods. This cuvée, produced from mature Syrah vines offers a taste very similar to that of a Côte-Rôtie! It has intense aromas of green pepper, black cherries, game and spices that wrap around a smooth, balanced, mature, lasting and fresh texture. It is produced in limited quantities.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Giannikos Lion Agiorgitiko PGI 2017
Description: Ruby red colour. Complex texture with soft tannins and hints of plum, cherry and nutmeg. Full bodied with a balanced acidity and long finish.

title: Quinta Da Lixa Vinhao 2019
Description: Young, fresh, elegant and perfect acidity.

title: Kessler-Zink Merlot Red Dry 2018
Description: Full-bodied, smooth and round. Very fruity with intense aroma of ripe forest berries and black cherries, spicy notes of pepper, cloves and balsamic and nuances of cedar wood. Pleasant silky tannic structure and long aftertaste. Decant well and serve with grilled meat or game.

title: Kessler-Zink Dornfelder Red Dry 2019
Description: Fruity and smooth red wine with light notes of liquorice, candy and dark chocolate. Typical to variety taste of dark berries, raspberry and strawberry. Lower content of tannins but a very fruity style. Very good matching partner for BBQ.

title: Kessler-Zink Pinot Noir Red Semi-dry 2019
Description: Complex and layered fruit aromatics of wild berries, dried apricots, 'mixed berry pie' and what we're calling 'dessert' aromatics. Dark cherries and concentrated fruit flavours complemented by anise and clove spiciness. Dense, juicy, and mouth coating texture, backed up by firm and balanced tannins.

title: Alfacinha Red IGP LX 2019
Description: Pomegranate coloured wine, with aromas of red fruits. In the mouth it is smooth and rounded with balanced acidity and with ripe and elegant tannins.

title: Domaine Germain Pommard 'Chanière' 2018
Description: Traditionally, Pommard wines are powerful and tannic wines with earthy and gamey notes. This wine follows the trend, keeping the same approach and fruity fame, with more intensity due to southern exposure. Keep minimum 3-4 years and up to 15. Will accompany any red meat, game or hard cheese.

title: Wassmann Cabernet Franc 2016
Description: Firm, slightly tobacco-like scent of black berries and a little red pepper with delicate bacon and floral nuances. Ripe, firm, very juicy fruit, fine tannin, noticeable acid and clear minerality, persistent on the palate, again hinted at red pepper, herbal nuances, depth, has power, peppery-spicy hints, very good, again firm, tangy-juicy and slightly smoky finish with cocoa notes.

title: Domaine Roger Belland Santenay Charmes 2017
Description: Ripe and pretty with a fine vibrancy to the equally succulent and round flavours that are borderline lush.

title: Domaine Roger Belland Santenay Charmes 2014
Description: An expressive nose, with elegant and fine medium flavours that exude a subtle bead of minerality on vibrant and complex finale.

title: Domaine Roger Belland Maranges 1er Cru la Fussiere 2018
Description: A cool, pure & fresh nose speaks of aromas of ripe black raspberry, violet & subtle spice nuances.

title: Nemea Winery Agriorgitiko PDO Nemea Red Wine 2017
Description: The complex, varied topography of Nemea allows producers to craft considerably nuanced, refined wines from Agiorgitiko. This one is made in an inviting, crowd-pleasing style. It's floral and delicately toasty, with candied red fruit, blackberry and vanilla. Great value and simply delicious. Pair with grilled ribs or lamb.

title: Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon Organic 2017
Description: The 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon is a classic Alexander Valley wine with medium body, great fruit flavours and smooth, structured tannins. Winemaker Kevin Hall added 12% Merlot for structure, a touch of Cabernet Franc for floral notes and Malbec and Petit Verdot for colour. This is an elegant wine with aromas of black cherry, cassis, plum, vanilla, oak and a hint of chocolate. In the glass there are lush flavours of cherry, cassis, blackberry and chocolate. The 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon evolves with each sip. This is a graceful wine with great balance and a long, lingering finish. Enjoyable upon release, this wine will reward those with the patience to lay down a few bottles.

title: Morais Rocha Reserve Red 2017
Description: Intense garnet colour, aromas of black fruits and jam fruits, with notes of caruma. Flavour with great complexity, where the fruit and the wood, where it aged, in perfect harmony. Long finish and extremely persistent.

title: Herdade dos Veros Reserva Red 2018
Description: Highly intense aroma of black berry fruits and wild fruits. Intense in the mouth with good tannins. Long and intense finish. Food pairing: Red meats, baked in the oven and hunting. Tip: Decant 30 minutes before serving.

title: Meia Encosta Red 2018
Description: Clear, ruby colour. Young nose with dark fruit aromas, such as plums, interposed by floral nuances from geranium and very discrete vanilla notes resulting from the period in the wood. In the mouth it is soft and velvety, with notes of dark plums, awarding it a set of balanced acidity and soft tannins, with a fresh and persistent finish. Serving temperature: 15 to 17 °c. Excellent with poultry, meat, smoked sausage, cheeses and some fish.

title: Covila Rioja Alavesa Crianza 2016
Description: This is a pretty Rioja where everything is in moderation. It opens with raspberries, citrus, vanilla, cumin and sandalwood. Medium-bodied and dialed-in. The tannins, fruit and acidity are all in balance. Drink now. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, July 26, 2019)

title: Villa Diana Primitivo di Salento 2018
Description: Villa Diana was named for Rome's goddess of the hunt, the moon and nature. Diana was known for her grace, charm and strength of character, which are also fine attributes to find in a wine. This one is unoaked, with bright red fruit and a lively, juicy, easy-drinking character. Touches of black tea, licorice and chocolate round this out nicely. Pair with pork.  (Vintages panel, Jan. 2020)

title: Herdade Grande Grande Reserva 2013
Description: Aged for a year in French oak, this dense wine is still firm. Its rich fruit supports the dry core of the wine with its tarry character, layers of spice and intense black fruits. This is a massive wine, one to savor, which is ready to drink while always firm. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2019)

title: Terroirs du Vent La Violette Syrah 2017
Description: Husband-and-wife team Jean-Luc and Anne Colombo opened the Centre Oenologique des Côtes du Rhône in 1984. Since then, they've become sought-after wine consultants, earning the French Legion of Honour for their contributions. This 2017 Syrah is named for the intense wildflower aromatics it possesses. It's ripe and round, with fresh red fruit and a savoury undertone. Pair with braised beef.

title: House of Mandela Thembu Tribute Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Blackcurrant flavours and a hint of spice is evident on the nose. The palate offers mouthfuls of dense and dark fruits that contribute to a generous finish. (thetimes.co.uk, July 14, 2019)

title: Ligas Bucephale 2018
Description: Bucephale Ktima Ligas, 100% Xinomavro, mature vintage, natural wine, rich, deep, savoury and delicious red for meat dishes. The flavours are richer, deep, with notes of black olive, dried tomato, red and black fruits with very good acidity and a long finish.

title: Jraghatspanyan Reserve Red Dry 2017
Description: Full-bodied, berries, and floral tones with pronounced aromas of spices, cherry, pomegranate, and oak, with the harmonious taste of berries, oak and velvet tannins.

title: Riecine Chianti Classico DOCG 2018
Description: Ruby red in colour with aromas of violet petals and alcohol-infused cherries, and a touch of juniper. An exciting nose and bright acidity. Succulent, red fruit with fine, powerful tannins. This Sangiovese has taken on a Pinot Noir like guise.The finish is clean and persistent

title: Kamara Red Blend 2013
Description: This is a blend of 40% Xinomavro, 30% Merlot, and 30% Syrah from the slopes of Oraiokastro, Thessaloniki. Expect lots of dark fruits, with hints of eucalyptus, olives, and pepper. It's round and smooth, with enough acid and tannin to cellar for the short term. The wine is aged in oak barrels for twelve months before release.

title: Tbilvino Qvevris Saperavi 2017
Description: Dark violet in colour, well-balanced tannin structure and aromas of ripe cherry and red berries. Qvevris Saperavi goes well with lamb, steak and pork ribs.

title: Old World Winery Two Rock Block 2009
Description: 80% Cabernet, 20% Petite Sirah, grown on an undulating benchland, between upper mountains and flat valley floor. Sweet fruit on the nose, blackcurrant & vanilla, really ripe and a bit jammy.

title: The Magic Box Spectacular Shiraz
Description: Step into a world of wonder with this striking Australian shiraz. Deep purple, with intense aromas and flavours of raspberry, dark cherry, pepper, vanilla and oak. It's medium-bodied and fruity with a lengthy finish. Perfect for barbecued chicken thighs beside seasonal vegetables and cheesy garlic bread rolls.

title: Plungerhead Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: The Cabernet for this wine is sourced from three principal vineyards in Lodi: Alabama Ranch Vineyard, Mettler Family Vineyards and Stama Vineyards. The wine also contains small amounts of other reds such as Tempranillo, Petite Sirah and Zinfandel. The resulting wine is complex, approachable and ripe, with an exciting depth of black fruit and oak spice, plus excellent structure. Pair with steak.

title: Angels Ink Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Sourced from a number of prime sites, this Pinot was fermented in stainless steel and aged for 14 months in a combination of new and used oak. This process affords the wine complexity and structure without overwhelming the finer fruit tones. An expressive, elegant wine that will pair well with duck, or cedar-planked salmon.

title: Oak Farm Vineyards Tievoli Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: 'Tievoli' is 'I love it' spelled backwards. Cool, eh? The Cabernet in this wine is sourced from three sites: the Oak Farm Estate Vineyard, the Rootstock Vineyard and the Shinn Farms Vineyard. These result in a concentrated, ripe wine, with blackcurrant, blackberry, earth, tobacco and a hint of eucalyptus. Petite Sirah from the Forest Lake Vineyard adds weight and texture. A wine for lamb or steak.

title: Saints Hills Dingac 2016
Description: WINE ENTHUSIAST 94 POINTS 'This 100% Plavac Mali from Dingac is dark garnet in the glass with aromas of wild blackberries on the vine, black plum, bramble and a touch of smoked charcuterie. It has good weight on the palate, with flavors of cranberry, pomegranate, dark berries and dried lavender. It has a pleasantly bold tannic structure on entry but the bright acidity in the finish balances perfectly and makes this a wine to drink now or lay down for a few years.'

title: Volarevic Plavac Mali Gold Edition 2016
Description: The colour is deep red-purple. The predominant aromas are of matured blackfruit, with slight red and black peper. It has a very complex body with smooth tannins and soft acidity, which gives a very balanced and special wine.

title: Thema Red 2016
Description: Thema Red 2016 is a blend of Syrah and Agiorgitiko grape varietals. Dark purple colour with violet reflections. The nose is dominated by an intense bouquet of cherries and plums followed by scents of chocolate, smoke and vanilla. Generous in the mouth, with good balance and lively tannins contributing to a velvety structure. Long and fruity aftertaste, with a light touch of oak. It needs further ageing to reveal its full potential. Serve with grilled red meat and spicy game, as well as spicy and unctuous cheeses. Decant before serving.

title: Tobin James Notorious Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Juicy dark fruits consume your palate along with complex aromas of coffee and chocolate. This wine is very well structured with a silky and sexy finish.

title: IL Borro Vin Santo del Chianti DOC 2012
Description: Shows a vivid amber colour with golden reflections. On the nose, intense dried apricots, sultanas, and dates enriched by caramel, hazelnut and almond nuances. The palate is fairly sweet, well balanced with acidity and hints of walnut husk, honey and candy finish.

title: Redtail Pinot Noir 2012
Description: Perched on the outskirts of PEC wine country, Redtail is the passion project of Pauline Joicey and Gilbert Provost. They farm their vineyards organically with minimal intervention, and make Pinot Noir a specialty.

title: Daskalaki Sera Red 2015
Description: Dry dark red wine with notes of blackberries and figs. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Mandilari, which is a local indigenous variety. Made from Silva Daskalaki, a biodynamic winery. Ideal with grilled red meat and aged yellow cheese. Silver Medal at the 2019 Thessaloniki International Awards 2019 (2013 vintage)

title: Tselepos Nemea Driopi Reserve 2017
Description: Full-bodied with fine tannins, complex aromas of red fruit with hints of eucalyptus and green bell pepper. Well-structured and balanced with a velvety palate and a long finish. Gold - Balkan International Wine Competition 2020.

title: Biblia Chora Pangeon Areti Red PGI 2013
Description: A deep ruby wine of limited production. Its rich cherry aroma is typical of the variety and combines wonderfully with vanilla, cedar wood and spice notes. The wine is charming, offering notes of ripe red fruit and luscious tannins.

title: JJ Hahn Section 72 Shiraz 2018
Description: Attractively fruited and elegantly complex, the bouquet shows dark plum, spiced cherry, game and nutmeg characters, leading to a juicy palate that is beautifully rounded and flavoursome. The wine offers lovely fruit intensity backed by silky tannins. At its best: now to 2024. Score - 92. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, Aug. 2020)

title: Gabriel Meffre Saint-Pierre Crozes-Hermitage 2016
