Description: Fresh and easy in feel, with a mix of cherry, strawberry and raspberry fruit flavors gliding through, backed by a hint of rooibos tea on the polished finish. Drink now through 2022. Score - 90. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, 2019)

title: Domaine de Beyssac Initial 2016
Description: An organic merlot, cabernet franc, malbec and local abourriou blend, this is fragrant and ripe wine from the deep Southwest of France (not far from Bordeaux but inland), with an appealingly rustic, savoury edge but also skilled winemaking in evidence, clean and pure. Tannins are still a little rough-and-tumble, so another 1-2 years in the cellar is recommended, or decant and serve with salty protein. Length and depth are solid. Worth discovering.  Score - 90. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com, May 23, 2020)

title: Long Valley Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: California's Salinas Valley is also known as the Long Valley; a name coined by writer John Steinbeck due to its 100-mile length. This wine offers notes of juicy berry fruit, rich blueberry pie and toasty oak, with moderate tannins giving structure. A good choice for steak. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2019)

title: Parker Station Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: This earthy red gave us cause to cheer, with focused and pure aromas of beets in tilled soil, black cherry, and vanilla. The spice on the initial sip leads to an accent of cinnamon and white pepper on the red fruit. Cedar and mocha come in midway and extend through the finish. Score - 90. (Meridith May, tastingpanelmag.com, Nov./Dec. 2019)

title: Org de Rac Die Waghuis Swartland Red Blend 2017
Description: This wine comes from south-facing slopes in the foothills of the Piketberg Mountains, from mostly terra rossa soils that have a high quantity of shale, which provides superb drainage. The bush vine Grenache comes from the highest plots, while the Shiraz, Mourvèdre and the small percentage of the white grape Verdelho come from trellised vines at lower elevations.  [Winemag.co.za did not include a tasting note.] Score - 93. (winemag.co.za, July 2019)
By:: Org De Rac Wines Pty Ltd

title: 19 Crimes Pinot Noir The Punishment
Description: You'll think you hit the jackpot when you try this pinot noir gem. You'll encounter notes of cherry, strawberry, oak and vanilla. It's medium-bodied and fruity with ultra-silky tannins on the long, graceful finish. Serve with broccoli quinoa cakes, grilled salmon steaks over rice or a cheese platter.

title: Paternoster Synthesi 2017
Description: Mouthwatering acidity and a subtly smoky, minerally underpinning focus the rich notes of plumped cherry, red licorice, coffee liqueur and orange peel in this harmonious, medium- to full-bodied red. Light, taut tannins firm the spiced finish. Drink now through 2027. Smart Buys. Score - 90. (Alison Napjus, winespectator.com, June 30, 2020)

title: Montecarlo Rosso Doc 2018
Description: A very easy drinking wine, with an intense fruity scent, in particular morello cherry and sour cherry hints. Well structured, harmonic, soft, fresh and persistent, it is a wine for every season, with the typical characteristics of the Montecarlo region. To be served at the ideal temperature of 18 °C. Perfectly paired with meat sauces, pizza, roast pork or fish.

title: Le Pietrine IGT Toscana 2016
Description: Blend of 2016 vintage is 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 50% Merlot. After spontaneous fermentation the wine ages for 18 months in French oak barriques and is then bottled without filtration. 2016 vintage is elegant and austere with notes of blackberries and red fruits, tobacco, black pepper, sweet pepper and a leather and balsamic background. A full body elegant mouthfeel with bright tannins and very long finish. 3100 bottles were made for this vintage.

title: Nikolaou Agiorgitiko Nemea Organic 2019
Description: 100% Agiorgitiko. Deep vivid red, with black cherry and marmelade aromas. Spicy character with strong tannins and intense acidity bringing out its freshness. Accompanied by meat or light dishes as well.

title: Château Comte André de Monpezat Cahors 2019
Description: Cahors, the French cradle of Malbec, is known for its charmingly rustic, solidly structured wines built around the variety. Our Vintages panel tasted a previous vintage of this wine and loved it. Expect dark, earthy, spice-accented fruit, and pour with beef stew or chili.

title: Nautilus Red 2017
Description: The 2017 Nautilus Red is a Mavrodaphne aged for six months in used French oak. Sourced from roughly 80-year-old vines, this is a little different because it was held for six months after bottling in a cement tank filled with fresh water (as with the Nautilus white this issue). Perhaps the best red table wine I've seen from the winery, this is sophisticated and flavorful with fine structure. Textured, silky and precise, it has nuanced fruit flavors, with cranberries and baked plums, plus a tight, tense finish. The mid-palate finesse is exceptional. The acidity supports the fruit nicely, lifts it and allows the flavors to linger. There is also a serious backbone, but the tannins are ripe enough so that they never go overboard. You can open this now if you must - give it an hour of air if you do - but it will certainly be better in a year or two. It should age pretty well, but let's take that in stages. How well it ages, whether it develops or merely holds, will determine how impressive it really is. Drink date: 2020-2032. Score - 91. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Feb. 28, 2019)

title: Château Saint-Jacques d'Albas Le Petit Saint-Jacques Cabernet/Syrah 2018
Description: This blend of Cabernet and Syrah is small in name only. Loaded with notes of dark fruit, oak and spice, it's a fruit-led wine with excellent definition and a wide appeal. A fine option for a range of grilled meats or vegetables and ideal for a hearty lamb stew.

title: Serna Imperial Reserva 2010
Description: The Escudero family started making wine in 1852 and, four generations on, it is still very much a family business. They own a total of 150ha of vineyards, of which 120ha are located on the southern slopes of the Monte Yerga mountain range, where the grapes for this wine are produced. The vines are grown at between 450m-800m above sea level and are approximately 40 years old. Predominantly made from Tempranillo blended with Mazuelo and Garnacha, this reserva was aged for 14 months in five-year-old American oak barrels followed by a further 28 months in bottle. Sarah Jane Evans: Supple, juicy, well-balanced, fully rounded. A lovely vintage and a great wine. Simon Field: A broad and generous mouthfeel, the tannic grip still persuasive, but acidity is wrapped around the black fruit core with subtle conviction. Pierre Mansour: Liquorice and dark fruit, compact, quite complex, framed by muscular tannins, underlying depth that unfurls in the glass, and really good length. Drinking window: 2020-2023. Score - 95. (decanter.com, Dec. 9, 2020)

title: Aresti Trisquel Series Altitud Merlot 1.245 2018
Description: This wine presents a very particular aromatic palette, where sweet spices and some natural herbal aromas blend with hints of fresh fruit. Slow ripening results in a powerful, mouth filling structure, remarkable complexity, round tannins and a lingering, tasty finish. Perfect to pair with lamb, red meats and mature cheeses.

title: Clooney Ridge Devil's Kiss Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: Devil's Kiss Cabernet Sauvignon is bursting with aromas of blueberry, cocoa, leather and cinnamon. The structure is lush and full of soft tannins. The wine finishes with cedar cigar box, vanilla spice, and ripe red cherries. Pairs well with beef, duck, lamb, wild game, heavily spiced dishes, or salads topped with beef or red meats.

title: Edicion Limitada Mediterranean 2016
Description: This wine's garnet-red colour of medium intensity stands out immediately, revealing a larger presence of Grenache in this year's blend. It displays great complexity on the nose, slowly showing a vast array of aromas which start with herbal and spicy notes, like rosemary and grey pepper, which give way to soft fruity aromas of cassis and blueberries and are completed with soft mineral touches. Floral aromas, as well as some citric notes, such as mandarin, also emerge. Its rich and vibrant acidity stands out on the palate, along with its juicy and fresh structure, making this wine a great Mediterranean blend with a long cellaring potential.

title: Ligas Pata Trava 2019
Description: 100% Xinomavro. Light red, beautiful scents, apple and cherry.Grapes are hand harvested. The wine is pressed directly, the contact with the skin gives a 'pinkish' colour to the wine. Natural fermentation in stainless steel tank. Ageing in barrel for 6 months. It's not fined or filtered. No added sulphites.

title: Churton The Abyss Pinot Noir Organic 2017
Description: From Churton's 'grand cru' site; this wine is only made in exceptional vintages. Floral aromas of rose petals overlay a deep core of black cherry fruit with a delicious hint of spice and a long finish.

title: Antica Hirpinia Taurasi DOCG 2015
Description: The Prince of the winery. Elegant, strong, with the perfect body and big shoulders. On the nose is powerful, rich of ripe and pulpy red fruits, immediately followed by dark spices like cloves and coffee. The long flowery finish is guaranteed.

title: Spade & Sparrows Pinot Noir
Description: Canadian television star Kaitlyn Bristowe is behind the creation of this food-friendly pinot noir. Anticipate aromas and flavours of strawberry, raspberry, and rose petals. It's light-bodied and fruity with silky tannins and a balanced finish. Serve with grilled salmon over a bed of rice.

title: La Carraia Solcato 2016
Description: Very perfumed with lavender and blackberry aromas that fill the glass. Full body, chewy tannins and a flavorful finish. Needs a year or two to soften. Drink in 2020. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 25, 2018)

title: Ebony Margaret River Cabernet Shiraz 2017
Description: Delicious tobacco and dark-berry aromas and flavors here with wet earth. Medium body. Light tannins. Fresh and simple finish. Drink now.  Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, June 26, 2019)

title: Xanadu Exmoor Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: The brightest purple/red colour. It's modern, bright and fruit-driven - Ribena and cinnamon, with the taming whiff of spicy oak. Juicy berries on the palate - that fruit burst of crisp blueberries. Terrific winemaking. Serious with instant appeal. Drink date: 2019-2025. Score - 93. (Nick Butler, therealreview.com, June 30, 2019)

title: Château Les Tourelles 2017
Description: This perfumed wine is initially dry and then reveals great black fruits, rich tannins and acidity, well in balance. The wine's structure will see it age well. Best Buy. Score - 90. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, March 1, 2020)

title: Mas d'en Gil Coma Vella 2014
Description: The red 2014 Coma Vella feels a tad rustic in the context of the 2016s, which show great finesse. It is a blend of Garnacha with 20% Cariñena and 10% Syrah from the Coma Valley within the Mas d'en Gil property. It fermented in a combination of stainless steel and oak vats, and the wine matured in 225-, 1,500- and 3,000-liter oak barrels and vats for one year. It has some earthy notes reminiscent of the dusty Priorat roads, integrated oak and good ripeness but without excess. The palate is medium-bodied with dusty tannins and a dry, serious and mineral finish. Impressive. 35,658 bottles produced. It was bottled in May 2016. It's evolving quite slowly. Drink date: 2019-2025. Score - 92. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Aug. 30, 2019)

title: Speri Sant' Urbano Valpolicella 2012
Description: Intense ruby red colour with ample and characteristic bouquet. Spiced hints of ripe red fruit.

title: Global Wines Casa de Santar Reserva Dao Red 2014
Description: 'A powerful wine from the aristocratic Santar estate, the wine is densely textured. Licorice and dark chocolate flavors merge with the firm tannins and now mature fruits to produce a wine that is serious and structured but also ready to drink.' - WE

title: Valle Da Fonte DOC Douro Red 2017
Description: 30% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinta Roriz, 20% Touriga Franca, 20% Tinta Barroca from a small production (2000 cs) in the Cima Corgo sub-region of Douro. Ruby red colour with wonderful aromas of red fruits. The wine is aged only in steel tanks until bottling in December 2018. The palate is fruity, velvety with well integrated acidity & high quality tannins.

title: McManis Merlot 2019
Description: From a popular wine family now into its fifth generation to work the vines, this Merlot is generously aromatic, well-structured, rich and silky, with ample juicy dark fruit and a compelling herbal complexity. Pair with lamb, grilled sausages or smoky ribs.

title: Pedra Alta Reserva Tinto 2017
Description: 93 Points, Jamie Goode. A classic Douro blend of Tourigas Nacional and Franca along with Sousao and Fernao Pires. Hand-sourced from the Quinta's best sites. Sorted by hand, de-stemmed and fermented by wild yeasts for 10 days, including traditional foot treading in concrete lagars. Racked to new (35%) French puncheons and older French barriques. Full M/L in barrel. Aged for 24 months.
By:: Vinhos Quinta Da Pedra Alta, Sa

title: Vacqueyras Rouge 2019
Description: This gorgeous, medium-bodied wine is made from 75% Grenache (2019 was a superb vintage for Grenache), 15% Mourvèdre and 10% Syrah, hand-picked from vines averaging almost fifty years of age. The yield was under 30 hl/ha. The Mourvèdre and Syrah were aged in large oak casks for twelve months. It is a deep, pure garnet with powerful aromas of plums, prunes, raspberries, black cherries, currants, new leather, Provençal spices with a note of black pepper and cloves. In the mouth it is fresh and lively with surprising complexity and excellent balance. And, oh those delicate, silky Palon tannins. This wine has lots of character, depth and substance and will go beautifully with roasted fowl and charcuterie. This lovely wine is a real pleasure to drink right now and will continue to be so for at least another 7 years.

title: Gigondas 2019
Description: This elegant Gigondas is made from 80% Grenache (2019 was a superb vintage for Grenache), 15% Syrah and 5% Mourvèdre hand-picked from seven hectares of vines averaging well over fifty years of age. The yield was under 30 hl/ha. The Syrah and Mourvèdre are aged for twelve months in new oak casks. It is a pure purple with a lustrous sheen and offers up pronounced aromas of ripe blackberries, black cherry jam, plums, pepper, roasted coffee beans, garrigue, pepper, licorice and a note of cocoa. It is big and velvety in the mouth with gentle tannins and a long, perfumed finish. Served just below room temperature, this most impressive wine will go perfectly with magrets de canard, wild game, roasts and medium cheeses. Decant at least an hour before drinking. It will cellar well for at least 10 years.

title: Cerejeiras Tinto 2019
Description: Lively red colour. Fruity aroma and well structured with a soft finish, it is very easy to drink. It can be drunk now or within 4 years. Goes very well with fish, meat and pasta. Should be served at 16-18ºC.

title: Tricana Reserva Red Dao 2017
Description: 40% Touriga Nacional, 40% Alfrocheiro, 20% Tinta Roriz. Violet red colour, with blackberry & blueberry scent, & slight nuances of pinewood & dry caruma. It is a fresh, young wine with a sweet but elegant palate.

title: Lilas Douro 2017
Description: Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca & Tinta Roriz. Plum & berries aromas, red fruit flavours with soft tannins. The grapes were totally destemmed for small stainless steel tanks, where they macerated 24 hours at low temperatures, before starting the fermentation with selected yeast at controlled temperatures.

title: PAGINA Touriga Nacional DOC Obidos 2019
Description: Violet ruby color, aromas of small wild berries with some discreet floral notes and slight herbaceousness revealing the Atlantic influence. On the palate there is excellent balance and freshness. The acidity is present but well integrated into the wine's structure, thanks to lively but mature tannins. The finish is clean, fresh and long.
By:: Romana Vini - Vinhos E Culturas, Ld

title: COZs vm - Castelao 2019
Description: 100% CASTELAO - Fermented with native yeasts in 1000 litres dornas and then pressed to age on old Burgundy barrels for 11 months. Malolactic completed. COZs vm-Castelao 2018 is a smooth red wine with perfumed fruit aromas and subtle herbal notes. On the palate it is fruity, flavoursome and fresh. A wine with marked tannins and noticeable acidity.

title: Heron Hill Pinot Noir Reserve Finger Lakes 2017
Description: Much like Ontario's own Niagara Peninsula, the Finger Lakes region has a cool climate nicely suited to Pinot Noir. Heron Hill, which has been family-owned and -run since its founding in 1972, produces this sleek, elegant expression.

title: Breca Old Vine Garnacha
Description: 92 Points Guia Penin. An authentic wine produced from the original Garnacha, which was first cultivated in Aragón in the 7th Century, and spread around Europe by the Medieval Kingdom of Aragón. Calatayud produces a unique expression of Garnacha due to its geographic and climactic conditions. As Spain's highest altitude region for the production of Garnacha, the temperature swings are radical.

title: Cantarutti Pinot Nero 2018
Description: This wine has a bright violet ruby red colour, fruity aromas and a balanced note of wood.

title: Emilia Sweet Wine 2009
Description: 100% Liatiko (indigenous red grape from Crete). One of the best sweet wines in Crete. Aromas of raisins, vanilla, caramel and chocolate. Aged for 5 years in oak barrels. Thessaloniki International Awards 2012 - Gold Medal (2007 vintage) & special award from the Hellenic Foreign Trade Board (HEPO)

title: Sunny with a Chance of Flowers Pinot Noir
Description: It's like sunshine in a glass. This pinot noir gleams with aromas and flavours of sweet black cherries, pomegranate and a hint of toasted oak. A clean finish caps the light-bodied and fruity palate. Pair with rotisserie chicken, tomato basil pasta, or BBQ turkey burgers.

title: Smoky Bay Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: This flavourful Australia cabernet sauvignon is deep ruby, exhibiting upfront aromas and flavours of red plum, dried herb, rye bread, oak and baking spices. It's medium-bodied and fruity, with soft silky tannins. An ideal match for veal tenderloin, grilled steak or a charcuterie board.

title: Folonari Valpolicella Classico DOC
Description: Valpolicella is the classic red wine of Italy's Veneto region; a blend of local grape varieties that combine to give forward fruit and a supple approachable structure. Ruby red in colour, with upfront spice and plum aromas. On the palate, expect a medium body, soft berry and plum flavours and a fresh, food-friendly finish.

title: Negrar Amarone Classico DOCG
Description: With 85 years of winemaking, this winery continues to grace dinner tables with many styles. Made by drying the grapes gives it depth and density. Aromas and flavours of coffee, toast, nuts, spice and dried figs lead to a concentrated medium-bodied palate and smooth finish. Try with rich cheeses.

title: Stoneleigh Marlborough Pinot Noir
Description: Pale ruby colour; bright aromas of violets, cherries and vanilla with beetroot and citrus notes; extra dry, medium-plus bodied, soft tannins, flavours of cherry, vanilla, and oak spice with balanced acidity.

title: Château des Charmes Gamay Noir VQA
Description: Ruby red colour; fresh plum and red fruit aroma with a note of toast; plum, red berry, toast, cedar and cherry in flavour, medium body, clean dry finish.

title: Jacob's Creek Shiraz Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: A legend in South Eastern Australia, Jacob's Creek offers a modern expression of the classic Aussie shiraz-cabernet blend. Upfront aromas of licorice, fig, honey and herbs. Extra dry palate, with spice and fig flavours leading to a honey and toasty oak finish. Serve with ribeye steak, or lamb burgers with grilled mushrooms.

title: Mezzomondo Negroamaro Puglia IGT
Description: Experience wine from the center of the world! Dark, rich and sensuous, this Negromaro combines enticing notes of dried herbs, spice, dark fruit flavours with toast notes. Make it the 'center' of any gathering of friends or family.

title: Enzo Vincenzo Valpolicella Ripasso DOC
Description: Deep ruby red colour in the glass. The nose bursts with aromas of cassis, spice and red fruit with a coffee note. On the palate this is dry, light to medium body, quite elegant and smooth with fine tannins and deep flavours of tangy cassis, spice and red plum with a hint of coffee bean on the long finish.

title: Apothic Red
Description: Ruby colour; upfront aromas include dark berry and fruit - plum, blackberry, fig, with spice notes - cinnamon and vanilla; medium body; layers of ripe fruit and rich flavours with a long finish

title: Castillo De Almansa Reserva, Almansa DO
Description: Deep ruby colour; aromas of smoky oak and prune reduction with notes of juniper, chocolate and nuts; dry, medium-bodied, with soft balanced acidity, fine tannins and a soft plummy fruit finish.

title: Trius Red
Description: From a pioneer of premium Ontario red wines, this Bordeaux-inspired blend has been crafted to perfection every year since 1989. Blackcurrant, grilled herbs, tobacco and cedar. Savour with blackened Ontario lamb, slow-cooked pork shoulder or roast beef.

title: Concha y Toro Marques de Casa Concha Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Voted 'the most admired wine brand in the world,' Chile pioneer Concha y Toro marked its 130th anniversary in 2013. This robust Cab exhibits cassis, blackberry, chocolate and cedar notes. Savour with roast leg of lamb with garlic potatoes, or a meaty lasagna.

title: Bonterra Cabernet Sauvignon Organic
Description: Bonterra has been crafting organic wines for 20+ years. This focused Cab shows blackberry, cassis, mocha, dried herbs and toasty oak flavours. Pair with grilled portobello mushroom burgers or organic rare steaks with roasted potatoes.

title: Bersano Costalunga Barbera D'Asti DOCG
Description: Bright garnet hue; spice, smoke and plum notes are evident on the nose; light earthy, smoky, plummy fruit flavours with light leather notes and good acidity.

title: Wines of Substance Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: This Cab is from Charles Smith, the dynamic, self-taught guru of Washington wines. He turned from a life as a rock band manager to rock the world of wine. The Wines of Substance Cabernet Sauvignon is loaded with blueberries, cassis, scorched earth and spice in a rich, full-bodied, balanced package. Pair with braised beef short ribs.

title: Black Cellar Shiraz Cabernet
Description: The Black Cellars winemaker explored numerous blends deep within the heart of the cellar until perfection was achieved. The ultimate blend combines upfront flavours of black currant, floral and jammy notes with a touch of mint chocolate and a smooth mouthfeel that exemplifies the mystique of Black Cellar.

title: Pelee Island Cabernet Franc VQA
Description: Medium ruby/violet colour; aromas of black plum, chocolate, cassis, cedar and vanilla; extra dry, medium bodied with plum, chocolate and cedar flavours and a fresh finish.

title: Villa Annaberta Amarone Della Valpolicella DOCG
Description: The Cottini family strictly adheres to the requirements of Amarone production to create this elegant and harmonious example. Deep ruby in colour with aromas of dark fruit, licorice, fig and chocolate featuring on the nose; the palate is rich and silky with pronounced black fruit and spice character and a long warm finish.

title: Catena Malbec
Description: Nicolás Catena helped revolutionize Argentina's wine industry after visiting California in the 1980s. This, his benchmark Malbec, has rich blackberry, blueberry, dark chocolate, exotic spices and mint. For grilled sausages, aged steaks or rare roast beef.

title: Wolf Blass Yellow Label Shiraz
Description: Inky purple; lifted notes of red fruit, rye bread, mulberry and fresh mushrooms; the medium-bodied palate explodes with red fruit and berry, and leads to a pleasing rich finish.

title: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Ivory Label Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Classically styled Cali Cab featuring cassis, cherry, spice and woodsmoke. It's dry and fruity, with supporting tannins and refreshing acidity. A crowd-pleasing wine. Try it with grilled stuffed peppers or alongside gourmet burgers with caramelized onions.
By:: Francis Ford Coppola Pres Rosso & B

title: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Cabernet Franc Cabernet Sauvignon VQA
Description: Medium ruby colour; aromas of red fruit, toast, floral note, marmalade and berries; on the palate it is extra dry and medium-plus bodied with flavours of bright red fruit, toast and berries with medium tannins and medium finish.

title: Felix & Lucie Cabernet-Syrah
Description: France's Languedoc region possesses a warm, dry climate that's ideal for growing ripe, rich versions of cabernet sauvignon and syrah. This cab/syrah blend delivers upfront aromas and flavours of black olive, smoke, prune and toast. Given its light to medium body and ripe flavours, pair with beef brisket or stews.

title: Peller Family Vineyards Shiraz
Description: Soft and generous with upfront black plum and licorice flavours supported by a hint of coffee beans on the finish. Shiraz is a great choice for entertaining; serve with barbecued ribs, smoked brisket, burgers with cheese and mushrooms or a charcuterie platter.

title: Liberty School Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: The Hope family, owners of Liberty School, helped transform the 'wild west' of Paso Robles into a wine lover's destination thanks to wines like this rich Cab with its black fruit flavours. A real crowd-pleaser with barbecued fare or a meat-lovers' pizza.

title: Wakefield Estate Shiraz Clare Valley
Description: Wakefield is the name used in North America by Australia's eminent Taylor family. Their Clare Valley Shiraz will offer great depth and richness with ripe blackberry, blueberry, black pepper and chocolate. Pair with lamb.

title: Stags' Leap Winery Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Stags' Leap Winery is more than a deer crossing. Layered and complex, this wine features aromas and flavours of cassis, black cherry, cinnamon and woodsmoke. Cellar this powerhouse for up to 5 years, or enjoy tonight with rare steaks, roast beef or lamb.

title: Peller Family Vineyards Merlot
Description: A smooth, fruity merlot sourced from fine vineyards in Canada and around the world. It's medium ruby in colour. Shows aromas of cassis, floral tone, cadar, licorice and smoke. The palate is medium bodied and dry with ripe cassis character and notes of violets, cedar, spice and smoke. Well suited for any occasion.

title: Bodacious Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Bodacious wines are gaining a following for their bold, yet smooth character. Bright ruby red in the glass with aromas of sweet red berry fruit and vanilla. Lively flavours of strawberry, cranberry, and vanilla on the palate. Medium-bodied and fruity with a soft, silky finish, this is great for peppercorn steak.

title: Pelee Island Bourbon Barrel Reserve Baco Noir VQA
Description: A special selection of baco that's matured in both ex-bourbon and premium wine casks. Shows lifted aromas and flavours of red cherry, tart berry, red plum and smoke with juniper and spice. On the palate, it's medium-bodied with juicy acidity leading to red fruit, earth and smoky tones on the finish. Great with bbq or pasta.

title: Pelee Island Merlot
Description: Pelee Island Winery is located in Canada's warmest and most southerly grape growing region. This wine is dry, medium-bodied with medium acidity and noticeable tannins. Toasted oak, nuts, and ripe berry flavours with a hint of herbs and cedar on a smooth finish. Serve with barbecued chicken, burgers or grilled vegetables.

title: Woodbridge By Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Attention to detail creates the quality and consistency that Woodbridge wines are known for. This cabernet sauvignon bursts with aromas and flavours of ripe plum, wild berry, oak and coffee. It's medium-bodied and dry with silky tannins and a long finish. Pair with braised short ribs or grilled Portobello mushrooms.

title: Lion And The Lily Red Blend
Description: An inviting red Bordeaux made up of cabernet sauvignon and merlot. Expect aromas and flavours of plum, blackberry, fresh herbs and oak. It's medium-bodied and fruity with silky tannins capped with a long finish. Pair with flank steak alongside roasted turnips topped with shaved Parmesan or a charcuterie board.

title: Clarence Dillon Clarendelle Red 2015
Description: Fresh nose with berries and chocolate with hints of hazelnuts. Sandalwood. Medium-bodied, linear and focused with fine tannins and a delicious finish. Drink and enjoy.  Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 2, 2018)

title: Santa Carolina Reserva de Familia Carmenère 2016
Description: Very fresh and juicy, this has a neat array of ripe darker plums and berries with a floral edge, too. The palate has sleek, fine-boned tannins and really delivers fresh and silky at the finish. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2019)

title: Remo Farina Montefante Riserva Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2013
Description: This is always a powerhouse Amarone, but one that keeps a firm grip on balance and is never overwhelming. Look for a mix of ripe and dried black fruit notes, with underlying tones of forest, leather, vanilla, herbs and spice. This is a wine built to age; consider following its evolution for another 5-10 years. Serve with hearty beef stews, braised beef or fine cheeses.

title: Cono Sur Bicicleta Shiraz
Description: Deep red violet colour; forward aromas of black olive, black plum, with smoky and black pepper notes; extra dry, rich and medium bodied, smooth with rounded tannins on the palate; flavours of olive, plum and spice, bright medium acidity and well integrated oak on the finish.

title: Burrowing Owl Syrah 2017
Description: Burrowing Owl's Syrahs are perennially powerful, rich, intense wines that offer tremendous depth and complexity. They feature aromas and flavours of black fruit and spice along with mocha accents and are also noted for their texture, balance and length. A great age-worthy wine from one of BC's most recognized family estates.

title: Le Gravillas Sablet Côtes du Rhône-Villages 2017
Description: You can expect to uncork a mix of ripe dark fruit framed by pepper spice and touches of tobacco. This typically has the structure, balance and freshness to pair with burgers or steak.[The Concours des Vins Orange did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Concours des Vins Orange, 2018)

title: Pelee Island Ruggles Run Noir Zweigelt VQA
Description: Medium ruby colour with a pale pink rim; aromas of blackberry, herbs and spices with smoke and floral notes; dry, medium bodied with moderate acidity and tannins with flavours of blackberries, green herbs, spices and smoke.

title: Domaine Chanson Beaune Teurons 1er Cru 2013
Description: Rich in character, this is a dense wine, with smoky tannins and juicy red fruits that are deliciously ripe. The tannins and the fruit concentration result in a weighty yet brightly acidic wine. It will develop quickly, and then remain at a peak for many years. Drink from 2018. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2016)

title: Feudo Montoni Vrucara Nero d'Avola 2015
Description: The en primeur nero d'avola, finished but so far from even hinting at a readiness. Wild strawberry and the dreams of aromatics to come; carob, liquorice, salumi and all the herbs. Grasses and magical things that grow in a Montoni natural world. Top quality acidity for 2015, reeling, supportive and wild. A truly structured wine and one that will resist growing old despite the passage of time. Drink date: 2020-2029. Score - 95. (Michael Godel, winealign.com, Sept. 7, 2019)

title: Azienda Agraria Campanella Soviano Regale 2011
Description: Founded in 2005, this winery is devoted to creating quality wines. This food-friendly sangiovese is light ruby in colour, with inviting aromas and flavours of cherry, plum, spice and cocoa with herbal tones. Medium-bodied and dry this pairs well with red wine braised beef over rice and vegetables or a charcuterie board.

title: Firriato Chiaramonte Nero D'Avola 2015
Description: Dried berry and spice with hints of rose petal on the nose. Full body. Round, velvety and ripe tannins. Gorgeous fruit. Drink or hold. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Oct. 20, 2017)

title: Obikwa Shiraz
Description: Ruby red; aromas of smoke, floral notes, prune and spices; the palate is dry, medium-bodied with flavours of campfire smoke, prune spread, spice and rye bread.

title: Tawse Laundry Vineyard Cabernet Franc 2016
Description: Very pretty, evolving nose and terrifically savoury palate, this is both ripe and fresh, sappy and concentrated, fleshy but also firm. I love the fine-grained tannins, abundant but coated in loads of black berry and raspberry extract, and the excellent length and depth overall. A magnificent vintage for this perennial favorite from Tawse, a strength in the portfolio to be sure. I'd cellar for another year or so, or hold until the mid to late '20s. Score - 93. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com, May 22, 2020)

title: Mission Hill Five Vineyards Pinot Noir
Description: Light ruby colour; sour cherry, berry, beet, earth and raspberry aromas; dry, medium bodied, with earthy, fruity flavours, balanced acidity and moderate tannin on finish.

title: Matetic Corralillo Syrah 2015
Description: This is ready to drink now, but will reward following for 3-5+ more years.Aromas of blackberry, blueberry, slate and stone. Full body and lovely fine tannins. Long finish. Fantastic. Drink now. Score - 95. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, May 29, 2017)

title: Reif Estate Meritage 2015
Description: This terrific, robust Niagara red wine blend over-delivers against its price point. Balanced, elegant and full-bodied: a beautiful blend of Cabernet and Merlot from this Niagara winery. Decant 1-2 hours. Pair with hearty meat dishes. Drink: [now]-2021. Score - 90. (Natalie MacLean, nataliemaclean.com, Nov. 23, 2018)

title: Paso Creek Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Hot days and cool nights provide ideal climatic conditions for achieving both fruit ripeness and food-friendly acidity, and that's Paso Robles in a nutshell. For California-Cabernet lovers looking for value alternatives to Napa, this popular, fruit-forward, big, bold take is just the thing. Expect ripe cassis, blueberry and vanilla tones in a robust but elegant package. Great for steak, ribs or roasts.

title: Zuccardi Serie A Malbec 2018
Description: This is very fresh and bright with dark berries and spice and hints of rose stems. Medium body, easy tannins and a juicy and rich finish. Lovely concentration here. [Ready to] Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, March 27, 2019)

title: Concha y Toro Marques de Casa Concha Carmenère 2017
Description: Expect this wine to suggest dark fruit, red berry, herb and licorice notes, with spice and chocolate on the finish. It will drink well till 2025+, but would be wonderful tonight with lamb or braised beef.[The International Wine Challenge certificate did not include a tasting note.] Score - 95. (International Wine Challenge, 2019)

title: Banfi Brunello di Montalcino 2015
Description: The Castello Banfi 2015 Brunello di Montalcino is fragrant and bright. Aromas of wild cherry, blackberry and plum emerge from the glass with spice, tar and licorice following close in tow. The unified front created by those aromas adds to the overall intensity and purity of the wine. The wine is silky and glossy with a mid-weight style that wraps closely over the palate. This Brunello is fermented in both steel and oak. About 80% of the total volume ages in 60- or 90-hectoliter botte made with French oak, and 20% is aged in new barrique. The wine was bottled in April 2019 and hit the market in January 2020. You can drink this accessible wine straight out of the gate or wait to age it longer. Drink date: 2020-2033. Score - 93. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Jan. 31, 2020)

title: Cafaggio Chianti Classico 2015
Description: Attractive Chianti Classico with a good balance between ripe dark cherry fruit, firm (but ripe) tannins and fresh acidity. Still youthful, this will mellow and improve with a further year in bottle. Very good purity and typical Classico character. Drink date: 2019-2024. Score - 93. (Andy Howard, MW, decanter.com, Jan. 29, 2019)

title: Anakota Helena Montana Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Very deep purple-black in color, the 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon Helena Montana Vineyard gives up notes of coffee grounds, chocolate box and warm blueberries with hints of black currant cordial and blackberry pie, plus touches of tar and black soil. Medium-bodied and totally laden with tightly packed fruit layers and great tension, it has a very firm frame of grainy tannins and epic length. 847 cases produced. Drink date: 2017-2036.  Score - 96. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Dec. 29, 2017)

title: Castellani Filicheto Vino Nobile di Montepulciano 2013
Description: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano was called "the perfect wine" in 1549, the "king of wines" in 1685, and had "noble" incorporated into its name in the late 18th century. This one is made from 90' Prugnolo Gentile (Sangiovese) with 10' Canaiolo, spent 24 months in oak casks and offers smoky notions of violets and red cherry that will be familiar to fans of Brunello and Chianti. Pour it with osso buco, or sautéed chicken in a marinara sauce.

title: Los Ricos Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Description: This wine perfectly illustrates why California Cabernets reign supreme for many tastes. For all the flavourful brawn this red reveals, it maintains a sense of restraint that focuses the flavours. Black cherry base notes and a lavish texture are tinged with tantalizing aromas of rose, mint and cedar.

title: Rioja Bordón Reserva 2013
Description: This blend of Tempranillo, Garnacha and Mazuelo was aged in American oak and French oak for 18 months. You can expect a ripe, focused wine with red fruit, smoke, mocha and pepper spice. Enjoy it tonight with steak or follow it for another 5+ years.

title: Casas del Bosque Reserva Carmenère 2018
Description: Carmenère, the signature red wine variety of Chile, can produce intensely flavourful wines that deliver remarkable depth and structure. This one was aged 10 months in French oak barrels. You can expect to find smoky campfire, earth, dark cherry, plum, grilled red pepper and vanilla tones. Perfect for anything hot off the grill.[Tim Atkin, MW, did not provide a tasting note.] Score - 89. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2019)

title: Zanchi Armane Amelia Rosso DOC 2013
Description: Ruby red in appearance, it releases fragrant red berryfruit aromas then develops well rounded and harmonious in the mouth, with just the right level of tannins and slight hint of almond. A wine with good ageing potential. Food Pairings: Red meats, game & aged cheeses

title: Flowers Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Moving to the reds, the appellation 2018 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast was just about completely destemmed (2% stems) and spent 10 months in 18% new French oak. Lots of spice box, earthy forest floor, cherries, and redcurrant notes define the bouquet, and it's medium-bodied and balanced, with good acidity and a great finish. As with everything from this estate, it's impeccably made and high-quality. Drink it over the coming 5-7 years. Maturity: 2020-2027. Score - 93. (jebdunnuck.com, May 21, 2020)

title: Sterling Vintner's Collection Pinot Noir
Description: Deep ruby colour; red cherry, earthy and vanilla aromas; light to medium bodied, dry; raspberry and cherry flavours with a nice touch of spice on the finish

title: Martin Berdugo Reserva 2010
Description: An elegant wine made from Tempranillo grapes grown in Ribera del Duero, this smooth red features a perfect blend of forest fruits and oak, notes of chocolate and vanilla, and polished tannins. Savour it solo, or serve it with red meats or game.

title: Faust Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Lovely softness and balance to this wine. Aromas and flavors of currants and blueberries. Medium-to full-bodied. Refined and beautiful now. Drink and enjoy [now to 2030+]. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 14, 2020)

title: J. Lohr Carol's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: With a smattering of Petit Verdot, this hearty, full-bodied red is robust in oak. Tobacco, leather, clove and char highlight a concentrated dark-berry frame, with a lingering mocha tone on the finish.  Score - 90. (Virginie Boone, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2020)

title: Brigaldara Case Vecie Amarone della Valpolicella 2012
Description: The Brigaldara 2012 Amarone della Valpolicella Case Vecie (a traditional blend of 55% Corvina, 25% Corvinone and 20% Rondinella) comes from a warm vintage that saw hot, drying winds for most of the summer season. Those scorching weather conditions have further contributed to the richness and concentration of the fruit you get here. After harvest, the grapes are laid out to dry for 120 days, and during that process, they lose up to one-third of their water mass, tightening and further concentrating that distinctive richness. After the grapes are destemmed, pressed and fermented, the wine goes into French barrique for two years, followed by an additional two years to refine in large oak casks. Dried blackberry and plum segue to spice, smoke and tar. The wine is soft in terms of mouthfeel, with impressive textural richness. Drink date: 2019-2035.  Score - 94. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Sept. 30, 2019)

title: Casa Montes Alzamora Syrah 2013
Description: The brilliant, fruity aromas emanating from this intense, red-purple Syrah suggest raspberries and black pepper seasoned with clove and allspice. Vanilla and caramel notes on the round palate soften and complement its well-balanced structure. Pair this wine with a garlicky, herbaceous roast leg of lamb.

title: Black Stallion Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: A soft and silky red with lots of dark-berry and toasted-coffee undertones, yet not overdone. Full body, round and silky tannins and a flavorful finish. Mainly cabernet sauvignon with some petit verdot, merlot and other red grapes. Drink now. [This stately Napa Cab will continue to evolve for another 8+ years.] Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 19, 2018)

title: Zimmerlin Alte Reben Pinot Noir 2013
Description: Pinot Noir is a notoriously challenging grape to nurture but, when given the proper care and cultivation, the result lands in this territory. Aged for 12 months in oak, this beautifully balanced red poses cocoa and cherry notes with a charmingly long finish.

title: Billy Goat Hill Shiraz 2014
Description: Offering a true taste of Western Australia, this youthful, purple-rimmed Shiraz is clean with ripe plum and spiced rhubarb aromas wrapped in hints of vanilla and dusty oak. Spiced dark fruits dominate the dry palate and make it an excellent choice for pairing with roast crown of pork, chicken kebabs or grilled lamb shoulder seasoned with rosemary.

title: Halos de Jupiter Vacqueyras 2016
Description: Shows the intense ripe and racy feel of the vintage, with dark plum, black currant and blackberry fruit inlaid with graphite and black tea notes. Focused and long, revealing an echo of singed alder. Best from 2019 through 2023. Score - 92. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Oct. 15, 2018)

title: Rex Hill Pinot Noir 2017
Description: This has a very rich array of deeply toasty spices and reductive, meaty nuances, as well as ripe, rich dark plums and cherries. The palate has a plush, smooth and sleek array of vibrant red fruit, velvety tannins and drink-now appeal. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, July 2, 2019)

title: Heredad de Baroja Gran Reserva 2002
Description: A veritable feast for the senses; it is deliciously savoury then climaxes on an explosion of red berries, spice and vanilla, finishing with an orange spritz. Mature and refined, this will drink now but also keep on giving in years to come. Drinking Window 2017-2026. Score - 91. (decanter.com, March 2017)

title: Inniskillin East West Series Merlot Cabernet
Finca Agostino Inicio Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: The grapes for this ruby red Cabernet Sauvignon are grown at the edge of the Andes, 850 metres above sea level. Aromas of black pepper and tobacco dominate the nose, but a delicate and intriguing smokiness really stands out. The palate is elegant and well balanced, with a long finish, and the wine is beautifully suited to roasts and game.

title: Lantides Neméa Agiorgitiko 2016
Description: Good value in a Greek red with a quite fine, well integrated and pretty if not showy nose of red plum/raspberry jam, fresh herbs, underbrush and wood spice. It is medium-full bodied, quite rounded but not at all sweet, with lowish acid and fine-grained dusty tannin. The wood spice echoes on the finish longest. A bit warm, very good to excellent length.  Score - 89. (David Lawrason, winealign.com, Oct. 7, 2019)

title: Mi Terruño Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Description: This wine shows violet and raspberry aromas, along with a swirl of chocolate and vanilla on the nose and ripe berry flavours on the well-rounded palate. Pair this Cab with a plate of red-sauce enchiladas.

title: Waupoos Red Rabbit VQA
Description: Pale ruby colour; spicy/peppery nose with red berry fruit and a hint of milk chocolate; dry, spicy, berry fruit flavours with lively acidity on the palate.

title: Six Sigma Ranch Reserve Tempranillo 2013
Description: Fans of Spanish wines should reach for this winery's flagship red to experience a taste of pure talent. Commanding red fruit flavours and aromas play out big on the palate and welcome any opportunity to pair with grilled meats, such as fatty lamb or pork.

title: Miras Cabernet Franc 2014
Description: This Patagonian Cabernet Franc shows tons of lovely fruity aromas strongly informed by black fruits, along with notes of vanilla, spice and coffee. On the palate, it's full bodied and well balanced, with excellent persistence on the finish.

title: Miras Jovem Malbec 2015
Description: Hailing from the remote vineyards of Patagonia, this Malbec shows red fruit and floral aromas framed by elegant wood notes. The smooth, intense flavours of ripe plum, blackberry and tobacco linger on the palate. Serve this wine alongside a classic margherita pizza.

title: Miras Malbec 2014
Description: Ripe blackberries, strawberries and raspberries define the fruity aromas, while toasted oak, tobacco and cassis round out the complex nose. The full-bodied palate is supported by excellent, round, ripe tannins. A herbaceous Bo Ssam (Korean roast pork) makes an outstanding pairing.

title: Maison Roche de Bellene Vieilles Vignes Volnay 2014
Description: A bright, sleek style, displaying violet, cherry and black currant aromas and flavors. Well-structured and balanced, this lingers with smoke and mineral accents. Terrific length. Best from 2019 through 2032.  Score - 93. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, April 30, 2017)

title: Beringer Founders Estate Zinfandel
Description: Medium ruby colour; aromas and flavour of ripe black cherries and cocoa; dry and fruity with soft tannins.

title: Tarima Hill Monastrell 2015
Description: This red shows grace and depth. Black cherry, plum, mineral and smoke flavors mingle harmoniously over well-integrated tannins, while lively acidity keeps this focused. Not showy, but all the pieces fit together. Balanced, in the modern style. Monastrell. Drink now through 2025. Smart Buys. Ranked #17 in the 2017 Wine Spectator's Top 100. Score - 92. (Thomas Matthews, winespectator.com, Dec. 31, 2017)

title: Le Rocche Colli Di Rimini Cabernet Sauvignon DOC 2016
Manzone Gramolere Barolo 2013
Description: This is Giovanni Manzone's headline Barolo. At 13,000 bottles made per year, production numbers are more than double the other Barolos in his portfolio, so this wine is reasonably easy to locate as a result. The 2013 Barolo Gramolere is an articulate and exuberant expression of contemporary Nebbiolo. It sees a 40-day maceration period for extra color and structure, plus 30 months aging in both botte grande and tonneaux. It reveals a dark color and medium body with black cherry, spice and licorice aromas that lift elegantly from the bouquet. Drink Date: 2018-2030.  Score - 94. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2017)

title: Artesa Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2012
Description: No need to complicate matters when settling on a pairing for rib-eyes. Just reach for this red and let its sociable personality take command. Assertive cassis, chocolate and cherry aromas ready the palate for similar flavours playing bigger and bolder. A slight kick of spice, smoke and oak makes it give that much more of an impression.

title: Monticello Estate Pinot Noir 2013
Description: A celebration of pure winemaking skill is on show with this red that shows abundant personality and flows with ripe red berry and an expansive, full-bodied texture. All of this is backed by aromas that span sweeter touches of strawberry to cinnamon and graham cracker.

title: Clark-Claudon Estate Napa Cabernet Sauvignon 2012
Description: Prepare for a flood of ripe fruit to consume the palate in this densely crafted dynamo. Blackcurrant, licorice, plum and an earthiness are tinged with flecks of Asian spice. With its medium- to full-bodied disposition, the deep hue promises a flavourful encounter.

title: Colle Uncinano Flame Vino Rosso
Description: A blend of Sangiovese and Merlot, this wine is fruity with notes of cherry and sour cherry.

title: Pondview Lot 74 Cabernet Merlot VQA
Description: Pale ruby colour; spicy berry and cherry aromas and flavours; light and fruity on the palate.

title: Materrra Merlot Napa 2010
Description: This is a red that flaunts its youthful and lively personality with easy aplomb. Nimble plum and raspberry flavours occupy the forefront, while hints of cocoa and sage linger. Soft tannins on the palate mingle with more complex aromas as a delectable acidity carries the flavours through to a firm finish.

title: Herzog Variations American Oak Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: The anticipation of a hearty feast always brings with it the prospect of finding that perfect pairing - which should find you securing this superlative option. Captivating berry fruit, both black and red, tug this into unreservedly rich territory, as shades of dill and soothing vanilla grow on the finish.

title: Herzog Lineage Camouflage 2015
Description: There's no hiding the fact that this red will match fluently with a range of robust dishes. Nuances of leather, anise and toasted nuts integrate with upfront cherry and blackberry. Traces of delicate sweetness and floral notes give the overarching boldness that much more personality.

title: Del Sio Celestia Tierra Tinto 2015
Description: A blend of two prized Spanish grapes, Tempranillo and Garnacha, grown in northern Catalonia, this red is dark and delicious. With notes of berries and juicy fruit flavours, it makes a fresh change from your usual red and a nice choice for roasted meats.

title: Galan Reserva Privada Merlot 2013
Description: Our Preimium wine Merlot reflects the high grape quality with silky ripe berry and plum character, accented with violet and spice nuances. Here, The Lontué Valley, providing outstanding conditions for growing Merlot, a grape variety that prefers cooler mesoclimates. We have given the wine a touch of oak aging, to complement the forward fruit character.

title: La Castellina Maremma L'Aureo Di Poggio Alla Buca 2013
Capcanes Peraj Petita Red Blend 2014
Description: Medium ruby with hints of violet fresh, seductive aromas of red berries and cherry; loads of red fruit in taste.

title: The Barber Shiraz Cabernet 2013
Description: These wines are specifically made for early release and focus on freshness and drinkability. This Shiraz/Cab blend shows a fulsome concentration of blackberry, black currant, white pepper and sweet spice both on the nose and on the palate. Pair this easygoing wine with backyard burgers or a spicy Calabrese pizza.

title: Tobacco Road Merlot 2013
Description: Victoria State in Southeastern Australia is known for producing big, lush wines with real character and this smart Merlot is no exception. Ripe blackberry and fruitcake aromas lead to a plump palate filled with ripe plum and dark berry characters while a subtle touch of oak imparts delicate spice and additional complexity.

title: Tobacco Road Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: A true Australian Cabernet Sauvignon, it shows all the Antipodean character traits: blackcurrant, plum and violet aromas leading to a lively, fruit-filled palate supporting rich, chocolatey oak complexity and fine spice, finishing soft and smooth. This wine yearns to be paired with red meat cooked over charcoal.

title: Epica Red
Description: This blend of three different varieties sourced from different Chilean valleys delivers defined notes of ripe black fruit and spice character. Full and structured on the palate with balancing softness and a lengthy savoury finish.

title: Sue-Ann Staff The Chestnut Tree Cabernet Franc 2015
Description: 100% Cabernet Franc. A cedar and dried herb nose leading to a green pepper palate with layers of red plum, blueberry and spice.  Score - 92. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2018)

title: Dona Isidora Merlot 2012
Description: This Merlot is full-bodied with an intense aroma of red fruits and a delicate and elegant flavour profile. This quality Merlot is ideal with any type of pasta and sauce.

title: Dandelion Vineyards Lioness of McLaren Vale Shiraz 2017
Description: Hand-picked, crushed to open fermenters, 12 days on skins, 18 months maturation in French and American oak, largely used. Deep crimson-purple; full-bodied, but not the least oppressive, letting all things McLaren Vale free to express themselves. Blackberry, black cherry and bitter chocolate are wrapped in a gauze veil of ripe tannins. Drink by: 2032. Special Value. Score - 95. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2019)

title: Nemea Driopi Agiortiko 2015
Description: Rustic, approachable, oak aged, agiorgitiko from Northern Greece. Ripe and generous aromas of wild berry, plum and herb with spice notes. On the palate this is full-bodied and fleshy with fine acidity, ripe tannins and bold, flavours of juicy, black fruit, vanilla, coffee and dried herb. Drink now with hearty meat dishes.

title: Muses Estate Clio Red 2015
Description: This family-owned winery is located in Askri, Viotia, in Central Greece. A mélange of merlot and agiorgitiko, it is ruby in colour, with alluring notes of cherry, blackberry, oak and pepper, with a hint of herbal tones. Medium-bodied and dry, with velvety tannins, it is well-suited for rack of lamb beside roasted turnips.

title: Ruggabellus Efferus Mataro 2015
Description: The name translates roughly as 'rugged, untamed beauty,' and what's in the glass matches the description perfectly. A complex blend of four grapes - Mataro, Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault - the wine has a wild, rustic feel. Blackberry and fig aromas blend with fresh earth and a distinct meatiness that makes a powerful impression.

title: Belle Glos Dairyman Vineyard Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Expect this to be a decadent expression of Pinot Noir that reflects a powerful, rich style. It's typically crafted to deliver exuberantly lavish notes of chocolate and mocha atop the blackberry and cherry fruit tones. Look for some herbal undertones and notable oak influence. A silky, unabashedly generous match for game, lamb, or beef stews.

title: Jacques AOP Languedoc Red 2015
Description: Ruby red with purple reflections. Aromas of red fruits, especially cranberry and blackcurrant combined with notes of sweet spices bringing a beautiful complexity and a Mediterranean style. A gourmand and round mouth, reminiscent of the red fruits appreciated on the nose, with acidulated notes that bring a beautiful freshness.

title: Stoney Ridge Cabernet Franc
Description: Look for this Cabernet Franc to deliver complex and layered aromas of dark fruit, earth and oak tones. The palate will be balanced and integrated with black fruit, earth and spice undertones.

title: Morandé Gran Reserva Carmenère 2017
Description: Ricardo Baettig blends 11% Carignan and 4% Cabernet Franc into his Maipo Carmenère, which adds some acidity and extra perfume to the cuvée. Smooth, scented and well balanced, with toasty oak and good concentration. Drink Date: 2020-2027. Score - 90. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2019)

title: L'Ecole No. 41 Perigee 2014
Description: Very oaky nose but the cherry and cassis fruit comes through. Quite full, ample and powerful with a fine but firm chassis of tannins and inviting blueberry and herbal flavours. An engaging wine with more than a little presence.  Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2017)

title: Pintia 2015
Description: A very structured and intense Pintia with lots of blackberry, chocolate and cedar character. Full body. Yet, it's more refined than in past vintages. One of the more balanced bottlings from this winery. Delicious already. Available in 2020. Better after 2021. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, Sept. 22, 2020)

title: Wildass Merlot 2016
Description: From the 2016 vintage, which offered great consistency and quality across all of Ontario's varietals, this hand-harvested Merlot is mouthfilling with good concentration and depth. Lots of complexity here, with a nice mélange of dark and red fruit, smoke, chocolate and a low-toned earthy note. Good balance and structure and a luxurious velvety feel. An easy choice for a casual meal like a meaty pizza or meatloaf, but with enough presence to step up to more serious fare such as a lamb dinner. (Vintages panel, Feb. 2018)

title: Tenuta Di Trecciano Chianti Colli Senesi DOCG 2013
Description: Colli Senesi is a Chianti sub region with varied terroirs. Made entirely of sangiovese grape, this wine matures in steel vat and bottle. Aromas of strawberry, black cherry and violets continue to a juicy palate of black cherry, raspberry and dried herbs. The finish displays soft tannins. Pair with roast lamb or cold cuts.

title: Sperling Vineyards Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Vibrant and impressive, with unmistakable varietal character, a fresh, lifted palate and some spice. A wine to consider cellaring for 3-5+ years. It will be a great match for barbecued chicken or roasted meats.  (Vintages panel, Oct. 2019)

title: Edition FELS Lemberger 2015
Description: This full-bodied red marries blackcurrant and green pepper notes that highlight the hearty flavours of grilled lamb, game or beef.

title: Torres Cordillera de los Andes Reserva Especial Carmenère 2016
Description: Cordillera is made entirely with Carmenère grapes from Peumo, generally considered one ofthe best places to grow the grape in Chile. Toasty, grassy and well balanced, with some white pepper spice and fine tannins, this is at the lighter end of the stylistic spectrum. 2020-26. Score - 92. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2019)

title: 992 Finca Rio Negro 2015
Description: Crafted at a family-run winery in the foothills of Guadalajara, this Tempranillo blend is bright, clean and brimming with aromas of red berries and violet, and notes of oak. A food-friendly, medium-bodied red, it's equally good with chicken, lamb and steak.

title: L'Aventure Côte à Côte 2014
Description: The estate's southern Rhone blend and a rough mix of 50% Syrah, 35% Mourvedre and 15% Syrah, the 2014 Cote a Cote is a killer looking barrel sample that has lots of jammy blackberry, violets, peppery herbs and graphite aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, big and concentrated, yet surprisingly light on its feet and silky, it could match or exceed the 2012. Drink: 2017-2027. Score - 94-96. (Jeb Dunnuck, robertparker.com, Aug. 2015)

title: Do Les Agapans 2014
Description: 100% hand-picked harvest. This wine is then aged in 100% oak barrels for 24 months. Power & elegance; concentrated & complex; delicate & tannic. A full bodied wine with a velvety taste. Pairs well with game. Aging capacity: 8-10 years.

title: Pillitteri Canadian Gothic Cabernet Merlot VQA
Description: Medium ruby; aromas of red berry, raspberry, leather, earth and some oak; the palate is dry and medium body with fresh zippy flavours of red cherry and raspberry with supple tannins that add structure.

title: Dyer Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: The 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon is another super-impressive wine from Dawnine Dyer. Ripe, sumptuous and super-concentrated in the glass, the 2015 is quite rich and yet it also offers superb balance. Dollops of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot add aromatic intrigue throughout. This is an unusually seamless, voluptuous wine from Dyer. I can't wait to taste it from bottle. Score - 92-95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Dec. 2016)

title: Giesen The Brothers Pinot Noir 2016
Description: The fruit for this is harvested and fermented in small batches and aged in a mix of old and new French oak. This is quite a robust Pinot with great raspberry, sour cherry and earth tones. Caramel and spice round out the complex flavours nicely. Great for duck, or meaty fish such as tuna or salmon.  (Vintages panel, May 2018)

title: El Chico Malo 2014
Description: From a young winery in southern Murcia, this silky-smooth blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Monastrell grapes, featuring a bouquet of ripe red fruit with spicy notes and a rich finish, is an ideal match for red meats and savoury dishes.

title: Viewpointe Estate Big Bluff Red VQA
Description: Originating in the southwestern extremity of Ontario's Lake Erie North Shore, this lovely blended wine is ruby in colour and it offers big and bold aromas and flavours of plum, cherry, raspberry, strawberry and oak. Medium-bodied with a silky finish, enjoy this with bacon-wrapped scallops or pulled chicken sliders.

title: Louis M. Martini Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2012
Description: I am always a fan of this wine with its dusty, red-tile and rust character, which underlines the fruit and ripe tannins. Full-bodied, powerful and tannic, all the way up to the flavorful finish. Give it three or four years to soften. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 12, 2016)

title: Betz Family Winery Père de Famille Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Lastly, the 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Pere de Famille is another flawlessly balanced, pure, powerful 2016 that knocks it out of the park in terms of quality. Crème de cassis, blackberries, lead pencil, iron, and violet notes all emerge from this inky colored, full-bodied, yet ultra-fine Cabernet Sauvignon that does everything right. A blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot, and 5% Merlot that's mostly from Red Mountain, it has the balance and texture to shine even today yet will keep for 20+ years. Maturity: 2022-2042. Score - 97. (jebdunnuck.com, April 11, 2019)

title: Henschke Keyneton Euphonium 2013
Description: Henschke's 2013 Keyneton Euphonium is deep garnet-purple in color and exudes lovely, expressive blackberries and cherries on the nose, with menthol, pepper, anise and cloves--plus a waft of fragrant earth. A full, rich and concentrated blend, with firm and grainy tannins, this wine is well balanced and possesses great structure. Score - 92+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, June 29, 2016)

title: Gérard Bertrand Grand Terroir Les Aspres Syrah/Mourvèdre/Grenache 2017
Description: Intriguing herb and spice notes lead the way in the 2017 Cotes du Roussillon les Aspres Grand Terroir, a blend of Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. It's a medium-bodied, balanced wine that avoids any excess heat or ripeness in favor of drinkability and complexity. Red raspberries and cherries provide the backdrop, framed by silky tannins and embellished with hints of cracked pepper, anise and rosemary. Drink date: 2019-2022. Score - 90. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, April 30, 2019)

title: Pelee Island Baco Noir Reserve VQA
Description: Medium ruby; lifted aromas of red berries, earth, spice, herbs and smoke; medium bodied, flavours of cherry, tart raspberry and subtle spice and smoky notes.

title: Basilica Cafaggio Single Estate Chianti Classico 2015
Description: A sleek, supple red, boasting cherry, strawberry, floral and spice aromas and flavors. Very pure and harmonious, persisting on the detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2024. Smart Buys. Score - 90. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Feb. 28, 2018)

title: Pillitteri Canadian Gothic Cabernet Merlot VQA
Description: Medium ruby; aromas of red berry, raspberry, leather, earth and some oak; the palate is dry and medium body with fresh zippy flavours of red cherry and raspberry with supple tannins that add structure.

Description: Medium ruby; lifted aromas of red berries, earth, spice, herbs and smoke; medium bodied, flavours of cherry, tart raspberry and subtle spice and smoky notes.

title: Basilica Cafaggio Single Estate Chianti Classico 2015
Description: A sleek, supple red, boasting cherry, strawberry, floral and spice aromas and flavors. Very pure and harmonious, persisting on the detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2024. Smart Buys. Score - 90. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Feb. 28, 2018)

title: Pères De L'Eglise Châteauneuf Du Pape Cuvée Héritage 2015
Description: Jeb Dunnuck tasting note: RP 92-94 ...the 2015 Châteauneuf du Pape Heritage is 100% Grenache that was partially destemmed and is still aging all in two- to three-year-old demi-muids. Uber ripe, even a touch overripe, with decadent notes of olive tapenade, game, melted licorice and serious dark fruits, it's full-bodied, rich and mouth-filling, with polished tannin and a great finish.

title: Cuvee Mythique Halloween Edition Pays Doc*
Salman Vineyards Petite Syrah
Description: The picture of sophistication, with smooth, succulent flavours, this wine is big with blackcurrant and a soothing layer of creamy-sweet oak, and the texture is dense and darkly delicious. Jammy berry aromas combine with hints of chocolate and a wisp of smoke to emphasize the sheer depth of character.

title: Quinta da Rede Reserva 2015
Description: This is a powerful ripe wine, packed with black fruits and firm tannins. It is an impressive blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, rich with black-plum flavors, a dark texture and great structure. This is a wine to age. Drink from 2020. Editors' Choice. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, June 1, 2017)

title: Dona Isidora Syrah 2015
Description: Intense and bright cherry colour, deep and strongly aromatic, with pleasant notes of mint and eucalyptus in mouth. Full bodied, with very concentrated ripe fruits, which contribute in displaying its soft, persistent, pleasant and elegant tannins. Specifically recommended to serve next to all sorts of red meats, pastas and cheeses. Serve at room temperature.

title: Dona Isidora Merlot Carmenere 2015
Description: On the nose the aromas of berries and blackberries; the barrels give this wine a roasted flavour. On the mouth a soft texture with a medium body and adequate presence of tannins.

title: Quinta da Foz Reserva 2014
Description: Cherry red colour. Complex and intense aromas dominated by red fruits as well as the black plum and light floral tones. Dark chocolate notes and spice from the aging in French oak barrels. In the mouth it is a full-bodied wine, which brings aromas of fresh fruit. Seamless, velvety, well integrated tannins give the wine elegance and a pleasant and persistent finish.

title: Gato Negro 9 Lives Reserve Red Blend
Description: This opaque, ruby wine is loaded with aromas of cassis, savoury herbs and black fruit; the palate is dry and medium-bodied with soft tannins and flavours of savoury herbs, ripe black cherry, vanilla and a medium-long finish.

title: Enclos Des Anges Semper Fidelis AOP Corse Calvi 2015
Description: Dark with a fruity nose mixing blueberries, plums and pleasant floral aromas with spicy Corsican maquis aromas. A medium bodied wine with crisp acidity and fine tanins the wine has a fruity and wild maquis final. Good length. From 10-50 year old vines, hand-picked grapes, blend Niellucciu (70%) and Sciccarellu ( 30%), low yields (20hl/ha), aged 18 months on lees in concrete vats.

title: Vieni Briganti Red
Description: A blend of Baco Noir, Chambourcin and Maréchal Foch.The Briganti, a Celtic tribe from the North of England, were such a thorn in the side of the Roman army that the name 'brigand' has survived to this day as a way of speaking of someone who simply won't follow the dang rules! The 2014 Vieni Briganti is juicy and lithe with black cherry, cocoa, earth and smoke, and will be ideal with a meaty pasta. You'll be hard-pressed to follow the rules of hospitality with this one - you'll likely not want to share. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2017)

title: Quinta Sardonia Sardon 2015
Description: Cherry red colour with a violet trim. The nose is intense. Notes of fresh red fruit, blackberries and cherries appear with light balsamic notes, spices (cinnamon, pepper) and nuts.The palate is tasty, aromatic, ripe, smooth and balanced. Aromas of red fruits are integrated with woody aromas. Long finish. pair with grilled red meats, aged cheeses, chicken stew, beef, white roasted meat.

title: Balbás Crianza 2013
Description: This wine has a gorgeous, deep cherry red colour with a violet rim. It is powerful and complex, with aromas of dark fruit, purple flowers, menthol, cocoa, vanilla, smoke, cigar box, aromatic herbs and woods and Chinese ink. Juicy, mouth-filling and well-structured, it has traces of prune, blueberry, candied fruit and dessert spices as well as woody, balsamic, cedary and tobacco notes. Persistent aromatic finish. Score - 94. (Guía de Vinos Gourmets, 2017)

title: Filinona Elero DOC 2012
Description: On the palate the wine confirms the aromas that were present on the nose. The tannins are firm, yet well integrated with good acidity. The finish is medium in length.

title: Lone Birch Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: The lifted floral quality on the nose is very inviting and is the perfect precursor to the bright, fresh, lithe palate. Tangy, with crushed red fruit and the acidity for pairing with food. A really nice, characterful Yakima Cabernet that will serve you well when paired with grilled beef or lamb.  (Vintages panel, May 2019)

title: Alpasión Malbec 2015
Description: This pure, rich, fruity wine expresses the goodness of the soil and climate of the Uco Valley. Its aroma presents red and dark fruits with a hint of minerality that keeps it fresh, while 10-plus months of aging in French oak barrels adds a spicy complexity, with hues of vanilla and smoke. The silky mouth feel is concentrated and combines ripe fruitiness with round and supple tannins.

title: Seriously Cool Red 2016
Description: The Seriously Cool series of wines takes its name from the Seriously Cool Chardonnay tasting Bill Redelmeier organized in the UK in 2010. The moniker is also a nod to Ontario's cool growing conditions and a recognition of the impressive wines that serious winemaking produces. This red offers notes of fresh strawberry and raspberry with a food-friendly, refreshing acidity. Enjoy with burgers. (Vintages panel, March 2018)

title: William Hill Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Ripe and structured, with black fruit, cassis and vanilla. This fresh, balanced wine offers considerable value and is crafted in an approachable, engaging style that will have broad appeal, especially when served with steak. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2018)

title: Fontanafredda Eremo Langhe Rosso 2016
Description: This red expresses cherry, currant and leather flavors, accented by tobacco and underbrush notes. Fresh and well-structured, with moderate length. Nebbiolo and Barbera. Drink now through 2023.  Score - 89. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, April 30, 2018)

title: Zuccardi Concreto Malbec 2017
Description: It's from a selection of limestone-rich vineyards that surround Zuccardi's Piedra Infinita winery in Altamira. Aged in concrete and 100% whole-cluster fermented to support the flavors, the texture is firm, but it's also smooth and friendly. Floral and herbal aromas are everywhere, while the acidity continues leading it down a road of freshness and tension. In the little fiefdom that Zuccardi has in Altamira, this is one of the best examples of potential. Score - 95. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2019)

title: Anthonij Rupert Optima 2013
Description: This is a maturing Bordeaux-styled, cabernet based blend with quite generous and complex aromas of currants, caraway, graphite, leather and some liver/meaty notes. It is not a heavy, dense red - indeed there is considerable energy and vibrancy with firm tannin. Lots here for the money, in a quite Euro-lean, dry style. The length is excellent. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com, Jan. 18, 2018)

title: Heitz Martha's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: From the famous Oakville site, this aged wine spends three years in 100% new French oak, one in neutral oak and an additional year in bottle. Though it has had time to evolve, it has years to go to unfurl its core of eucalyptus, mint and cedar. It shows an unmistakable crispness of red fruit, orange peel and stone, all honed by a grippy, generous palate. Enjoy 2024-2034. Ranked #22 in Wine Enthusiast's Top 100 Cellar Selections of 2020.  Score - 100. (Virginie Boone, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2020)

title: River Road Cabernet VQA
Description: Crafted for freshness, this un-oaked red is fragrant with aromas of cherry and raspberry. The palate is medium-bodied and dry with sweet mid-palate notes of white sugar and vanilla alongside of red berries and  followed by light white pepper notes on the medium-length finish.

title: Rock Point Pinot Noir 2015
Description: Rock Point makes their Pinot partly in oak and partly in stainless steel to emphasize the fruit character. Expect ripe strawberry, red cherry and raspberry and pair with duck, roast beef or tourtière.

title: Tolaini Montebello Gran Selezione Chianti Classico 2015
Description: This is tightly wound, fresh and austere now, its cherry, almond, mineral and tobacco flavors compressed. Hard to see where this is going, yet no one element sticks out, so the potential is fine. Best from 2023 through 2040. Score - 94. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Oct. 15, 2019)

title: Paul Hobbs Hyde Vineyard Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Pale to medium ruby-purple colored, the 2017 Pinot Noir Hyde Vineyard sings of ripe cranberries, kirsch and black raspberries with hints of rhubarb, underbrush, spice cake and fragrant soil. Medium to full-bodied, it has a wonderfully soft texture and tons of bold red berry layers, extending to a long, compelling finish with a touch of minerality. 1,015 cases produced, to be released in March 2019. Drink date: 2019-2029.  Score - 95. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 29, 2018)

title: Zuccardi Aluvional Altamira Malbec 2011
Description: The 2011 Aluvional Altamira is pure Malbec planted at 1,100 meters in soils with big boulders and a high chalk content in Altamira, which produces serious, elegant but a little backward wines. It opens with shy aromas of black cherries and blueberries, ripe, yet terse, vibrant and very harmonious, then moves on to a medium-bodied palate, that is powerful but without showing it in an obvious way. This is a superb example of the character of Altamira through the Malbec grape. Drink now-2020.  Score - 94. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, April 29, 2014 )

title: Ca' Momi Heartcraft Merlot 2017
Description: Beautifully articulated dark berry and plum, with vanilla and touches of smoke. Soft and juicy, with excellent vibrancy and balance and a savoury undertone. Pair with grilled lamb, ribs or pulled pork. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: The Lane Single Vineyard Block 14 Basket Press Shiraz 2016
Description: 10% whole bunch. It's a floral, lifted, spicy shiraz with beautiful, fluid fruit running sweetly throughout. It's medium in weight but it feels generous, an infusion of bacony/toasty oak adding positively to the impression. Tip top. Drink By: 2030.  Score - 95. (Campbell Mattinson, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2018)

title: Cantina San Paolo Aglianico 2017
Description: Wow! Now here's great value! The aglianico grape is considered to be the nebbiolo of southern Italy - firm, gutsy, complex. This captures so much of this character for only $15. Great structure and depth but in that dry, grippy Euro style that you need to embrace up front. Expect lifted currants, thyme, pepper, old spicy wood and earthiness. It is medium weight, warming, drying and thoroughly engaging. The length is excellent. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com, Feb. 20, 2019)

title: I Balzi Rosso 2017
Description: Dark, young-looking garnet. Pleasant nose of morello cherry and plum with a floral touch. Ample, easy-drinking palate augmented by deliciously fresh spice notes with a subtle touch of firmness on the finish. Playful, charming character. Score - Gold. (gilbertgaillard.com, 2019)

title: Joel Gott Merlot 2015
Description: This ripe, robust Merlot uses fruit from Napa Valley, Central Coast, Lodi and Sonoma and is aged in a combo of American and French oak. It's fruit-forward, with plum and cherry wrapped in velvety tannins, and will be a hit at your next barbecue when paired with flank steak or beef tenderloin in a cocoa-and-coffee spice rub. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2017)

title: Le Macchiole Bolgheri Rosso 2017
Description: As usual, Le Macchiole has done a great job with all of its releases, including the lower-end bottles such as the 2017 Bolgheri Rosso. There is a sure sense of precision and sharpness here with bright berry and black cherry. Those aromas show quality and craftsmanship. You would do well to pair this accessible, mid-weight wine with simple pasta topped with fresh tomato sauce. Drink date: 2019-2025. Score - 91. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, May 16, 2019)

title: Domaine François Lumpp La Brûlées Givry 1er Cru 2015
Description: A notably ripe yet slightly more elegant nose displays essence of black cherry, cassis and spice aromas that are trimmed in just enough oak to mention. There is excellent richness to the dense and relatively powerful but elegant medium-bodied flavors that also possess a lush and lingering finish. Drink: 2019+. Score - 88-91. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, Oct. 8, 2016)

title: Rebellion Shiraz
Description: This winery plays by its own rules to create a strikingly smooth combination of jammy black currant and oak aromatics. This shiraz sings with notes of blackberry, red berry and a hint of spice; a wine to enjoy on your own terms!

title: Vinetti de Fiorini Chianti Superiore DOCG
Description: Twelve months of ageing in large casks gives this Chianti a finesse that is notable in this price range. Dry and medium in body, this is a traditional Chianti Superiore, with lively acidity and moderate tannins supporting sour cherry and savoury notes.
