title: Barbera D'Asti San Bastian 2016
Description: A tiny Barbera with high acidity well balanced by a full body. Ripe plum and cherry hint, wide in mouth, medium plus finish.
By:: Poderi Rosso Giovanni Di Rosso Lion

title: Skouras St George Nemea 2016
Description: Made from Agiorgitiko 100% with a bright, deep crimson colour. The nose reveals aromas of blackberries, black raspberries and ripe strawberries with just a touch of anise and spices such as clove and cinnamon. It is a medium bodied wine with graceful texture, balanced acidity and very ripe elegant tannins. The finish is moderately long, full of red fruits with a touch of sweet vanilla and black pepper.

title: Montevertine Le Pergole Torte 2017
Description: The 2017 Le Pergole Torte is a wine of pure and total sensuality. I imagine the 2017 is one of those wines that will always offer tremendous pleasure. Pliant and inviting, with soft, voluptuous curves, the 2017 is off the charts gorgeous. Layers of deep Sangiovese fruit gradually reveal themselves with air. The flavors are so intense but also so primary. I wouldn't touch a bottle before age ten. Readers lucky enough to find the 2017 should not hesitate, as it is magnificent. I can't imagine anyone who loves Le Pergole Torte not wanting a good supply of the 2017 in the cellar. The 2017 has come together beautifully over the last year. Drinking window: 2025-2047. Score - 98. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Sept. 2020)

title: Sequoia Grove Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: Family-owned winery Sequoia Grove was founded in 1979 in a 110-year old barn beneath a grove of Sequoia trees in Rutherford. Michael Trujillo joined the winery as assistant winemaker in 1981, becoming director of winemaking in 2002. His philosophy is based on balance in the vineyard, planting different blocks with different clones, and farming without pesticides. Juicy, vibrant blackberry nose. Broad, fleshy and succulent, this has power and density too. Still a touch raw and oaky, it nonetheless has tension and drive. A lot of sucrosity on the finish, but it's not jammy. Drinking Window: 2020-2030. Score - 95. (Decanter, Oct. 10, 2017)

title: Domaine Lafage Cuvée Nicolas Vieilles Vignes Grenache Noir 2018
Description: The 2018 Nicolas is 100% Grenache, still aging in a combination of demi-muids and tanks. There's a floral top note accenting ripe black cherries on the nose, while the palate is medium to full-bodied, supple and creamy, finally finishing with a touch of velvet and spice. It should be a beauty when released later in the year. Score - 90-92. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, April 30, 2019)

title: Montes Limited Selection Carmenère 2018
Description: This has a gently peppery nose with light notes of dried dark and herbs, together with a core of dark berries and cassis. A flicker of oak spice, too. The palate has a very plush, smooth-honed feel with velvety blue cherries and cassis. Full, fleshy build to the finish. Drink now. Score - 91. (jamessuckling.com, April 17, 2020)

title: Tormaresca Torcicoda Primitivo 2017
Description: Rich primitivo with dried berries and dark-chocolate and citrus undertones. Full and juicy. Fresh acidity. Lightly chewy tannins. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Herència Altés L'Estel 2016
Description: Crafted from Garnacha, Syrah and Carignan grapes grown in mountainous Terra Alta, this red is a standout for its deep colour and full body. With black fruit and spice aromas, soft tannins and a long, tasty finish, it's made for grilled meat.

title: Tantalus Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Made from selected vineyard blocks of mature vines separately fermented with natural yeast, then aged in partially new oak for 15 months. It has fairly deep ruby colour and fairly generous nose of red cherry, considerable spice, toast and some foresty character. It is medium weight, with balanced acidity and alcohol, yet still fairly firm with drying woodsy tannin. The length is excellent. I would age this two or three years waiting for a bit more exuberance.  Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com, May 8, 2020)

title: Mission Hill Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: 88% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Cabernet Franc, 1% Merlot. A soft seductive red with a dark cherry and milk chocolate nose, lots of new oak and broad commercial appeal. Succulent finish. Score - 92. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2020)

title: Silverado Vineyards Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: In another near-perfect growing season, with a mild July and August and warmer temperatures in September, harvest wrapped up on 7 October - just a week before the first big rainstorm. The word that defines this mid-weight Cabernet is refined. It's bright, lifted, dark-fruited and juicy, with attractive cassis aromas and savoury herb-and-olive flavours. Though mostly Cabernet Sauvignon, the blend includes a bit more Merlot than usual, as well as dashes of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Drinking window: 2021-2029. Score - 94. (Elin McCoy, decanter.com, May 29, 2019)

title: Lello Reserve Red 2016
Description: Soft and velvety, with whiffs of vanilla and smoke, this full-bodied wine from the Douro region evolves to include notes of blueberry, fig and eucalyptus. Try it with short ribs or herbed pork sausages.

title: Giribaldi Barolo 2014
Description: Here's a darkly saturated and rich Barolo that opens to impressive intensity and depth. The Giribaldi 2014 Barolo offers a wide and large aromatic presentation with dark fruit, forest floor and black truffle. This wine ages in tonneaux for 30 months, and those oak tannins add a lot to the structure and the texture of this full-bodied Barolo. Some 14,000 bottles were made. Mario Giribaldi has done a very nice job in 2014. Drink Date: 2020-2035.  Score - 92. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2018)

title: Château La Cardonne 2010
Description: A superb blend of 50% Merlot, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon and the rest Cabernet Franc, the 2010 from this well-known property has performed as well as I've ever tasted. A sleeper of the vintage, this endearing style of wine has copious quantities of ripe black cherry and black currant fruit interwoven with hints of forest floor, licorice and subtle background oak. It is medium to full-bodied, rich, textured and, overall, an enormously seductive style of wine to drink over the next 7-8 years.  Drink 2013-2021. Score - 90. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Feb. 27, 2013)

title: Paros Reserve Red 2015
Description: The one and only red PDO wine produced from a blend of red and white grape variety. It has a dark red colour with purple hues and nose with emphasis on aromas of ripe red fruit, plum jam, chocolate and coffee liqueur. Soft and silky mouthsense with a delicious aftertaste of olive.

title: Cune Reserva 2014
Description: Limpid ruby-red. Expressive red berry and floral aromas are accompanied by suggestions of woodsmoke, vanilla and candied rose. Supple and open-knit, offering sweet cherry and raspberry flavors that slowly deepen and take a darker turn with aeration. Clings with very good tenacity on the finish, which features sneaky tannins and lingering suggestions of cedary oak and cherry pastry. Drinking window: 2021-2029. Score - 91. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, Feb. 2019)
By:: Compañía Vinícola del Norte de España

title: Conceito Contraste 2016
Description: The 2016 Contraste Tinto is a field blend mostly (80%) from 40-year-old vines with Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz comprising the last 20% combined (from 60-year-old vines). It was aged for 16 months in used French oak and comes in at 13.5% alcohol. A fine follow-up to the 2015, this might even be a little more concentrated. As always, that's relative as this is a very elegant bottling, not a jammy one. It may not have quite as much zip and zest as the 2015, but these are high-altitude vines. It does pretty well in that regard too. There's a real backbone too, but the tannins are controlled. Just recently bottled, this has plenty of room to improve. It may be one of the best Contraste reds yet, but let's be conservative just now. It will certainly be better next year. Score - 90. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2018)

title: Geyser Peak Winery Walking Tree Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: [The San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition did not include a tasting note.]TASTING NOTE: Excellent intensity, with a refined purity of cassis followed up by ripe blueberry, leather, anise and some coffee tones. There's a lifted mint note that stands out on the close. Great balance and value here; this punches well above its price point. Just a delight. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2018) Score - Double Gold. (San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition, 2019)

title: Le Macchiole Paleo 2016
Description: Here's another pure varietal expression, this time Cabernet Franc, and it is one for the ages. The 2015 edition of the Paleo was hot with nutty notes, whereas the 2016 Paleo is tighter and fresher. There is tension and precision here, rendering beautifully pastoral tones of green olive and herbs. You'll pick up notes of moist earth along with some spice. The freshness is truly epic, with well-integrated tannins. When you hit the licorice tones, you'll finally appreciate the depth and dimension of this wine. This is a true beauty, with enormous depth, concentration and power. Drink date: 2020-2045. Score - 97. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, May 16, 2019)

title: Fumanelli Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2015
Description: Made with an eye to history, this Amarone is grown using the classic Veronese pergola system and the fruit is dried on traditional wooden racks for 120 days. Perfumed, almost ethereal aromas of flowers and spice introduce an elegantly structured, substantial wine that'll stand up to the flavoursome richness of a mushroom-and-pancetta risotto. (Vintages panel, Jan. 2020)

title: Cherubino Apostrophe Red Blend 2017
Description: This beautiful red blend of Shiraz, Grenache, Matari is almost indescribable. This blend wine has aromas of rose petal, musk, and plum. The medium bodied palate presents vibrant berry flavours and fine tannins with a cleansing acidity. Shiraz's earthiness tempers Grenache's muskiness which softens Mataro's steeliness. This wine pairs beautifully with cured meats or a heftier pasta Bolognese.

title: Cherubino Ad Hoc Cruel Mistress Pinot Noir 2017
Description: This absolutely beautiful Pinot Noir has a stunning aroma that shows notes of graphite and minerals, juicy black cherries. A hint of spicy oak plays a supporting role. The palate is softly textured, fresh and vibrant, the flavours of black cherry and earthy beetroot carried along by a fine long acid finish. This wine should be enjoyed with a roasted game with a rich wine gravy.

title: Marqués de Murrieta Limited Edition Gran Reserva
Eisele Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Medium to deep garnet-purple in color, the 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon charges from the gate with exuberant red and black cherries notes, black currants and mulberries with a beautiful roses and lavender perfume, plus hints of sandalwood and cinnamon stick. Full-bodied, concentrated and downright explosive in the mouth, it is still wearing loads of gorgeous puppy-fat fruit flavors, offering suggestions of the complex, multilayered blockbuster that it will emerge into. The structure deserves its own mention: wonderful, seamless freshness and oh-so-fine, pixelated tannins, with an extraordinary persistence of fruit and mineral nuances. Wow. Drink Date: 2019-2049. Score - 100. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2017)

title: Produttori del Barbaresco Barbaresco 2016
Description: The 2016 Barbaresco is a tight and beautiful wine that will require more time to unwind and soften. This beautifully balanced vintage is characterized by a tight inner core of fruit that underlines the graceful aging capacity of these wines. The 2016 is shaping up to be one destined for long cellar aging. Now in its youth, the wine offers wild berry, rose and licorice aromas. Drink date: 2022-2040. Score - 95. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, June 28, 2019)

title: Domaine Font de Michelle Cuvée Étienne Gonnet Châteauneuf-du-Pape
Yves Cuilleron Cavanos Saint-Joseph 2018
Description: Dark magenta. Highly perfumed red and blue fruit, potpourri and incense aromas are sharpened by a peppery nuance. Sappy, sweet and lively on the palate, offering energetic, mineral-driven blackberry and black currant flavors that show impressive depth and building spiciness. Finishes smoky, sweet and very long, with lingering florality and gentle, well-judged tannins that add subtle grip. There's a level of finesse here that reminds me more than a little of Côte-Rôtie. Drinking window: 2023-2031. Score - 93. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, April 2020)

title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2015
Description: This generous, ripe wine is filled with fine tannins as well as juicy black-currant fruits. It is approachable in the sense that the fruit is so delicious. However, watch for those tannins that are firm and dense and will allow the wine to age. Best to wait until 2024. Score - 94. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Feb. 1, 2018)

title: Domaine Bouchard Père & Fils Beaune du Château 1er Cru 2016
Description: Exuding both ripe cherry fruit flavor and a smoky overtone, this red is distinctive and vibrant. Earth, spice and mineral elements add depth and the firm, yet integrated structure gives this some grip. Fine length. Best from 2020 through 2033.  Score - 92. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, April 30, 2019)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Clos de Malte Santenay 2018
Description: The 2018 Santenay Clos de Malte (Domaine Gagey) bursts with expressive aromas of red cherries and raspberries, deftly framed by a subtle touch of new oak. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, succulent and generous, with a fleshy core of fruit and an attractively sapid finish. Drink date: 2020-2038. Score - 90. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Elena Fucci Titolo Aglianico del Vulture 2017
Description: Good dark red. Perfumed aromas of red berry liqueur and ripe red cherry are lifted by pungent medicinal herbs and complemented by sexy vanilla and spice tones. Full-bodied yet delicate, with a fine-grained personality and compelling sweetness on the suave finish. This is aged 12 months in 50% new and 50% used French oak barriques. Drinking window: 2022-2028. Score - 93. (Ian D'Agata, vinous.com, Feb. 2020)

title: Rolet Arbois Trousseau 2012
Description: This is made from 100% Trousseau from the Arbois region of the Jura. Expect lots of raspberries, licorice herb, smoky bbq notes. Crisp on the palate, with a nice mineral finish

title: Quintessence de Peybonhomme Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux 2015
Description: This is a blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's got a lot of dark black fruits, with a touch of baking spice, cinnamon, and vanilla from spending one year in new oak. It's got plenty of life to it, so decant if enjoying now or lay it down for years in the cellar. This wine is certified biodynamic.

title: Federici Roma Rosso 2017
Description: TASTING NOTE: This blend of Cesanese and Montepulciano is intense and spicy on the nose. There's a lot to like here, with plenty of ripe dark fruit, cherry, fig, plum, herbs and forest tones, plus a hint of cocoa emerging at the end. Tangy and smooth, round and lush, but with drying tannins on the long, flavourful finish. Try it with veal cutlets. (Vintages panel, May 2019)[Luca Maroni did not include a tasting note.] Score - 98. (Luca Maroni, lucamaroni.com, March 16, 2018)

title: Three Finger Jack Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Silky and supple despite the great concentration and full body, this opulent wine has focus and fruitiness. The color is extra dark, the aromas are brimming with black currants and black cherries, while the flavors capture wonderful baked fruits and dark chocolate. The wine's tannins are soft and well integrated, providing a smooth mouthfeel.  Score - 92. (Jim Gordon, Wine Enthusiast, July 1, 2019)

title: Secreto Patagónico Malbec 2017
Description: This wine comes from Patagonia, which is one of Argentina's cool climates. It's a fresh, juicy Malbec with layers of black fruit, granite and floral notes wrapped in firm yet supple tannins. Brilliant natural acidity makes it a great food wine. It'll especially impress with steaks. (Vintages panel, Feb. 2018)

title: Cakebread Cellars Benchland Select Cabernet Sauvignon
Icardi Parej Barolo 2014 DOCG
Description: Parej: 'In this way' - this is how Barolo wine should be, an assemblage of Nebbiolo grapes coming from 3 different areas. A racy style, featuring blueberry, black currant, violet, tar and spice flavours allied to a linear frame. Balanced and complex, building to a long, mineral-tinged and mouthwatering finish. Best from 2021 through 2036. 94 points Wine Spectator

title: Leopard's Leap Pinotage/Shiraz 2016
Description: Aromas of strawberries and dried flowers follow through to a medium body. Firm and silky tannins and a bright finish. Drink or hold.  Score - 89. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, June 25, 2018)

title: LAN Reserva 2012
Description: A thick, firm texture carries ripe flavors of blackberry and fig paste in this solid red. Notes of dark chocolate, smoke and forest floor add complexity. The tannins are well-integrated, and balsamic acidity keeps this lively. Tempranillo and Mazuelo. Drink now through 2028. Smart Buy. Score - 91. (Tim Matthews, winespectator.com, Aug. 31, 2019)

title: Quinta de Lemos Jaen 2009
Description: Structured with red fruits, vegetal and resinous notes. Fresh medium body. Young with long, lingering finale.

title: Luis Seabra Mono Castelão Douro 2016
Description: Made from Portugal's second most widely planted varietal Castelão, this is an easily approachable, juicy wine, bursting with lots of red fruits. The palate is round, with soft tannins and crisp, mouthwatering acidity. Perfect with all sorts of cuisine and at any time of year.

title: Dona Louise 2010
Description: Ripe fruit of wild berries, pine needles with a medium body. Fresh and elegant in the mouth, gastronomic with mature tannins of great firmness.

title: Luis Seabra Xisto Cru Red Douro 2016
Description: Dark and earthy on the nose, with plenty of wild fruit, wet stone minerality, and a hint of dark chocolate. Dry and beautifully textured on the palate, the tannins are powder-fine but layered to give depth and shape to the scented fruit.

title: Domaine l'Or de Line Cuvée Paule Courtil Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2019
Description: A smaller production cuvée based largely on Grenache (there's 10% Syrah in the blend), the 2019 Châteauneuf Du Pape Cuvée Paul Cortil displays a dense ruby/plum color as well as a rocking Grenache nose of black raspberry liqueur, jammy blackberries, ground pepper, and Provençal garrigue. It's medium to full-bodied, opulent, and textured on the palate, with a great mid-palate. Another terrific looking barrel sample from the 2019 vintage, it has remarkable purity of fruit and great acidity, and I suspect it will be a long-lived wine, drinking well for upwards of 15-20 years. Maturity: 2020-2040. Score - 93-95. (jebdunnuck.com, Oct. 6, 2020)

title: Dona Ermelinda Reserva 2016
Description: A garnet-coloured, almost opaque wine, with aromas reminiscent of dark fruit, spices and smoke, and hints of jam due to the lengthy period of maturation. Dense, full on the palate, and well structured. Tannins are present, but are soft and well integrated. A finish that is extremely pleasant, long-lasting and persistent

title: Le Cirque Grenache/Syrah/Mourvèdre 2015
Description: The 2015 Cotes Catalanes is another smoking value from the Roussillon region in the south of France. Based on 60% Grenache, 20% Carignan and 20% Syrah, it has a forward, medium-bodied, complex style as well as terrific notes of spices, leather, garrigue and ripe plums. It has no hard edges and is a delicious, Old World fruit bomb to drink over the coming 2-4 years. Drink Date: 2017-2021. Score - 90. (Jeb Dunnuck, robertparker.com, April 28, 2017)

title: Königschaffhauser Steingrüble Trocken Pinot Noir 2016
Description: This wine is sourced from a single steep vineyard on the side of an extinct volcano in Germany's leading region for Pinot Noir: Baden. Expect attractive aromas of red cherry, raspberry, pomegranate and sandalwood and pair the wine with grilled sausages or mushroom burgers.

title: Lucien Le Moine Les Vaucrains Nuits-Saint-Georges 1er Cru 2017
Description: Mild reduction masks everything but a whiff of sauvage character. The middle weight flavors are not as dense as those of the LSG but they're just as powerful with good minerality adding a touch of lift to the rustic, focused and very serious finish that possess excellent persistence. To put away and forget. Drink: 2032+. Score - 91-93. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, April 10, 2019)

title: Villa Canestrari di Franchi Amarone Valpolicella Riserva 1888 - 2011
Description: Deep ruby red colour with garnet highlights. The bouquet is spicy and typical while on the palate it is full, warm and velvety, slightly toasted on the finish. Ideal with hearty meat and game dishes, as well as very mature and strongly-flavoured cheeses, accompanied with 'mostarda' (Italian chutney) if you wish.
By:: Soc. Agr. Villa Canestrari Di Franc

title: O'Lillo Baracchi 2016
Description: Blueberry and blackberry aromas and flavours on the nose and palate, with toasty oak and dark spice. Firm grip on the palate from tannins. Full-bodied. Decant 2 hours and enjoy with a rare steak. Pair with meat lasagne, rich stews in tomato sauce, vegetarian pizza.

title: Quinta dos Murças Reserva 2013
Description: This is a rich wine based on a field blend of traditional Douro grapes. It is massively concentrated, firm and properly mature, with rich black fruit and spice leading the flavors. It is perfectly aged and ready to drink. Editors' Choice. Score - 94. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2019)

title: Dyo Elies 2016
Description: Deep red in colour, on the nose the wine shows a lush character composed of smoky, caramel and vanilla notes emerging over a background of ripe red fruits and chocolate. The palate is full, showing volume, a rich structure and a lip-smacking freshness that creates a lingering, spicy finish.

title: Maxwell Silver Hammer Shiraz 2017
Description: Rich and spicy, with concentrated gingerbread, spiced plum, clove and black pepper accents to the smooth, velvety frame. The finish is epic, showing details of candied violet, clove, Earl Grey tea and sage that go on and on. Drink now through 2033. Score - 92. (MaryAnn Worobiec, winespectator.com, April 30, 2020)

title: BenMarco Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: This wine is bottled unfined and unfiltered.The cold vintage has done wonders with this wine from a vineyard in Los Arboles, 1,200 meters above sea level in the Tunuyán Department. It's planted on rocky riverbed soil - the kind of soil that cabernet clearly likes. This wine has herbal notes, red fruit everywhere you turn, and black fruit, too, as well as that spicy side so typical of the variety. And the tannins are firm and tense, yet docile at the same time. Very elegant and very fresh.  Score - 95. (Patricio Tapia, Descorchados, 2019)

title: Viña Olabarri Crianza 2016
Description: Classic Rioja aromas of mild oak, vanilla and dried berry fruits are slightly earthy as a whole. This crianza is tight due to smacking acidity, but that also creates freshness and overall health. Plum and berry flavors are saucy, while firm tannins and acidity drive the finish. Score - 90. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, July 1, 2019)

title: Domaine Armand Rousseau Clos de la Roche Grand Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Clos de la Roche Grand Cru is an excellent wine in the making, wafting from the glass with a complex bouquet of red berries, orange rind, raw cocoa, rich soil tones and grilled meats that's framed by a discrete application of cedary oak. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied, deep and impressively racy, with lively acids, powdery tannins and a long, resonant finish. Score - 93-95. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Dal Cero Sangiovese IGT Toscana 2016
Description: A luminous, bright ruby red. A pronounced, heady bouquet offers fragrant cherry and raspberry, with a hint of spice. On the palate, it is refined and very well-balanced, while the finish is full-flavoured and ultra-appealing. A fine partner with all types of meat, game, and cheeses.

title: Cimal Garnacha 2016
Description: This pure garnacha shows black cherries, hot stones and lavender. Full body, dense and compact texture, firm tannins and a vibrant and exciting finish. I like the tension here. Needs to soften. Better in 2020. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Aug. 2, 2018)

title: Calamus Estate Winery Meritage 2016
Description: This 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 50% Cabernet Franc hits all the right notes. A gorgeous nose of rich, thick dark fruits, elegant spice, subtle graphite ... just a lovely entry. It has a structured feel on the palate, a bevy of dark and red fruits, firm(ish) tannins, spice and length through the finish. You couldn't ask for anything more from a $20 Meritage red blend in Niagara. Score - 90. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Dec. 14, 2018)

title: Canonica a Cerreto Riserva Chianti Classico 2013
Description: Ample, generous and inviting, the 2013 Chianti Classico Riserva offers notable textural breadth and volume. Succulent dark cherry, plum, new leather, licorice and spice build in a Riserva that impresses for its persistence and overall balance. Drink it over the next 10-15 years. Drinking window: 2018-2028. Score - 92. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 2019)

title: Pierpaolo Pecorari Refosco Friuli 2016
Description: Aromas of blackberries, tobacco, prunes, spices. Full body, soft tannins, dark berries, chocolate & dried fruit like prune & fig notes with a long & pronounced finish. Serve with roast meat, mature cheeses, speck, prosciutto.

title: Château Magondeau Passion 2016
Description: 100% Merlot. Bold and elegant with glossy, high toast oak. Spice and coffee notes are complemented by ripe cherry and blackberry fruit. Classic Fronsac.  Score - 90. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2018)

title: Montes Folly Syrah 2017
Description: This is big and very rich, as always, with spices, chocolate, black olives and dried meat. Full-bodied and layered with beautiful, luscious fruit that carries on through the long, long finish. So drinkable and beautiful. Drink or hold. Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 17, 2020)

title: Brittan Vineyards Cygnus Block Pinot Noir 2016
Description: Sourced from a 2008 planting of the Swan clone, rare in Oregon, the Cygnus once again stands out as the best in a stellar lineup. Layered with plum, brambly berry and streaks of wood and herb, it's a seamless and beautifully balanced wine. The juicy acidity brings lemon and tangerine into the mix, while the tannins add orange tea. Barrel aging for a year (one-third new) polishes the finish with a whiff of toasted almonds. Drink now-2030. Cellar Selection. Score - 96. (Paul Gregutt, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2020)

title: Firriato Santagostino Baglio Sorìa Nero d'Avola/Syrah 2013
Description: Authentic wine from southern Italy, showing aromas of cherries, red plums and orange peel. Medium to full body, velvety tannins and a beautiful and shining finish. A blend of nero d'avola and syrah. Delicious now. Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Oct. 22, 2018)

title: Château Haut-Bages Libéral 2015
Description: This is one of the three biodynamic estates that are owned by Gonzague and Claire Lurton. The wine is generous while also firmly structured in the style of this property. A dense, dry core surrounded by blackberry and black-currant fruit promises great things. It finishes clean, clear and crisp. Drink from 2024. Editors' Choice. Score - 94. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Feb. 1, 2018)

title: Castello d'Alba Vinhas Velhas 2015
Description: 75% Touriga Nacional, 10% Touriga Roriz, 15% Touriga Franca. A lifted nose with aromas of wood-smoke, violet, fig and dark fruits. The juicy palate displays lovely varietal character with berries and oak notes that will unravel over time.  Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2018)

title: Minimus Pinot Noir Johan Vineyard 2016
Description: The Johan Vineyard pinot is scented of black cherries, dark chocolate and sautéed herbs with suggestions of mossy logs and black earth. Light to medium-bodied with a firm, chewy frame of stem-inspired tannins and just enough freshness, it finishes long and pleasantly edgy.

title: Domaines André Aubert Visan Côtes du Rhône-Villages 2016
Description: Mostly Grenache, with about 25' Syrah that brings a peppery complexity to the final wine. Though this will continue to evolve for another 3+ years, it's a wine that is crafted to be enjoyed immediately. It offers great value, and its well-defined dark fruit, mineral and peppery spice will delight. A good option for midweek burgers that would also fare well with ribs or grilled lamb.

title: Argento Reserva Cabernet Franc 2015
Description: This may not have a lot of cabernet franc character but is a nice glass of fullish-bodied, ripe (but not overripe) red wine with moderately-dry tannins. Drink or hold. Score - 90. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2018)

title: Casale del Bosco Brunello di Montalcino 2014
Description: Classically fashioned and available at a great price, this wine delivers a wealth of lush dark fruit, plum, aromatic cherry, spice, chocolate and smoke. Bold and structured, it will be excellent with roast meats or Parmigiano Reggiano. (Vintages panel, Feb. 2019)

title: Casa Ermelinda Trincadeira Reserva 2016
Description: A concentrated wine, in ruby and garnet tones. An aroma reminiscent of very ripe dark fruit preserves, with some spice and the touch of balsamic that is emblematic of this grape variety. Velvety and full on the palate, with very well integrated tannins and good acidity. A long, pleasant and persistent finish.

title: Doudet Naudin Vin de France Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Dark ruby colour. The nose is aromatic, with scents of black and red berries mixed with flower aromas. This wine is rich, long and complex, and displays fruity flavours (cherries, blackberries, blackcurrants). The Pinot Noir Vin de France of Doudet-Naudin is a wine full of delicacy. Fresh and fruity, it is very pleasant, all in harmony. Doudet Naudin, Burgundy fine wines producer since 1849, makes the best use of its knowhow to produce this great wine.

title: Fratelli Broccardo Barolo Bricco San Pietro 2015
Description: Presents notes of cherry, violet, cloves and licorice. Full, harmonious, warm taste with a slightly spicy aftertaste. Recommended with well-seasoned cheeses, duck, tasty meats and dishes with truffles.

title: Luciano Arduini Fontana del Fongo Valpolicella Classico 2018
Description: (Translated from the Italian) Corvina 50%, Corvinone 30%, Rondinella 20%. Thick, enthralling, not completely transparent to the eye due to its great extracted concentration. Another excellent note comes from its mellow taste, with thick tannin supported by proper sour note, which never interferes with its expressive palate mellowness. A great wine with a full harmony, whose spicy aroma brings out turgid and clean enological execution.  Score - 95. (lucamaroni.com, May 21, 2019)

title: Hazaña Viñas Viejas 2014
Description: The 2014 Hazana Vinas Viejas is simply one of the greatest values in Rioja that money can buy. A blend of 85% Tempranillo and 15% Graciano, this collaboration between importer Eric Solomon and the owner and winemaker has produced an absolutely amazing Rioja from 45- to 70-year-old unirrigated, head-pruned vines. Loads of lead pencil shavings, black and red currants, licorice and tobacco leaf all jump from the glass of this dense, ruby/purple wine. Soft tannins, medium to full body and fabulous intensity make for a sensational Rioja to drink over the next 5-7 years. Drink Date: 2015-2022.  Score - 92. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, July 30, 2015)

title: Tamaral Roble Ribera del Duero 2018
Description: Plenty of toasty oak on offer here with ripe raspberries and boysenberries, as well as a spicy thread that leads into the palate. An attractive, bright Ribera here that's ready to enjoy.

title: Manz Contador de Estorias Reserva 2016
Description: Full bodied wine with good acidity, well structured tannins and elegant. Long and lingering finish.

title: Manz Contador de Estorias 2017
Description: Full bodied wine with good acidity, well structured tannins and elegant. Long and lingering finish.

title: Château Canon 2005
Description: Tasted at the Château Canon vertical, the 2005 Canon is evolving into a quite gorgeous Saint Emilion. One can still discern those brown spices infiltrating the ripe red and black fruit. There is fine mineralité here, great focus, perhaps just a hint of dried blood that develops with time. The palate is medium-bodied with supple, ripe tannin. It is a very complex Saint Emilion with immense purity and style, a wine that you have to keep coming back to in order to understand. It's at that pivotal stage between primary and secondary notes, the red and black fruit being overtaken by cedar, morels and a touch of game. It gently lifts and fans out to a quite captivating finish. Dare I say that the 2005 Canon is the pick of the three over 2009 and 2010? There...I've said it...it is a quite brilliant wine. Tasted October 2015. Drink date: 2018-2040. Score - 95. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com, March 31, 2017)

title: Ségla 2012
Description: The 2012 Ségla, the second wine of Rauzan-Ségla, is soft, fruity, dense ruby/purple, with some nice plum, blackcurrant and cherry fruit and well as hints of earth, licorice and spice. A strong effort for a second wine, this round and generous 2012 should drink well for 12-15 years. Drink date: 2015-2030. Score - 89. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, April 29, 2015)

title: Château Canon 2009
Description: Medium to deep garnet colored, the 2009 Canon is a little reticent to begin, opening out to notions of rare beef, cast iron pan, cigar boxes and cloves with a core of baked plums and mulberries plus a waft of dried lavender. Full, richly fruited and sill quite youthful, the palate has a firm yet velvety texture and seamless freshness supporting the generous fruit, finishing long and mineral laced. Drink date: 2021-2050. Score - 97+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 14, 2019)

title: La Franc Touch 2017
Description: This 100% Cabernet Franc comes from 10-15 year old vines planted in calcareous limestone soil on south facing slopes. On the nose, a mixture of fresh red fruit, mint and peppery hints. The wine expresses the brightness of a ripe yet fresh Carbenet Franc from Bordeaux. On the palate, the acidity gives length and balance to the sweetness and the roundness of the fruit.

title: Wirtemberg Lemberger Trocken 2016
Description: This distinctive full-bodied ruby red wine has harmoniously integrated tannins. In the nose, it presents specific Lemberger characters with unique aromas of black current berries and green peppers. Wonderfully pairs with roasted beef, lamb, wild game, B.B.Q. meats and hard cheeses.

title: Magic Mountain Red 2013
Description: Intense ruby red in colour with clear typical aromas of red forest fruits, blueberry, gooseberry, wild fig and black cherry. Munificent, velvet and impressive body. Balanced acidity accompanied with smooth, rich tannins. Relevant intense aromas in the mouth. Elegant, complex and long aftertaste with a dynamic character.

title: Kokkinos Naoussa Xinomavro 2015
Description: Crimson in colour with aromas of pepper, leather, herbs, green pepper, and black berries. Dense and rich mouthful with imperious but not aggressive tannins. The long lasting aftertaste is that of red fruit jam and wood tones, with a slightly bitter feeling. Pair with red meats and game.

title: Askitikos Red 2016
Description: Well ripened grapes are vinified under controlled conditions following an aging process in French and American oak barriques for 12 months. It pairs well with red meat, charcuterie and spicy cheese dishes.

title: Roda Reserva 2014
Description: (malo in large French oak barrels; aged for 14 months in French oak barriques, 40% of them new) Youthful violet color. A highly perfumed bouquet evokes oak-spiced dark berries, cola, vanilla and incense, along with a smoky mineral topnote. Sappy, plush and seamless in the mouth, offering concentrated blackberry, boysenberry, mocha and spicecake flavors that spread out steadily on the back half. The impressively long, spice-tinged finish displays pliant tannins, excellent clarity and a suave touch of candied flowers. Drink date: 2022-2032.  Score - 93. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, Feb. 2019)

title: Hacker Sangiovesse Toscana IGT 2017
Description: Cosmopolitan and sporty, I am liked for my structure and freshness as well as my bouquet which recalls notes of sweet violet and small red fruits.

title: Clos Pegase Hommage Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: Aromas of plums, berries and tile follow through to a medium to full body, savory character and a long and flavorful finish. Extremely well done. Balanced. Drink in 2020. Score - 94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, May 5, 2017)

title: Nerd Nero d'Avola Terre Sicilia DOC 2017
Description: My soft appearance reveals a strong and decisive character. I am liked for this precise identity and personality. My bouquet recalls floral notes and hints of spices like aniseed and cinnamon.

title: Mauro Molino Barolo La Serra 2015
Description: 93 points James Suckling 'Aromas of ripe fruit, cream and praline follow through to a medium to full body, firm and silky tannins and a gorgeous finish.'

title: Mauro Molino Barolo Bricco Luciani 2015
Description: 94 points James Suckling 'Aromas of dark berries, licorice and rose petals. Full-bodied, firm and very chewy with silky and intense tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Great intensity, structure and polish.'

title: Righetti Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2015
Description: Deep ruby with heavy tearing; complex nose with dried black cherries, and prunes joined by beefy and earth aromas all supported by sweet sandalwood; dry and full bodied with high levels of alcohol balanced by a concentrated yet elegant palate that replays the dried fruit and oak notes of the nose; long finish.

title: Righetti Capitel de Roari Amarone 2015
Description: Deep ruby with heavy tearing; complex nose with dried black cherries, and prunes joined by beefy and earth aromas all supported by sweet sandalwood; dry and full bodied with high levels of alcohol balanced by a concentrated yet elegant palate that replays the dried fruit and oak notes of the nose; long finish.

title: Clos Dalian Crianza 2016
Description: Light cherry colour. It has an aroma of red fruits with a gentle touch of toast and mineral notes, which are so characteristic of our Garnacha. In the mouth it is meaty, balanced and well rounded.

title: Juillot Mercurey 1er cru Combins 2016
Description: This vineyard is between 35 and 45 years of age and is a massal selection (different clones all planted together). The wine is finished for 12 months in 25% new barrels. It has all the passion and the power of this great terroir. Blackberry and blueberry, opulence and volume, with incredibly soft tannins.

title: Leclerc Gevrey Chambertin Patieres 2015
Description: Fresh, ripe cherries and red currants. Rich and well-structured on the palate, with hints of vanilla and spice. Good length.

title: August Kesseler The Daily Pinot Noir 2016
Description: The Daily August Pinot Noir has a subtle scent of black cherry and blueberry, paired with the delicious aromas of cassis and red pepper. This wine will definitely become part of your daily routine!

title: Largeot Beaune 1er cru les Beaumont 2016
Description: Shows aromas that include small red fruits, vanilla and some floral accents (rose and jasmine). Good density on the palate, with present but silky tannins that will assure an elegant evolution.

title: Juillot Mercurey Chateau Mipont 2017
Description: Half way between a Mercurey Vieilles Vignes and a red Premier cru, the complexity and the finesse of the wines produced in this terroir will no doubt see them recognized as a new Premier cru when the Mercurey classifications are reviewed. This wine is made from vines planted in 1963. Pale ruby, it shows bright red fruit with some hints of baking spice. The palate is medium with crunchy acidity and light tannins.

title: Gevrey Chambertin 1er Cru les Cherbaudes 2014
Description: The approach here is manual harvesting, sorting at the cuvérie, 4 to 5 days of cool but not cold soaking, natural yeasts and a relatively long 3 week fermentation. Typically, the new wine is settled for 24 hours and transferred to cask, of which 30 to 50% is new. After 12 to 15 months of élevage with no racking, the wines are racked, assembled and bottled without fining or filtration. Cherbaudes is nestled between Mazis-Chambertin and Clos de Beze, so not too shabby there. The wine is just gorgeous.

title: Luigi Bosca D.O.C. Malbec 2016
Description: A complex malbec that shows violets, blueberries, strawberries, chocolate and hazelnuts. Hints of licorice too. Medium to full body, firm and well-integrated tannins and a deep and precise finish. Drink now or hold. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2018)

title: Perrin C Ladoix Les Briquottes 2016
Description: Beautiful garnet colour with purple reflections. On the nose, the bouquet opens with red fruits (raspberry, strawberry, blackcurrant) and jam. The palate is soft, fruity and elegant, with silky tannins and a round texture. This wine is certified organic.

title: Perrin C Aloxe Corton Les Boutieres 2016
Description: Dark ruby in colour. Aromas of little red fruit (cherry, raspberry) when young, after a few years it develops aromas of prune, pistachio nuts and truffle. A very rich wine that will benefit from mid-term aging (at least 6 years). This wine is certified organic.

title: Domaine du Crêt de Bine Cuvée de François 2017
Description: Wonderfully round and delicious Beaujolais made from 100% Gamay. Lots of fruit and minerality drive the palate, with fresh acidity bolstering the structure. Drinking great now and will last years. Good on it's own and better with food. Certified Organic & Biodynamic.
By:: Scea Subrin Et Associes - Domaine D

title: Fox Creek Red Baron Shiraz 2017
Description: McLaren Vale is best known for its Shiraz with its premium quality and generous fruit style. The Red Baron Shiraz showcases a rich front palate of plums and red cherries, which lead to a strawberry and cream mid palate. Fruit is complemented by hints of roasted nuts and dark chocolate and fresh, vibrant and youthful tannins that complete the experience with an injection of textural and structural oak on the finish.

title: Cantina del Pino Langhe Nebbiolo 2017
Description: The Langhe Nebbiolo is made predominantly from a parcel in Ovello that yields slightly bigger and juicier grapes, plus the second selection of fruit from the estate's other vineyards. It sees a shorter period of contact with the skins and is made in a style that emphasizes fruit.

title: Cantina del Pino Barbaresco Albesan 2014
Description: 94 points Wine Advocate 'Cantina del Pino chooses to release its Barbarescos one year later than its peers. The 2014 Barbaresco Albesani is distinguished by a very fine and tightly knit texture that bodes very well for its future aging potential. The wine promises to reward more intensity and elegance as it moves forward in time. But even now, at this young stage in its life, this is an elegant and approachable expression of Nebbiolo.'

title: Puente Austral Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: This generous cabernet sauvignon has very attractive aromas of redcurrants and blackcurrants with hints of plums and smoke. Very satisfying balance of ripe tannins and full body, the finish long and quite velvety. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2019)

title: Bera Barolo DOCG 2015
Description: An elegant, austere, noble wine, obtained from Nebbiolo grapes cultivated in the town of Castiglione Falletto. This Barolo displays a garnet red colour and is ethereal and spicy, very persistent, with light notes of vanilla, cocoa, coffee, licorice and hints of truffle. A full-bodied well-balanced wine with a long finish.

title: Monferrato Dolcetto Sponde DOC 2018
Description: Made with 100% Dolcetto grapes, this wine is garnet in colour with aromas of red fruits. Lightly tannic and moderately acidic, rounded and balanced on the palate. Pairs nicely with entrees, white meats and medium-ripe cheeses.

title: Chateau Lazaridi Red 2016
Description: A charming blend of deep red color which combines Merlot's sweet fruity aromas with the density of Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese's finesse. With a pleasant nose of red berries and aromas of mocha and violet which is a feature of Drama's biodiversity. Well-structured wine with elegant and delicious tannins and a long aftertaste of sugared fruits and mint. This fruity and spicy blend is the result of twelve months aging in oak barrels. Perfect Pairing: With grilled meats, red meats and game cooked with intricate sauces.

title: Maison Louis Jadot Clos de la Barre Monopole Volnay 1er Cru 2018
Description: Another success is the 2018 Volnay 1er Cru Clos de la Barre Monopole (Maison Louis Jadot), offering up aromas of cassis, red plums, baking chocolate and earthy forest floor. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, with good concentration, lively acids and chalky tannins. Score - 90-92+. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Puelles Reserva 2009
Description: The 2009 Reserva felt riper and headier than the image I had of the 2008. It had a savory and developed profile, with an orange border and tertiary aromas. The palate revealed some rustic tannins and an earthy touch, a dry, somehow austere finish. They produced 10,000 bottles, which were filled in the summer of 2011, so the wine has had enough time in bottle to be ready by now. Drink Date: 2018-2022.  Score - 90. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Feb. 28, 2018)

title: Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari Nozzole Chianti Classico Riserva 2015
Description: This ripe Chianti Classico shows aromas of strawberries, cherries and red plums. Hints of earth, too. Full body, juicy tannins and a medium-deep finish. Delicious now, but it will be better in 2020. Score - 94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Jan. 22, 2019)

title: Domaine Chevrot Maranges 1er Cru 2017
Description: Loaded on the nose with blackcurrant buds and preserved red fruit, this wine is well balanced with an elegant spice.

title: Domaine Chevrot Haute Cotes de Beaune 2017
Description: Notes of bright Morello cherry and strawberry on the nose, developing to darker fruit such as blackcurrant, liquorice and with a touch of spice on the finish.

title: Zanatta Cannonau di Sardegna Riserva 2015
Description: Bright lemon yellow with green reflections. Jasmine and wild flowers. Rich with lemon zest and golden apple with a smooth finish.

title: Mettler Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Inviting aromas of dark cherry, cola, cedar, mineral and earth followed by a graceful mingling of cherry, cranberry and sweet oak flavours with a whisper of vanilla. On the palate, the rich mouthfeel is moderated by juicy acidity, and the long finish is reminiscent of a fine Bordeaux. This elegant and poised Cabernet is accessible now, and its structure and complexity will see it through many years of aging.

title: Gabriëlskloof The Landscape Series Cabernet Franc 2017
Description: Now into its third vintage, Gabriëlskloof's Cabernet Franc has established itself as one of the best examples of the grape in the country. Refreshing and perfumed, it's Loire-like in terms of weight and structure, with herbal, black cherry and cut grass intensity and medium weight tannins. Drink date: 2020-2027. Score - 94. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, South Africa Special Report 2019)

title: Luce Lux Vitis 2017
Description: Wow. This is really well crafted with rich fruit and polished tannins. It's full and layered with ripe fruit and lots of chocolate, berry, walnut and currant flavors. Excellent finish. Triumph for the vintage. Drink after 2022. Score - 97. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, June 22, 2020)

title: Inglenook Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: The base cuvée is the 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon, which is 82% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Cabernet Franc, 6% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot, and 1% Malbec sourced all from Rutherford. It has a classic, Saint Julien-like bouquet of crème de cassis, tobacco lead, damp earth, and spice that gives way to a full-bodied, concentrated, textured Cabernet that hits all the right marks. The top Rubicon release has a touch more elegant and precision, but this isn't far off. Drink this stunner any time over the coming 20 years or more. Maturity: 2020-2040. Score - 94. (jebdunnuck.com, Jan. 31, 2020)

title: Rippon Mature Vine Pinot Noir 2016
Description: This is such profoundly complex pinot with violets, dark cherries, plums, blueberries, graphite, black tea, peppery nuances, licorice and woody spices, all taking a role on the nose. The palate has such density and precision, delivering a powerfully composed and profoundly concentrated core of blueberry and dark-cherry flavor in a layered and refined style. Such impressive depth and character. From biodynamically grown grapes. Drink or hold. Score - 97. (jamessuckling.com, Oct. 16, 2019)

title: Grosset Nereus 2015
Description: Made from estate-grown shiraz with a small amount of nero d'Avola, it has a bright crimson-purple hue, the fragrance a mix of exotic spices and perfumes, the palate a juicy mix of red and darker fruits, the tannins positive, the finish long and balanced. Drink by: 2030. Special Value. Score - 96. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, July 1, 2018)

title: Massetino 2018
Description: Massetino was first produced in 2017, the same year that Masseto unveiled their amazing new winery. Unlike the 100% Merlot flagship wine, Massetino includes some Cabernet Franc. Expect a powerful, polished red, with notes of black cherry, spice, tobacco and mineral. The inaugural 2017 vintage received a score of 95+ from Monica Larner in robertparker.com on May 21, 2020.

title: Thorn-Clarke Shotfire Quartage 2016
Description: A blend of cabernet sauvignon, cabernet franc, petit verdot and merlot. Elegant red wine with dark berry, cherry and spicy oak flavours. A fine-boned wine with good underlying power. It offers value at this price. Drink date: 2018 to 2023. Score - 91. (Bob Campbell, MW, therealreview.com, Dec. 9, 2018)

title: Barahonda Barrica Monastrell/Syrah 2016
Description: An attractive, smooth and rich red with plenty of spice-dusted dark berries, as well as a swathe of fine, juicy tannins. Plums and blueberries abound. From organically grown grapes. Drink through the next 5 years. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Aug. 2, 2018)

title: Colgin IX Estate Red 2014
Description: From their steep hillside vineyards on Pritchard Hill, the 2014 Proprietary Red IX Estate is an old-fashioned Médoc blend dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, but with some Cabernet Franc (rarely seen in the Médoc these years) as well as Merlot and Petit Verdot. Striking aromatics of violets, forest floor, loamy soil nuances, blueberry, black raspberry and blackberry soar from the glass of this spectacular 2014. The acidity seems reasonable but on the lower side, the texture is magnificent, and the overall purity and equilibrium flawless. This is a wine pushing, even demanding, a three-digit score once again, but I'm holding back - at least for now. This magnificent effort from Colgin should drink beautifully for 25-30 years. Drink date: 2016-2046. Score - 98+. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Oct. 28, 2016)

title: Colgin IX Estate Red 2012
Description: The 2012 IX Proprietary Red Estate, which comes from their gorgeous hillside vineyards overlooking Lake Hennessey high on Pritchard Hill, is a blend of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Franc and 8% Petit Verdot. Absolutely spectacular aromatics of spring flowers, blueberry, blackberry and blackcurrant fruit intermixed with creosote, graphite and floral notes are followed by a wine of great depth, elegance, richness and purity. Simply loaded, but with pristine harmony and equilibrium, this is a sensational tour de force and a great tribute to this spectacular hillside site on Pritchard Hill. Drink it over the next 25-35 years. Drink date: 2015-2050. Score - 99. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Oct. 29, 2015)

title: Colgin IX Estate Syrah 2014
Description: Incredible aromas of grilled meat, blackberries, rose petals and black velvet. Medium to full body and ultra-velvety tannins - even if this doesn't show at first. It lags for five or six seconds and then grows and grows. Linear structure.  Score - 97. (jamessuckling.com, May 5, 2017)

title: Quinta da Soalheira Old Vines
Description: Dense ruby in colour, this wine displays very intense and fresh aromas with notes of black and red fruits, such as plum and strawberry, enveloped by nuances of eucalyptus. A wine highlighted in the mouth by an excellent balance between its full-bodied structure, velvety tannins and acidity, for a unique elegance and a long and very persistent finish.

title: Prova Cega 2017
Description: This wine blends 50% Touriga Nacional with equal parts Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo). It's silky and ripe with good intensity of dark cherry, licorice and sweet spices, and an elegantly structured finish. An outstanding value, and a good choice for meaty fare. (Vintages panel, April 2019)

title: Poderi Elia Barbaresco DOCG Serracapelli 2012
Description: Stunningly elegant Barbaresco. Bouquet offers tones of red currant and Morello cherry over a layer of toasty oak; the structure is marble-solid, with fine grained tannins. Long exotic fruity aftertaste. Silver medal International Wine Challenge 2016. Commended by Decanter 2016. Silver medal International Wine Challenge 2016. Commended by Decanter 2016.

title: Xavier Vignon Cuvée Anonyme Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2015
Description: Xavier Vignon is one of the Rhône's leading winemaking consultants, and so it's no surprise he had access to some great fruit for his 2015 Chateauneuf du Pape Cuvee Anonyme. Tellingly, the blend entirely omits Syrah, containing 60% Grenache, 25% Mourvèdre, 8% Counoise, 4% Vaccarèse and 3% Muscardin. Floral notes and ripe cherries appear along [with] licorice and vanilla (one-fourth of the wine was matured in new barriques), yet this is no drink-now version of CdP. This full-bodied wine boasts broad shoulders, a plush, creamy center and a muscular finish loaded with ripe tannins and spice. Give it a few years to mellow, and drink it over the next 15. Drink date: 2020-2035. Score - 94. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2017)

title: Bibbiano Chianti Classico Gran Selezione Vigna del Capannino 2011
Description: 90 points Wine Advocate 'The 2011 Chianti Classico Gran Selezione Vigna del Capannino is a single vineyard expression that opens to brooding dark fruit and a great level of aromatic intensity. This is a luscious and generous Sangiovese-based red with dark fruit flavors followed by pretty layers of spice and tobacco.'

title: Portao de Cima Red
Description: Red in colour, this wine is young, intense and elegant with notes of red fruit. On the palate, good volume, balanced tannins and a lingering finish.

title: Saint Mont Les Vieilles Vignes 2014
Description: One year in barrel and some bottle aging has given this generous wine structure and density. Old vines are not uncommon here and this one is a blend of Tannat, Cabernet Sauvignon and Pinenc. Spice, ripe tannins and full-throttle black fruits are joined by a mineral texture and acidity, making for a rich wine with further aging potential. Drink from 2019. Score - 91. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Nov. 1, 2018)

title: Calmel & Joseph Saint Chinian 2015
Description: It is brightly expressed on the nose showing dark plum, mulberry, floral, thyme and roasted beet characters. The palate is succulent and beautifully fruited, offering plump mouthfeel and fine tannins, leading to a lingering silky finish. A lovely fruit-expressive wine showing immediate appeal. At its best: now to 2019.  Score - 91. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, Feb. 2018)

title: Caparzo Rosso di Montalcino 2016
Description: Bright and fresh, boasting cherry, raspberry, earth and iron flavors. Balanced, with a burst of energy on the finish. Drink now.  Score - 90. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Oct. 31, 2018)
By:: Borgo Scopeto E Caparzo S.R.L. Soc.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy Beaune 2017
Description: The Nuiton-Beaunoy wine-growing cooperative has been crafting fine Burgundian wines since 1957. This one has good weight and presence on the palate, with red cherry, earth and smoke tones. It's fresh, balanced and beautifully put together. A good option for grilled pork dishes. (Vintages panel, April 2019)
By:: Union Des Vignerons Associes Des Mo

title: Les Darons 2017
Description: The 2017 Languedoc Les Darons is made from 75% Grenache, 20% Syrah, and 5% Carignan that's mostly from older vines in the Minervois. It saw a touch of whole clusters in the fermenters and is still aging all in concrete tanks. It's deep purple (almost inky) and offers a sensational perfume of blueberries, blackberries, licorice, ground pepper, and earth. Deep, full-bodied, beautifully concentrated, and long, it shows the purity and sexiness of the 2017 vintage and is going to be a killer value. Score - 91-93. (Jeb Dunnuck, jebdunnuck.com, June 15, 2018)

title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2016
Description: The 2016 La Mission Haut Brion is a blend of 57.5% Merlot and 42.5% Cabernet Sauvignon picked between 19 September and 14 October, one of the longest ever. 'We had to be patient and wait for each plot,' Jean-Philippe Delmas told me. 'It took longer than usual.' As is customary, I allowed my sample, and likewise all the wines poured at this tasting, around 40-45 minutes to open since they always transform in the glass. It has a clean and precise, quite understated bouquet with fine mineralité, cold stone aromas infusing the black fruit. This has incredible precision, perhaps even more pixelated than the 'gaff over the road' Haut-Brion. The palate is medium-bodied with supple and lithe tannin. I appreciate the line of acidity here, the smoothness and harmony that takes your breath away. Every atom is infused with life-affirming freshness. It is a wine bridled with incredible focus and delineation. I thought that the 2015 La Mission Haut-Brion flirted with perfection. The 2016 has that extra edge, a 'je ne sais quoi' that leaves you reaching for the thesaurus looking for superlatives. Drink Date: 2026-2070. Score - 98-100. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com)

title: Trapiche Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard Malbec 2015
Description: A tight and powerful red with lots of blueberries, burnt orange peel and violets. Multifaceted. Full body, long, polished tannins and a fresh and vivid finish. Drink or hold. Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, March 27, 2019)

title: Clonakilla O'Riada Shiraz 2017
Description: Spice, red flowers, pepper and wood smoke all appear and promptly disappear on the bouquet, reforming in a different order next time around, the ensuing palate a pond without a single ruffle. Red cherry infuses all one's senses with a constant framework of spice. The faultless balance will still be sustaining the wine 30 years hence. What value! Drink by: 2048. Special Value.  Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2019)

title: Antinori Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione Chianti Classico 2016
Description: This is a wonderful pure sangiovese with wet earth, mushrooms, pine and cedar with black cherries. Full body. Dense and layered with ripe tannins, yet there's vivid and energetic acidity. It drives to the end and pulls you in. Top stuff. Drink or hold. Score - 96. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Il Botolo Barbera D'Asti DOCG 2016
Description: Juicy cherry notes and a touch of mint lead the way in this captivating Barbera. Smooth, full-bodied and well-balanced, it is an ideal pairing for robust foods, from blue cheese to root vegetable dishes to rich meats.

title: Esk Valley Pinot Noir 2017
Description: This is a dark-fruited and complex style of Marlborough Pinot Noir. It is a robust wine with complex aromatics of plums and herbs with a subtle oak influence.

title: Palon Cotes du Rhone Rouge 2017
Description: This is an excellent Côtes-du-Rhone from a great year comprised of 69% Grenache, 16% Syrah and 15% Cinsault. It is a dark and lustrous ruby red with hints of violet. The nose is of pronounced aromas of ripe cherries, plums, black currants, garrigue (the fragrant underbrush of Southern France), smoke, new leather, cassis and a hint of pepper. In the mouth it is very big, round and satisfying with delicate tannins and good length. Served slightly chilled (16°-17°C), it will go splendidly with roasts, grilled meats and medium cheeses. It will keep nicely for three to five years.

title: Inurrieta Sensaciones 2017
Description: Cherry and redcurrant notes flow from the glass, combined with fine spices and a very subtle graphite note. The 3 month barrique maturation gives this wine perfect harmony and elegance.

title: Fishbone Shiraz 2016
Description: '100% Geographe, 4% grenache in the blend. Positioned in the inexpensive, everydaydrinking. category and it sits there quite comfortably. Ripe red fruit with a bit of spice and oak provide the flavours for a soft easy-going style. Steven Creber - James Halliday Wine Companion 2020 - Bronze 87 Points

title: Poderi Elia Barbera d'Alba Superiore DOC 2015
Description: Intense ruby red in colour with freshly pressed cranberries on the nose accentuated by pomegranate and fresh flowers. On the palate, discreet tannins, balanced, and decidedly fruity. This Barbera gets the appellation 'Superiore' because it ages 18 months in oak barrels, then finishes aging in the bottle.

title: L'Oustal Blanc Naick Rouge 2014
Description: Made from 70% cinsault & 30% carignan, this is a big, ripe red from the Languedoc in Southern France. Lots of dark fruits, plums, and prunes. There is some nice minerality on the palate, with good length and warm finish.

title: Grey Elk Shiraz 2014
Description: Red plum to the core with dark berry fruit with a hint of oak vanilla and spice. Dry medium bodied Shiraz, good intensity of dark berry fruit with attractive spice through to a long lasting clean finish. Drink now and in 7 to 10 years with good cellaring.

title: Altos de Inurrieta 2015
Description: Born in our vineyards located on slopes and at an altitude of 450 - 480 m, with shallow and stony soils. In these conditions the concentration of the grape is sensational, with great balance and expression. The careful elaboration gives a wine of superb colour, intense and aromatic, where initially its fragrant fruit content stands out, the memory of its aging in quality oak and some seductive mineral notes. The palate is elegant and fleshy, with enveloping and silky tannins.

title: Fishbone Premium Black Label Shiraz 2017
Description: Black plum to the core with a thin rim. On the nose, this complex wine showcases dark berry fruits, chocolate and sweet spices, white pepper and tobacco. Bone dry, full bodied Shiraz characters of the nose flow through to the palate. Layers of fruit backed by natural acid and tannin will provide the wine with great longevity.

title: Poggio Salvi Morellino Di Scansano DOC 2016
Description: The vintage Morellino is a pleasant, light-hearted wine, boasting exuberant freshness, to drink straight away, especially if accompanied to the cuisine from Maremma, consisting of decisive tastes of game, wild boar, pheasant, hare, delicious tortelli and tagliatelle with wild boar meat sauce. It is a wine to drink right away, but it can age well for at least 3/4 years.
By:: Poggio Salvi Di Bicchi Laura S

title: Castelforte Amarone della Valpolicella 2015
Description: This Amarone will deliver a juicy, full-bodied experience, with big blue and black fruit, baking spice, anise, cinnamon and a long, spicy finish. Pair this great value with veal or roasted meats.[Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 98. (Luca Maroni, lucamaroni.com, Sept. 27, 2019)

title: Chateau Chizay Merlot Kosher 2018
Description: Complex fruity aromas. Full bodied, velvety, off-dry, with a light tannic astringency and spicy notes. Its smooth finish is ideal with pasta and chicken dishes.

title: Quinta dos Mattos Grande Reserva 2016
Description: Deep ruby red with violet tints. Intense black fruits with some notes of the new wood and spices. Concentrated, balanced and fresh; complimented by soft ripe tannins and a long finish.

title: Winzerkeller Andau Sankt Laurent 2017
Description: Our Saint Laurent shows deep purple with purple edge. It flatters the nose with smoky aromas of dark berries and black cherries. On the palate, the wine is very elegant with deep berry fruit supported by fine tannins. The wine is carried by a Saint Laurent typical, fine acidity and ends in a long and harmonious finish.

title: Winzerkeller Andau Zweigelt 2017
Description: Deep red characterizes our Zweigelt. On the nose our wine shows spicy fruit aromas of red berries and cherries. On the palate, our classic flatters with deep fruit paired with smoky notes. The wine is carried by a fine acidity and ends in a long finish.

title: Famille Perrin Les Hauts de Julien Vieilles Vignes Vinsobres 2017
Description: Like the les Cornuds bottling, the 2017 Vinsobres Les Hauts de Julien is a 50-50 blend of Grenache and Syrah. It's co-fermented, then divided into foudre and barrels for aging (half in each). With its toasted coconut and cocoa aromas, it comes across as a bit exotic, but it adds plenty of mixed berry fruit and hints of dried spices. There are only 5,000 bottles of this full-bodied, richly textured wine for the world, so fans will have to move fast to secure some once it's released. Drink date: 2020-2030. Score - 94-96. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2018)

title: Barbera d'Asto DOCG Superiore Blinc 2016
Description: A deep garnet hued Barbera with vibrant aromas of black cherries and prunes with chocolate and toasty oak undertones and a touch of mint. The palate shows redcurrant and black cherry fruit with a spicy kick, taut acidity and fine oak tannins.

title: Cabeca Gaio Red Reserve Douro DOC 2016
Description: Red ruby wine with great colour intensity. Notes of red fruits with intense aroma, well balanced with spicy hints. The palate is structured, with smooth but firm tannins, and a long and persisitent finish. Serve between 16 to 18°C.

title: Roberto Voerzio Riserva 10 anni Fossati Case Nere Barolo 2010
Description: The strawberry, light cherry, hazelnut and dust character are thought-provoking in this wine. It's full-bodied, chewy and polished with a line of tannins that provide a beautiful frame for this wine. Just starting to be agreeable and positive. Drink or hold. Score - 97. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 4, 2020)

title: Larry Cherub Middle of Everything 2016
Description: This beautiful wine has aromas of red earth, ground black spice and dark berries. The even more complex and stunning palate presents fine, silky tannins, juicy fruit flavours of blueberry and dark cherry with undertones of spice. To truly bring out the beauty, complexity, and delicacy of this wine, pair it with slow cooked meats or with an assortment of hard cheeses.

title: Alain Corcia Vosne Romanee 2011
Description: On the palate the wine is velvety and distinguished. The wine may seem a little austere in its youth; it needs time in the bottle to develop structure and fleshy texture. Full-bodied and voluptuous.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Château des Capitans Juliénas 2017
Description: This is a muscular red with sweet-berry character. Structured and powerful at the same time. Medium-to full-bodied, polished and driven. Impressive at the end. Excellent. Better than from barrel. Try after 2020. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 18, 2019)

title: Viñalba Gran Reserva Malbec 2015
Description: 100% Malbec. Saturated dark black-purple in colour, with arrestingly floral aromas, alluring plum, damson and sloe fruits and a grind of pink peppercorn, too: so splendid in its youthful appeal that it seems a shame to wait any longer, though the depth of the wine suggests that it would take ageing in its stride. On the palate, the wine is dark, concentrated and once again head-turningly floral and fresh, without any evident 'heat' or overripeness. Brilliant Malbec from a great site. Drink date: 2018-2023.  Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2018)

title: Arrepiado Amma Reserva Red 2015
Description: A wine that boasts big fruit, big tannins, power everywhere. The style is concentrated but balanced, with raisin and dark plums along with the wood and the dark tannins. Stunning packaging.

title: Colle Uncinano Sangiovese 2016
Description: Colour of black essence elegantly shading into purple. Aromas of ripe cherry with herbaceous notes that give it freshness. On the palate silky tannins due to maturation on fine wine lees that give notes of final sweetness. Serve with grilled pork, cheese, pasta with red sauce and parmesan cheese.

title: Arrepiado Brett Edition Alentejo 2016
Description: Big beefy Syrah from the South of Portugal. Expect lots of meat, pepper, cigar box, and leather in this unctuous tinto. Best with big protein and will only get better after a few years in the cellar.

title: Arrepiado Tradicao Red Alentejo 2016
Description: Dark, concentrated red from the South of Portugal. Lots of black fruits, with a touch of florality. Medium tannins give it good structure, and the crispness means this will go well with food. Enjoy now or lay down for further developments. Stunning packaging.

title: Le Ginestre Barbera d'Alba DOC 2016
Description: 90 points James Suckling 'A rich and fruity Barbera with lots of ripeness and juicy fruit. Full body, a round texture and a flavorful finish. Drink now'.

title: Graf Neipperg Lemberger VDP Gutswein Dry 2016
Description: Clear, very polished nose with notes of berries, cherries, herbs, delicate pepper and nuts.

title: Le Ginestre Dolcetto d'Alba DOC 2017
Description: 89 points James Suckling 'Bright blueberries, citrus and elderberry reduction. Light to medium body, fine tannins and a fruity finish.'

title: Zinfandel Amador Z Massoni Ranch 2016
Description: 82% Zinfandel, 18% Petite Syrah. The aroma is loaded with black raspberry, dark cherry and plum. 17 months in small barrels has contributed a bouquet of cocoa, hazelnut and dark chocolate. The flavours are soft, luscious and feature succulent red currants and raspberry.

title: Canalicchio di Sopra Brunello Riser 2012
Description: 95 points Wine Advocate '...beautifully saturated expression, with gorgeous density and presence. The bouquet is carefully considered in terms of its power and intensity (remember, this was a hot and dry vintage, and ripening was accelerated as a result).

title: Livio Felluga Sosso Friuli Colli 2015
Description: This is such a clean and beautiful merlot of blueberry and smokey meat character. It's full-bodied with round tannins and a fresh finish. Very Pomerol-like.

title: Le Ginestre Barolo DOCG 2014
Description: 92 points James Suckling 'Very pretty for a 2014 with aromas and flavors of cherries, strawberries, cedar and sandalwood. Medium body, firm and silky tannins and a fresh finish. Extremely well-done. Drink now'.

title: Galan 1492 Malbec 2013
Description: This mature Malbec from a cool vintage offers concentrated, meaty aromas of black fruits, iodine, black olive, herbs and minerals. In the mouth, this is a bit scratchy and tartaric. Flavours of blackberry and stewed plum are short and a touch salty, while this feels chewy, full and a bit sticky of the finish. Drink through 2022. Wine Enthusiast 89 Points - (M.S. Published 01/05/2019)

title: Martin Berdugo Barrica 2017
Description: Ruby to cherry red colour with some glints of purple and violet. On the palate nuances of forest fruits (blackberry, mulberry and liquorice) along with a hint of vanilla and dark roasted notes. Velvety and pleasant. The tannins are round, sweet and well balanced, with a hint of toasted oak. Serve at 17 °C. Consume in four years. Match with any kind of meat, roast, fish.

title: Chateau Pesquie Terrasses Ventoux 2017
Description: Wine Advocate (#239/ Oct 18), 91-93/100 'Crushed stone notes accent dried spices and raspberries on the nose, while the medium to full-bodied palate delivers rich, deep fruit flavours, plenty of concentration and an impressive velvety finish.'

title: Chateau Pesquie Edition 1912m Ventoux 2017
Description: The name 'Edition 1912m' is a tribute to the famous Mont Ventoux which proudly stands at an altitude of 1912 metres, the last real mountain of the Alps chain. It is commonly called 'the Giant of Provence'. 'Edition 1912m' shows red fresh fruit flavours, herb notes and a beautiful freshness. Pairs well with pizza, charcuterie, vegetable pies or mixed salads.

title: Rapariga Da Quinta Reserva Red 2017
Description: This wine has a jammy character that is balanced by the intense black fruits and acidity. It is structured, juicy and firm.

title: Ascheri Verduno Pelaverga 2018
Description: Light ruby red colour. Elegant bouquet of red berries and flowers. Spicy with velvety notes of black pepper. Charming wine with great balance and typicity. Serve at 12° to 14°C. Try it with appetizers and red meat skewered and grilled. You can also drink it cool, well matched with fresh water fish.

title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2009
Description: A rich and opulent wine, very ripe, packed with luscious blackberry and damson fruit as well as sweet tannins. It is a fruit salad of fruit flavors given structure by a core of dryness. Already a gorgeous wine, but one that will also age. Cellar Selection. Score - 95. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Feb. 1, 2012)

title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2015
Description: The 2015 Rauzan-Segla (Rausan-Segla) is a blend of 63% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, 3% Petit Verdot and 1% Cabernet Franc and was matured in 65% new and 35% one-year-old barrels for 18 months. Medium to deep garnet-purple colored, it gives up a myriad of softly spoken fresh berry, floral and fragrant earth notes, including crushed red and black currants, black raspberries and menthol notes with touches of cigar box, lavender, violets, smoked meats, black truffles and chargrill. Medium to full-bodied with a firm frame of very finely grained tannins and seamless freshness, the palate possesses an arresting quiet intensity of many tightly wound, subtle layers, finishing on a lingering mineral note. Very polished and precise, this Rauzan-Ségla is truly a triumph! Drink date: 2024-2047. Score - 97. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Feb. 21, 2018)

title: Château Canon 2009
Description: Medium to deep garnet colored, the 2009 Canon is a little reticent to begin, opening out to notions of rare beef, cast iron pan, cigar boxes and cloves with a core of baked plums and mulberries plus a waft of dried lavender. Full, richly fruited and sill quite youthful, the palate has a firm yet velvety texture and seamless freshness supporting the generous fruit, finishing long and mineral laced. Drink date: 2021-2050. Score - 97+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 14, 2019)

title: Château Canon 2015
Description: The 2015 Canon is going to be a benchmark for this historic estate. A blend of 72% Merlot and 28% Cabernet Franc, it was cropped at 42 hl/ha between 14-25 September and 30 September until 2 October respectively. The alcohol level is an average 14.5% with a pH 3.78, matured for 18 months in 70% new barrels (except for one barrel of Cabernet Franc that they will bottle separately - just to see). Lucid in color, it has an intense bouquet that exudes extraordinary purity with scents of raspberry, wild strawberry, limestone and violets. It makes a huge impression. The palate is medium-bodied and multilayered with vivacious red and black fruit infused with minerals. The acidity lends the tension here from start to finish, but what this Canon possesses unlike the dozens of other vintages that I have tasted, is an overarching structure that will see it age in similar fashion to past classics such as the 1929, 1947 and 1964. It lingers very long in the mouth, the oak just surfacing a little on the aftertaste, although that will be subsumed with time. This estate has been in the ascendant in recent vintages under winemaker John Kolasa and now Nicolas Audebert, together with a benevolent growing season, has elevated Canon to a level that few could have predicted. Drink date: 2025-2060. Score - 98-100. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com, April 27, 2016)

title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2005
Description: Very beautiful aromas of crushed berry, flowers, currant and Indian spices follow through to a full body, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long finish. Extremely polished and beautiful, with a seamless texture. Best after 2014. 10,000 cases made. Highly Recommended. Ranked #2 out of Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 2008. Score - 97. (James Suckling, winespectator.com, March 31, 2008)

title: Château Canon 2015
Description: The 2015 Canon is going to be a benchmark for this historic estate. A blend of 72% Merlot and 28% Cabernet Franc, it was cropped at 42 hl/ha between 14-25 September and 30 September until 2 October respectively. It lingers very long in the mouth, the oak just surfacing a little on the aftertaste, although that will be subsumed with time. This estate has been in the ascendant in recent vintages under winemaker John Kolasa and now Nicolas Audebert, together with a benevolent growing season, has elevated Canon to a level that few could have predicted. Drink date: 2025-2060. Score - 98-100. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com, April 27, 2016)

title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2005
Description: Very beautiful aromas of crushed berry, flowers, currant and Indian spices follow through to a full body, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long finish. Extremely polished and beautiful, with a seamless texture. Best after 2014. 10,000 cases made. Highly Recommended. Ranked #2 out of Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 2008. Score - 97. (James Suckling, winespectator.com, March 31, 2008)

title: Sorella 2014
Description: The deep inky colored 2014 Sorella checks in as a blend of 74% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Franc, and the balance Petit Verdot and Malbec. Cassis, smoked earth, graphite, and chocolate all emerge from this full-bodied, concentrated, gorgeously rich and layered beauty that has sweet tannin, beautiful purity, and a great finish. This is a sensational wine. Drink date: 2018-2038. Score - 97. (jebdunnuck.com, April 5, 2018)

title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2015
