Description: The 2015 Rauzan-Segla (Rausan-Segla) is a blend of 63% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, 3% Petit Verdot and 1% Cabernet Franc and was matured in 65% new and 35% one-year-old barrels for 18 months. Medium to deep garnet-purple colored, it gives up a myriad of softly spoken fresh berry, floral and fragrant earth notes, including crushed red and black currants, black raspberries and menthol notes with touches of cigar box, lavender, violets, smoked meats, black truffles and chargrill. Medium to full-bodied with a firm frame of very finely grained tannins and seamless freshness, the palate possesses an arresting quiet intensity of many tightly wound, subtle layers, finishing on a lingering mineral note. Very polished and precise, this Rauzan-Ségla is truly a triumph! Drink date: 2024-2047. Score - 97. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Feb. 21, 2018)

title: Château Canon 2005
Description: Tasted at the Château Canon vertical, the 2005 Canon is evolving into a quite gorgeous Saint Emilion. One can still discern those brown spices infiltrating the ripe red and black fruit. There is fine mineralité here, great focus, perhaps just a hint of dried blood that develops with time. The palate is medium-bodied with supple, ripe tannin. It is a very complex Saint Emilion with immense purity and style, a wine that you have to keep coming back to in order to understand. It's at that pivotal stage between primary and secondary notes, the red and black fruit being overtaken by cedar, morels and a touch of game. It gently lifts and fans out to a quite captivating finish. Dare I say that the 2005 Canon is the pick of the three over 2009 and 2010? There...I've said it...it is a quite brilliant wine. Tasted October 2015. Drink date: 2018-2040. Score - 95. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com, March 31, 2017)

title: Château Canon 2009
Description: Medium to deep garnet colored, the 2009 Canon is a little reticent to begin, opening out to notions of rare beef, cast iron pan, cigar boxes and cloves with a core of baked plums and mulberries plus a waft of dried lavender. Full, richly fruited and sill quite youthful, the palate has a firm yet velvety texture and seamless freshness supporting the generous fruit, finishing long and mineral laced. Drink date: 2021-2050. Score - 97+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 14, 2019)

title: Hewitson Old Garden Mourvèdre 2014
Description: The 2-acre Old Garden Vineyard was planted in 1853 and is recognised as the world's oldest mourvedre vineyard, producing only 5 tonnes, 25% whole bunches included in the ferment, matured in new French oak. Great colour for a '14 wine, still vivid and clear; super-intense, super-juicy; the quality and character take hold immediately you take the first sip, the bouquet a deceptively serene introduction. It is one of the most seductively savoury (or vice versa) wines of this medium-bodied style I can remember. Drink by: 2040. Special Value. Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Oct. 1, 2018)

title: Murphy-Goode Merlot 2016
Description: This Merlot is typically made in a bold style. The 2016 offers up ripe blueberry, cherry, cassis, vanilla and spice, with a delectable herbal underbelly. Refined and balanced with vibrant acidity, this will be great with grilled lamb. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Origen de Resalte Crianza 2015
Description: Firm and polished, this solid red shows loamy earth, espresso and clove notes framing a core of currant and dried fig flavors. The muscular tannins are well-integrated and balanced by lively acidity. Harmonious and energetic. Drink now through 2035. Highly Recommended. Score - 93. (Thomas Matthews, winespectator.com, May 31, 2019)

title: Sorelle Olivero Barolo DOCG 2015
Description: The wine in the glass, has a red ruby colour tending to garnet. On the nose it expresses floral notes of violet and dried flowers, aromas of red berry fruits and delicate spicy sensations. Strong, elegant, it has a good structure that is supported by a dense and evolved tannic texture. The aromas are rich and intense, with a harmonious finish and good freshness. This barolo DOCG is ideal with red meats like roasts, stews, strong cheeses and dishes with truffle. Serve at 18 °C - 65 °F in glasses for Barolo wine.

title: Terra Noble Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Made with grapes from the Los Lingues zone, toward the Andes, and from Marchigüe, toward the coast, both in Colchagua, this wine has all of the exuberant fruit of the cabernets from the valley, and in the case of this wine, very fresh fruit as well. It also has 15% grapes from Maipo Alto, which lend smoothness to the rather wild Colchagua tannins. Score - 91. (guiadescorchados.cl, 2019)

title: Linajes 12 Tempranillo Crianza 2014
Description: Blackberry, leather and plum aromas are inviting. This wine is full and lush on the palate, with grippy tannins. Oaky berry flavors are accented by spice and chocolate notes, while the finish brings pronounced coffee and mocha flavors. Drink through 2025. Score - 92. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2018)

title: Turley Juvenile Zinfandel 2018
Description: The 2018 Zinfandel Juvenile is a pretty, fragrant wine that will drink well right out of the gate. Bright floral and red-toned fruit notes convey a real sense of energy in this perfumed, entry-level Zinfandel from Turley. This is such a pretty wine. I very much like the energy here. Drinking window: 2020-2028. Score - 89. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Jackson-Triggs Okanagan Grand Reserve Red Meritage 2016
Description: Coming to Ontario in November 2019, this blend of cabernet sauvignon, cabernet franc and merlot shows an impressive and well integrated nose of currants and herbal sage nicely embedded in chocolaty oak and spice. It is medium weight, nicely balanced if a bit sweet in the end. The tannins are dusty if fine; the length is very good with that chocolaty note persisting. Score - 89. (David Lawrason, winealign.com, Aug. 14, 2019)

title: Château Lanbersac Cuvée Vieilles Vignes 2015
Description: Powerful ripe fruits and rich tannins come together in this jammy Merlot with a dark texture. Packed with spice, berry flavors and toasty wood aging accents, the wine is still young. It needs time for the impressive fruit to come through, so drink from 2022. Cellar Selection. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2018)

title: Castiglioni Giramonte 2011
Description: Wonderful aromas of blueberry, currant and licorice follow through to a full body with velvety tannins. Shaved chocolate and hints of coffee bean. Slightly bitter but will soften with time: better in 2016. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Oct. 20, 2014)

title: Romano Dal Forno Amarone della Valpolicella 2010
Description: 2010 is a more considered vintage compared to the outright opulence of 2009, but it's no shrinking violet, especially in Dal Forno's hands. This has a meaty nose with savoury hedgerow fruit , surprisingly open already. I had to put an exclamation mark after writing 'elegant' in my notes, as it seems incomprehensible that a wine of this magnitude could still have such balletic balance. It is broad and juicy, with chalky grip and clean, fresh acids followed by a hint of warmth on the long finish. Drinking window: 2019-2050. Score - 98. (James Button, decanter.com, March 6, 2018)

title: Sartori 120th Anniversary Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2012
Description: Deep ruby with a garnet hue, on the nose it shows extremely concentrated ripe fruit aromas, with notes of blackcurrant, ripe black cherries and bramble. Floral notes of rose petals, intense toast, dried herbs and spiciness. Off-dry, generous and full-bodied. On the palate with soft tannins, lively acidity and a lingering finish. The wine exudes balance, finesse, and persistency. Pair with game, braised meats, grilled red meats and aged cheeses.

title: Domaine Anita Reine de Nuit Moulin-à-Vent 2017
Description: Night harvesting of grapes for this wine has preserved freshness and fruitiness. It's also allowed the tannins to have great play and density. Structure and beautiful, juicy black fruits have a good future ahead of them. Drink this powerful wine from 2020. Score - 94. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, March 1, 2019)

title: Rupert & Rothschild Baron Edmond 2016
Description: Not quite in the same league as the brilliant 2015, but that's understandable given the very different vintage conditions in 2016. Youthful, intense and firm, with lots of freshness and acidity, firm, layered, sinewy tannins and assertive new wood. Cabernet Franc-based, with 48% Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this needs more time in bottle. Drink date: 2022-2028. Score - 93. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, South Africa Special Report 2020)

title: Groenland Wines Shiraz Classic 2017
Description: The smokiness on the nose blends well with vanilla and spicy flavours that come from maturing in small American and French oak barrels. Soft on the palate with enough tannin to bring it in good balance. Best within a few years. Pair with peppered beef or ostrich steaks, oxtail and bobotie.

title: Rustenberg Kloof Syrah 2016
Description: The Kloof vineyard site is planted in one of the coolest and least sun exposed slopes on Rustenberg, resulting in a long, late ripening process. The vineyard consistently produces the most well-structured and full-bodied Syrah on the estate, characterised by gamey, spicy aromas and flavours showing more savoury than sweet fruit complexity with a solid tannin structure and full body.

title: Quinta da Basília Red 2017
Description: From a small but respected family winery, this wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Sousão and Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo) grown on vines aged 40 years and picked by hand. It's fermented in stainless steel and then spends 12 months in used French oak barrels, rounding out the texture while keeping the focus on fresh fruit. Look for ripe red berries, floral notes and an elegant mineral aspect.
By:: Quinta Da Basilia Do Todao - S

title: Monte do Zambujeiro Red Alentejo 2016
Description: Big, dense, ripe and peppery red blend with herbal undertones which are rich, developed and savoury. Supple tannins and soft sweet oak make for a powerful and brawny red.

title: Inurrieta Cuatrocientos 2016
Description: At 400 meters of altitude we grow the vineyards in which we create this tall wine. In these conditions the process of grape ripening is long and balanced, favouring the accumulation of aromas and flavours. With a dark colour and an elegant nose in a sweet and fruity touch, it combines a fine and perfumed imprint of its barrel aging. The palate is alive and balanced, fleshy, highlighting the excellent quality of the tannins.

title: Dame de Montrose 2011
Description: The fruit on the nose is rich and deep quite sweet with the richness filling out the mid palate. The tannins feel ripe; the mid palate is supple with the sweetness of the black fruited mix giving richness on the finish.

title: Tikves Kratosija Crveno 2018
Description: A great value, juicy and fruity red from Northern Macedonia. Made with the native Kratosija grape (pronounced Krat o Sha) believed to be closely related to Zinfandel. The wine has bright aromas of redcurrants, cherry and red berries leading onto a medium-bodied and soft palate. Well worth trying. It's a lovely versatile red and one that will show its best served slightly chilled.

title: Poggiocurzio 2015
Description: Deep ruby red colour with a ruby rim. This wine has intense aromas of vanilla and red fruits. Well balanced and rounded with pleasant acidity. Captivating flavour with every dish especially spaghetti topped with basil and tomato sauce, white meats, fried eggs, goat cheese, red meat, and fish. Medium ageing potential (more than 5 years). To be enjoyed for its characteristic freshness.

title: L'Oustal Blanc Giocoso Minervois 2014
Description: 90-92 points Wine Advocate '..about as sexy and textured as they come in the vintage. Made from a mix of Grenache, Syrah and Carignan that's raised mostly in tank (30% in barrels), it offers lots of jammy red and black raspberry fruits, crushed flowers, licorice and hints of oak in its medium to full-bodied, ripe, rounded style. This is a high quality red that will drink nicely in its youth, yet keep through 2024.'

title: Tement Sudsteiermark Zweigelt 2013
Description: 91 points Falstaff. Expect lots of ripe black berries, a touch of dried fruit, some nougat, and delicate herbal notes. It's powerful & juicy, with well integrated tannins, lots of minerality, and a touch of chocolate on the finish. Certified Organic.

title: Barbera d'Asti Evolution DOCG 2017
Description: Lingering fragrance and fruity with notes of violet, ripe fruit flavour and spice. Excellent flavour and body, soft, harmonious and round. Notes of cherry and chocolate, good acidity.

title: Ruche DOCG Tradizione 2018
Description: Bright red with violet reflections in youth, tending to garnet with refinement. Intense, persistent, aromatic, fruity, with typical hints of rose and violet petals in the early years.

title: Piemonte Rosso DOC Fuori 2016
Description: Ruby red with delicious garnet reflections, it maintains that chromatic dynamism that stimulates its drinking. Brilliant and characteristic. On the nose, vinous, ample, intense and persistent with hints of nutmeg.

title: Villa Maria Cellar Selection Syrah 2017
Description: Purple and crimson hues lead to a perfumed nose of violet, black fruit, herb and spice aromas. The palate is medium bodied, supple and silky in texture, featuring wonderfully integrated tannins and plush oak. Pure fruit flavours lead the wine to a lengthy finish.

title: Forti del Vento Alto Red Blend Organic 2018
Description: Expect lots of bright red fruits on this crisp Dolcetto. Strawberry, raspberry, and a lot of cherry right up front. It's tart, with lip smacking freshness which make this a great food wine. Good length. Drink or hold. Certified Organic & Biodynamic.
By:: Forti Del Vento S. Agr. A R.L.

title: Domaine Ravaut Côtes de Nuits Villages 2016
Description: Whether red or white, this is the wine King Henry IV had in mind to go with the Sunday chicken he wished every family in France to enjoy. Its aromas run a classic spectrum through cherry, gooseberry and blackcurrant to notes of underbrush, mushroom and spices (cinnamon). This is a big-hearted wine, powerful in the mouth, full and meaty, and its tannins (more conspicuously present in the younger wines) are well smoothed-down.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Tenuta Santa Maria alla Pieve Verona Pràgal 2017
Description: This is a fresh and firm red with lovely perfume and dark berries on the nose. Fresh and linear fruit and tannins on the palate. Lovely, racy and clean wine. Drink now. Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 25, 2018)

title: Solaia 2005
Description: This offers gorgeous aromas of blackberry, mineral and flowers follow through to a full body, with superfine tannins and a long, long finish. A complex and wonderfully structured red. Long and beautiful. Best after 2012. Collectibles. Score - 97. (winespectator.com, Oct. 15, 2008)

title: Weinhauss Bettina Shumann Blauer Spatburgunder Dry 2017 Pinot Noir
Description: Pinot Noir with intense cherry and smokey, slightly greasy notes. Short tannins, very elegant wine.

title: F.Pato Nossa Calcário Baga 2017
Description: Beautifully balanced and surprisingly approachable, this is a powerhouse red in it's youth and will only get better over time. Lots of red fruits overtop steely minerality. It's graceful and heady.

title: Ca La Bionda Valpolicella Superiore Casal 2016
Description: All of this wine's fruit comes from vines in Casal Vegri, a steep, terraced vineyard with well-drained limestone soil, located in the heart of Valpolicella's Marano Valley.

title: Casal Garcia Red Lisboa 2018
Description: Intense ruby colour. Fresh and fruity aroma, with hints of ripe red fruit. Excellent balance, with freshness and ripe fruit flavours. It's a young and elegant wine, medium bodied, soft tannins and long-lasting end.

title: Ciu Ciu Oppidum Rosso Marche 2014
Description: This is made from 100% Montepulciano in the towns of Offida and Acquaviva Picena. The wine is aged in oak barrels for one year prior to bottling. It's a full bodied red, with dark purple and black fruits over top vanilla and spice.
By:: Societa Agricola Ciu Ciu Di Ba

title: Carabas 2015
Description: A blockbuster Barbera, significantly bigger and riper than most are accustomed to from this varietal. Huge flavours of black cherry, ripe plum, blackberry and licorice, with a hint of toasted vanilla. Like all of Luretta's wines, this one is all about balance. Fine grained tannins, vibrant acidity and the length goes on and on. Piacenza shares a lot of characteristics of its northern brother, Piedmont, and this hearkens to some of the finest examples from that region. Unbelievable value for a wine with this much depth.

title: Gutturnio 2016
Description: A regional blend of Bonarda and Barbera, from the alluvial soils of Piacenza. Bright and fruitforward, with delicate tannins and laser-focused acidity. The nose explodes with aromas of bing cherry, tart raspberry and spice box. The palate carries those berry flavours forward, but adds notes of cedar, red currant, pipe tobacco and strawberry. Medium-bodied and refreshing. Chill lightly and enjoy with cedar-planked salmon.

title: Ciu Ciu Gotico Piceno Superiore Organic 2015
Description: This is made from 70% Montepulciano and 30% Sangiovese. It spends 12 months in barrels and six months in bottles before release. It's a dark, full bodied, fruity wine, with notes of vanilla and spice on the finish. Certified organic and vegan.
By:: Societa Agricola Ciu Ciu Di Ba

title: 2018 Barbera d'Alba DOC Mara
Description: Deep ruby red in colour with purple highlights. On the nose intense ripe red fruit, cherries and berries. A highly drinkable wine showing depth and balance on the mouth. This wine is great for serving throughout a meal, and a perfect match for pasta, cheeses and cased meats.

title: NOM Saurwein Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Nom stands for nombuelo (gratitude in 'Xhosa') and Nomkhubulwane (a forgotten African goddess of agriculture). Situated at 700m altitude, the vineyard is a place where gratitude is instilled and tales appear. On the nose, orange rind, toasted cocoa bean, rose hip and cherry. On the palate black cherry fruit, hibiscus, garrigue, umami, roasted chestnuts, vevelty, firm tannins and balanced acidity. Serve with baked goats cheese crotin, white meat, fish, meat stews, mild curries and poultry.

title: Monte Velho Red 2018
Description: Clear appearance with a ruby colour this wine has aromas of red and wild berries which are nicely enveloped in subtle notes of fresh spices. Intense and rich on the palate with a solid structure and long finish.

title: Ciu Ciu Saggio Marche IGP Organic 2015
Description: This is made from 100% sangiovese from the towns of Offida and Acquaviva Picena. Only 30% of the wine is aged in oak so it's mainly fruity, with notes of cherries and blackberries and a touch of coffee at the end. Certified organic and vegan.
By:: Societa Agricola Ciu Ciu Di Ba

title: Bindi Porcellese Vieilles Vignes Organic 2014
Description: This is a clean and crisp Nielluccio from Corsica, having aged 24 months in stainless steel tanks. Expect notes of black fruits, liquorice, menthol and leather. It's medium bodied, with fine tannins and a nice finish. Certified Organic.

title: Chateau du Glana Saint-Julien 2015
Description: A red Bordeaux blend that is savoury and classic. Pair with beef and venison.

title: Nine Hats Red 2017
Description: Nine Hats, which was once blended from the declassified wines of the Long Shadows portfolio, has become a standout, standalone wine of its own. Named for the nine winemakers who craft Long Shadows wines, this Merlot/Cabernet combo is concentrated and ripe, with cherry, leather, a smooth mouthfeel, and a touch of firmness on the long finish. An impressive wine for steak or roast. (Vintages panel, May 2019)

title: Thenard Pernand Vergelesses 1er Cru Verge 2014
Description: A core of ruby with bronzed edges. Savoury cherry and strawberry followed by musk, Forrest floor and a hint of salty minerality. Tannins are still big and earthy. There is a good line of crunchy acidity running through the palate that holds it all together. Probably has a good number of years left but is drinking very well just as it is. Great value Burgundy.

title: Arenile Montepulciano D'Abruzzo DOC 2017
Description: 100% Montepulciano D'Abruzzo. Ruby red colour with violet nuances, intense perfume of black cherry and wild fruits. Full, balanced and with persistent ending. Gold Medal Mundus Vini. 90 Points from Luca Maroni. Gold medal from Mundus Vini.

title: Marques de La Concordia Viña Alarde Reserva 2013
Description: Earthy, leafy plum and berry aromas are spicy, while this cool-vintage reserva feels dense and grabby. Flavors of tobacco, spiced plum and oak outmuscle the wine's fruit, while this is mouthfilling but plodding on the finish. Drink through 2022. Score - 90. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, Nov. 1, 2019)
By:: Marques De La Concordia Family Of W

title: Brothers In Wine Primitivo 2016
Description: Expect good fruit intensity and an herbal undertone in this wine, along with structure and depth. A nicely priced option for pairing with lasagna or grilled meats.[The Berliner Wein Trophy did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Berliner Wein Trophy, 2017)

title: Luciano Arduini Classico Superiore Valpolicella Ripasso 2017
Description: (Translated from the Italian) Extraordinary strong taste of fruits with perfect smoothness, as well as full fragrance and freshness, in its deep colour that fills up the glass completely. Extraordinary balance among the three tones of taste, with acidity and strong tannin wrapped in the grapes' softness. Incredible concentration and production process of exceptional and clear transformation. Bravo! Score - 98. (Luca Maroni, lucamaroni.com, 2020)

title: Mukuzani Microzone Tbilvino 2017
Description: This dry red wine made from Saperavi grapes is a top-rated Georgian wine. Smooth with pleasant aromas of wild berries and laurel, it has a dark cherry colour though fairly transparent at the same time. The wine is full bodied and goes well with cold grilled pork, and sausages.

title: Tortochot Gevrey Chambertin Corvees Organic 2017
Description: An organic winery for the last decade, they take a very hands-off approach to growing and winemaking. The grape clusters are hand picked and fully de-stemmed with only wild yeasts used. Barrels are 25% new with medium toast to support but not overpower the gentle expression of Pinot Noir. Les Corvees is situated just underneath the great Grand Cru vineyards and the wines produced here are the most delicate and naturally balanced, offering remarkable fullness and length. This is a powerful and fleshy Gevrey Chambertin village. Excellent length.

title: Perlage C Cabernet Sauvignon delle Venezie Organic 2017
Description: Mostly cabernet sauvignon with a hint of cabernet franc, this rich wine shows black and red fruits, backed by earthy and herbaceous notes. It's full and dry on the finish. Certified Organic and Vegan.

title: Domaine Lapalus Macon Pierreclos 2017
Description: Made from Gamay grown on sandy soil, this wine has an intense fruity nose, with notes of black currant, cherry and raspberry. Very aromatic and juicy with ripe tannins and a good acidity . Good balance. Good value.

title: Rcabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: This is a balanced, plush, bold Cabernet that hits all the marks. There's a complex array of aromas and flavours to indulge in, including blueberry, blackcurrant, bramble, baking spice, mocha and graphite. Displaying great tension and backbone, this has the oomph for big dishes such as lamb shanks or venison.   (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Spier Creative Block 5 2016
Description: Blackberry, cherry and blackcurrant is supported by cedar, dark chocolate and fennel hints that flow into a vibrant palate with great balance and dense tannins. The taste will be enhanced by ageing.

title: Carmen Do Mezcal Tinta Matorral Chi 2018
Description: A fresh and floral wine dominated by red fruit, strawberries, and raspberries on a creamy palate with well-balanced acidity and a very long, persistent finish.

title: A'Kira T.FX.T Blaufränkisch Mittelb Organic 2016
Description: A joint venture between F.X. Pichler in the Wachau, Manfred Tement in Styria and Illa Szemes in Burgenland. The wine is made in Horitschon, a region famous for growing Blaufränkisch. The result is a hugely spicy wine, full of red berry fruits and firm but sweet tannins. Certified Organic.

title: Carmen Gold Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Beautifully fresh, subtle and spicy - the perfectly ripe and elegant tannins of this wine reflect gracefully the unique character of the alluvial terraces where the grapes are sourced from.

title: Filipa Pato Território Vivo Baga 2017
Description: This is made from the baga grape, the mainstay of Portugal's Bairrada region, which often produces rather gruff and rustic wines but in the hands of Filipa Pato, however, this wine offers remarkable freshness and purity, with red rather than black-fruit flavour and silky tannins that would appeal to fans of lighter reds.

title: Roc des Templiers Plan de Dieu Côtes du Rhône-Villages 2017
Description: This crowd-pleaser has plum, cherry, vanilla, cassis and spice tones in abundance. A really tasty red that could serve as a reception wine with light apps but will also pair nicely with lamb, rabbit or beef main courses. (Vintages panel, Jan. 2019)

title: Longview Saturnus Riserva 2017
Description: Made only in the finest years, the Riserva is sourced from the vineyard's 3 oldest parcels of Nebbiolo. The fruit was harvested by hand during the coolest part of the day and immediately brought to the winery for sorting by hand. Traditional vinification followed by an extended post-ferment maceration (4 weeks). Maturation took place in 6 and 7 year-old French puncheons (500l). Bottled un-fined and unfiltered. An alluring and intense nose of liquorice root, dark cherry, violets and roses. The palate is full, firm and complex with an array of spice and savoury fruit. 93 Points, Gary Walsh (The Wine Front)

title: Masi Poderi Del Bellovile Rosso 2016
Description: Deep ruby red in colour with violet reflections.On the nose, strong berry fruit and liquorice. The palate is firm and richly fruity, but soft and well-balanced at the same time. Plums and sweet spices. Delicate with a long finish.

title: The Doctor's Pinot Noir 2018
Description: The complex, yet seamless nose segues nicely into the palate with dried herbs, red fruits, and floral notes. Silky smooth tannins and modest acidity unite in a very hedonistic expression of the Doctor's Vineyard. This Pinot Noir finishes soft and luscious.

title: Perlage Primitivo Puglia Organic 2018
Description: This is made from Primitivo from the Puglia region. Expect typical violets and plums on this easy drinking red. It finishes smoothly, with a touch of cocoa and familiar savoury overtones. Certified Organic and Vegan.

title: Perlage Fattoria Rosso Molise Organic
Description: This is a biodynamic red from Italy's south east. Expect notes of spices and red fruits, with a medium body and dry finish. Certified Organic and Vegan.

title: Baltasar Gracian Red 2018
Description: Its bright red cherry colour with purple hints on the edges anticipates its fruitiness and balance. Rich in sensations with aromas of cherry, plum and red fruits. Round and full-bodied.

title: Longview Vista Shiraz Barbera 2018
Description: 80% Shiraz, 20% Barbera. Fruit is all hand-picked, destemmed and crushed before a cool and open co-ferment that lasted 21 days. Matured in 3rd and 4th fill French Hogsheads. Dominated by Longview's classic cool climate Shiraz style; spicy and savoury with crunchy berry fruit. The Barbera adds a juicy, cherry-like brightness to the blend along with the grape's textbook acidity. 91 Points, Campbell Mattinson (The Wine Front)

title: Coreto Joker Red 2018
Description: Soft and appealing aromas. Balanced acidity. Jammy mid-palate, with lush berry and a touch of earthyness. Medium finish, with soft tannin. Food: meats, grilled fish, pizza and pasta dishes.

title: Chateau Les Riganes Bordeaux Kosher
Description: This red Bordeaux expresses the typical quality of Entre-Deux-Mers: Ruby colour, fruity bouquet, full body and long finish. The wine pairs well with hearty meats and cold cuts.

title: Klippenkop Pinotage 2018
Description: Fans of fruit-forward Pinotage and of smoky, oak-influenced 'coffee' Pinotage alike should appreciate this wine, which bridges the gap between the two styles. Matured on wood for three months, it brings a touch of creamy vanilla-mocha to a core of rich, concentrated, almost jammy berry and plum. This solid value is a great choice for bacon-and-cheese pizza. (Vintages panel, June 2019)

title: Bleasdale The Powder Monkey Single Vineyard Shiraz 2015
Description: Destemmed, 15% whole berries, 9-12 days on skins, matured in French oak (27% new) for 12 months, gold medal Melbourne Wine Awards '16. Deep crimson-purple; this is a wine that begs no questions. It is very concentrated and powerful, but there's no sign of a midriff bulge. The fruits are all black, both berry and cherry, the oak and tannins built into the very fabric of the wine. Drink by: 2035. Special Value. Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2017)

title: Domaine des Souchons Côte du Py Morgon 2016
Description: The volcanic soil of this impressive vineyard gives powerful wines, like this. It is about tannins as much as fruit, but this will change. Wood aging has already done much to smooth the up-front structure and the fruit is developing well. But wait until 2021 for the wine to be at its best. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, March 1, 2019)

title: Andes Plateau 700 High Altitude Red Blend 2015
Description: Andes Plateau buys their grapes from a vineyard in the Pirque zone, 800 m above sea level. The rest of the blend (about 5%) comes from Alcohuaz, 1,800 m above sea level in the Elqui Valley. The result is very Pirque, with the elegant texture the wines from this area are known for, ripe red fruit, a bit of spice, and the firm acidity of mountain wines. It's lush, yet gripping at the same time, and the red fruits inundate the palate. The acidity brightens everything and makes the other flavors stand out, something akin to earth and blood, even though that sounds strange. A tremendous wine think about aging for at least 5 years. Score - 96. (guiadescorchados.cl, 2018)

title: Lail Vineyards Blueprint Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: This is a stunningly beautiful wine that is ageworthy, complex and will stay with you long after it's gone. Tones of cedar, clove and cinnamon start it off, followed by a dusting of cocoa powder and toasted oak. Lingering threads of crushed rock, violet and currant carry the finish. It finishes soft and silky. Ranked #40 in the 2019 Wine Enthusiast Top 100. Score - 96. (Virginie Boone, Wine Enthusiast, March 1, 2019)

title: Toscolo Chianti Classico 2016
Description: This shows dried violets and dried cherries with hints of lemons. Medium to full body, firm tannins and a bright finish. I like the texture here. [Ready to] Drink now.  Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Sept. 11, 2018)

title: Saraceni Libero Chianti Riserva DOCG 2014
Description: A vivid purple red with a rich and intense bouquet of fruity (raspberries and blackberries) and floral (irises) hints backed by notes of vanilla. Dripping with rich flavours of dark cherry, blackberry, chocolate and coffee, this new creation offers a lush mouth feel and a long, very elegant and balanced intricate finish. Pair with grilled meats, braised beef short ribs, an indulgent chocolate treat or as the perfect accompaniment to a night under the stars. Drink over the next 4-5 years.

title: Righetti Recioto della Valpolicella 2018
Description: Sweet with aromas of dried cherries, raspberries, and vanilla. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and warm baking spices complement the rich texture and raisin fruit character of this complex dessert wine.

title: Contesa Montepulciano D'Abruzzo DOC 2017
Description: Deep ruby red colour with grenadine tints, very limpid and full-bodied. At the olfactory evaluation it appears intense, persistent, of fine quality. It has a fragrance of ripe red fruits especially of wood and jam fruits, with tones of toast cocoa and chocolate. The taste is full , round, warm, just tannic. The wine is well structured and mature.
By:: Contesa Di Rocco Pasetti + C. S.A.S

title: Montes Limited Selection Cabernet Sauvignon/Carmenère 2017
Description: Aromas of lavender and hints of spearmint and currants follow through to a medium body with soft and polished tannins and a creamy texture. Enticing finish. Delicious now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2019)

title: Delirare Red 2017
Description: Made from sustainably farmed and hand-picked Alicante Bouschet, Castelão, Sousão e Tinta Míuda, with the denomination IGP Tejo. About 10% was matured in second use French barrels. Intense ruby colour. Clean and deep aromas, where the forest fruits stand out against nuances of dark chocolate. Balanced palate dominated by fine acidity and well-matched quality tannins, finishing with an unctuous feel and very good length.
By:: Romana Vini - Vinhos E Culturas, Ld

title: Domaine Magellan Syrah Grenache 2015
Description: This is a tasty and well priced Syrah, Grenache and Carignan combo with plenty of aromatic lift and force on the palate. Expect black cherry, plum, smoked meat and spice with a few creamy nuances. Spicy, meaty and fruity components are joined by some firm tannin on the finish.

title: Pagina Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Beautiful light ruby colour, well-defined aromas dominated by ripe and intense red fruits, slight perception of the oak stage. Fresh mouth, lively tannins, very well attuned to the lively and balanced acidity.
By:: Romana Vini - Vinhos E Culturas, Ld

title: Domaine Magellan Grenache 2018
Description: This Grenache is made from old vines, half of which are 45 years old, the other half 60. Grown on pebble-strewn soils outside the village - which is why it is labelled as a IGP. Shows a sanguine hint on the nose, with plenty of savoury notes to the dried berry and wild cherry flavours, delivering a touch of graphite. This is taut in structure, with a vibrant mouthfeel and a long finish that echoes with slate and white pepper.

title: Contesa Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riserva DOC 2016
Description: Deep ruby red colour with grenadine tints, very limpid and full-bodied. At the olfactory evaluation it appears intense, persistent, of fine quality. It has a fragrance of ripe red fruits especially of wood and jam fruits, with tones of toast cocoa and chocolate. The taste is full , round, warm, just tannic. The wine is well structured and mature.
By:: Contesa Di Rocco Pasetti + C. S.A.S

title: Domaine Magellan Coteaux du Languedoc 2016
Description: This 2.5-hectare vineyard of Syrah and Grenache is located in the Pézénas viticultural area. The Syrah and Grenache are hand harvested and fermented together with no added yeast. Low-temperature fermentation enables good extraction, particularly at the start of fermentation. This technique allows us to achieve greater precision during the maturation phase in 2-3 year-old Burgundy casks lasting 12 months.

title: Pagina Touriga Nacional 2018
Description: Violet ruby colour, aromas of small wild berries with some discreet floral notes and slight herbaceousness revealing the Atlantic influence. On the palate there is excellent balance and freshness. The acidity is present but well integrated into the wine's structure, thanks to lively but mature tannins. The finish is clean, fresh and long.
By:: Romana Vini - Vinhos E Culturas, Ld

title: Domaine Pavelot Savigny-lès-Beaune 2017
Description: The 2017 Savigny-lès-Beaune Village has a pure blackberry, raspberry and subtle briar bouquet that really blossoms in the glass (while Hugues Pavelot and I discuss whole bunches addition - of which there is none here, by the way). The palate is medium-bodied with sappy red berry fruit, grainy tannin, nice structure and gentle grip toward the almost nonchalant finish. Enjoy this over the next five to seven years. Delicious. Drinking window: 2020-2027. Score - 89-91. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2019)

title: St. Huberts The Stag Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: A blend of grapes (82% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Merlot, 6% Petite Sirah, and 3% Tannat) is sourced throughout California's fine wine regions, primarily Red Hills and High Valley in Lake County. Matured in American oak and stainless steel, this full-bodied red engages with aromas of earthy chocolate and cedar. Its depth of character shows through a lush mouthfeel. Structured yet supple tannins glide alongside flavors of coffee, sage, and violets. Score - 92. (Meridith May, tastingpanelmag.com, Jan. 29, 2019)

title: Domaine Dujac Les Gruenchers Chambolle-Musigny 1er Cru 2018
Description: Aromas of cherries, raspberries, sweet spices, orange rind and peony preface the 2018 Chambolle-Musigny 1er Cru Les Gruenchers, a medium to full-bodied wine that was also quite firm and structured on my visit chez Dujac, displaying plenty of succulent, fragrant fruit behind its youthfully muscular chassis of tannin. Again, there's a lot of potential here, but patience will be required. Score - 92-94. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Dona Ermelinda Red 2018
Description: Red fruits aroma, well defined with the wood, developing to aromas of dry fruits and spices. Soft in the mouth, with good structure and tannins.

title: Nera IGT Toscana 2017
Description: The nose is characterized by pleasant notes of ripe red fruits and sweet spices, sustained on the palate by a crisp acidity that combines structure and complexity and a broad, harmonious tannin texture. Pairs beautifully with grilled meat, fish, fried foods and aged cheeses.

title: Laura Hartwig Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Lovely fresh flowers to this cabernet, such as lilacs, not to mention raspberries. Juicy and round on the palate with soft tannins and a medium-chewy finish. Drink now. Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2019)

title: Alice Vieira de Sousa Reserve Red 2017
Description: Look for this blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz to offer superb balance, a grippy structure and fresh, food-friendly acidity. You can expect dark fruit, vanilla, pepper spice and a lively texture. A nice match for grilled back ribs or barbecued steak.
By:: Vieira De Sousa Vines + Wines, Lda

title: Portal Muros Vinha 2017
Description: This wine has good aromatic intensity with floral notes. On the palate fine acidity. Fresh and elegant with a long and refreshing finish. Perfect with seafood dishes and salads.

title: Porta Dos Cavaleiros 2013
Description: Deep ruby in colour with intense aromas of mature red fruits and dried prune. Soft and full-bodied.
By:: Caves Sao Joao - Sociedade Dos Vinh

title: Carmen Winemaker's Red 2015
Description: The nose presents ripe red fruits, black currants, black cherries, pencil lead, and a light touch of tobacco. The sweet, firm tannins lend tremendous structure and depth.

title: Sao Domingos Tinto Bairrada 2015
Description: Very attractive aroma, focused on fresh fruit, showing notes of wild berries and vegetable. The soft and balanced texture and fruit always present in the mouth, resulting in an elegant and persistent set.
By:: Caves Do Solar De Sao Domingos

title: Bera Barbera d'Asti DOCG 2018
Description: Ruby red colour with garnet red tinges, this wine is originated from vines with a particularly favourable place for growing Barbera. The calcareous clayey substratum rich in sand brings out it's intense, dark fruit fragrances and the harmonic structure of the wine which is warm and dry in the mouth with a long finish, suitable with many types of cuisine including starters, roast meat and aged cheese.

title: Cinco Sentidos Malbec Reserva 2017
Description: Blueberry and cassis aromas come in front of a narrow, rubbery palate. Rubbery, earthy plum and dark-berry flavours end with grabby tannins and herbal, salty, briny notes.

title: Oscar 697 Rosso
Description: Clear, orange amber colour with a nose of rhubarb, rooty notes, liquorice, zesty citrus, and cinnamon spice. Sweet red berry fruit flavour with liquorice, citrus zest, rooty herbal complexity and underlying bitterness. Drier finish with pleasing herbal, spice, fruit and balancing bitterness.

title: Vinha Do Mouro 2015
Description: Dark red colour with only a slight edge. Intense aroma of red fruits, vanilla and some spices. This wine is full bodied with good acidity. Very soft in the mouth with flavour focused on the fruit and a good final persistance.

title: Quinta Casal Branco Touriga Nacional 2018
Description: Bright red colour with floral notes, violets, and blackcurrant. The floral notes are repeated in the retronasal aromas, combined with a wine with soft tannins, fairly full-bodied and persistent. This is a good example of the aromatic characteristics of this grape variety. Not aged in barrels. Ideal with meat, and cheeses.

title: Benito Santos Mencía 2018
Description: From vineyards situated in the DO of Monterrei comes this light, fruity and aromatic wine. The fruit comes from 27+ year-old vines growing on granite/slate soils. The grapes are hand-harvested. Fermentation in stainless steel and no mention of oak usage. Benito Santos Mencía is a smooth, balanced and tasty wine. It stands out for its aromas of wild berries. It is one of the most elegant Mencías in the area.

title: Quinta Casal Branco Red Blend 2017
Description: Intense violet in colour with aromas of ripe fruit, blackcurrant and some spicy notes. The elegance stands out, both in the aroma and the mouth. Medium structure, very well balanced with soft tannins - a pure reflection of the terroir.

title: Castelgiocondo Ripe al Convento Riserva Brunello di Montalcino 2013
Description: This has a regal feel with a wealth of ripe blueberries and a complex array of new leather, warm earth, terracotta and spice. The palate has concentration and depth with assertive, fine and long tannins delivering a long, unwavering impression on the palate, bathed in ripe red and dark-fruit flavors. Drink or hold. Score - 97. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Castelgiocondo Ripe al Convento Riserva Brunello di Montalcino 2013
Description: This has a regal feel with a wealth of ripe blueberries and a complex array of new leather, warm earth, terracotta and spice. The palate has concentration and depth with assertive, fine and long tannins delivering a long, unwavering impression on the palate, bathed in ripe red and dark-fruit flavors. Drink or hold. Score - 97. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Spalatrone Taurasi DOCG 2007
Description: Impenetrable deep ruby in colour, with red fruits, balsamic spices, coconut and vanilla aromas. Full bodied with a very long finish and a hint of tannins. Serve with red meats, game and mature cheeses.

title: Goru Gold Monastrell/Cabernet Sauvignon/Syrah 2017
Description: Colour: dark-red cherry. Nose: toasty, spicy, cocoa bean, honeyed notes, ripe fruit. Palate: flavourful, toasty, fine bitter notes.  Score - 90. (Peñín Guide to Spanish Wine, 2020)

title: Lost Poet Red 2017
Description: Lost Poet brings together celebrity Instagram poet Atticus and former Sea Smoke cellar master Ryan Zotovich. This blend of Cabernet, Merlot and Syrah has impressive plum, cherry and vanilla tones, with an underlying herbaceous minty note. Complex and compelling in both tasting and smelling, it will not miss a beat when served with grilled meat. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Bellevue Laffont 2014
Description: Chateau Fourcas Dupre is one of the few Medoc estates to have over 80% Pyrenean gravel - their 114-acre vineyard contains a surprising mixture of gravel, clay, and limestone. This unique soil gives such personality to their wines, making them one of the top Cru Bourgeois in Listrac. Made with 60% Merlot, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. A delicious, medium-bodied red wine with pleasant ripe-fruit aromas. Pair with red roasted meat, poultry, or soft cheese.

title: Morais Rocha Reserve Red 2016
Description: Intense garnet colour, aromas of black fruits and jam fruits, with notes of caruma. Flavour with great complexity, where the fruit and the wood, where it aged, in perfect harmony. Long finish and extremely persistent.

title: JJ Red 2018
Description: Very intense wine, with ripe red fruit. Good mouth, with easy tannins and well balanced end. Perfect with stewed meats and pasta. Preferably settle for 10 min. Serve at 14ºC.

title: Pavillon L'Ermitage 2016
Description: Aged entirely in barriques (25% new), the 2016 Ermitage le Pavillon shows only a hint of warm pencil shavings on the nose, inky in colour, beautifully setting up notes of fresh blackcurrants. Full-bodied, concentrated and plush across the mid-palate, it turns rich and velvety on the nearly endless finish, marked by savoury notes of beef, licorice and espresso. Drink Date 2025 - 2045

title: Sei La! Red 2018
Description: Ruby colour. Intense wine, with black fruits and prunes. Good mouth, with easy tannins and well balanced end.

title: Tedeschi Capitel Monte Olmi Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
Capofosso Chianti DOCG 2018
Description: A nose of earthy red berries, forest floor and lovely woodsy spices. It's complex and rich on the palate with cherries, raspberries and currants that play well with the earthy/loamy/spice bits through the finish. It has structure and complexity with medium-plus tannins.

title: Gérard Bertrand L'Hospitalitas La Clape 2018
Description: From a three-hectare parcel of Bertrand's La Clape estate, the 2018 La Clape L'Hospitalitas is a blend of Syrah and Mourvèdre, aged a year in new French oak. Basically, it ratchets up the intensity from the Château l'Hospitalet bottling while playing on the pitch: garrigue, blackberries, black olives and salted licorice on the nose, a full-bodied palate supported by ripe tannins and plenty of length and intensity on the finish. It's a big, beautiful beast capable of drinking well for a decade or more. Drink date: 2020-2030. Score - 95. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, June 30, 2020)

title: Guastaferro Memini Aglianico 2016
Description: Big, velvety and ripe, displaying lively inner-mouth notes of black cherry and fresh herbs. Harmonious acidity provides clarity and verve to the plush, rather ripe red fruit flavours. The finish features suave tannins and outstanding length.

title: Macanita Touriga Nacional LETRA A 2017
Description: Between 1935 - 1947 a system of soil classes in the Douro was created ranging from Letter A to Letter F. The vines closest to the river (Letter A) were said to have great concentration and power, which gave the region its fame. This is Macanita's Douro 'Letter A'.

title: Chateau Larose Perganson 2006
Description: Deep dark ruby colour. A bouquet boasting of ripe red berry aromas : strawberry and raspberry underlined by toastier notes as well as roasted coffee notes. The wine is still a bit closed but evidences much complexity to come. On the palate tighter, opulent tannins are indicative of a vintage with great ageing potential.

title: Polluce Calabria Rosso 2018
Description: Bright and deep ruby red colour, a complex aroma with hints of cherry and blackberry, fragrant and spicy. Great concentration and elegant softness, the taste is elegant and velvety with a good aftertaste. Recommended food pairing: red meats, tasty roasts, grilled meats, game, and seasoned cheeses.

title: Planeta Santa Cecilia Noto 2015
Description: This is one of Sicily's iconic red wines. The 2015 Noto Santa Cecilia shows a new change of clothes with this vintage. I was immediately struck by the direct and chiseled quality of the bouquet that makes a break from some of the heavier and more extracted aromas of the past. The aromas are bright and buoyant with ruby cherry followed by crème de cassis and dried cranberry. I love the way those perfumes caress and embrace the senses. The mouthfeel is perhaps less impactful in terms of length. It does show elegantly integrated tannins and fresh acidity, but I wish it lasted longer. This new and beautiful vintage of Santa Cecilia opens a new chapter, and I can't wait to try future releases. Drink date: 2019-2030. Score - 94+. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Dec. 28, 2018)

title: Marchesi Mazzei Belguardo Tirrenico 2016
Description: Aromas of blackberries and blueberries with hints of dried flowers and ripe strawberries. Full-bodied, layered and softly textured. Delicious and succulent. A blend of cabernet sauvignon, alicante, cabernet franc and petit verdot. Drink now or hold. Score - 94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Sept. 11, 2018)

title: Sebastiani Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Sebastiani has been a significant player in California's premium-wine landscape for over 116 years. Its focus today is on single-vineyard and sub-appellation wines. This Cabernet comes from a variety of prime sites and delivers forward aromas of ripe red fruit, with rose petal accents. The palate offers plenty of cherry, strawberry, cassis, vanilla and spice, with a hint of mint. A great option for steak or barbecued ribs. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Super Tuscan Toscana IGT Saraceni 2014
Description: Made with Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Sangiovese, this blend is intense with a ruby red colour and aromas of ripe red berry fruit, black cherry, hints of cacao, and sweet spices. Full-bodied and vigorous on the palate, a rich fruit and spice flavour and a classic refreshing acidity. Persistent and perfectly balanced, this wine has impeccable style both in structure and round tannins. Drink over the next 4-5 years.

title: Ea Red 2017
Description: Grenadine in colour with a young, intense and fresh aroma reminiscent of rockrose, red berries and truffles. Intense and exuberant fruit on the palate, complemented by ripe, elegant, smooth tannins with a strong, persistent finish of red berries, mocha and spices.

title: Mildiani Kindzmarauli Ceramic 2017
Description: The wine is velvety, bright, very deep red, rich with hints of blackberry, cherry and a pleasant long finish. Aromas of blackberry and sweet cherries. Serve with different fruit dishes, desserts, sweet pastries and soft cheeses.

title: Quinta do Covão Reserva Touriga Nacional 2016
Description: An opaque ruby-red colour, this intense wine is both complex and elegant. Notes of well-ripened black and red fruit, delicate floral tones and fresh shrubby touches combine wonderfully in a wine that gains increased complexity from aging in oak barrels. On the palate, it is harmonious and balanced with smooth tannins adding both structure and body. Additional aromas of forest-floor combine with prominent fruity tones to reveal a long and persistent finish.

title: Mauro Molino Barbera D'Asti Radici 2018
Description: 89 points James Suckling 'Lots of cloves and candied strawberries on this one, as well as burnt oranges and blackberries. Full-bodied, round and quite decadent, but slightly jammy.'

title: Franciscan Magnificat 2015
Description: Rich and inviting with a soft and full entry. Mouth filling with a velvety texture of dark berry fruit and notes of black plum, cassis, and mocha. Delicious, supple tannins. The smooth finish lingers with notes of ripe cherry fruit, toasty oak, and bittersweet chocolate on the finish.

title: Mildiani Mukuzani Ceramic 2017
Description: Dark ruby in colour, this wine has flavours of ripe red fruit, a velvety texture and a long, rich finish with rounded oak accents. On the nose, cherry and delicate touches of wood. Serve with grilled meat, desserts and cheeses.

title: Quinta do Covão Red Dao 2015
Description: Solid core of toast and fruits, soft tannins, persistent, fresh and elegant wine making it a great company for a wide selection of dishes.

title: François Lumpp Pied du Clou Givry 1er Cru 2017
Description: There was a little bit of Brûlée blended in with this wine from the domaine's home vineyard in 2017, adding some texture to what it is already a rich, deeply-coloured wine. Dense and plush, it's spicy, sweet and concentrated, with lots of dark plum and cherry fruit. Drinking window: 2021-2028. Score - 93. (Tim Atkin, MW, decanter.com, Oct. 23, 2018)

title: Fleur de Laroze 2015
Description: The second wine of Château Laroze, Saint Emilion Grand Cru Classé. Stringent selection from the various vineyard plots and a great attention to detail when blending the wine. Fleur de Laroze is vinified in the same conditions as Château Laroze. This wine is made on Château Laroze's 27-hectare (67-acre) terroir. La Fleur de Laroze is pure, fresh and smooth on the palate. Keeping potential: about eight years.

title: Amuse Bouche Vin Perdu Napa Valley 2016
Description: 94 points Vinous 'The 2016 Vin Perdu is absolutely gorgeous. In 2016, Vin Perdu is once again based on a core of Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich, ample and beautifully layered in the glass, the 2016 has a lot to recommend it. Mocha, plum, bittersweet chocolate, leather and spice meld together in a super-expressive, resonant wine from John Schwartz and Heidi Barrett. The Vin Perdu is technically the second wine of Amuse Bouche, but in many vintages I prefer it'.

title: Burn Cottage Moonlight Race Pinot Noir 2018
Description: A blend of fruit from the Home vineyard in Lowburn and the Sauvage vineyard in Bannockburn. Seductive and accessible pinot noir with ripe cherry, fresh herb, plum, spice, thyme, roasted chestnut and nutty oak flavours. Drink date: 2020-2024. Score - 94. (Bob Campbell, MW, therealreview.com, April 2, 2020)

title: Ramírez de la Piscina Selección Reserva 2015
Description: Lots of flowers and hints of oak with dark berries and spice. Full-bodied yet fresh and balanced with ripe tannins and a long, flavorful finish. A beauty. [Ready to] Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, July 26, 2019)

title: Tyrrell's Vat 9 Hunter Shiraz 2017
Description: Hand-picked, open-fermented, matured in new and 1yo 2700l French casks for 15 months. This is opulent and rich, bringing back memories of '59, '61, '65 and '66 ('65 the standout). The black fruits are wrapped in velvet, the oak and tannins watching on enviously. A wonderful wine with its own part of history. Drink now to 2047. Special Value. Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2019)

title: Ca' Romé di Romano Marengo Rio Sordo Riserva Barbaresco 2013
Description: Shows lovely depth and richness, but there is so much vitality on the nose. Tea leaves, incense, dried nutmeg, hibiscus, cedar and dried rose petals. Full body, tightly wrought and grippy tannins and a taut, long finish. A great wine. Drink in 2023. Score - 95. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Sept. 24, 2018)

title: Château de Ferrand 2015
Description: Aromas of attractive red flowers, black cherries, chalk and deep cedary wood. This wine has a super fresh and tight-knit feel to it. The palate is laced up tight with fine, smooth tannins. Reserved and elegant. Full of finesse. Best from 2022. Score - 94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 2, 2018)

title: Château Coufran 2009
Description: The quality of the fruit and tannins are very pretty here. It's full-bodied, with round velvety texture and a delicious finish. Very impressive. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, July 13, 2014)

title: Dom Brial Crest Petit Côtes du Roussillon-Village 2014
Description: 80% Syrah, 20% Grenache. A big but well-mannered red with a compelling bramble jam and wild herb nose. Sapid and juicy palate with caramel, dried/fresh black cherries and clove spice flavours. Complex and beautifully matured, it's a real pleasure to taste.   Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Sorlini Rossardente Toscana IGT 2018
Description: A full red colour with purplish highlights. The nose, pleasurable and intense, offers fruity notes of cherries, blackberries, and plums fused with aromas of vanilla and coffee. The palate is supple, enveloping, and full of fruit on the finish and aftertaste.

title: Apricot Block Shiraz 2016
Description: This rich, dark red wine has complex aromas of spice and fruit, plums, berries and a splash of dark chocolate with a lingering velvety finish.

title: Ella Syrah Reserva Apalta, Colchagua 2017
Description: Deep red colour with purple hints. On nose shows eucalyptus, mint and violets, plus some blackberries and cherries. The spicy touch and freshness appears on palate, where it also shows smoothness, elegant ripe tannins and a pleasant end together with a medium body.

title: Portal del Priorat Luno 2017
Description: Sourced from estate vineyard holdings in Montsant. The vines are planted at 820-1,470 feet on chalky clay soil. It is the entry level wine for the winery and quite a crowd pleaser. Notes of ripe dark fruits, blackberries and cherries lead to a balanced and supple wine that finishes smooth on the palate.

title: Osoyoos Larose Le Grand Vin 2015
Description: Eighth overall in the Bordeaux blends category. Established by Groupe Taillan (owner of Château Gruaud-Larose) in 1998, Osoyoos Larose is single vineyard planted to all five Bordeaux varieties, and has had a series of French winemakers. The 2015 vintage was vinified by Mathieu Mercier but the final blend was assembled by current winemaker, Caroline Schaller. I have been able to try every vintage since the inaugural 2001 release and, in some years, the components before assemblage. Usually backward and almost excruciatingly tannic in its youth, this is the friendliest vintage I have ever tasted. It's polished, refined and expressive, with subtle wood spice and smoke atop red and black currants. The tannins are firm but not over-extracted, and it skips brightly across the palate. I did question if it was from Bordeaux. Drinking window: 2019-2027. Score - 92. (Michaela Morris, decanter.com, Oct. 23, 2018)

title: Scattered Earth Bush Vine Cinsault 2018
Description: Cinsault is originally from the Southern Rhône, where it's a common contributor to blends alongside Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. This single-varietal example from the Western Cape is a fresh, fruity, easy-drinking wine featuring lifted violet florals, bright strawberry, raspberry, earth and spice, with a vibrant, food-friendly finish. It will be great with lamb burgers or beef stew.  (Vintages panel, June 2019)

title: Pietra Majella Montepulciano D'Abruzzo 2015
Description: Intense, ethereal, with hints of ripe fuit. Longevity 6-8 years. Serve with red meats, game, roasts and cheeses.

title: Pacheca Lagar N.1 Reserva Red 2016
Description: Pacheca Lagar Nº1 presents a deep ruby colour. In the aroma it is very fruity with salient notes of ripe black fruit, such as blackberries and plums, accompanied with notes of chocolate from the barrel. It is very complex in the mouth with an acidity that gives it freshness, marked rounded tannins and a long and persistent finish.
By:: Quinta Da Pacheca Soc. Agricola E T

title: Humanitas Red Reserva 2015
Description: Garnet colour, intense aroma of forest fruits, spices and balsamic notes. Fresh and complex on the palate, with firm and well balanced tannins. Ending long with a strong sensation of freshness promising potential to evolve in bottle.

title: Domaine Armand Rousseau Chambertin Grand Cru 2018
Description: There is barely enough wood to mention on the wonderfully fresh and airy aromas of red cherry, pomegranate, earth and a hint of the sauvage. The seductively textured yet well-delineated big-bodied flavors possess an abundance of energy on the intensely mineral-inflected, sappy and impeccably well-balanced finale that reflects a touch of youthful austerity. The sheer level of complexity is stunning, and this knockout of a Chambertin should age for a very, very long time yet it's not so backward and it couldn't be approached after a decade or so of aging. Drink: 2038+. Score - 97. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, Jan. 10, 2021)

title: Domaine Armand Rousseau Clos St-Jacques Gevrey-Chambertin 1er Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Gevrey-Chambertin Clos Saint-Jacques 1er Cru has an exquisite bouquet that offers transparent red fruit, fine mineralité, sous-bois, and a sense of vivacity and focus that this vineyard has above all over premier crus. The harmonious palate is medium-bodied with supple tannins, orange peel and a velvety-smooth finish. Superb. Drinking window: 2024-2055. Score - 96-98. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Chateau St. Jean Merlot 2017
Description: Floral, with fruit, vanilla and spice on the nose. The palate is ripe and vibrant, offering mixed blueberry, raspberry, strawberry, rhubarb and cherry. Pair with grilled ribs or lamb burgers. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Pagodes de Cos 2011
Description: With its ruby colour and nose of fresh strawberries and mint, the first contact with the 2011 vintage is remarkable. On the palate, notes of blackberry, blueberry and vanilla are revealed, with a long finish. Even with its high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine expresses all the roundness of Merlot, thus offering a beautiful greedy frame.

title: Baron d'Albret AOC Buzet 2016
Description: The bouquet rolls out its ripe fruit scents, set off nicely by hints of oak and vanilla. The sensation on the palate is powerful and the tannic structure pronounced but pleasantly mellow.

title: 1000 Nights 2015
Description: Deep purple colour, exciting aromas of vanilla and a rich taste of mature black fruits, offering a truly characteristic finish. Aged in oak for 12 months.

title: Dauphin de Grand Puy Ducasse Pauillac 2015
Description: Brambly summer-berry and dark-plum aromas with a thread of violets and cassis. The palate has a smooth, pastry-like tannin texture and is gently grainy and layered. Very fresh and elegant finish.

title: 1000 Nights Syrah Sterea Ellada 2014
Description: Deep purple colour and intense aromas of spices, vanilla and black fruits. A rich taste and long finish. Aged for 12 months in oak.

title: Domaine de Michelet AOC Buzet 2018
Description: This wine reveals a deep purple colour. The nose offers an explosion of red fruit, red currants and blackcurrants. The palate offers a full yet fresh attack and is structured by already well integrated tannins, despite their young age. Fruity notes linger on the persistent finish.

title: Casablanca Nimbus Pinot Noir 2016
Description: 100% Pinot Noir. Seductive aromatics of wild herb, toasty warm spice and sappy red fruit, lead to a palate dressed with elegant summer fruit and a pristine acidity.  Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Tenuta della Luia Cilestro 2015
Description: Plenty of treacle tart, Christmas cake, blackberries, mint and fresh herbs as well as hints of tobacco. Full, round palate with ripe tannins and a chewy finish. Made from a blend of cabernet and sangiovese. Drink in 2019. [to 2025] Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Aug. 28, 2017)

title: Koncho Kindzmarauli Kakheti 2018
Description: Kindzmarauli is the most famous among Georgia's top wines. This late-harvest semi dry is crafted from select indigenous Saperavi grapes grown in the Kindzmarauli PDO Micro-Zone once known as the 'royal vineyards'.

title: Koncho Akhasheni Kakheti 2017
Description: Harmonious and complex, this wine shows pleasant tones of French plum, ripe cherry and raspberry. A long finish is filled with spicy notes with floral motifs.

title: Georges Millérioux Sancerre AOC Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Nicolas Millérioux brings a modern vision combined with traditional, low intervention practices to the vineyard and the cellar. His Sancerre rouge is made from 100% pinot noir. The wine expresses a minerality that is inherent to pinot noir from the Loire Valley. With a beautiful ruby color, it has a fresh, slightly spicy nose. On the palate it has notes of strawberry and cherry. Balanced and harmonious with a long, round finish. Ideally served with red meats, stews, game and soft cheeses.

title: Domaine Comte Georges de Vogüé Chambolle-Musigny 2017
Description: The 2017 Chambolle-Musigny Village has a mixture of red and black fruit, plus hints of damp woodland and truffle lingering on the sidelines. The palate is well balanced with red currant and cranberry fruit on the entry, a fine bead of acidity and touches of Chinese five-spice and sage toward the finish. Fine. Drinking window:2023-2035.. Score - 90. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Domaine Comte Georges de Vogüé Vieilles Vignes Musigny Grand Cru 2017
Description: The 2017 Musigny Vieilles Vignes Grand Cru is complex and well defined on the nose, where touches of iodine and wild heather infuse the black fruit. The palate is medium-bodied with a slightly grainy texture; notes of black truffle and fresh fig complement a fruit profile that welcomes more red fruit toward the finish. Hints of white pepper and sage linger on the aftertaste. This is certainly beginning to close up in bottle, so allow a decade if you can for this Musigny to show what it is capable of.Drinking window: 2027-2060. Score - 95. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Domaine Comte Georges de Vogüé Bonnes-Mares Grand Cru 2017
Description: The 2017 Bonnes-Mares Grand Cru has a complex bouquet that is slightly more Musigny in personality than I expected. There is mainly dark fruit here, mixed with potpourri and incense and becoming more flamboyant as it aerates in the glass. The palate is medium-bodied with fine-grained tannins, and quite compact in style because, as François Millet noted, these 2017s are beginning to close down. But there is certainly good density here, and an enticing tensile finish.Drinking window: 2024-2048. Score - 94. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Château Rouget 2015
Description: Beautiful aromas of plums and filtered coffee follow through to a full body. Firm and silky tannins and a flavorful finish. Bright acidity and spice character. Tight and focused. Needs two or three years to open. Score - 94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 2, 2018)

title: Domaine Rouge 2017
Description: Dark colour with purple highlights. Expressive nose of blueberries and wild strawberries. Refreshing finale with peppermint flavours. Round and smooth in the mouth. Full wine. Nice pairing with red beef and chocolate desserts.

title: Calera Selleck Vineyard Mount Harlan Pinot Noir 2005
Description: The very Burgundian 2005 Pinot Noir Selleck Vineyard is super. While it displays hints of menthol, bay leaf, and roasted herbs, it is dominated by black currants, kirsch, earth, and flowers. The wine has fresh porcini mushroom and forest floor notes reminiscent of a grand cru from Burgundy's Morey St.-Denis. Full-bodied, rich, and impressive, this wine should drink well for at least 12-15 years.Drink date: 2009-2014. Score - 93. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Aug. 30, 2009)

title: Dal Forno Romano Monte Lodoletta Amarone della Valpolicella 2009
Description: The Dal Forno family considered the idea of releasing their Amarone ten years after the harvest. If that plan had been implemented, this would be the vintage on the market now. The 2009 Amarone della Valpolicella Monte Lodoletta is a full and generous expression that delivers thick lines and robust flavors of dried blackberry, camphor ash, exotic cedar wood, licorice and tarry road pavement. This vintage saw average temperatures throughout the growing season with a few hailstorms along the way. Very dry weather led to some mild drought in July and August, with ensuing ripening and concentration of the clusters. I found this monumental wine to be irresistible when I first tasted it five years ago, and I consider it to have improved since then. This is one of the most complete and comprehensive vintages produced at Dal Forno, and it gives us an ample 360-degree view onto the might, brawn and potential of this icon wine from the Veneto. Its evolutionary track shows no sign of slowing down. Score - 99. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Sept. 19, 2019)

title: Sesti Grangiovese IGT 2017
Description: Exceptionally good value red with ripe, gamey flavours that linger in the mouth. Delicious wine!

title: Sesti Brunello di Montalcino 2014
Description: 92 John Szabo (Wine Align) 'There's some fantasy and complexity here in a decidedly earthy, leathery, advanced and evolved style (fully in the garnet spectrum). I appreciate the supple, succulent, silky palate, well-managed in an unabashedly old school style, working with the vintage to maximize potential.

title: Herdade do Pombal Red DOC Alentejo 2017
Description: A very fragrant wine with mature and red fruit. The mouth confirms good fruit volume, good tannins, elegant and round wine finishing with a medium long persistence.
By:: Sociedade Agr. Da Herdade Do Pombal

title: Dois Terroirs Red 2016
Description: Attractive lifted red berry fruit aromas, with a touch of vanilla. Vibrant fruit on the palate, juicy and intense, finishing with a nice acidity.

title: Opus One 2014
Description: Blended of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Cabernet Franc, 6% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot and 2% Malbec, the Opus One 2014 Proprietary Red Wine sports an inky purple color and nose of crushed black and red currants, black cherries and mulberries with touches of underbrush, sautéed herbs and pencil shavings plus a waft of spice box. Medium-bodied, finely crafted and with an energetic line lifting the red and black fruits, it has a bold frame of grainy tannins and a very long, earth and spice-layered finish. Drink date: 2019-2047. Score - 96. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2017)

title: Opus One 2015
Description: Purity and brilliance on the nose with so much currant and flower character. Roses, currant bush and fresh leaves, too. Brightness is the word that comes to mind. Full-bodied and broad-shouldered. Juicy and so gorgeous now. Balance is so wonderful here. All about harmonious fruit and tannin balance. I like it slightly better than the excellent 2014. 81% cabernet sauvignon, 4% petit verdot, 7% cabernet franc, 6% merlot and 2% malbec. Drink or hold. Score - 98. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 17, 2018)
By:: Robert Mondavi & Baron Philippe de Rothschild

title: Domaine Ponsot Chapelle-Chambertin Grand Cru 2017
Description: A pure and inviting bouquet of plums, raspberries, rose petals and peonies introduces Ponsot's 2017 Chapelle-Chambertin Grand Cru, a full-bodied, satiny wine that's concentrated and incisive, retaining all the suppleness and charm it displayed in barrel but having gained additional depth and reserve with further élevage and some time in bottle. This has turned out brilliantly and will merit a dozen years' bottle age to really show all its potential, even if it will be approachable sooner. Score - 95. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Feb. 13, 2020)

title: Château Croix de Labrie 2006
Description: A typically opulent, flamboyant, and extravagantly rich for a 2006, this tiny garagiste operation has fashioned a gorgeously sexy 2006 boasting sweet creme de cassis notes intermixed with kirsch, coffee, and subtle smoked herb and toast characteristics in the background. Full-bodied, round, and delicious, it is impossible to resist, so enjoy it over the next 8-10 years. Great value. Score - 94. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Feb. 24. 2009)

title: Skouras Fleva Syrah 2018
Description: A nose rich in aromas and focused on dark fruits, such as blackberries, black cherries and plums, followed by multiple layers of black pepper, liquorice, cloves, thyme, laurel leaves, hints of truffle, black chocolate and tobacco. The palate displays aromatic width, nerve and acidity.

title: Gran Maestoso Primitivo 2017
Description: (Translated from the Italian) ... there is an absolute fusion of warmth and fragrance, power and sophistication, impulse and depth of expression in this great wine ... There is the power and density of expression, a roundness in taste, a balance of composition that gives everything an embracing softness, of perfect sophistication of flavour ... A great wine, of exceptional agricultural and oenological value. Absolutely one of the best red Italian wines of the year. Score - 98. (Luca Maroni, lucamaroni.com, June 6, 2019)

title: Mauro Veglio Barolo 2015
Description: The nose is swathed in ripe red cherries and berries with attractive vanillin and cedary oak influence. The palate has a smoothly succulent thread of fine, fresh tannins that carry raspberries and ripe red cherries. Approachable now. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Assuli Besi Nero D'Avola Terre Siciliane 2016
Description: 91 points Vinous 'Dark ruby-red. Bright floral, flinty licorice and dark plum aromas and flavors. Smooth and rather suave, with a refined mouthfeel and a lingering floral closure. A lovely Nero d'Avola that clocks in with plenty of flavor...'

title: Assuli Lorando Nero D'Avola Terre Siciliane 2017
Description: 90 points Vinous 'Deep blue-red color. Ink, blueberry and sassafras on the enticing nose. Then tactile and rich but lively, with delightful easy to drink quality. A very pretty wine the aromas and flavors of which linger long on the aftertaste.'

title: Fita Preta Palpite Red Reserva Alentejo 2017
Description: 93 points Wine Advocate 'The 2017 Palpite Reserva is a blend of 42% Aragonez, 38% Alicante Bouschet, 12% Trincadeira and 8% Touriga Nacional, aged for 18 months in 30% new French oak. It comes in at 15% alcohol this year. This adds Trincadeira to the blend this year. It is still remarkably flavorful and then adds plenty of power. All the while, it is showing fine concentration, big bursts of flavor and superb structure.'

title: E.Pira e Figli Barolo Mosconi 2015
Description: 97 points James Suckling 'Aromatic depth here, drawing you in with cascading layers of flowers and leaves, fresh-tilled earth laced with woody spices, white pepper and fresh red fruit. The palate carries a very sturdy frame of fine, dense tannins. This is placed in the top league of 2015 Barolo wines. Long and succulent build through the finish.'
By:: Azienda Agricola E. Pira E Fig

title: E.Pira e Figli Barolo Via Nuova 2015
Description: 95 points James Suckling 'This delivers a fresh and vibrant impression on the nose with ripe red cherries and a deep-set, rose perfume. The palate has impressive power and focus with chiseled, driving tannins that cut a straight line of pure, red and black-cherry flavor. Long and assertive in 2015.'
By:: Azienda Agricola E. Pira E Fig

title: Liegenfeld Zweigelt Classic 2018
Description: Fine spicy nose with intense fruit aromas of cherry; velvet soft classic.

title: Encostas do Peso Douro Red 2018
Description: Ruby colour. Aroma with nuances of red fruits. Round in the mouth with a persistent finish.

title: Heinrich Blaufrankisch Burgenland 2017
Description: Refreshing red-berried fruit meets piquant herbal spice and invigorating pepperiness. Its delineated, compact body swings in cophasal harmony with fine-grained, soft tannins and a delicate, animating acid nerve.

title: Heinrich Pinot Noir Freyheit 2017
Description: 91 points John Szabo (Wine Align) '...It's still a touch reductive, and tannins are tightly wrapped around a core of firm acids, giving an overall dusty texture. Fruit extract and density are certainly up to the measure, with the necessary concentration and density to live on to engage in the early-mid-twenties. Length is very good to excellent. A fine and chalky example all in all.'

title: Matchbook Estate Bottled Red Gravel Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: ***LATE ARRIVAL. PRODUCT NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE.***This has quite an uplifting and floral nose - very pleasing. On the palate it's dry and tannic but balanced and fresh. There's a complex mix of dark fruit and cassis with vanilla and milk chocolate tones. Good concentration and intensity. A wine for steak or grilled lamb burgers. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Niepoort Poeirinho Tinto Bairrada 2016
Description: 92 James Suckling 'Cherries, flowers and fresh herbs, such as lemon grass, follow through to a full body, firm and chewy tannins and a crisp and vivid finish. Drink or hold.'

title: DogRidge MVP Petit Verdot 2014
Description: The first vintage of Petit Verdot since 2005, this is a rare treat!  The 2014 vintage displays bright aromatics of vanilla and spice, while on the palate, dark fruits and silky tannins feature and delight.  A truly elegant and balanced beauty.

title: Couteiro Mor Red 2018
Description: Very intense red fruits aroma and some floral notes. Very round in mouth with soft tannins and licorice finish.

title: Indelevel VT IGP Alentejo 2018
Description: The result is a ruby colour wine with mature fruit aromas; the palate is well balanced with a smooth and warm structure.

title: Monte do Pintor Red 2017
Description: The best years offer us some grapes with exceptional concentrations that are defining of such a distinct terroir. Complex aromas of dark fruit with notes of spice and cocoa arouses attention to a special wine with solid but silky tannins and a long and challenging persistence.

title: Monte do Pintor Red 2017
Description: This Monte do Pintor is the full expression of the grape varieties that compound this blend after ageing 10 months in French oak casks. Shows concentrated aromas of black fruit jam and spices, in a fresh well-balanced blend. Finishes elegant and persistent.

title: Monte do Pintor Reserva 2017
Description: The best years offer us some grapes with exceptional concentrations that are defining of such a distinct terroir. Complex aromas of dark fruit with notes of spice and cocoa arouses attention to a special wine with solid but silky tannins and a long and challenging persistence.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank Old Vines Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Medium intensity with flavours of smoked meats, sour cherry and earthy notes. The elegant spiciness of the European oak enhances the complexity of this well rounded and long wine. Pair with lean Beef (filet), roasted duck, mushrooms, grilled chicken, veal chops, grilled tuna, pork tenderloin, fennel.

title: Stanley Red Wine 2017
Description: Elegant wine with great balance and structure, intense colour where the balance between the ripe fruit and the wood is notorious. The palate is voluminous, with soft tannins, long finish.

title: Quarisa Mrs Q McLaren Vale Shiraz 2016
Description: This wine smells brash. It starts with vanilla custard then moves into blackberry pie filling, while a mineral tone emerges with time in the glass. Voluptuous and concentrated on the palate, this sensuous wine has a well-balanced structure of fine, sculpted tannins and scintillatingly bright acidity. The long finish turns a touch dry with oak-driven tannins. This needs time to reveal its many layers, but it's pleasant to drink now with rich red meat dishes. Drink now-2025.  Score - 92. (Wine Enthusiast Importer Connection, Jan. 14, 2019)
