title: I Balzi Nero d'Avola 2018
Description: There's a lot of wine here for the price, with richly articulated red and black fruit, tobacco, cocoa, coffee, and pepper spice. Refined tannins give structure, while the acidity offers nice balance. This is a wine to pair with venison or ripening cheeses.  (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Quinta Nova Grainha Tinto Reserva 2017
Description: A blend of Tinto Cão, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. This spends 7 months in French and Hungarian oak. It's fruity and floral, with a bit of spice from the barrels. Toasty and full on the palate this is showing nicely now and will hold in the cellar for a bit.
By:: Quinta Nova De Nossa Senhora D

title: Quinta Nova Grande Reserva Douro 2017
Description: 96-98 points Wine Advocate '...mostly a Touriga Nacional, with 25% from a field blend of old vines. It was aged for 12 months in 80% new French oak and comes in at 14.2% alcohol...Simply sensational on the nose, this is Touriga in full flight. While this has some elegance in the mid-palate, elsewhere it stands out. The aromatics are pungent, as noted, but the structure is exceptional too. Powerful and gripping?but never too astringent?this is built to age, develop and become more complex in time...There were 375 cases produced.'
By:: Quinta Nova De Nossa Senhora D

title: Château Monbousquet 2015
Description: A rich, expressive, slightly showy style, with waves of cassis, creamed raspberry and boysenberry fruit racing forth, backed by a polished yet ample structure. The long, licorice- and ganache-framed finish packs on weight as it moves along, yet stays defined and pure. Impressive. Best from 2022 through 2040. Ranked #16 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 of 2018. Score - 95. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, March 31, 2018)

title: Quinta Nova Referência 2017
Description: 94-96 points Wine Advocate 'The 2017 Grande Reserva Referência is the Tinta Roriz-dominated blend, the last 25% being a field blend from old vines. It was aged for 12 months in 70% new French oak...this is both very tight and very bright, with very appealing freshness. Tight, closed and stern, this is going to need some time to show its stuff. Then, it should age for a couple of decades or more. There were 375 cases produced.'
By:: Quinta Nova De Nossa Senhora D

title: Luis Seabra Indie Xisto Red Douro 2017
Description: This is a single-vineyard bottling from 30% Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo), 30% Touriga Franca, 10% Tinta Amarela, 5% Tinta Barroca, 5% Rufete, 5% Touriga Brasileira, 5% Donzelinho Tinto, 5% Malvasia Preta, & 5% Touriga Feme. Aged in old French oak barrels, the wine has a unbelievable depth and purity based around bright fruit, minerality and soft tannins. Notes of cassis, currant, cherry, and tobacco leaf showcase the best pf Portuguese terroir.

title: Mocali Brunello di Montalcino 2013
Description: Ripe cherry, plum and violet aromas and flavors highlight this supple, fruity red. Racy and elegant, showing terrific harmony and a long, fruit-, tobacco- and mineral-laced aftertaste. Best from 2022 through 2043.  Score - 95. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, June 15, 2019)
By:: Az. Agr. Mocali Di Ciacci Tiziano

title: Luigi Righetti Valpolicella Classic 2018
Description: Medium ruby; predominantly fruity aromas bursting with fresh cherries and a hint of almond; dry and light-medium bodied with fresh acidity and concentrated red cherry flavours, violets and a hint of white pepper; clean finish.

title: Gaia Monograph Agiorgitiko 2019
Description: Selected from vineyards in the hills surrounding Nemea. The yields in these semi-mountainous vineyards at a 500 m altitude are relatively low and never exceed 12,000 kg per hectare. The wine is thoroughly enjoyable to drink with, aromas of medium intensity that show prickly pear, pomegranate and butterscotch. The palate is round and very smooth, with soft tannins and a fruity aftertaste.

title: Rapariga da Quinta Tinto 2017
Description: This wine has a jammy character that is balanced by the intense black fruits and acidity. It is structured, juicy and firm.

title: Caliterra Tributo Single Vineyard Carmenère 2017
Description: Blueberry and slate aromas with hints of flowers follow through to a medium body, firm and juicy tannins and a flavorful finish. Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2019)

title: Monte del Frá Lena di Mezzo Valpolicella Classico 2018
Description: Ripe red-berry and vanilla aromas shape the inviting nose. The juicy light-bodied palate offers strawberry jam, cinnamon and white pepper alongside smooth velvety tannins. Enjoy soon. Editors' Choice. Score - 90. (Kerin O'Keefe, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2020)

title: Catena Zapata Fortuna Terrae Adrianna Vineyard Malbec 2014
Description: This is another phenomenal Fortuna Terrae that just rolls across the palate with amazingly complex and beautiful fruit. Full body yet tight and refined. Berry, light meat, mushroom and truffle character. Made from organically grown grapes. Love now. Score - 98. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, July 18, 2019)

title: Barbera d'Asti DOCG Sens 2018
Description: Made with 100% Barbera grapes. Ruby red in colour with purple hues. Fruity, not particularly complex, but clear-cut. Simple, pleasant, with medium persistence and a marked acidity. Serve with entrées, white meats, medium-ripe cheeses.

title: Château Pichon-Longueville Baron 2009
Description: The 2009 Pichon-Longueville Baron has a medium to deep garnet color and a very meaty/savory nose over a core of sweaty leather, baked blackberries and plums with notions of crème de cassis, sautéed herbs and black olives coming through with coaxing. Full, rich, concentrated and decadently fruited in the mouth, the palate has beautifully plush tannins and an herbal lift on the long finish. Drink date: 2020-2048. Score - 96. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 14, 2019)

title: Château Léoville Poyferré 1996
Description: This fabulous 1996 was tasted three times from bottle, and it is unquestionably the finest wine produced by this estate since their blockbuster 1990. Medium to full-bodied, with a saturated black/purple color, the nose offers notes of cedar, jammy black fruits, smoke, truffles, and subtle new oak. In the mouth, there is impressive fruit extraction, a tannic, full-bodied structure, and a classic display of power and finesse. The longer it sat in the glass, the more impressive the wine became. Backward, and massive in terms of its extract and richness, this should prove to be a sensational Leoville-Poyferre for drinking over the next three decades. Anticipated maturity: 2007-2028. Score - 93. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, April 22, 1999)

title: Château Troplong Mondot 2010
Description: Deep garnet in color, the 2010 Troplong Mondot explodes with beautiful floral notes of red roses and candied violets over a core of plum preserves, kirsch and blueberry pie with a waft of bouquet garni. Full-bodied, rich and decadently fruited, it has bags of plush tannins and just enough freshness, finishing very long and sinfully hedonic. Drink date: 2020-2045. Score - 98. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 5, 2020)

title: Tamaral Reserva Ribera del Deuro 2014
Description: 91 points James Suckling 'This has a strong thread of spiced oak and mocha on the nose with some meaty nuances and abundant, ripe dark berries. The palate has a bold, chewy feel and packs plenty of rich dark-fruit flavor.'

title: Domaine De Chevalier 2010
Description: Dark fruits such as raspberries and blueberries with subtle perfume on the nose. Full body, with super well-integrated tannins and a fresh and clean finish. Racy young wine. Shows classy structure and richness. Try in 2018. Score - 96. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 2, 2013)

title: Château Clos du Marquis 2009
Description: Rich yet firmly structured this is a very classic St.-Julien that's generous and polished with so much energy driving the long plush finish. Delicious now, but should hold for many years.  Score - 95. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, March 20, 2019)

title: Quinta da Foz Reserva 2015
Description: Intense, deep violet colour. The nose displays great complexity. Jammy red and black fruits are supported by subtle damson, floral notes. Ageing from French barriques lends spice and smoky aromas to the bouquet. The palate is intense, ripe fruits with elegant tannins that persist, with acidity to balance, offering freshness, elegance and a well-rounded mouthfeel to the wine. A wine with excellent potential for ageing.

title: Barossa Valley Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Fragrant black plum, fresh berry fruits and cinnamon spice, leading to a silky cocoa centre.

title: Terra De Lobos Red 2017
Description: Bright purple with a floral scent and aromas of ripe red fruits, berries and spices. Mild in flavour, fruity, complex and rich. Final finish is velvety and persistent. Serve between 16ºC and 18ºC and pair with meat dishes, grilled cheese and pasta.

title: San Pietro Monferrato Rosso Nero Organic 2017
Description: A blend of Albarossa, Barbera, and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes. The organic and biodynamic methods used to produce this wine really let the grapes show off their purity. Lots of red and dark berries coming out of the glass, this is an easy to approach and refreshing number from Italy's north west.
By:: Tenuta San Pietro In Tassarolo Az.

title: The Federalist Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: ***LATE ARRIVAL. PRODUCT NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE.***This is crafted in a ripe, oaky, powerful style. Layers of complex blackberry, red fruit, spice and sweet oak abound. Exceptionally well-priced. For fans of the style, this will be a sure-fire hit. Pair with grilled ribs.  (Vintages panel, Nov. 2019)
By:: Paterno Imports Ltd Dba Terlato Win

title: Corazon del Sol Gran Reserva Malbec 2015
Description: 91 points Wine Advocate 'The very oaky, dark and concentrated 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec reminded me of the wines from the turn of the century, but fortunately, the palate showed a lot more freshness than expected. It's showy and aromatic. For fans of the style.'

title: Carmen Gran Reserva Syrah 2018
Description: Intense and very rich with freshness at the same time, showing meat, black-tea and wet-earth character. Medium to full body. Flavorful finish. Yet, it's tight and focused. Drink or hold. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 17, 2020)

title: Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino 2013
Description: The deep, rich red-plum nose sucks you into this powerful Brunello that has great fruit and polished, dry tannins that are beautifully in synch. Long, intense and rather complex finish. A great food wine for tonight, but this has the structure to hold for up to a decade. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Sept. 11, 2018)

title: Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino 2015
Description: The Col d'Orcia 2015 Brunello di Montalcino (made with organic fruit) has a very distinctive aromatic profile with subtle hints of rusty iron and moist potting soil. However, this wine also shows an impressive evolution in the glass with those earthy and sanguine notes lifting to reveal sweet oak tones of vanilla and baking spice that remain pronounced in a second underlayer. To me, Col d'Orcia's wines are almost always characterized by a medicinal or balsamic element, and the primary fruit is downplayed as a result. This vintage puts on a good show with wild berry, blackcurrant and dried blackberry. That said, this wine is more ethereal and spicy than it is fruity per se. Drink Date: 2021-2038. Score - 93. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Jan. 31, 2020)

title: Tenuta Buon Tempo Brunello di Montalcino 2015
Description: Aromas of dried strawberries, blackberries and light cloves follow through to a medium to full body, firm and chewy tannins and a flavorful finish. Tight and rich. Give it a year to two to open. Try after 2021. Score - 94. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)
By:: Tenuta Del Buon Tempo Soc. Agr. Srl

title: Erzetic Crna Rebula 2017
Description: This autochthonous varietal almost went extinct, with only small plantings of it in Friuli and Brda. It can be rustic and difficult to love if not handled with care, but Erzetic has crafted some gorgeous examples of it. Notes of black plum, garrigue, violets and white pepper. Aged 50% in large old oak barrels and 50% in newer barriques, it is full bodied and balanced, with fresh acidity and perceptible, but silky tannins. Blackberry, baking spices and mocha lead to a long, fruit-driven finish. Drinking beautifully now, this will reward cellaring for a decade or more if you wish to see how it evolves.

title: Schiopetto Merlot Des Rosis IGT 2015
Description: Garnet-violet coloured Merlot with a warm scent of crunchy plums and ripe blackberries, along with earthy nuances and a hint of clove. Slim but full-bodied on the palate, all components wonderfully harmonious.

title: Domaine Dujac Echezeaux Grand Cru 2018
Description: Dark berry, cassis, cherry and dried flowers, with gentle smoke notes and a hint of chocolate. Lively and well-defined. Drink 2024-2045.[Tim Atkin, MW, did not include a tasting note.] Score - 95. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Burgundy Special Report 2018)

title: Esk Valley Syrah 2018
Description: Ripe tannins and long, languid flavours grace this well-made Syrah, with inviting aromatics of berry and plum embellished by spice and pepper notes.

title: Rocca delle Macìe Roccato 2015
Description: Very nicely done on the nose with a wealth of brambleberries, dark cherries, mocha, dark chocolate, licorice and bay leaf. Full-bodied and really delicious, carrying layers of dark fruit through succulent and polished tannins. Drink from 2021. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Domaine la Décelle Réserve Valréas 2017
Description: 50% Grenache, 50% Syrah. Leather, pepper, red berry fruit and floral perfume. Lovely texture with fine, elegant tannins and abundant strawberry, smoky and raspberry flavours. Very long, silky and insistent finish. It all works very well. Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Remo Farina Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2017
Description: Big, rich, robust flavours are the calling card of this popular Amarone. This food-friendly wine is always a hit, and the large format makes it perfect for family dinners.

title: Vega Canada Crianza 2015
Description: Bright cherry. The nose is mature and intense, with roasted and balsamic hints. Soft, velvety tannins and well-integrated ripe fruit.

title: Chianti Classico DOCG 2016
Description: Deep ruby red colour. Fresh and vivid with aromas of marasca cherry, pomegranate and notes of violets and spices. The palate is balanced, smooth, with fine tannins and a long harmonious aftertaste.

title: Castel Sallegg Lagrein 2018
Description: Crimson with purple reflexes. A wine with character and the seductive fragrance of ripe black currant, plum, a hint of elderberry and liquorice, complemented by a delicate herbal note. Strong, distinctly tannic with a fruity finish.

title: Castel Sallegg Pinot Nero 2018
Description: Medium ruby colour with garnet hues. Typically clean aroma with a mildly earthy note. Red berries, cherry and spices on the nose. Smooth, well-rounded flavour. Balanced and medium-bodied. Fresh, tannic and lingering finish.

title: Château du Chatelard Cuvée Les Vieux Granits Fleurie 2018
Description: Celebrating the granitic soil of the northern Beaujolais, this young wine is strongly mineral in texture. Firm tannins and dark black fruits are lit by perfumes and rich black-plum flavors. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2021 [or decant for one hour and enjoy tonight]. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2020)

title: Canoe Ridge The Expedition Merlot 2017
Description: Sleek and supple, with vibrant cherry, lead pencil and tomato leaf accents that build richness toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2024. Smart Buy. Score - 91. (Tim Fish, winespectator.com, Oct. 31, 2019)

title: Lacrau Reserva Red 2015
Description: Wine with good depth and aromatic complexity. Gluttonous, medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a spicy side which gives it elegance.

title: Manoir du Carra Beaujolais Villages 2017
Description: The vineyards of Manoir du Carra date back to 1850. The property is now run by Jean-Noël Sambardier, the fifth generation of his family to oversee winemaking here. Expect a ripe, juicy wine, with red and black fruit framed by spice and a touch of earthiness. Pair with grilled salmon.[The Concours des Vins Macon did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Concours des Vins Macon, 2018)

title: McManis Petite Sirah 2018
Description: Lodi has become famous for its Zinfandel, but there's much more going on here. Petite Sirah is often used to add colour and structure to Zin, and as demonstrated here, it makes a fine single varietal as well. This one has a plush texture, with complex dark fruit and a touch of spice. A wine for barbecued beef. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2019)

title: Dreissigacker Spätburgunder Organic 2016
Description: From organic, hand-harvested Pinot Noir, wild-yeast fermented for 3 weeks and then aged for 24 months in 1/3 new oak, and 2/3 used oak barriques. Bright ruby red, with elegant red berry notes, palate is extremely refined with great balance between fruit, structure and oak, serve on its own and as a match to lamb, pork, and roasted wild salmon. Age for the next 10 years.

title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Touriga Nacional 2017
Description: A concentrated, garnet-coloured wine. An aroma reminiscent of very ripe dark fruit preserves and jams, with a light, floral touch typical of this grape variety. Velvety and full on the palate, with soft, well integrated tannins. A long and persistent finish.

title: Donnata Nero D'Avola 2018
Description: An aromatic and distinct wine where fragrant and wholesome notes of blackberry, cherry, Mediterranean shrubs, nutmeg and chocolate vie with each other. On the palate, intense, lively and with character. Donnata is soft yet pulsating and extremely pleasant to drink. The finish is harmonious, silky with enduring determination.

title: Dagueneau Pinot Noir Cotes de La Charite 2018
Description: Opens up with a very aromatic, slightly caramelly and toasty bouquet of sweet red fruits along with lemon and floral notes. Full-bodied, fruity, round and fresh, with a dense yet silky texture, this wine has a nice purity and firm tannin structure.

title: Guy Barge St Joseph Coteaux Legende 2016
Description: Deep brilliant ruby. Vibrant cherry and black currant aromas are complemented by black pepper, violet and olive nuances. Taut and structured on entry and then more fleshy in the midpalate, offering fresh dark berry and bitter cherry flavors sweetened by a suave floral pastille accent. Shows very good lift and delineation on the gently tannic finish, which hangs on with strong, floral-dominated persistence. Score 90, Josh Reynolds, Sept 2019

title: Guy Barge Cote-Rotie Le Combard 2016
Description: Le Combard's terroir produces a particularly savory peppery quality which marries beautifully with the floral character of its 8% Viognier. The result is an intensely aromatic Côte Rôtie that's unlike any other. Barge's 2016 Cote Rotie le Combard is one of the stars of the vintage, delivering violets and herbal tea on the nose, black cherry fruit on the palate and a kaleidoscopic blend of them all on the finish. It's medium to full-bodied, supple and creamy in texture and, simply put, a must-purchase for lovers of Côte Rôtie. Score 94-96, www.eRobertParker, Oct 2018

title: Louis M. Martini Lot 1 Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Broad-shouldered and dense, with very ripe waves of raspberry, plum and boysenberry reduction flavors coursing through, inlaid with singed vanilla, apple wood and sweet tobacco accents. Cuts a wide swath through the finish, with the fruit powering through in unison with the toast and a tug of loam. A big 'un. Best from 2020 through 2030. Score - 94. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Feb. 28, 2019)

title: Guy Barge Cote du Rhone Coteaux Legende
Description: A Cotes du Rhone from the Northern Rhone is unique. Made from 100% Syrah. Black berries, plum and smoked meat on the nose, with dark fruit and slate on the palate. Prominent tannins and bright acidity make this an excellent food match but pretty drinkable stand alone too. Think of it as declassified Cote-Rotie.

title: Terras do Po Red 2019
Description: A ruby-coloured wine that is concentrated, rich in good-quality tannins and very complex. With aromas reminiscent of mature red fruit, it is well matched by the wood which endows it with a touch of vanilla. A persistent, long-lasting finish.

title: Luberri Monje Amestoy Reserva Rioja 2015
Description: This is 100% Tempranillo with aromas of raspberry and cherry accented by a hint of fresh flowers. Sappy and gently sweet on the palate, offering energetic, deep flavours of red and dark berries. Closes gently tannic and long, leaving a subtle note of white pepper behind.

title: Château Malescot-Saint-Exupéry 2014
Description: Dark currants and berries with walnuts on the nose. Follows through to a full body, integrated tannins and a gorgeous finish. Exciting. Wow. Drink in 2020. Score - 96. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 13, 2017)

title: Fontanafredda Riserva Barolo 1967
Description: Along with 1955 and 1961,1967 is considered to be one of the finest vintages for Barolo in the 20th century. Barolo is one of the most compelling and collectible of all wines. Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your collection with this limited offering of one of the very best of the best.

title: Sella & Mosca Terre Rare Riserva 2015
Description: ***LATE ARRIVAL. PRODUCT NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE.***Carignano (Carignan) is well-known as an important component in the blends of Southern France, notably in Languedoc-Roussillon, but in Sardinia it shines as a single varietal. The Carignano del Sulcis DOC requires wines be 100% Carignano. Expect this example to show intense, concentrated red fruit and possess great freshness, lifted floral notes and a characterful underlying spice. A great wine for grilled lamb or Spanish-style chicken dishes.

title: Cellier des Dauphins Réserve 2018
Description: 70% Grenache, 30% Syrah. This is delicious! Very classy and appealing aromas of flowers, garrigue, spice and forest floor. On the palate sweet vanilla oak marries into the charming and svelte herbal, red and blue fruit mix. It's full of flavour, super supple, super drinkable and authentic. Bouquet, taste, finish: all are magnificent. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Lenz Moser Selection Blaufrankisch 2018
Description: Fine spicy blackberry aromas, fruity in taste, powerful and rich in tannins.

title: L'Arco Principe Del Sole Sangiovese 2017
Description: Intense ruby red colour with purple, lustrous and brilliant reflexes. Elegant with clean aromas of red fruits like cherry and blackberry. Intense, soft, balanced and fresh with remarkable aromatic persistence.

title: Principe Del Sole Chianti DOCG 2018
Description: Intense deep ruby red colour with fragrant and healthy fruit aromas of cherries and raspberries. This is followed by lighter, more complex hints of licorice and coffee. Velvety sweet tannins with a fruity and lingering finish making this an extremely enjoyable wine. Pair with pasta, aged and semi-aged cheeses, lamb chops, steak, roast pork, game meat.

title: Il Palagio Di Piccini Monia Chianti Classico DOCG 2016
Description: Bright ruby red colour with fairly intense cherry notes, fine hints of red fruits and a unique earthy nose. Finely structured, well balanced, with good acidity and rich, smooth tannins.
By:: Az. Agr. Il Palagio Di Piccini Moni

title: Frey-Sohler Pinot Noir Organic 2018
Description: The Frey-Sohler estate has evolved through several generations, all intimately linked with the village and the wines of Alsace. Organic wine with ruby colour. Light with a nice length, this Pinot Noir is full of red fruits! To be enjoyed in the next few years with cheese or pies for example.

title: Chateau Haut-Myles Medoc Cru Bourgeois 2016
Description: This wine is 60 % Merlot Noir, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon with 12 months in a mixture of new and old oak. Deep, ruby colour. The nose is complex, with lush aromas of ripe berries. On the palate expect a wine that is round yet powerful with medium body and a lot of dark fruit, elegant mineral notes and lush tannins.

title: Governo all'Uso Toscano IGT Rosso 2017
Description: Deep ruby red colour with an elegant and fine bouquet of red berries and a delicate vanilla finish. Full bodied red wine, rich and creamy, with bold tannins and a long, lightly spiced finish.
By:: Tenuta Di Artimino Soc. Agr. Srl

title: Il Palagio Di Piccini Monia Chianti Classico Riserva DOCG 2015
Description: Bright ruby red with a pretty intense aroma and persistent flavour notes of red fruits, cherries, raspberries, and notes of spices. Finely structured, well balanced, and fresh with smooth tannins.
By:: Az. Agr. Il Palagio Di Piccini Moni

title: Chateau Bardoulet Saint Emilion Grand Cru 2015
Description: A blend of 85% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Cabernet Franc with aging for 12 months in barriques. The Merlot gives a plush and round mouthfeel, with red berries and some forest floor, while the Cabernet brings a certain tannic heft to help give some cellaring potential. This wine is now deliciously mature. Fine tannins give support to black fruits, with mushroom and spice flavors that signify a wine at its peak. The wine is ready to drink now. Score 91, Editor's Choice, Wine Enthusiast, January 2020

title: Chateau German Marbuzet St. Estephe 2016
Description: Blend of 55% de Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% de Merlot et 10% de Cabernet Franc. Deep, brilliant crimson in colour, with hints of ruby. The nose is fine and expressive, in a heady floral style (jasmine, rose), combined with crunchy black fruits (blackcurrant, blueberry). Grilled notes when swirled. The balance of the wine is marked by the freshness of liquorice, which complements a full-bodied and delicious note of blackcurrants. Slight hint of coconut and vanilla in the finish. Score 93-94, James Suckling Bordeaux en premier

title: Vins Nus No 6 Alter Ego 2015
Description: '94 points Wine Enthusiast ''Powerful tannins initially show in this perfumed wine. Behind them lie velvety-smooth blackcurrant fruit. The wine is pure, open and will age well over a medium term. It will be ready to drink from 2025. (RV)'' (4/2018)'

title: Les Charmes de Kirwan Margaux 2015
Description: Charmes de Kirwan, as the second wine of the great Château Kirwan, made from younger vines tends to be a fuller style of Margaux - rich in brambly fruit with the hallmark smoothness of the Margaux appellation. Delightful to drink between now and 2024.

title: Calera Selleck Vineyard Mount Harlan Pinot Noir 2001
Description: This is the most accessible of Calera's current single-vineyard releases, a real charmer with its creamy cherry, mocha and oaky vanilla flavors. But don't be misled, it's an ager. Acidity is big, tannins are sturdy, balance is fine. As with all Calera Pinots, this wine is elegantly structured. Score - 91. (Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2005)

title: Chateau Le Crock Saint Estephe 2013
Description: Second wine of Chateau Le Crock, a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Dense, dark garnet colour. Notes of cassis, violet, mocha, vanilla, spices and licorice. Strong tannins reaching maturity slowly, with black fruits, a note of freshness, often a woody or smoky aspect and a floral touch.

title: Chateau Lynsolence St Emilion Grand Cru 2005
Description: Very black in colour; very concentrated and fruit forward; The nose is creamy, with notes of cashew and morello cherry, bursting with fruit. 'It's a real fruit bomb' (says Robert Parker); In the mouth, it is supple, full, fat, silky full bodied and well built. It finishes very long.

title: Francois Feuillet Nuits St Georges 2012
Description: Colour is deep ruby with garnet reflections. A nose of black and red fruits with a dominant of strawberries and white pepper. The mouth is rich supported by very present tannins. Finish is long.

title: Geantet Pansiot Gevrey Chambertin Vieilles Vignes 2012
Description: A mature Burgundy showing all the complexity of these old vines. A classy Gevrey that shows intense fruit with a delicacy that can only be achieved in Burgundy. The palate is concentrated, fine and delicate with discreet tannins and perfect harmony ... Magnificent!

title: Anselmo Mendes Vinhao 2019
Description: Intense in colour with purple reflections. Aromatic, lively with notes of floral and fruit. Well balanced with a lot of structure, strong tannins but without being aggressive.

title: Raffault Chinon Rouge Clos d'Isore 2017
Description: 16.5 points (out of 20) Jancis Robinson 'A monopole of 3ha originally planted in 1938 (20% replanted), this is a more ambitious wine than Les Galuches but needs a bit more time. West-facing slope of clay limestone. Malo in oak casks of one to five years in age. Then a year on fine lees before bottling. Straight to the cellar with this one.'

title: Raffault Chinon Rouge Clos L'Hospice 2017
Description: Pungent bouquet of wild red fruits, licorice and aged beef. Nicely focused on the palate, offering bitter cherry and redcurrant flavours, with the tannins building slowly on the back. Well-structured and substantial but light on its feet, this Cabernet Franc finishes with resonating spice character.

title: Pavillon de Léoville Poyferré Saint Julien 2016
Description: Second wine of Léoville Poyferré. Balanced and easy drinking it reveals the fruity character and the finesse of the Grand vin. Dark color, intense and purple. Intense bouquet, fine and perfumed. Delicate on the palate, the wine caresses and evolves juicy, suave and very aromatic. Beautiful persistante finish.

title: Chateau Lagrange Saint Julien 2010
Description: Deep and intense colour; red and black fruit aromas, toasted and vanilla notes. In the nose, impression of freshness; firm in mouth and increasing with an exceptional tannic richness. Powerful, smooth and harmonious tannins.

title: Fifth Realm McLaren Vale Shiraz 2016
Description: Deep dark purple. The nose exhibits aromas of ripe blackberry and dark plum followed by some liquorice and confectionary notes. Full bodied and possessing a plump texture the palate delivers rich juicy flavours of ripe blackberry, dark chocolates, liquorice and spice. Soft velvety tannins. Good depth with medium to long aftertaste of blackberry, dark chocolate and spice.

title: Calera Selleck Vineyard Mount Harlan Pinot Noir 2002
Description: This is the palest and lightest of Calera's '02 Pinots, but paradoxically it's enormously concentrated in flavor and possible the most ageworthy. It explodes with cherry cola, cherry pie filling, raspberry, blueberry, cocoa-dusted latte and cinnamon-nutmeg spice. But it has the depth and balance for the long haul. Best now through 2012. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 1, 2006)
By:: Delas Vins A St Jean De Muzols

title: Le Marquis de Calon-Ségur Saint Estephe 2016
Description: Deliciously easy-drinking, silky and expressive, its charm comes to the fore, while at the same time bringing to our minds the elegance of the Grand Vin.

title: Longview Fresco 2019
Description: A highly intriguing blend of Nebbiolo (37%), Pinot Nero (33%), Sangiovese (24%) and Barbera (6%) sourced entirely form Longview's single-vineyard at Macclesfield. All fruit is cane pruned, shoot thinned early and bunch thinned up to three times during the growing season to control yields. All varieties were cold-fermented separately, left on lees with full malolactic conversion. The result is a young, vibrant and fresh wine with an amazing perfume of fresh berries overlaid by notes of rose petals and herbs. Mid-weight with refined tannins and zesty acids.

title: Calmel & Joseph L'Epicurius IGP Pays d'Oc 2019
Description: A gleaming wine of deep, intense purple red. Its aromas are powerful, with highly expressive exotic fruit derived from the Petit Verdot and a bouquet of spices that are characteristic of Malbec. This mingling of ripe fruit, spices and toasted notes results in a luscious, seductively smooth and superbly balanced wine. Exotic touches of grenadine, notes of violet, but also liquorice, plum and virginia tobacco complete the harmony of a blend that is highly unusual for our region, but eminently gluggable! A must try!

title: Rolet Arbois Rouge Pinot Noir 2014
Description: Pale tomato red. Attractive, confident, distinctive wine with a taste of pasture (in a good way). Real attack and life. Great spine and intensity.

title: Calmel & Joseph Villa Blanche Marselan 2018
Description: The colour, dense as always, that veers towards an inky, blackish violet, is an indicator of the generosity of this wine. Black fruit, quince and spices subtly intertwine to finish on superb jammy aromas. Mouth-filling and smooth, its notes of blackcurrant, blackberry, liquorice and spices are accompanied by powerful tannins that retain a magnificent and surprising freshness. The richly contrasted balance and originality of this grape variety, painstakingly crafted, cannot help but provoke emotion. Perfect for drinking throughout the seasons.

title: Pintas Character Red 2017
Description: Very rich and powerful red, with notes of raspberry, black cherry and plums. The long finish as velvety and well integrated tannins associated with freshness and beautiful ripe fruit. Food matches: A wine that pairs wonderfully with the rich and smoky characteristics of grilled meats. Richer meats, such as grilled lamb and beef chops, are an optimal pairing for the wine.

title: Domaine de L'R Chinon Les Cinq Elements
Description: The Domaine de L'R was founded by Frédéric Sigonneau in 2007, and it is already counted by Chinon amateurs among the ones where Cabernet Franc shines. This complex red has fine tannins and red berry notes ? strawberry, raspberry.

title: ER Etna Rosso DOP 2014
Description: Intense ruby colour. On the palate red fruits, cherry, leather with a balsamic note. Elegant, balanced, fresh, long lasting. Best served with red meats, cheese, salami.

title: Shannon Ridge High Elevation Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: This wine is definitely oaky, but in a good way, with baking spice aromas leading to mulled raspberry and cherry flavors that meld with a cocoa accent on the palate. A medium body and smooth tannins give just enough grip to the mouthfeel. Score - 90. (Jim Gordon, Wine Enthusiast, Nov. 1, 2019)

title: Quinta dos Termos Tinto 2016
Description: This blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Trincadeira offers pretty, floral aromas and ripe cherry and strawberry flavours, with plenty of ripe tannin and fresh acidity. A good value and quite an approachable style that will be great for grilled steak, ribs or burgers. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2019)[The Wine Masters Challenge did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Wine Masters Challenge, 2019)

title: Emiliana Novas Gran Reserva Pinot Noir 2018
Description: This shows really attractive pinot character, such as blueberries, tangerines, fresh herbs and redcurrants. Juicy and round on the palate, yet firm with tangy acidity. Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, April 5, 2019)

title: Toplou Syrah Aged 2012
Description: Monastic single variety Syrah from the organic vineyard of Toplou Monastery. Carefully vinified, ages for 12 months in new oak barrels. Well structured, it has a deep ruby colour and a unique bouquet with notes of wild rosewood, green pepper, blueberries and chocolate , full body with a rich flavour and a spicy aftertaste.

title: Pradurent Dolcetto D'Alba Superiore 2018
Description: Deep ruby red with little transparency. Intense, clean, pleasing and refined aromas that open with notes of cherry, plum and blueberry and are followed by nuances of violet, blackberry, strawberry, carob, vanilla and menthol. Good correspondence to the nose, prominent tannins, good body, intense flavors, very pleasing. The finish is persistent with recalls of cherry, plum and blueberry.

title: Alario Claudio Nebbiolo D'Alba Cascinotto DOC 2017
Description: A red wine with floral notes, dynamic and well-balanced.

title: Badel Plavac Hvar South Dalmatia Islad Hvar
Description: Plavac Hvar has a delicate varietal bouquet of fruitiness (plum, cherry) and is fresh and medium-bodied in flavour with ripe tannins.

title: Chateau des Annereaux-Lalande de Pomerol Organic 2014
Description: Organic vineyard. Blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this lalande de pomerol offers an intense garnet colour. Well structured and dense, the wood is well integrated, and you get notes of cherries and plum. Long refined finish. To be enjoyed now or in a few years.

title: 2015 Badel Korlat Syrah Benkovac-Stankovci
Description: This top quality red wine has deep, dark red and purple colours and a strong and rich structure. Intensively concentrated and seasoned with aromas of ripe berry fruits such as blackberry and black grapes. Strong complexity and personality of the bouquet are also complimented by well balanced aromas of coffee, black chocolate and a discreet aroma of tobacco. The wine is warm, balanced, permanent and ready to enjoy.

title: Vincent Latour Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Allen Meadows in Burghound describes it as follows: A toasty and distinctly earthy red berry fruit nose gives way to delicious, round and naturally sweet middle weight flavors that are delicious if rustic on the acceptably persistent finish. Delicious and easy-drinking, wide range of foods possible.

title: Badel Mediterano South Dalmatia Islad Hvar
Description: This top-quality wine is produced from the indigenous Plavac Mali variety grown on inland terraces of the island Hvar. The wine is dark ruby red in colour, fruity in fragrance, slightly dry, smoky and framed in soft tannin structure, and with a strong and rich body. Plavac Mediterano is vigorous and seductive. The Mediterranean in a bottle.

title: Badel Cuvee Benkovac Benkovac-Stankovci
Description: Cuvee Benkovac has a character of elegant wine with a smooth and fresh nature, nicely followed with notes of berry aromas as well as light spicy notes making this wine warm and well-balanced. The presence of tannin structure contributes to the mildly pronounced freshness and will safeguard the further wine quality and development in the bottle.

title: Domaine Ponsot Cuvée du Pinson Bourgogne 2017
Meyer McLean Creek Road Vineyard Pinot Noir 2018
Chamisal Morrito Pinot Noir 2016
Description: This bottling from a hillside block is powerful, attention-grabbing and deliciously balanced. Aromas of candied plum and exotic black cherry meet with piles of red and purple flowers on the nose. The palate shows both impact and depth, offering acid-powered flavors of hearty red fruit and dark star-anise spice. Score - 96. (Matt Kettman, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2019)

title: Domaine A.F. Gros Beaune 1er Les Sizies 2013
Description: Les Sizies 1er Cru covers 8.58 hectares and is planted to both Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The reds are generally described as medium weight and fruity, and best suited to short to medium term bottle aging. This wine is perfectly enjoyable and approachable now and made in the elegant and refined style AF Gros is known for.

title: Post House Blueish Black 2018
Description: Post House Blueish Black is a blend of Shiraz, Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It is a dark blueish black wine with good colour. It has a nose of mulberries, red currant and ripe strawberries with a hint of pepper and spice. A full bodied rich wine with supple soft tannins for easy drinking.

title: Sr. Nino Ribera del Duero 2019
Description: Intense ruby red with violet reflections. Elegant aromas of ripe fruits with shades of black berries, spices and flowers. Light body, complete, nice, fresh, clean, with flavours of ripe fruit and spicy tones. long, elegant finish.

title: Domaine A.F. Gros Beaune 1er Les Boucherottes 2012
Description: The Boucherottes name originally means 'thorny bushes' and signifies that the vineyard is and was surrounded by vegetation that is typical of poor, high clay content soils. These soils give lushness to the wine, with rich fruit, plump texture, and a firm structure. Allen Meadows' barrel tasting note: Discreet if not invisible wood frames a layered mix of various red berry fruit scents that display plenty of earth influence. There is an attractive vibrancy to the delicious and round flavors..(87-90) [drink] 2019+

title: Giglio Perricone IGP Biologico 2017
Description: Ruby red with purple reflections. Intense aromas of red berry, licorice and tabacco. Harmonious, persistent with pleasantly tannic notes. Pair with red meats, roasts.
By:: Cantine Giglio Sas Di Giglio Tommas

title: Domaine A.F. Gros Bourgogne Hautes Cotes de Nuits 2018
Description: Lovely Pinot character with medium full-bodied layers of cherry/berry fruit with round tannins, a fine balance of fruit and measured power.

title: Gabriel Meffre La Châsse Grande Réserve 2015
Description: This is lovely very classy Rhone blend of mostly grenache and syrah from the southern Rhone village of Vacqueras. The perfumed complex nose shows raspberry and candied red cherry with hints of tobacco, lemon, and warm spice. It is midweight, round and finely balanced with some firm tannin giving grip to the finish. Pure and clean with its power nicely tamed by soft acidity. Very good length. For fine dining with roast or grilled meats, or rich creamy cheese like Brie.  Score - 90. (Steve Thurlow, winealign.com, April 20, 2018)

title: Estampa Gold Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Syrah, 7% Carmenère. Opulent and inviting on the nose with pristine, pure fruit, then the lush palate has heat, spice and a delicious pepper edge. Score - 94. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Negretti Mirau Barolo 2012
Description: I like the rose petal and dried strawberry character with hints of cedar. Medium to full body, velvety tannins and a fruity aftertaste. Drink or hold. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 14, 2016)
By:: Azienda Agricola Negretti S.S Soc A

title: Vale de Lobos Syrah 2015
Description: The 2015 Syrah Vale de Lobos was aged for just three months in used French oak and comes in at 14% alcohol. Tightly wound and rather fresh, this Syrah is focused and precise, with some of those beefy overlays the grape tends to show in this style. I rather liked this lively Syrah a lot. It has fine mid-palate depth, even better structure and a lot of character. There's finesse, somehow with a little sex appeal. It could use another year or so in the cellar, as it is a bit tight, but it is still very approachable. It expands in the glass and develops over several hours. This is impressive, and it's a fine value. Drink date: 2019-2030. Score - 92. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, June 28, 2019)

title: Domaine Armand Rousseau Gevrey-Chambertin 2018
Description: The 2018 Gevrey-Chambertin Village opens in the glass with a deeper-pitched bouquet of red plums, wild berries, peonies, baking chocolate and sweet soil tones. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, textural and nicely concentrated, with powdery tannins, ripe acids and a long, sapid finish. This, too, is showing well. As usual, the communal Gevrey includes fruit from premiers crus Perrières and Etournelles Saint-Jacques. Score - 90-92. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: ESTREIA Vinhao Red Reserva 2018
Description: A Vinho Verde obtained exclusively from a rigorous selection of the most illustrious red grape variety of the Vinhos Verdes region - Vinhão. With an intense colour and red fruity flavour, its culinary versatility makes this red wine perfect with a variety of dishes.

title: Lescure Bourgogne Rouge Les Verduns 2017
Description: The wine shows elegant high-toned floral aromas of earthy cherry and strawberry with hints of spice, mint and rose petal. The palate is earthy and mineral with saline acidity with underlying spice, wild strawberry and black raspberry fruit. The finish is long, dominated by mineral flavours that linger on the palate.

title: Chateau Sainte Eulalie Grand Vin 2016
Description: Beautiful colour with an explosive fruity nose (blackberries, black cherries) and spices. Full bodied, silky tannins, with a lingering taste. Elegant and harmonious wine.

title: Manincor Reserve Del Conte 2018
Description: Grape varieties: Lagrein 35%, Merlot 40%, Cabernet 25%. Fermented in a mixture of oak barrels, cement vats and stainless steel tanks using wild yeasts. The wine was aged in oak barrels of varying sizes for twelve months. Deep bright ruby. Rich, seductive berry fruit.
By:: Manincor Sas Az Agr Di Michael Goes

title: Domaine Bel Avenir Morgon
Description: A playful nose whets the appetite with aromas of black raspberries, blueberries, and prunes. Concentrated, slightly jammy fruit. Hints of truffles, wet earth, pepper, and other spices round out the nose. Tart, dark fruit dominates the palate. Weighty, with grippy tannins and an almost chewy texture. Floral hints on the mid-palate with moderate acidity. Baking chocolate emerges on a dry, medium-length finish. Well-integrated flavours with a good balance and generous structure. Verging on full-bodied. A fruity, juicy, generously proportioned wine.

title: Manincor Kalterersee Keil 2019
Description: From various ancient clones of Vernatsch or Schiava. Bright soft-hued ruby. Delicately fruity on the nose reminiscent of cherry and toasted almonds, juicy on the palate, extremely 'quaffable' and elegant on the finish. Enjoy now to the end of 2023. Delicious with cold cuts, perfect for a big bowl of pasta or any dish based on tomato, garlic and olive oil, white meats or fried fish. Certified biodynamic.
By:: Manincor Sas Az Agr Di Michael Goes

title: Château d'Arsac 2015
Description: Owner Philippe Raoux has created both a major sculpture park and a series of impressive vintages at this estate at the western end of Margaux. This vintage is one of the best yet, rich and vibrant with great fruits and solid tannins. It needs serious aging, so drink from 2025. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2018)

title: Calcu Reserva Especial Carmenere 2017
Description: This Carmenere stands out for its intense red fruits, good body and long finish. It has a bright dark red colour. On the nose, aromas of flowers and black spices predominate with certain touches of fresh red fruit. In the palate it is a wine with body and elegant tannic structure, delivering a fresh and fruity final. Rodrigo Romero, Calcu Winemaker.

title: La Tunella Refosco 2017
Description: Medium intensity nose with stewed strawberries, leather and wild mushroom. The palate has firm tannins, fairly high acidity with intense fruit and leathery flavours that would benefit from several years aging to help integrate. The finish is impressively long.

title: Handley Estate Pinot Noir Anderson Valley 2017
Description: Aromas of cola, violets, candy cap mushrooms, and clove. Flavours of red cherries, cranberries, hibiscus, and root beer, with hints of cinnamon and cardamom spices. Long and plush finish with soft tannins and balanced acidity.

title: Chateauneuf du Pape Reserve 2018
Description: Blessed with tremendous raspberry and blueberry fruit, the 2018 Chateauneuf du Pape Reserve adds nuances of dusty earth and crushed stone to the mix. It's full-bodied, lush and creamy, ending on a flourish of dried spices - all spice, clove and star anise. Rating: 92-95 - Joe Czerwinski, Wine Advocate, August, 2019.

title: Le Sabounet 2019
Description: This overachieving vin de France is a blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault and is an entry-level wine bearing a Mediterranean character with great body and expressive fruit. The grapes were hand-picked and destemmed and vinified in the Sabon tradition. It is a pretty deep purple with vibrant aromas of ripe red fruit, garrigue, toast and liquorice. It is harmonious and delectable and is meant to be consumed in the short-term

title: Domaine des Coutures Saumur Champigny L'Epanouie
Description: Sustainable viticulture. Mechanical harvesting. Total destemming. Temperature-controlled fermentation in stainless steel vats. Malolactic fermentation. Ageing in concrete eggs. Garnet red colour, bold. Elegant and aromatic nose with flavours of raspberry and black fruit. Elegant on palate with silky tannin and a good length. To be enjoyed with red meats in a sauce, pigeon, spit-roasted capon or a lamb tajine.

title: Domaine Giuliani Les Notes de Louis 2018
Description: This glorious Côte du Rhône is made from 95% Grenache (the Giulianis are very, very talented Grenache growers) and 5% Syrah. This robust beauty is a brilliant ruby colour and exhibits a pronounced, lively nose of raspberries, plums and cherries. In the mouth these persist, accompanied by black currants and hints of pepper and licorice. It is big and wonderfully round and supple with silky tannins and surprising length. This stunner will go marvellously with savoury tarts and grilled meats. While drinking well now, it will keep nicely for at least three or four years.

title: Terre Di Giumara Frappato Nerello 2019
Description: This blend of two classic red Sicilian grapes reaches perfect equilibrium between the marked tannins of the Nerello Mascalese and the low tannin content of Frappato. A light and refreshing wine with a powerful nose. Notes of spices and wild berries. Balanced acidity. Perfectly matches both fish (salmon, tuna) and meat; also pairs well with semi-aged cheeses.

title: Chelti Kindzmarauli 2018
Description: The wine is characterized by harmonious, full-bodied, velvety and refined taste with pleasant sweetness, notable fruit and varietal aromas, blackberry and berry tones.

title: Chelti Saperavi 2018
Description: Dark ruby-red with intense aromas of blackberry, cherry and blackcurrant.

title: High Heaven Majestic Pines Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Description: This is a well-made, solid take on Columbia Valley Cabernet, offering ripe dark fruit, cassis, fresh herbs and a graphite-tinged minerality. Long and fresh with pleasing concentration. A great wine for grilled portobello mushroom burgers. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2019)

title: Quinta dos Avidagos Lote 138 Red 2017
Description: A juicy blend of Port grapes that displays  abundant fruit, mainly dark berries, mild spices with a lively freshness. Nice rounded tannins that work with or without food.

title: CM Prestigio Rioja DOC 2015
Description: Complex and lively wine, endowed with an exquisite aroma, an intense dark cherry red colour and a rich, long and lingering flavour.

title: Valdelosfrailes Prestigio DO Cigales 2006
Description: High expression wine that is crisp and bright, great complexity of flavours and aromas, good volume, elegant and balanced. High aromatic intensity with black fruits, high minerality and great acidity. Elegant and long finish.

title: Schild Estate Pramie Shiraz 2016
Description: Vines planted '00, hand-picked and bunch-sorted, open-fermented, 4-day cold soak, 12-day ferment, some further maceration post-ferment, standard Schild schedule of oak handling. Intense, focused black fruit, licorice and bitter chocolate. The tannins are balanced, even though they are quite firm. Drink by: 2041. Score - 96. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2019)

title: Kagor Chizay Limited Edition 2018
Description: Intense varietal fruity aroma with pleasant notes of cocoa and chocolate. Rich, full bodied with a pleasant sweetness and velvety texture. Long fruity aftertaste. Traditional wine at family celebrations. But best of all, it is combined with desserts - coffee, fruits, ice-cream, cocktails or creamy and rich blue cheese and foie gras.

title: Cataldo Calabretta Ciro Rosso 2016
Description: Ruby red colour with a delicate orange rim. The wine shows balsamic and spiced aromas with hints of liquorice and cloves. Tannins and acidity are very well balanced, showing flavours of ripe fruits and a mineral finish.

title: Cantarutti Pinot Nero DOP Friuli Colli Orientali 2012
Description: This wine has a bright violet ruby red colour, fruity aromas and a balanced note of wood. The finish is long, soft and elegant.

title: Balduzzi Viejo Encachao Grand Reserve Carignan 2016
Description: This has a rich array of red and dark berries with wild herbs and cedary oak. The palate is smooth and deeply flavored, offering silky fruit. Very intense and plush with super polished tannins. Drink or hold. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Dec. 5, 2019)

title: Zuccardi Q Cabernet Franc 2017
Description: This is a beautiful cabernet franc with fresh flowers, rose stems and dark fruit. Medium body, lovely fruit and bright acidity. New and wonderful. Drink now [to 2027]. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, March 27, 2019)

title: Mouton Cadet Heritage 2017
Description: A rich blend of Merlot with touches of the two Cabernets, this wine is full of blackberry fruits and a layer of tannins that allow it to mature further. It is, however, very drinkable now. Score - 88. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2020)

title: Chateau des Moriers Fleurie 2015
Description: The 7 hectares planted for Fleurie are around the château, on the border with Moulin-à-Vent and close to Chenas. Les Moriers is a special terroir of Fleurie with great wines known to have a bigger structure than some other wines of the appellation. 2015 was a massive vintage, lots of fruit and structure and built to last. A terrific and easy match for grilled lamb chops.

title: Fleurs Des Champs Le Fleurie De Vicky 2018
Description: From the north of Beaujolais, between Les Thorins and Le Point du Jour. Grapes harvested on hillsides and the plain. A lovely wine served lightly chilled, Full of fruit, with a floral nose, typical of Fleurie. An easy going and charming wine. Serve with charcuteries and cheeses; an extremely versatile wine.

title: Chateau des Moriers Fleurie La Brirette 2014
Description: From a 1ha plot on a slope called La Brirette, within the terroirs of Les Moriers at the border with Moulin-à-Vent. 2014 is a lovely vintage with precocious and approachable wines. Expect lots of depth and spice and great elegance on the finish. Chill lightly and serve on its own or with a rich pasta or game.

title: Cyan Tinta de Toro 2017
Description: Great structure balanced by a fresh acidity. Red fruit in the mouth and nose with toasted notes. Long and pleasant finish with round tannins.

title: Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino (Double Magnum) 1995
Description: The 1995 Brunello di Montalcino emerges from the glass with hints of smoke, scorched earth, licorice and tobacco. Here, too, the aromas are more forward than the fruit, which remains big, powerful and virile. The tannins are quite firm, and the wine remains young, even after all these years. A huge, intense finish rounds things out. Today the 1995 comes across as a bit awkward. It should be a little more composed in another 2-3 years. Drinking window: 2015-2025. Score - 92. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, May 2012)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Clos Saint-Jacques Gevrey-Chambertin 1er Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Gevrey-Chambertin Clos Saint-Jacques 1er Cru has a wonderful bouquet that just pips the Cazetiers for precision and poise. This is detailed and very finely tuned, the oak married perfectly with the fruit. The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannins and very well-judged acidity, almost sorbet-fresh. The vivacious blood-orange-infused finish seems to shimmer. This is a great Clos Saint-Jacques from Louis Jadot. Drinking window: 2024-2050. Score - 94-96. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Échézeaux Grand Cru 2018
Description: There are ten barrels of the 2018 Echézeaux Grand Cru (Domaine Louis Jadot), an excellent wine that unwinds in the glass with aromas of sweet wild berries, dark chocolate, potpourri and spices. On the palate, it's full-bodied, velvety and supple, with a broad and textural attack, fine depth at the core and a lively, nicely defined finish. This is often one of Jadot's most underrated wines, and it is well worth seeking out. Score - 93-95. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Secreto de Viu Manent Carmenère 2018
Description: This wine comes from a granitic hillside planted in the El Olivar Vineyard in the Peralillo zone in 2005. 38% of the wine was aged in barrels and the rest in stainless steel tanks. Displaying abundant ripe red fruit and some spices, this is a textbook juicy carménère with a backdrop of herbal tones in a wine with a commercial character, in the best sense of the term. There's no excess here - just fruit. Score - 92. (guiadescorchados.cl, 2020)

title: Aubert Pinot Noir 2018
Description: Beautifully done, the 2018 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast has an incredible sense of purity and finesse while packing plenty of classic California fruit. Vivid ruby-hued with a kaleidoscopic array of framboise, spring flowers, charcoal, toasted spices, and damp earth, it hits the palate with medium to full-bodied richness, incredible purity of fruit, integrated acidity, and a great finish. This quintessential Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir is already drinking brilliantly yet will keep for at least 7-8 years. Maturity: 2020-2028. Score - 96. (jebdunnuck.com, May 21, 2020)

title: Paul Hobbs Katherine Lindsay Estate Pinot Noir 2017
Description: The flagship is the 2017 Pinot Noir Katherine Lindsay Estate comes from vines around the estate, in the Laguna Ridge region of the Russian River Valley. It saw just touch of stems (10%) and was brought up in 45-55% new French oak. This ruby/purple-hued beauty offers an incredibly elegant, seamless profile that carries perfumed red currant, raspberries and cherry fruits intermixed with white flowers, spice, and underbrush. While one of the most elegant and seamless in the lineup, it doesn't skimp on fruit and has plenty of intensity, integrated acidity, and thrilling tannin quality. It's another awesome Pinot Noir from this estate that benefits from a decant if drinking anytime soon and will benefit from 2-3 years of bottle age and keep for a decade. Maturity: 2021-2031. Score - 97. (jebdunnuck.com, June 14, 2019)

title: Falernia Gran Reserva Syrah 2016
Description: 100% Syrah. Heady with plush layers of savoury black olive, chocolate, spice and blackberry, while the palate is dense with lush fruit and framed with supple tannins. Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Valquejigoso V2 2008
Description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend from the south-of-Madrid area represents no designated region other than Spain. It's an intense blend with aromas of blackberry, pepper, toasted oak and smokiness. A deep, pure palate pumps out cherry, plum and especially cassis flavors, while baking-spice notes come prior to clove, toast and char on the finish. Drink through 2024. Ranked #81 in Wine Enthusiast's Top 100 Cellar Selections of 2016.  Score - 94. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2016)

title: Mazzei Siepi 2016
Description: What a beautiful nose of elderberries, freshly picked blackcurrants, citrus, herbs, licorice and crushed stones, amidst a backdrop of coffee beans, cedar and vanilla. Full-bodied and very subtle and refined with tightly wound tannins and an impressive balance of fruit and acidity. Long, grainy and elegant on the finish. A masterpiece. Drink in 2020. Score - 98. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 17, 2018)

title: Château Maucoil Privilège Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2016
Description: My favorite of this estate's three red cuvées was the 2016 Chateauneuf du Pape Privilege, a barrel-aged blend (30% new) that includes 5% or so white grapes and a wide swathe of red varieties. The cedar and vanilla notes are pronounced but not overwhelming, serving to highlight gorgeous cherry fruit. It's full-bodied, plush and unabashedly modern but also luminous and silky, with a long, long finish. Drinking date: 2018-2035. Score - 96. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2018)

title: Barbera D'Asti Superiore Le Rocche 2016
Description: This is serious Piemonte wine made by the area's pre-eminent Barbera specialist. Grapes are sourced from and tended to entirely by hand from the sustainably-farmed Rocchette vineyard. A long, slow ferment and maceration are followed by 18 months of oak aging in large, Allier French barrels. It offers up a complex nose of rich red plums, Bing cherries, cacao and fennel. The palate is full and ripe with pitch-perfect balance between streaky acids and soft, dusty tannins.

title: Sangreal Shiraz Vina Bibich 2016
Description: Distinct aromas of spices, green pepper, peppermint, sage leaf and dark berry fruit. It has finely matured rounded tannins. Taste is rounded, full. It pairs great with dark meat, game, spicy sauces, noble cheeses, Dalmatian prosciutto or even 'solo for personal enjoyment.'

title: Torre Muga 2016
Description: Even better than the magical 2015, the 2016 Torre Muga offers a thrilling bouquet of cassis and assorted pure dark fruits, lead pencil, graphite, white flowers, and spice-laced aromas and flavors. While this cuvée is always thought of as the most modern in the lineup, it's far from it and has integrated oak, flawless balance, sweet tannins, and a gorgeous finish. It's beautifully done and just a thrilling bottle of Rioja that's going to evolve for 20-30 years or more. Maturity: 2020-2050. Score - 99. (jebdunnuck.com, Oct. 21, 2020)

title: R6 Vina Bibich 2017
Description: A dry red wine from varieties Babic, Lasin and Plavina. The wine smells like sweet berries - strawberries, blackberries and homemade cherry juice with a pronounced rustic charm. Indigenous varieties of the Sibenik region complement each other perfectly in this bottle. The wine is light and smooth, with a distinctive ruby colour and light spices and black pepper aromas. Full on the palate, harmonious, lively, intriguing.

title: Terra Grande Reserva 2017
Description: Granada colour. Complex red fruit aromas combined with vanilla hints from oak aging. Silky and bodied mouth feel with ripe and mild tannins. Long and well structured finish.

title: Fermentum Lambrusco 2019
Description: Very intense red colour with purple reflections. Evolved and ripe aromas, of good intensity with notes of red fruits and ripe grapes. Fresh taste, good structure, pleasant on the palate, harmonious and rightly tannic. Perfect with red meats and sausages.

title: Château Patache d'Aux 2017
Description: This dry and ruby coloured red showcases a complex nose releasing balsamic, woody, spicy, fruity and mineral scents. You will be charmed with this medium-bodied wine revealing a broad texture, fleshy tannins and a medium finish.

title: Trollinger Alte Rebe 2019
Description: A very traditional light German red wine from the Stuttgart region. It is almost exclusively cultivated on steep, sunny locations on the slopes of the Neckar river valley. The grape has moderate acidity, and is light bodied with fruity strawberry and subtle smokey notes. A table wine that pairs well with pasta dishes, venison, lamb, beef and spicy cuisine.

title: Quaresimo Lambrusco 2019
Description: Deep red colour with purple reflection. Deep fragrance, high intensity with scent of red fruits and mature grapes. Fresh taste, excellent structure, delicate palate, armonious and properly tannic.

title: Villa Reguela DOC Douro 2017
Description: Grown in the Douro River valley and aged for a year in French oak barrels, this is a lush red wine bursting with blackberry flavours and hints of coffee and vanilla. Enjoy it with hearty meat and cheese dishes.

title: Château Purcari Cabernet Sauvignon de Purcari 2018
Description: An intense ruby colour with purple highlights. Rich aroma of black cherry, complemented by fine notes of exotic spices. The taste is full, complex, with notes of ripe fruit, chocolate, vanilla and raisins. Soft tannins emphasize the roundness and softness of aftertaste with shades of ripening.

title: Negru de Purcari Stefan Voda 2017
Description: The scarlet red colour is characterized by a complex and intense bouquet with notes of sweet fruits - ripe plums and figs - which develop over time. Fine flavours of spices and saffron in the end. Deep and velvety taste reminds of the same fruit flavour with ample hints of delicate tannins and a long sensual aftertaste.

title: Terras de Viriato Red Dao 2015
Description: Clear, garnet with brownish reflections, given by its bottle ageing. Elegant with berry notes. Soft and velvety, with a good balance between its alcohol and acidity. Good persistence, highlighting the characteristics of these grape varieties.

title: Fari Societa Agricola Semplice Sciopettino 2018
Description: Ruby red colour with purple hues. On the nose, intense and spicy, with scents of cherry, blueberry and raspberry. In the mouth it is complex, fresh and elegant. A decidedly harmonious wine.

title: Marenco Aldo Pirona Barbera 2018
Description: Made from organic certified grapes which have been hand selected from their vineyards in Madonna Delle Grazie. One of the main characteristics of Pirona is its hints of dark chocolate and its garnet red colour.
By:: Az. Agr. Marenco Aldo Di Maren

title: Adega Moncao Red 2019
Description: Made from a blend of local northern Portuguese grapes, this wine is a regional specialty. Notes of dark berries with herbal hints, the palate is dry, full bodied and firm with high acidity which are all characteristic of this regional style.

title: Esk Valley Winemakers Reserve Cabernet Blend 2016
Description: This winemakers Reserve blend is widely regarded as one of the finest of New Zealand's red wines. Since the 1990 vintage this is the first Cabernet-based vintage reflecting the nature of the season and our desire to produce the finest wine possible. Deeply coloured, showcasing black cherry, fruit cake, tobacco, and subtle oak spice this is a dry complex and age-worthy wine.

title: La Parde de Haut-Bailly 2017
Description: Charming and elegant, the rich blueberry fruit has good density, even if its not particularly generous. The tannins close the fruit down but have life and definition in them, and this will soften and open within four to five years. There was 30% frost in the vineyard, but no second generation fruit was used - in fact, they didn't even have any. The blend has a little more Merlot than usual. 30% of production was used for La Parde, and around 20% for the estate's third wine. Drinking Window: 2023-2036. Score - 91. (Jane Anson, decanter.com)

title: Quinta Nova Mirabilis Gran Reserva Red 2017
Description: 96-98 points Wine Advocate. 'A field blend of old vines (including all sorts of interesting grapes like Tinta da Barca, Bastardo, Tinta Barroca, Tinta Pomar, Mourisco, etc.), with 35% Tinta Amarela, aged for 12 months in 60% new French oak. There were just 375 cases produced. Tightly wound, this is always one of the Grande Reservas that shows fine mid-palate finesse, but it is so dense and concentrated this year, at least in perception, that finesse won't be the first impression, at least in its youth. The second impression will be its pure power. It is certainly competing for the most powerful wine here. Unevolved, burly and simply too young, this was a few weeks from bottling when seen. It looks pretty brilliant, but it certainly wasn't harmonious or fully expressive. Plan on cellaring it for a few years.'
By:: Quinta Nova De Nossa Senhora D

title: Antinori Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino 2004
Description: The 2004 Brunello di Montalcino Riserva Vignaferrovia, a new bottling, is sweet, rich and layered in its fruit. This is a decidedly firm Brunello in need of a few years in the cellar to soften the firm yet refined tannins. Red raspberries, flowers and sweet spices are some of the nuances that emerge on the round, creamy finish. There is quite a bit of volume and richness, due in part to the greater use of French barrels, but the oak has also left the Riserva with some slightly oxidative qualities and less overall freshness than is typically the case here. Drinking window: 2014-2024. Score - 92. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, April 2010)

title: Caves do Casalinho Romanisco Red 2019
Description: Romanisco is a remarkable red wine, very deep in colour. Reveals enormous concentratrion of aromas with jammy red fruit and some spice.

title: Tramier Hautes Cotes de Nuits 2018
Description: This wine comes from the vineyards lying just beyond the villages of Nuits Saint Georges and Gevrey Chambertin. The climate of those vineyards is cooler and offers fruity and easy to drink wines, 100% Pinot Noir. A dark ruby colour and a fruity nose. On the palate, a fruity attack. Medium-bodied with a good structure on red berries. A fruity finish.

title: Wakefield Pinot Noir 2016
Description: One of the most trusted names in Australian wine, Wakefield (known as Taylor in Australia) is a member of the Australian First Families of Wine - an organization comprised of 12 of Australia's most important and iconic family-run wineries. This 2016 Pinot Noir is floral, smooth and easy-drinking with bright red fruit and juicy blackberry, plus a touch of spice. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2016)

title: Rombauer Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Fresh blueberries, ivy, holly and some light cedar. Medium to full body, fresh acidity and a fruity finish. Drink now. [till 2030+] Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 21, 2017)

title: Scribe Pinot Noir Carneros 2018
Description: Scribe Winery in Sonoma, California produces vibrant, terroir-driven wines. The winery--founded in 2007 on a property that pioneered pre-prohibition Sonoma Valley winemaking--is managed by fourth-generation California farmers and brothers, Andrew and Adam Mariani. Vinification methods are the same as the Estate Pinot--fermented with native, wild yeast in concrete or steel then aged in neutral oak barrels for about six months; but, compared to its counterpart, the Carneros Pinot ends up expressing a softer, more delicate touch and feel. Expect spicy and tart notes of bay laurel, cranberries and pink peppercorn.

title: Ramos Pinto Duas Quintas Tinto 2017
Description: Lovely dark ruby red, clear and bright with garnet reflexes. Intense and involving aroma. It starts with the final notes of red berries and floral aromas, followed by notes of cocoa and spices. In the mouth it is full, embracing and harmonious, with a fine texture, freshness and persistence. Excellent if drunk now but with great ageing potential. Critical Acclaim

title: Gran Bombus Malbec 2016
Description: Deep ruby with violet hues. Intense and pure mature red fruit such as cherries and plums. On the palate, powerful, precise and elegant. This wine shows intensity of mature red fruit. On the pallet it is concentrated and balanced with generous weight, minerality and structure.

title: Codru Premium 2017
Description: Red coloured with bright shades. Well-structured and tannin-rich wine, it has aromas of ripe fruit with soft nuances of blueberries and pomegranate. Vinified by the traditional method and matured in oak casks. Perfect accompaniment for lamb with herbs and roast pheasant.

title: Barolo Mosconi 2016
Description: 'The 2016 Barolo Mosconi is a gorgeous wine made all the more remarkable given that Mosconi can't really be said to be a top-level site. Dark and imposing, the 2016 captures all the breadth and tannic clout that are such signatures of this site. This is an especially brooding, virile Barolo, but Chiara and Giorgio Boschis clearly brought out all the best the vineyard had to give.' - 96 points (Antonio Galloni, Vinous, Feb 2020)
By:: Azienda Agricola E. Pira E Fig

title: Kardanakhi Cabernet Qvevri PDO 2016
Description: Deep dark red in colour with aromas of ripe black cherries and blackcurrants. Rich tannins on the finish.

title: Dal Cero Sangiovese IGT Toscana 2017
Description: A luminous, bright ruby red. A pronounced, heady bouquet offers fragrant cherry and raspberry, with a hint of spice. On the palate, it is refined and very well-balanced, while the finish is full-flavoured and ultra-appealing. A fine partner with all types of meat, game, and cheeses.

title: Quinta Da Espinhosa Red 2014
Description: This wine is the result of a selection of grapes made using the traditional method. They were crushed gently to allow all characteristics to be maintained. With less reassembly and less color extraction, it resulted in an aromatic, violet colored wine, balanced, round tannins and a medium finish.

title: Château Pipeau 2016
Description: The dark-berry and graphite aromas jump out of the glass, together with a salty undertone. Full body, firm and silky tannins and a juicy finish. Shows decadence and richness at the end. Always excellent quality for the money. Try from 2022. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 3, 2019)

title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2010
Description: Black truffle and dark berries. Full body, round and fresh tannins and fresh acidity give this lift and intensity. Drink or hold. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Jan. 7, 2019)

title: Domaine de Suremain en Sazenay Mercurey 1er Cru 2017
Description: On the eastern side of Mercurey, this vineyard is one of the leading premier crus. This wine with its structure and generous fruits is densely textured and still young. Powerful black fruits are fresh, juicy and developing. Drink this wine from 2023. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 1, 2019)

title: Ruelas Red VT IGP 2019
Description: Pomegranate coloured wine, with aromas of red fruits. In the mouth it is smooth and rounded with balanced acidity and with ripe and elegant tannins.

title: Tua Rita Per Sempre Syrah 2015
Description: I love the dried flowers and smoked meats with hints of plums and berries. Full body, layered and refined with an extremely pretty and textured palate. Tea and dark fruits. Deep and fantastic. Savory. 20% whole berry. Best ever? Made from organic grapes.  Score - 98. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 28, 2017)

title: Nielson by Byron Pinot Noir 2017
Description: The 2017 Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County was sourced from multiple sites across the county and aged in 5% new French oak. Pale to medium ruby, it has a perfumed nose of violet, tangerine peel, Earl Grey tea leaves, crushed blackberries, cranberries, rhubarb, woodsmoke and pipe tobacco with an earthy undercurrent. The palate is light to medium-bodied with a good core of earthy fruit framed by grainy tannins and great freshness, finishing earthy. This is a great value, and with 31,000 cases produced, this should be easy to find. Drink date: 2019-2025. Score - 90. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Sept. 12, 2019)

title: Pères de Eglise Côtes du Rhône Rouge 2017
Description: JEB DUNNUCK 88: Blackberries, blueberries, saddle leather, and peppery notes all emerge from the 2017 Côtes du Rhône, which is based on 85% Grenache and the rest a mix of permitted varieties. This rich, medium to full-bodied Côtes du Rhône has good fruit, plenty of texture, and a good finish.

title: Pères de Eglise Lirac Rouge 2018
Description: ROBERT PARKER 89-91: A blend of 70% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 10% Carignan, the 2018 Lirac aged in concrete (80%) and barriques (20%). Red cherries and ripe peaches appear on the nose, while the full-bodied palate is supple and creamy textured, firming just a little bit on the mouthwatering finish.

title: Luna Blue Rock Vineyard Pinor Noir 2016
Description: Moderately dense yet elegant pinot noir with Black Doris plum, dark cherry, anise, spice and nutty oak flavours. A bright, high energy wine that's reasonably accessible now but will clearly benefit from bottle age. Drink date: 2017-2023. Ranked #10 of 45 in The Real Review's 2016 Pinot Noir from Martinborough.  Score - 95. (Bob Campbell, MW, therealreview.com, Dec. 14, 2017)
By:: Zn Agri Ltd Ta Luna Estate

title: To Kalon Vineyard Co. Highest Beauty 2016
Description: This pure cabernet sauvignon is the real deal with redcurrant and terracotta character on both the nose and palate. It's full-bodied, yet really reserved and ultra-refined. The quality of the tannins is super with such fine grain, yet it continues on for minutes. This is the first release and it shows beautiful classicism. Shows the essence of the place. Needs four or five years to come around. Try after 2023. Score - 99. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 16, 2020)

title: Bindi Sergardi I Colli Chianti Classico Riserva 2015
Description: Lots of black cherries, crushed raspberries and flowers on the nose. Full body and firm, chewy tannins. Extremely long and flavorful. A beauty. Fantastic. Drink or hold. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Brancaia Ilatraia 2016
Description: A blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Petit Verdot and 20% Cabernet Franc, the 2016 Ilatraia is a terrific, full-bodied expression from Tuscany. If you love this combination of full-throttle grapes, I suggest you try this rendition. It tends to be more delicate and nuanced at the edges compared to a similar blend from a New World wine region, like say, California. The wine is contoured and full but never heavy. Indeed, the aromas of blackberry, spice and tar remain surprisingly fresh and bright. This is a big wine to be sure, but there is a lot of tonic energy packed tight within. Some 30,000 bottles were made. Drink date: 2020-2035. Score - 96+. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Sept. 19, 2019)

title: Two Sisters Cabernet Franc 2016
Description: Extremely impressive cabernet franc here from Two Sisters, varietally accurate with its roasted vegetal-herbal flavours, but with an equal measure of dense and ripe but fresh black fruit and dried violets, a very essence of the grape. Viticultural care and ambition are indeed obvious, as is careful winemaking and post-production handling. Tannins are lovely and creamy while acids are firm but ripe, and alcohol comfortable at 14% declared. Excellent length, too. Top notch Ontario red in the category; drink or hold comfortably into the late '20s.  Score - 93. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com, July 30, 2020)

title: Marietta Gibson Block Syrah 2016
Description: The 2016 Syrah Estate Gibson Block is the star of this range from Marietta. From a dry-farmed site planted in the 1880s, the Gibson Block is powerful, sumptuous and racy to the core. A whole range of complementary varieties give the Gibson Block striking inner perfume and lift to play off the intense dark fruit, while silky tannins add to the wine's racy, inviting personality. Drinking window: 2022-2036. Score - 95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, May 2019)

title: Philippe & Vincent Jaboulet Hermitage 2014
Description: The star of the show and an impressively rich and layered effort, the 2014 Hermitage offers gorgeous amounts of black and blue fruits, leafy herbs, crushed violets and graphite. Coming all from the Les Dionnières lieu-dit and aged two years in 50% new French oak, it's certainly the greatest wine I've tasted from this estate in some time. Drink date: 2016-2024. Score - 94. (robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016)

title: Ravera Barolo Riserva 2013
