Description: Perfumed and floral with lots of character on the nose. Subtle. Full-bodied, tannic and chewy. Savory with tar and earth undertones. Drink or hold. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: Jean-Claude Boisset Savigny-Lès-Beaune 1er Cru Aux Guettes 2017
Description: This is very juicy, yet graceful and pristine for this appellation with a sensational, silky texture and a super long, soft finish that's so delicate. You could drink this right away, but it's got great aging potential. Drink from 2020. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 12, 2019)

title: Colgin IX Estate Red 2017
Description: The 2017 IX Estate is composed of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Cabernet Franc, 11% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Opaque purple-black colored, the nose is quite closed and shy to begin, slowly unfurling to reveal freshly crushed blackberries, mulberries and blackcurrants plus suggestions of dusty soil, bouquet garni, pencil lead and cast-iron pan with gentle wafts of sandalwood, cardamom, rare beef and black tea. Medium to full-bodied, the palate is built like a brick house, strutting incredibly ripe yet super firm tannins, and it has lovely, uplifting freshness to help define all those black fruit and savory layers, finishing with epic length. Needs time, but this should turn out to be incredibly nuanced and long lived! Drink date: 2025-2060. Score - 98. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2019)

title: Le Cadeau Trajet Reserve Pinot Noir
Tignanello 2015
Description: Once again, the 2015 Tignanello is stunning. Sweet, floral notes give the 2015 striking aromatic intensity to play off a core of red Sangiovese fruit. In 2015, the Sangiovese is a bit higher than the norm, which comes through in the wine's flavor profile. The tannins are also a bit biting at this stage, but that won't be an issue in time. Bright red cherry, plum, blood orange mint and sweet floral notes build into a finish laced with energy and tension. The 2015 is utterly captivating. That's all there is to it. Drinking window: 2022-2045. Score - 98. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Aug. 2019)

title: Wirra Wirra Vintage Bell Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: A carefully assembled blend of grapes from across McLaren Vale vinified and matured separately in French oak (30% new). It was a perfect vintage, giving the blending bench an embarrassment of riches with cassis, bay leaf, black olive, blackberry, tapenade, dark chocolate and more. Drink by: 2050. Special Value. Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2019)

title: Radacini Vintage Merlot 2017
Description: This generous Merlot shows aromas of red ripe fruits, cassis and blackberry. Flavours of rich red plum are complemented by subtle notes of vanilla and chocolate. Soft tannins give the structure.

title: Seghesio Defiant 2016
Description: This blend of 44% zinfandel, 29% cabernet sauvignon, 13% syrah, 10% petite sirah and 4% alicante has aromas of violets, blueberries, dried cherries and leaves and delivers a fleshy, plum-infused palate that has such approachable, silky tannins. Drink now. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 12, 2019)

title: Ampre Rara Neagra, Merlot & Saperavi 2018
Description: Ruby coloured wine with an expressive bouquet of ripe wild berries (cranberries, mulberries), plums, cherries complemented with spicy tones of red pepper and nutmeg. The taste is quite spice with mouth-watering tannins.

title: Falernia Gran Reserva Carmenère 2015
Description: Last year, I didn't understand anything about the previous vintage of the 2015 Carmenere Reserva because it's done in the style of an Amarone: the grapes were harvested two months later than normal, and the wine retained some seven grams of residual sugar. This time, I tasted the wines with winemaker Giorgio Flessati, and he explained it to me; it's also explained on the back label. There are no herbal or green notes, and there are no [raisiny] flavors either. But, it's an acquired taste... Drink Date: 2017-2020. Score - 89. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, April 28, 2017 )

title: Andre Delorme Pinot Noir AOC 2018
Description: The nose is marked by notes of fresh fruit (raspberries, blackcurrants and red-currants). There is a perfect balance between freshness, fruitiness and lightness in the mouth. Vinification in oak barrels gives it complexity and richness. It is a perfect introduction to Burgundy's most prestigious appellations. Serve with a terrine de campagna, rillettes, chicken pie, grilled meat on skewers, or a gratin of candied summer vegetables. Can be enjoyed while young.

title: Rubatos Bobal Manchuela DO 2018
Description: Red ruby colour, with a high layer, violet reflections; in the nose, cherries in liquor, red berries and notes of mint, powerful, huge balance from which light flashes of acidity, it has a good freshness, it´s fine and full of personality, Bobal in pure state.

title: Leone de Castris Riserva Salice Salentino 2011
Description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, exotic spice, tobacco and an anise note lead the nose on this intense wine. The succulent palate delivers layers of blackberry, raspberry, clove, licorice and allspice. Tightly-knit but velvety tannins provide support. Score - 91. (Kerin O'Keefe, Wine Enthusiast, March 2015)

title: Zonte's Footstep Lake Doctor Shiraz 2014
Description: Open and closed fermenters, matured for 12 months in new and used hogsheads. A substantial wine at the upper end of Langhorne Creek's normal weight; the 5% viognier has not had a major influence on the style, but is discernible on the fresh red fruits of the finish. Drink by: 2034. Score - 90. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Oct. 6, 2016)

title: Defesa Do Esporao Monte Velho Organic Red 2019
Description: Clear, ruby colour with aromas of red fruits and wild berries, wrapped in subtle notes of fresh spices. Intense and rich, with a solid structure and a lingering finish.

title: Meyer Pinot Noir 2015
Description: This wine was aged in older oak barrels which softened the wine without adding much oak flavour. It has aromas and flavours of cherry and strawberry. The juicy texture adds to the wine's immediate appeal. Score - 90. (John Schreiner, johnschreiner.blogspot.com, Nov. 29, 2016)

title: Paolo Scavino Bricco Ambrogio Barolo 2004
Description: This exhibits fresh cherry and black currant flavors, and there's a meatiness to its texture. The firm grip of tannins sweeps in on the finish, which echoes fruit, along with eucalyptus and spice notes. Best from 2014 through 2032. Score - 93. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Nov. 30, 2011)

title: Kindzmarauli Saperavi Qvevri 2018
Description: Well-expressed soft aroma, fresh, elegant, fruity bouquet filled with hints of blackberry, blueberry, cherry and French plum. Harmonious taste with pleasant oak tones and soft, enveloping tannins. Notes of black fruits, cranberry, sour cherry and black pepper.

title: Thread Count Red Blend 2016
Description: Produced by Joseph Wagner, the maker of iconic Belle Glos Pinot Noir. Cool, Pacific Coast climate and unique soils in Sonoma contribute to the quality of grapes used to make Thread Count Red Wine. Notes of black raspberry, chocolate, soft notes of sweet cherries with hints of toffee & pepper spice. Great value with this red blend, and the perfect pairing for ribs!

title: Robert Mondavi Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley is plump and juicy, not to mention a terrific introduction to the vintage. Succulent dark cherry, plum, mocha, spice and new leather are some of the signatures. Medium in body and expressive, the 2014 will drink well with minimal cellaring. This is a terrific value within the context of Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. The 2014 is 87% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Drinking window: 2016-2022. Score - 90. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Dec. 2016)

title: Robert Mondavi To Kalon Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: A blend of 91% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot, the deep garnet-purple colored 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon To Kalon Reserve opens with beautifully fragrant kirsch, wilted roses, candied violets and dried Provence herbs notes over a core of wild blueberries, red and black currants and mulberries plus wafts of tobacco leaf and cardamom. Medium to full-bodied, it fills the palate with perfumed, crunchy black fruits framed by firm, ripe, grainy tannins and finishes long and earthy. Drink date: 2020-2038. Score - 96+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 29, 2018)

title: Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon Estate 2017
Description: A bouquet of sweet black cherry with vanilla and spices. Velvety mouthfeel with notes of chocolate and jammy berries. Food Pairing Notes: Enjoy our Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon with a butterflied leg of lamb or lamb steak with rosemary. Also delicious alongside a cheese board with gorgonzola, aged cheddar and gouda.

title: Austin Hope Grenache 2014
Description: Deep garnet in colour with an aromatic intensity marked by dark cherry, fresh blueberry, black licorice, and dusty, dried herbs. On the palate, hints of smokiness lead you to refined flavours of leather & dried cherries. The flavour extends through your palate with a splash of fresh blueberry, juicy acid, and refined tannins finishing with finesse and strength.

title: La Luna e I Falò Barbera d'Asti Superiore 2010
Description: The 2013 Gambero Rosso guide awarded this wine 2 Glasses (out of 3), denoting a rating of Very Good to Excellent.An elevated walkway, situated above the rooms where these wines are made, literally provides visitors to the winery with a unique perspective on all stages of the winemaking process. This wine offers a wonderful high-toned nose rich in black and blue fruits accented by spice, vanilla, floral and brambly notes. Flavours of sweet berry fruit and cherry and a lovely soft vanilla touch on the long finish. (Vintages panel, March 2013)

title: Ambra Santa Cristina In Pilli Carmignano 2011
Description: (75% sangiovese, 10% cabernet sauvignon, 10% canaiolo nero and 5% other red grapes): Deep ruby. Sweet, spicy, ripe red cherry on the enticing nose. On the palate, fresh blackcurrant, aromatic herb and sweet pipe tobacco flavors are nicely framed by fine tannins. The finish is extremely long and fresh. Usually I find there is little to choose between Montefortini and Santa Cristina in Pilli (as in 2010) but in 2011 this wine is the clear winner. Score - 92. (Ian D'Agata, vinous.com, Sept. 2014)
By:: Fattoria Ambra Eredi Di Ludovica Ro

title: Domaine Amiot-Servelle Chambolle-Musigny 2009
Description: Free sulphur: 11 mg/L.    TASTING NOTE: Pinkish cherry colour. Dusty, almost leafy note over the red cherry fruit. Sweet oak spice on the mid palate. Fine dry tannins, upright and pretty austere at the moment. Drink 2014 to 2021. Score: 16.5 (out of 20) (Julia Harding MW, jancisrobinson.com, Jan. 27, 2011)

title: Domaine Amiot-Servelle Les Charmes Chambolle-Musigny 1er Cru 2006
Description: The most elegant wine to this point with high-toned aromas of raspberry and spiced cherry that introduce round and slightly more generous middle weight flavors that possess good depth though the finish leans out slightly on the mildly dry finish. Again, this may round out or be fined. Drink 2012+. Score - 87-89. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, Jan. 2008)

title: Domaine Allemand Le Theusien Rouge Vieilles Vignes 2019
Description: From 100% Mollard, a varietal grown only in this part of France, very old vines at 50+yrs, deep garnet ruby, cherries and light licorice notes, soft and easy on the palate, slightly smoky and refreshing. Extremely versatile with food, would be excellent slightly chilled and served with mountain cheeses and charcuteries.

title: StoneCap Syrah 2013
Description: StoneCap is named for the windblown hills and ridgelines of the region, which appear as a 'cap' of bare rock. This Syrah offers impressive varietal character, with great purity of black fruit and impressive depth and complexity for the price. A fantastic barbecue wine that will appeal to a wide range of palates.  (Vintages panel, July 2015)

title: Tbilvino Pirosmani Kakheti 2019
Description: Dark-cherry colour with rich aroma of fruits. This smooth and velvety wine pairs beautifully with Camembert and various desserts.

title: Domaine Jean-Marc & Hugues Pavelot Savigny-lès-Beaune Les Lavières 1er Cru
By:: Earl Jean Marc Et Hugues Pavelot

title: Domaine Perrot-Minot Les Fuées Chambolle-Musigny 1er Cru
Domaine Jessiaume Les Brouillards Volnay 1er Cru 2017
Description: Poised between ripe black-cherry flavors and a core of tannins, this young, structured wine has great potential. Plenty of acidity and juicy fruits give the wine a fresher side and the dry core will allow it to age. Drink this wine from 2022.  Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2019)

title: Planeta Eruzione 1614 Nerello Mascalese 2017
Description: A pure and very focused Etna red with aromas of cherries, strawberries, ash, rose petals and rose stems, following through to a full body with firm, chewy tannins and a bright, tightened finish. Shows class and persistence. Drink or hold. Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 21, 2020)

title: Encierra Carmenère 2018
Description: María Ignacia Eyzaguirre and consultant Didier Debono make one of my favourite Chilean Carmenères, which is even more impressive in 2018 than it was in 2017. Rich, ripe, dense and concentrated, but still beautifully balanced, this is a polished, glossy, harmonious red with sweet spices, understated wood and textured tannins. Drink date: 2022-2028. Score - 95. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2020)

title: Domaine Raymond Usseglio La Part des Anges Châteauneuf-du-Pape
By:: Domaine R. Usseglio Earl Les Amandi

title: Domaine Perrot-Minot Les Murgers des Cras Nuits-Saint-Georges
Domaine Amiot-Servelle Les Amoureuses Chambolle-Musigny 1er Cru
Les Forts de Latour 2014
Description: The 2014 Les Forts de Latour is a blend of 71.4% Cabernet Sauvignon and 28.6% Merlot. Deep garnet-purple colored, it needs a little coaxing to reveal expanding scents of blackcurrant pastilles, baked plums and boysenberries with suggestions of wood smoke, fragrant earth, cast-iron pan and charcuterie plus a faint waft of black truffles. Medium-bodied, the earthy/savory palate has loads of lively black fruit with a refreshing line and firm, grainy tannins, finishing on a lingering ferrous note. Drink date: 2022-2044. Score - 93. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 5, 2020)

title: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Gran Reserva
Argot Starstruck Cabernet Sauvignon
By:: Mixed Nuts, Llc Dba Argot Wines

title: Domaine Billon Christophe Les Elotins Côte-Rôtie
Château Mont-Redon Le Plateau Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2016
Description: Densely packed, with the ripe, vivid dark fruit that is the hallmark of the vintage, as plum, blackberry, black currant and fig notes course through, carried by a deeply embedded graphite spine. Warm ganache, singed tobacco, Turkish coffee and roasted alder elements hang in the background. Offers a long, rich finish. Really well-built. Best from 2022 through 2040. Score - 95. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Feb. 29, 2020)

title: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Rioja Gran Reserva
Loacker Corte Pavone Fiore del Vento Brunello di Montalcino
Domaine Adélie En Pierre Milley Mercurey 2018
Description: This is the first of Albert Bichot's wines to be released as organic. It's literally the fruit of 20 years of labour to convert the vineyard. The fruit from Burgundy's 2018 was of such quality that the rich, expressive wines it has produced have garnered comparisons to the legendary 1947 vintage. Currently, 2018 is poised to be counted among the greatest vintages of all time.

title: Corte San Benedetto Camporal Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva
By:: Soc. Agr. Corte San Benedetto Di La

title: Le Margaux du Château de Malleret 2015
Description: This has impressive fleshy depth and is really plush and attractive with aromas and flavors of blueberries, cassis, dark cherries, savory and nutty elements and a smoothly rendered, fine finish. Terrific depth here. Try from 2021. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 2, 2018)

title: Guy Farge Passion de Terrasses Saint-Joseph 2018
Description: Out of new barrels, the 2018 Saint Joseph Passion de Terrasses shows plenty of mocha aromatics but also plenty of richness, ripe tannins and plenty of length. From a 2016 barrel, it's lovely stuff, with ample nuance to its notes of violets and spice, plus layers of black olives and black cherries. It's full-bodied, supple and long on the finish. Drink date: 2020-2030. Score - 93-95. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Jan. 31, 2020)

title: Te Whare Ra Single Vineyard 5182 Pinot Noir 2015
Description: There's an aura of completeness and harmony that sits around this wine. The aromas of ripe blueberries and red and dark cherries, together with sappy, earthy and spicy notes and violet perfume are all entrancing. The palate has beautiful volume and sweeping fluidity. Fruit-drenched tannins curl around a long, focused and mouthwatering finish. Drink or hold.  Score - 97. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 4, 2019)

title: Salcheto Salco Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
Cakebread Cellars Dancing Bear Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon/Merlot
Pepper Tree The Gravels Shiraz 2016
Description: Supple, rich and juicy, with a flowing stream of black fruits studded with sparks of spice. The oak is integrated, the tannins fine, the finish long. Drink by: 2036. Score - 95. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2018)

title: Le Macchiole Scrio 2013
Description: Wow. This is the best syrah in Tuscany this year with incredible depth and beauty. The texture is so plush yet polished and caressing. Full body. The finish of chocolate, hazelnuts, smoked meat and fruit lasts for minutes. Drink or hold. Pure syrah. Score - 98. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 9, 2016)

title: Massolino Rionda Riserva Barolo 2001
Description: The 2001 Barolo Riserva Vigna Rionda is stunning. It opens with gorgeous aromas of rose petals and sweet ripe cherries that meld seamlessly onto a palate of dark raspberries, cocoa and licorice. It offers super length and elegant tannins in a style that is incredibly delicate and surprisingly approachable today ... Anticipated maturity: 2009-2026. Score - 95. (Antonio Galloni, robertparker.com, Oct. 2007)

title: Maria Mora Enamorada 2012
Description: The 2012 Maria Mora Enamorada Tinto, an Alentejo offering in partnership with Nunes Barata ... is an equal blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah, Alicante Bouschet and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon aged for 14 months in 50% new French oak. It comes in at 14.5% alcohol. Dense and concentrated, this is sensually textured with velvet. It features a long finish nuanced with beef. Despite the late release, it is still just a little tight, even after 90 minutes in a glass. Beautifully balanced, complex and intense in structure and flavors, this is pretty fine. It should age very well. It may yet improve more. Drink date: 2019-2035. Score - 94. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Aug. 30, 2019)

title: Château Phélan Ségur 2015
Description: A beautifully perfumed young red with blackcurrants, blackberries and dark chocolate. Some sweet tobacco. It's medium-to full-bodied with a very balanced and refined palate, showing focus and tightness. This needs time to open. Try after 2023.  Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, July 7, 2020)

title: Château Haut-Segottes 2015
Description: An attractive smooth and supple wine that has a wealth of sweet-smelling and spicy earth and undergrowth-like aromas. Hints of violets, too. The palate has a very succulent, fluid and rich presence with ample ripe dark-plum and blueberry flavors. Finishes fresh and long. Try from 2022. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 2, 2018)

title: Paolo Scavino Bric dël Fiasc Barolo 2012
Description: A core of sweet cherry fruit is enhanced by licorice, leather, spice and tar flavors. This is vibrant and focused, with a dense matrix for support and a long, gripping finish. Best from 2019 through 2033. Score - 94. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Aug. 31, 2016)

title: iCellars Icel Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Intense aromatics feature an intriguing mix of roasted herbs, black fruit, quality oak spice, and lightly lactic tones in a complex ensemble. The palate is full, smooth, richly textured with high concentration and polished, slick feel. Wood is a very dominant feature for now, and tannins could use more time to soften fully, so tuck in the cellar for another 2-3 years, or hold into the late '20s. Solid, ambitiously made, and successful wine. Score - 91. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com, Oct. 26, 2020)

title: Confidences de Prieuré-Lichine 2015
Description: The 2015 Confidences de Prieuré-Lichine is a very pretty second wine. Pliant, supple and inviting, the Confidences is an excellent choice for drinking now and over the next few years. All of the signatures of the Grand Vin come through nicely, but, of course, in miniature. This is a strong showing. Drinking window: 2018-2027. Score - 91. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 2018)

title: Le Vigne di Zamò Vigne 50 Anni Merlot
Murdoch Hill The Phaeton Single Vineyard Pinot Noir
Château Rauzan-Ségla 2017
Description: Composed of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot and sporting a deep garnet-purple color, the 2017 Rauzan-Segla (Rausan-Segla) has a profound nose of cassis, warm blackberries and black plums with touches of baking spices, violets, mocha and smoke plus a waft of garrigue. Medium to full-bodied with a great core of sustained, energetic black fruit, a frame of fine-grained tannins and a lively backbone, it finishes with great length. Score - 94-96. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: The Pundit Syrah 2014
Description: The finest vintage of this cuvee to date (it's only the second year for the cuvee though), the 2014 Syrah The Pundit has loads of ripe dark fruits, charcoal, smoked herbs and licorice in a concentrated, rich, yet always balanced and fresh style. Made from 88% Syrah, 6% Grenache and the rest Mourvedre, aged mostly in French oak (which is a positive change from the American oak used for the 2013), with a small part in concrete, drink this pleasure-bent effort over the coming 4-5 years. These Tenet releases are a joint project between the Rhone Valley's Michel Gassier and Philippe Cambie, and Chateau Ste. Michelle's Bob Bertheau. Drink: 2015-2020. Score - 92. (Jeb Dunnuck, robertparker.com, May 26, 2016)

title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet Cuvée Etienne Camuzet Bourgogne
Hollick Old Vines Coonawarra Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: The 2017 'Old Vines' Cabernet Sauvignon from Hollick begins with stunning aromatics which include dark cherries, tobacco, mint, fresh herbs, exotic spices and bell pepper which instantly grab your attention. On the palate this is medium to full-bodied and incredibly balanced with wonderful combination of fruit and acidity. It remains fresh and vibrant all the way through the fresh long, mouthwatering finish. This is a simply fantastic Cabernet Sauvignon that is simply outstanding today, but should also continue to evolve over the next decade. Drink: 2020-2030. Score - 93. (Joe D'Angelo, internationalwinereport.com, March 2020)

title: Espiritu de Chile Intrepido Reserva Merlot
Bishop's Ring Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Staete Landt State of Grace Pinot Noir
Pepper Tree The Gravels Shiraz 2016
Description: Supple, rich and juicy, with a flowing stream of black fruits studded with sparks of spice. The oak is integrated, the tannins fine, the finish long. Drink by: 2036. Score - 95. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2018)

Description: Wow. This is the best syrah in Tuscany this year with incredible depth and beauty. The texture is so plush yet polished and caressing. Full body. The finish of chocolate, hazelnuts, smoked meat and fruit lasts for minutes. Drink or hold. Pure syrah. Score - 98. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 9, 2016)

Murdoch Hill The Phaeton Single Vineyard Pinot Noir
Château Rauzan-Ségla 2017

(Jeb Dunnuck, robertparker.com, May 26, 2016)

title: Pipoli Aglianico del Vulture 2013
Description: Well-knit and fresh, with dusty tannins and ground spice layered with flavors of crushed mulberry, mocha, bergamot and herbes de Provence. Silky in texture and appealing, this is lightly juicy through to the expressive finish. Drink now through 2021. Score - 89. (Alison Napjus, winespectator.com, Aug. 31)

title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet Cuvée Etienne Camuzet Bourgogne
Hollick Old Vines Coonawarra Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: The 2017 'Old Vines' Cabernet Sauvignon from Hollick begins with stunning aromatics which include dark cherries, tobacco, mint, fresh herbs, exotic spices and bell pepper which instantly grab your attention. On the palate this is medium to full-bodied and incredibly balanced with wonderful combination of fruit and acidity. It remains fresh and vibrant all the way through the fresh long, mouthwatering finish. This is a simply fantastic Cabernet Sauvignon that is simply outstanding today, but should also continue to evolve over the next decade. Drink: 2020-2030. Score - 93. (Joe D'Angelo, internationalwinereport.com, March 2020)
